title: Data Engineer
description:
Cardano is looking for a new Data Architect/Engineer to join our Engineering team and help build out our sustainability offering. We are looking for a person to help architect and implement data pipelines to produce sustainability reports. This versatile role offers opportunity for varied exposure to investment and data with good career prospects.
Your roleAs a Data Architect/Engineer, you will work alongside the engineering team to understand Cardano's practices and architecture. Initially you will work embedded within a team of quantitative analysts and sustainability experts to enhance our data architecture and pipeline for producing sustainability reports. You will provide architectural guidance to the team, collaborating closely with our Engineering team on data structure and system design. Additionally, you will participate in coding and code reviews.
Responsibilities:Collaborate with the Engineering team to understand Cardano's practices and architecture.Work with quants and sustainability experts to improve the data pipeline for sustainability reports.Provide guidance on data architecture and system design.Engage in coding and code reviews.Work closely with client teams or other business teams as needed.
We use Python and Airflow as well as our Hive data lake and other databases (ie SQL Server). Our reports are typically generated in PowerBI and accessed by clients through our digital platform.
Your qualificationsYou have successfully completed a BSc or MSc in a financial, technological, mathematical or scientific degree and have a strong analytical and quantitative foundation. You are at the start of your career, but this is not your first experience.You have experience with Python and a passion for developing new software.You have an interest in designing data flows and systems that are robust You are passionate about design and architectureYou have a great sense of responsibility and are very committed and quality oriented.You have excellent communication skills.You are looking for full-time employment (40-hour contract) in a hybrid working environment (minimum 2 days in the Rotterdam office per week, preferably 3 days)
Don‚Äôt fully meet the above profile? Don't worry, no one has everything. Feel free to respond anyway! Diversity and personality are just as important.
What does Cardano offer?Cardano offers good working conditions in addition to ample development opportunities within a close-knit and pleasant team in a fantastic workplace. In addition to your salary and profit sharing, you will receive, among other things, a 13th month, 1st class train pass (if you live outside Rotterdam), company fitness, free lunch when you work at the office (we work hybrid) and we have monthly drinks. In addition, the team will help you gain:A good knowledge of all the products we trade, including derivatives, bonds and equities;Practical and theoretical fundamentals of risk and investment management; An in-depth knowledge of operational risk management.
We believe that your long-term development and training depends on your own wishes, abilities, interests and the possibilities within the company.
About usCardano was founded in 2000 based on the belief that in an uncertain world, everyone should be able to count on a fair pension. We believe in a just society in which our financial system contributes to the quality of life. In an irrational, uncertain world with a financial system that regularly goes haywire, we feel responsible for watching over other people's money. That's why we help to secure people's assets for a good old age. We do this by eradicating unwanted and unrewarded risks and embracing the risks that are necessary to make people and society more resilient.
Cardano offers its clients (mainly European pension funds) specialized and integrated investment and risk management services; both advice and full implementation and management. Since its inception in 2000, Cardano has supported many European pension funds, insurers and other financial end-users with strategic advice, implementation and management of investment strategies, manager research and selection. Cardano is a significant player in the European market for the implementation and management of LDI and derivatives overlay solutions. Every year, Cardano executes 150+ billion euros worth of transactions on behalf of customers, including interest rate, currency, inflation and equity derivatives and (government) bonds. Cardano has offices in the UK (London) and the Netherlands (Rotterdam), where more than 600 highly experienced specialists work.
Cardano is currently working through the regulatory consents necessary to become part of the Mercer Wealth business of Marsh McLennan. Any future integration would provide significant opportunity for interesting project work and future career growth.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Every month we have millions of sessions and hundreds of thousands of users on the platform. Our apps have more than a million downloads. Customers create thousands of orders every day in multiple countries. But we want more and we need your help to achieve it.

Things like category and product listing, offers, cart handling, checkout, payments and authentication are part of the daily agenda. But that's not all! We have our own advanced search engine and fraud detection mechanisms, a detailed order tracker for our customers, a subscription system, push notifications and much more. Everything is done through REST APIs, consumed by our website and apps, while always keeping an eye on security and the privacy of our users.

If you care about customers and their needs, if you are not afraid of pushing code used by millions and if you are always up-to-date with new technologies, then we are looking for you to join our Tech team!

This is a job opportunity with remote work contract.

Who We Are

Everli is Europe‚Äôs leading marketplace for online grocery shopping and one of its fastest growing scale-ups (part of the annual Financial Times ranking for four years in a row). We are on a mission to deliver customers peace of mind with a trouble-free grocery experience they love and trust.

We achieve our growth through a culture that is collaborative, transparent, data-driven and focused on our mission.

Our rapidly growing and diverse international team (20 nationalities and counting) has offices located in Italy (with headquarters in Milan & Verona).

What You Will Do

You will join a small distributed team of developers with decision-making autonomy: you will be responsible for your work;You will join a domain-driven teamYou will be part of an autonomous and heterogeneous squad, working closely with other areas, like Product, Design and Analytics;You will find brilliant solutions for complex problems and own the process from the analysis to the delivery;You will ship high-quality software: well-designed, well-tested, and scalable.

What we offer

Benefits

We have plenty of cool benefits (please note that some of them are available just to people hired with a contract of employment in Italy):

Welfare Budget. You can use this credit for a wide selection of services (education, public transport, vacations and entertainment, wellness, culture etc).Home Workstation Budget. Anytime you use our service to get your grocery, you can apply a reserved discount on your basket.Flexible working conditions (our Tech team is fully remote since 2017).Work asset. You can choose your preferred work laptop (Mac/PC).

What you bring

You developed at least a 4 years relevant experience working with PHP (Laravel), Node.js, or other backend technologies;You have a good knowledge of Redis, RabbitMQ, MySQL, ElasticSearchYou have experience with AWS, REST APIs and event-driven architectures;You are experienced in designing, building, and shipping infrastructure for traffic-intensive applications;You distinguish yourself for great communication and synthesis skills;You have an analytical, detail-focused mindset, but always looking at the big picture;You are a team player: you work well with other people within and outside the tech team;You are allowed to legally work in Europe (you are the holder of an EU Passport or you are the holder of an EU residency permit or you are the holder of a Schengen Work Visa).

Everli is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We foster an inclusive and diverse workplace. No matter who you are, what you look like or how many years ago you started your career: you will always be welcome in our team. Just like in a grocery store, diversity is richness!

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Bnewable, we‚Äôre leading the charge in the energy transition. We invest in and develop decentralized, sustainable energy solutions that empower businesses to achieve their green goals. Our mission? Make energy local, secure, and not subject to international conflicts, trade disputes, or embargoes.
We‚Äôre looking for a Backend Software Engineer to help us design and build energy management systems, all while embracing a culture grounded in Site Reliability Engineering principles.
What you‚Äôll do
Build powerful backend solutions that enable the energy transitionSolve complex, real-world problems with clean, well-documented codeDesign scalable, high-performance architecturesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to elevate our productsTake ownership of your projects from design to deploymentContinuously improve and implement best engineering practices
You'll work closely with Product and Architecture, all focused on driving innovative solutions that optimize battery performance, reliability, and more.
What we‚Äôre looking for
+6 years of experience in backend development (Python/Java), big data expertise would be greatStrong understanding of CS fundamentals - data structures, OOP, threadingProven experience building RESTful APIs and micro-services at scaleSolid experience with SQL, NoSQL, and ORMExpertise in cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred) and TerraformA proficiency for performance optimization and building distributed systemsYou thrive in a fast-paced environment, with a focus on delivering resultsFluent communication skills in English
Our tech stack
Backend: Python, Java, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, REST, Micro-servicesFrontend: Next.js/React.js, TypeScript, Module FederationData: BigQuery, NoSQL, Apache Airflow, Spark, DataFlow/Apache BeamDevOps: GCP, Docker, Terraform, Linux, GitHub
Our culture
We believe in Employeneurship - thinking and acting like an entrepreneur, while owning your professional growth. You will be empowered to shape your career, develop continuously, and be an integral part of our success story.
Interested?Mail to peter.bolle@italents.be or easy apply LinkedIn

title: Software Engineer
description:
Job Role: SDLC applicationLocation: Prague, CzechiaEmployment Type- Contract
Job Description We are seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our team. As a member of the Digital SDLC team, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our application that ensures compliance and proper documentation within our pharmaceutical company. You will be working in a cross-functional agile team of approximately 15 people located in Prague and contribute to both backend and frontend development, as well as writing and maintaining tests for the codebase.
ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with a cross-functional agile team to develop, maintain, and enhance the Digital SDLC application.Write clean, efficient, and reusable code using JavaScript (TypeScript) for both backend and frontend development.Develop and maintain unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure code quality and reliability.Participate in technical discussions, and code reviews and contribute ideas for improving the application's architecture, scalability, and performance.Stay updated with the latest software engineering patterns and principles to continuously improve the application.Work closely with product owners, UX designers, testers, and DevOps specialists to deliver high-quality software.Expected QualificationsStrong knowledge of software engineering principles and best practices.Proficiency in JavaScript (TypeScript) and experience with Node.js, Express, and Koa frameworks.Solid experience with React for front-end development.Familiarity with PostgreSQL and Redis databases.Knowledge of testing frameworks such as Jest, Chai, React Testing Library, or Robot Framework.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative, agile environment.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.Desired QualificationsFamiliarity with AWS and Terraform.Experience with Docker, GitHub, and Jira.Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment automation.

title: Python Software Engineer
description:
Job Overview
Wargaming is looking for a skilled Python Software Engineer to join our team. We are the Operation and Support Tools team.One of the values of our company is our happy players. To make it real, hundreds of customer support specialists are available 24/7. Operation and Support Tools team provides support specialists with all the tools necessary for work. Among them such things as interfaces to manage player accounts and tools for dynamic generation of such interfaces. Also we develop automations and bots that help players with their problems with no people being attracted.Our projects have integrations with almost all Wargaming services.Should you become a part of our team, you will learn how the Wargaming Platform works on the other side of the browser.
The salary range for this position is 4300‚Äì5500 ‚Ç¨ (gross) per month.Note that this salary range is valid for Lithuania, for other locations it might be different.
What will you do?Collaborate with business analysts and other teams to develop requirements for new features.Develop features and be responsible for their delivery.Setup monitoring and testing of our services to better understand their real time health.Participate in code review.Participate in planning, retrospectives and other team activities.
What are we looking for?Good knowledge of Python.General understanding of server-client architecture and network.Experience working with database management systems (mysql, postgresql).Experience working with Git.Basic knowledge of Linux.Knowledge of English language ‚Äì Intermediate (B1 or higher).
What additional skills will help you stand out?Expertise in common frameworks (e.g. Django, aiohttp, FastAPI) and infrastructure (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka , Clickhouse)Experience working with Continuous Integration systems (e.g. TeamCity/Jenkins/Bamboo)
BenefitsBenefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Vilnius include:Up to 8 ‚ÄúTrust days‚Äù per calendar year that require no medical certificateCareer development and education opportunities within the companyMeal AllowancePremium Private Health Care (with Gym training / Wellness program‚Ä¶)Personal Gaming AccountCoffee, fruits, and snacks in the officeCompany eventsSeniority AwardsReferral program - You can recommend the best talents to the company and receive a reward
About Wargaming Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Operating since 1998, Wargaming has become one of the leaders in the gaming industry with 15 offices worldwide, including studios in Chicago, Prague, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Vilnius. Our diverse and multicultural team works together to deliver a top-class experience to millions of players who enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms. Our flagship products include free-to-play hits World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Tanks Blitz.Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Leonardo √® un gruppo industriale internazionale, tra le principali realt√† mondiali nell‚ÄôAerospazio, Difesa e Sicurezza che realizza capacit√† tecnologiche multidominio in ambito Elicotteri, Velivoli, Aerostrutture, Elettronica, Cyber Security e Spazio. Con oltre 53.000 dipendenti nel mondo, l‚Äôazienda ha una solida presenza industriale in Italia, Regno Unito, Polonia, Stati Uniti, e opera in 150 paesi anche attraverso aziende controllate, joint venture e partecipazioni. Protagonista dei principali programmi strategici a livello globale, √® partner tecnologico e industriale di Governi, Amministrazioni della Difesa, Istituzioni e imprese.

 Conoscenze e competenze tecniche:Profonda conoscenza degli ambienti di sviluppo Rockwell (RSLogix5000/Studio 5000 Logix Designer) per la programmazione PLC Controllogix/GuardLogix.Ampia esperienza su configurazione/avviamento reti Ethernet/IPEsperienza nella configurazione/gestione di comunicazioni mediante RSLinx e i relativi drivers, in particolare via OPCConoscenza ambienti di sviluppo Siemens (Step 7/Tia portal) in particolare su AWL e SCL.Conoscenza dei sistemi operativi MS Windows, e del Pacchetto OfficeGradita esperienza pregressa su impianti di logisticaGradita esperienza su configurazione/avviamento drives PowerFlexGradita conoscenza ambiente Factory Talk View StudioGradita esperienza con libreria TIA OpenessGradita conoscenza WinCC FlexibleGradita esperienza nella gestione tecnica di commesse, progettazione, stesura requisiti e specifiche di progetto
Competenze comportamentali Orientamento al risultato, proattivit√†, ampia disponibilit√† e flessibilit√†Predisposizione lavoro in teamCapacit√† di analisiApproccio ‚Äúproblem solving‚Äù
Conoscenze linguistiche: Conoscenza lingua inglese (B1-B2)
Altro (es. Disponibilit√† a trasferte, Certificazioni specifiche, ‚Ä¶): Disponibilit√† a trasferte internazionali, saltuariamente di media/lunga durata
Il processo di selezione: Aspettiamo la tua candidatura: inviaci il tuo CV entro tre settimane dall‚Äôapertura dell‚Äôannuncio di lavoro.Come funziona il processo di selezione?
A seguito della raccolta delle candidature, vengono valutati e identificati i CV maggiormente in linea con i requisiti richiesti.
Le/i candidate/i selezionate/i sostengono un colloquio/interivsta conoscitivo con il team delle Risorse Umane, motivazionale e attitudinale, seguito da un‚Äôintervista di approfondimento tecnico con il Business.Al termine del processo, alla persona viene restituito un feedback, sia in caso di esito positivo che negativo.
Cosa offriamo: Coinvolgimento, valorizzazione delle competenze, cura del benessere e della sicurezza delle persone sono i cardini della nostra cultura aziendale.Ci impegniamo ogni giorno a favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e stimolante, promuovendo attivamente i principi di inclusione, equit√† e valorizzazione delle diversit√†. 
Cosa offriamo?Retribuzione fissa commisurata all‚Äôesperienza e al livello della persona selezionata, accompagnata da premialit√† legate ai risultati di business;Opportunit√† di formazione e aggiornamento continuo delle competenze professionali e delle soft skill;Work-Life Balance: promuoviamo il giusto equilibrio tra vita privata e vita professionale a partire da formule di lavoro ibride e flessibili; Benessere: mettiamo al primo posto il benessere economico, fisico, sociale e psicologico delle nostre persone, offrendo molteplici soluzioni vicine alle loro esigenze.
Il nostro contratto collettivo nazionale del lavoro di riferimento √® il CCNL per l‚ÄôIndustria Metalmeccanica Privata e della Installazione di Impianti. 
Lavorando con noi avrai modo di confrontarti costantemente con le sfide dell‚Äôalta tecnologia, di accrescere le tue competenze e costruire un percorso professionale di eccellenza.

title: Back End Developer
description:
About Us

Spanish company based in Valencia founded by telecoms and software experts, focused on providing data intelligence with machine-based decisioning, automating network operations and customer assurance, to help operators to deal with the incoming increase of network complexity.

>> Kenmei Technologies Raises 4 Million Euros to Lead Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the Telecommunications Sector


We are looking for a Back-end Developer.

What would you be doing?

As a back-end developer, you will be responsible for developing back-end components to improve responsiveness to requests from the front-end and overall performance, based on Django/Python.

Main responsibilities:

Develop new features for our product.Write, audit, and improve our test coverage.Document our back-end codebase.Write clean and reusable code.Profile and improve our back-end performance.

Degree in Computer Sciences. At least 5 years of relevant working experience in a similar position. Working experience developing web applications Hands on experience with Python/Django & SQL. Agile methodologies.Design patterns.REST APIs and JSON.Unit tests.CI/CD.Good level of English.


Desired

Selenium.GIS knowledge.React Native.Typescript.SQL Alchemy.Docker.GIS knowledge.


Benefits

Competitive salary.Flexible working hours and short working days on Fridays and during summertime.Smart Work: you can choose Hybrid work model based in Valencia or 100% full remote.Udemy Business license & 2hours/sprint for training & learning.Cutting edge technology and innovative and challenging projects.Ongoing training and career development.Flexible retribution: Health insurance & childcare check.Exclusive discounts: Benefits Club Platform.International environment and the best working atmosphere.


Kenmei is an equal opportunities employer and takes care to avoid any form of discrimination.

As part of its commitment to diversity, gender equality and geographical distribution, it strongly encourages applications from female candidates, even if you don‚Äôt have 100% requirements but a similar role and applies a policy of equal opportunities.

Kenmei does not discriminate against anyone on grounds of gender, social origin, genetic features, disability, religion, or belief, political or any other opinion, sexual orientation, race, colour, membership of a national minority, property or birth.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer / Architect - Energy Management Systems Join Our Mission to Power Africa with Sustainable Energy Solutions:G-HITECH is the developer of the Global Energy Supply System (G-ESS), an innovative approach to energy distribution. Unlike traditional centralized grids, our mini-grid is fully decentralized, connecting distributed production nodes‚Äîeach equipped with solar panels, batteries, and standalone inverters‚Äîto create resilient energy communities. This modular design significantly advances energy democratization, particularly beneficial for emerging economies due to its modularity and energy-sharing capabilities.At G-HITECH, we are committed to actively contribute to Africa‚Äôs energy revolution by providing affordable and reliable solar energy solutions. Our goal is to help bridge the energy gap for the 650 million people in Africa who currently lack access to electricity. This mission drives us to look for passionate, innovative, and motivated people who are ready to tackle significant challenges and make a lasting impact. Are you ready to be a part of this impactful journey? 
The Opportunity:As a Software Engineer/Architect at G-HITECH, you will be responsible for developing our Energy Management System (EMS) called SOLARSTEG. SOLARSTEG (SOLAR Satellite-based Transactional Electrical Grid) is an advanced software solution designed to operationalize our G-ESS mini-grid. The software focuses on predictive maintenance, advanced energy management, and payment services, integrating satellite communications (SatCom), global navigation satellite systems (GNSS), and IoT technologies.This role puts you at the core of our mission, where technology meets social impact, and gives you the opportunity to contribute to shaping the future of Africa's energy landscape.  
Your Role and Responsibilities:Service Requirements Mapping: Work closely with internal team and external stakeholders to identify and articulate service requirements, ensuring alignment with user needs, business goals, and the broader operational context.Architectural Strategy: Develop and implement strategies that support scalability, security, cost-effective data transmission, and long-term maintainability.Subcontractor Management: Oversee and coordinate with subcontractors to ensure their work aligns with project objectives, timelines, and quality expectations, fostering seamless integration into the overall project.Core Product Development: Design, develop and maintain a software platform that guarantees optimum performance and reliability for energy management.Front-end Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design intuitive and user-friendly front-end interfaces, enhancing SolarSTEG‚Äôs UI/UX and ensuring accessibility for diverse users.API Development: Develop and optimize APIs to enable seamless integration with external systems, such as mobile payment platforms, enhancing performance and scalabilityData Quality Assurance: Maintain high standards of data integrity and reliability through rigorous validation and processing measures.Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code ensuring that the software meets the high standards required for reliable energy management. 
What do we expect from you? We are seeking a candidate who adapts easily to dynamic environments and has a keen interest in sustainable development and innovation. You should bring:Experience:5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer, Software Architect or similar role.Technical Skills:Experience in software development and coding in various languages Familiarity with data processing frameworksStrong understanding of front-end and back-end development.Experience with building and integrating APIs.Experience with satellite communications and IoT is a plus.Soft Skills:Excellent team player with ability to collaborate effectively with international teams and stakeholders.Strong communication skills, both verbal and written in English.Hands-on approach with a problem-solving mindset.Bonus Skills:Experience or interest in renewable energy,Previous startup experience is a plus.
 What You Can Expect From G-HITECH? Impactful Work: Make a real difference by contributing to projects that improve lives and foster economic growth for all.Career Growth: Lead diverse technology initiatives and grow with a young company that is innovating within the energy sector. As the role evolves, you will have the opportunity to expand your leadership capabilities and become an integral part of our executive management team.Recognition and Rewards: Benefit from a competitive salary, profit sharing, and recognition of your hard work and dedication.Support and Development: Receive extensive support through coaching and targeted training designed to enhance your skills and career prospects. Ready to Make a Difference?If you‚Äôre motivated by impact and driven by innovation, G-HITECH offers the perfect setting to expand your potential. Apply today at hello@g-hitech.com and join us in our mission to energize Africa.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We‚Äôre looking for problem solvers, innovators, and dreamers who are searching for anything but business as usual. Like us, you‚Äôre a high performer who‚Äôs an expert at your craft, constantly challenging the status quo. You value inclusivity and want to join a culture that empowers you to show up as your authentic self. You know that success hinges on commitment, that our differences make us stronger, and that the finish line is always sweeter when the whole team crosses together.

We‚Äôre looking for a talented Python developer who loves crafting clean, efficient code and enjoys working with a team focused on quality and innovation. If you have solid experience in Python, containerization, and connectors, and you thrive in an Agile environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

About The Team

Our team is a dynamic group of five engineers, including three senior software engineers and two software engineers, all bringing an impressive average of 6.5 years of experience with Alteryx.

We operate within the Data Connectors department, where we place a high

emphasis on the quality of our connectors and the automation of our tests.

We are passionate about what we do, leveraging Python to drive innovation and excellence in our work. If you're looking to join a team that combines deep expertise with a shared commitment to quality and continuous improvement, our team is the perfect fit.

Required Skills

 3+ years of programming experience Proficiency in Python Experience with ODBC, JDBC Experience with consuming API services Proficient with SQL database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle Experience with containerization (e.g., Docker) Understanding the fundamentals of design patterns Experience with testing frameworks such as pytest Familiarity with version control systems such as GitLab or GitHub Passion for writing simple, readable, testable code Willingness to work in an Agile/LEAN environment within a collaborative team Fluent in English, both written and spoken

Preferred Skills

 Experience with RESTful API design and implementation Familiarity with OAuth Experience with major cloud provider tooling (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud

Find yourself checking a lot of these boxes but doubting whether you should apply? At Alteryx, we support a growth mindset for our associates through all stages of their careers. If you meet some of the requirements and you share our values, we encourage you to apply. As part of our ongoing commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace, we‚Äôre invested in building teams with a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, and experiences.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Job Description

Nokia TAS is a next generation application server, converging the best of breed voice, video and messaging services for the 2G, 3G, 4G, CDMA, WiFi and 5G users of the mobile, fixed and enterprise segments. The configuration, performance and fault management capabilities guarantee an optimized operation, from deployment to maintenance phase. With the open eco-system, the decomposed internal architecture and business logic, Nokia TAS is complements the Programmable Core and is DevOps ready. Nokia TAS is a cloud native containerized SW-only product, deployable on Nokia or 3rd party cloud infrastructure or baremetal.

As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

As a member of our NTAS team you will develop new functionalities and features, maintain and update existing software, investigate and fix defects, perform component testing and integrate the SW with other features / components. Take part in software design discussion and code review meetings. Solve complex engineering problems in many technology areas. Coach other team members in solving problems.

Key Skills And Experience

Hands-on attitude and quick learning are highly appreciated. Exact qualifications may vary depending on scrum teams / functional areas. We also want to find a good match with your interests.

We are looking for the following qualifications:

B.Sc. or M.Sc. in computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering or an equivalent qualificationSoftware development, testing and engineering knowledgeKnowledge of telecom domainGood command of English

The below list has skills that will help you, but you don't need to match all. Please also apply if you have a strong motivation to develop in one of the followings:

Familiarity with TDD and Clean Code principlesFamiliarity with automation tools/frameworks (e.g. Jenkins, Robot)Experience with private clouds (e.g. Vmware, OpenStack)Experience with container based deployment (e.g. Docker)Scripting experience (e.g. Shell, Python)

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

 One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Engineer
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world‚Äôs largest jewelry brand?

@Pandora we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product owners, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

As a Data Engineer within our Data & Analytics ‚Äì Marketing Analytics Engineering team, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining robust data pipelines in both Azure Synapse and Databricks. Joining our team, you will contribute to building a solid foundation for our data infrastructure, supporting our marketing analytics organization's goal of becoming more data-driven and customer-centric. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, helping to drive impactful data product deliveries and optimizing our analytical framework for scalable insights globally.

Your key accountabilities will be to:‚ÄØ

Develop and maintain data integration pipelines in Databricks and Azure Synapse AnalyticsCommunicate with stakeholders and users of our data products by understanding their problems and supporting them in their needsImprove existing data integration processes to provide better reliability and robustness


What is needed to succeed:‚ÄØ

Problem-solving team player with an analytical mindStrong knowledge of SQL and Spark SQLUnderstanding of dimensional data modelling conceptsExperience with Azure Synapse AnalyticsUnderstanding of streaming data ingestion processesAbility to develop / manage Apache Spark data processing applications using PySpark on DatabricksExperience with version control (e.g. Git), DevOps and CI/CDExperience with PythonExperience with Microsoft data platform, Microsoft Azure stack and DatabricksExperience in marketing is a plus.


Did we get your attention? 

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office‚ÄØ @jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØmade from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora‚Äôs products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its‚ÄØjewellery‚ÄØat two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.‚ÄØ

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

title: Backend Developer
description:

resolve complex technical tasks writing secure, reliable, scalable, and maintainable code. 


work on a large product spanning from a fine-tuned high performing database layer, multitude of integrations and all the way to clean-cut UI, all aspects in collaboration with highly skilled colleagues (100+ in R&D), stakeholders, UX, tech writers, product managers and your teams product owner. 


see your work in the hands of large well-known brands across the globe, with customers in all continents. 


have colleagues across US, UK, PL, DK, UA and IN providing you a diverse international culture guided by our Nordic values. 



‚ÄØ

Our process follows the agile mindset based on Scrum extended with SAFe for being able to coordinate and scale activities across the entire R&D department. ‚ÄØ

And you don‚Äôt need to be an expert in all, just have the right mindset that learning is a constant factor as a developer, then we will support you in your learning journey. 

‚ÄØ 

Who we are looking for We imagine that our new colleague is service minded and believe in the art of the possible ‚Äì we certainly do. We hope that you, like us, are also ready to go the extra mile to achieve results and add value to your team. Also, you have strong communication and cooperation skills enabling you to make long lasting relationships. 

Furthermore, you have: 
Degree in Computer Science or a similar field 


3 to 5 years of solid experience in Java development and related frameworks, such as Spring or Hibernate 


Proven experience integrating with external applications in a production environment 


Experience with Web Service Architecture based on REST, GraphQL 


Understanding of microservice architecture principles 


Solid experience in writing integration and unit tests: TDD, JUnit, Mockito 


Experience with ETL-related work on JSON/XML/XSD-based formats and data standards 


Good communication skills in English, both verbal and written  



What will set you apart: 
Experience with server-based architecture (parallelism, performance, scalability, security) 


Knowledge of Elasticsearch, including query DSL, indexing, and performance tuning 


Competence in SQL and NoSQL databases 


Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes) 


Understanding of cloud architecture, preferably with experience in Azure 


Contributions to open-source projects 


General knowledge of web development HTML, CSS, React, TypeScript 



 

We offer At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself. 
We care about our colleague‚Äôs work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model 


International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams 


Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities 
We create our own Software products and have a proven record of adding significant business value for our customers.  



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more. 

Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership! 

Interested? 

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible. Please note that due to summer vacations of hiring team there might be a delay in getting back to you.  

Should you have questions about the position, you are also welcome to contact Mads Johansen, Lead Recruiter Specialist on madj@stibosystems.com  

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Full stack Developer
description:
Do you want to use your technical skills to make a positive impact? Do you have experience with modern web technologies and are you eager to work in a dynamic startup focused on sustainability? Ecocharting is looking for a Fullstack Developer to join our team and help build our innovative solutions!
About EcochartingAt Ecocharting, we aim to set the European standard for sustainability reporting. We help companies of all sizes gain insights into their environmental, social, and governance impacts. Due to the growing demand for our solutions, we are looking for a driven Fullstack Developer to help develop our platform further.
Job DescriptionAs a Fullstack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing our applications, from front-end to back-end. You will work with modern technologies such as TypeScript, Angular, PostgreSQL, and use Docker and Kubernetes to build and enhance our platform. You will collaborate closely with the development team to ensure a user-friendly, scalable, and secure solution that helps our clients achieve their sustainability goals.

What We're Looking For:Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with strong knowledge of TypeScript, Angular, PostgreSQL, Docker, and Kubernetes.Experience in building scalable and secure web applications.Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach.A passion for sustainability and working on projects that have a positive impact.A team player with excellent communication skills.
What We Offer:A challenging role in a mission-driven startup.Opportunities for professional growth and development.Flexible working hours and the possibility to work partly remote.Attractive employment conditions, such as a 13th month, extra vacation days, and more.
Ready to Join Us?Apply today. Together, we‚Äôll build a more sustainable future!Ecocharting respects your privacy. All application data will be treated confidentially and used solely for the recruitment process.

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN) is the global leader in enterprise conversations. Hundreds of the world‚Äôs leading brands ‚Äî including HSBC, Chipotle, and Virgin Media ‚Äî use our award-winning Conversational Cloud platform to connect with millions of consumers. We power nearly a billion conversational interactions every month, providing a uniquely rich data set and safety tools to unlock the power of Conversational AI for better customer experiences.

At LivePerson, we foster an inclusive workplace culture that encourages meaningful connection, collaboration, and innovation. Everyone is invited to ask questions, actively seek new ways to achieve success and reach their full potential. We are continually looking for ways to improve our products and make things better. This means spotting opportunities, solving ambiguities, and seeking effective solutions to the problems our customers care about.

Overview

Engineering at LivePerson is an inspired, customer-obsessed organization dedicated to building solutions that redefine the Conversational AI industry. We work in small, collaborative, agile, and mission-driven teams with a clear mission empowering quality, continuous feedback, testing, monitoring, and end-to-end ownership.

Our engineering teams make some of the most significant decisions and at scale. Do you want to be part of the next stage of innovation and growth? As a Software Developer - you will be part of a Messaging Engine team and play a vital role in development and maintenance of the company core messaging platform. We are a globally distributed business unit spread across EMEA and the Americas.

In this role, you will be working across many internal teams, external partners, and large customers to deliver agent matching and routing solutions. We are a remote organization, but we value the opportunity to bring our teams together for offsite events, team collaboration, and training sessions. Therefore, we are looking for candidates who are based in Germany and are willing to come into the office for these activities. If this aligns with your situation and preferences, we encourage you to apply for this role.

You Will

Improve and optimize existing functionality of the messaging platform.Implement new features using Java and Spring.Assist in migrating the service to cloud-native solutions.Use the latest technologies to solve unique problems for our customers at scale.Work and collaborate with great engineers with experience in varieties of fields.Maintain >99.999% uptime of mission-critical messaging service.Contribute to the team‚Äôs on-call rotation and improve rapid-response coverage.

Some Of The Technologies We Are Using

Java 8/11/17, SpringCouch base, Redis, Elasticsearch, HadoopApache KafkaKubernetes, Docker, PuppetGCP, AWS, and On-Premises infrastructure (Hybrid)TeamCity, JenkinsVault, Terraform, OAuth2.0 Provider, and many more

You Have

3+ years of backend development- MUSTSolid understanding and knowledge of Java, concepts of multithreading, OO concepts and design patterns, etc.Experience with GCP - advantage.Experience building REST APIs, preferably with Java.Experience with websocket - advantage.Experience with mission-critical distributed microservices architecture.Willingness to own all stages of development process: from design and implementation to deployment and maintenanceAbility to work quickly while maintaining strong attention to detail and accuracyDeal well with ambiguous/undefined problemsAbility to effectively articulate and drive technical solutions to various challengesStrong communication and organizational skillsBeing a team playerExperience with globally distributed teams in multiple time zones is a plus.

Note: You will have to be located in Germany for this position with a valid work permit.

Benefits

Time away: Vacation, public holidays and care days.Financial: Pension, deferred pension and ESPP.Family: Parental leave.Development: Generous tuition reimbursement and access to internal professional development resources.Additional: Exclusive perks and discounts.

Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here

As leaders in enterprise customer conversations, we celebrate diversity, empowering our team to forge impactful conversations globally. LivePerson is a place where uniqueness is embraced, growth is constant, and everyone is empowered to create their own success. And, we're very proud to have earned recognition from Fast Company, Newsweek, and BuiltIn for being a top innovative, beloved, and remote-friendly workplace.

Belonging At LivePerson

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
At Billogram, we aim to be the good guys of billing. We profit when our clients' customers are happy and make timely payments, rather than benefiting from missed payments and subsequent debt collection. We believe that treating people well is a sound business strategy. That's why our invoicing and payments platform is engineered to eliminate friction and add value for both our clients and their customers, thereby enhancing their relationship.
Our OfferWe‚Äôre expanding our billing platform internationally, which means we need to cater to increasing volumes and expanding requirements. We also want to improve the quality and usage of our data, both internally within the system and throughout the organization. This requires rethinking and rebuilding our existing platform to make it more scalable and data-driven. We‚Äôre open to new ideas, strongly believe in collaboration within and across teams, and strive to create a supportive environment where you can grow and learn.
What You BringYou bring solid experience in designing, implementing, and delivering scalable, maintainable systems. You understand the trade-offs between writing great code and delivering business value, and you know how to balance them over time. You thrive in an environment where you‚Äôre encouraged to take on responsibilities and own deliverables from end to end, taking the time to understand both the business and technical requirements.You know how to evolve a production system incrementally without breaking things. If things do break, you‚Äôre experienced in finding solutions quickly to keep the lights on. You also see programming languages as a means to an end‚Äîthey‚Äôre tools to deliver value and can change over time. Whenever there‚Äôs a need to learn something new, you‚Äôre quick to pick it up.
Key Qualifications & Skills7+ years of experience in software development.Strong experience with Python and a good understanding of PHP.Willingness to work with multiple programming languages.Experience in a product-focused environment.Ability to lead and mentor junior developers.
Nice to HaveExperience in both B2B and B2C environments.Involvement with international expansion and entering new markets.Background in rewriting or migrating a platform.
What We OfferBillogram provides a digital billing and payments platform, revolutionizing a forgotten part of the payments industry: the recurring invoice. Using smart technology, we help companies automate the entire payments process, leading to lower costs, increased profitability, and higher customer satisfaction. We want both sender and recipient to have the best experience possible. But since their interests don‚Äôt always align, it‚Äôs up to us to come up with smart solutions to satisfy both parties.
At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. You will have the freedom and opportunity to develop alongside great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a whole lot of laughs.We provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Applications Back-End Developer.
description:
At Aistech Space, our mission is to use space-based technology including our constellation of small satellites to provide a new perspective of Earth's changing resources and improve our customer's decision-making processes toward a sustainable future.

And while we are passionate about space and technology, our key to success is having great people. We are very proud of the multi-talented, international, diverse team we have built. We support this team with a culture of feedback, bias toward action, self-driven problem solving, respect, and inclusion that we strive to uphold every day. Our goal is to create an environment where everyone is excited to come to work because they enjoy working with the team, feel like their skills and talents are being well used and valued, and are excited about our mission as we help write New Space history.

WHAT WE OFFER: At Aistech Space, we support our employees and their well-being by offering top-notch incentives:

One year initial contract with the possibility to extend to a fixed contract with no end date.

An inclusive, multinational, and vibrant team environment.

A work culture with open communication where the best ideas win.

Relaxing areas in our offices.

Team Lunch on Fridays.

Food pantry and drinks available all weekdays.

WHAT YOU WILL DO: Aistech Space is looking for an entry-level Back-End developer to be part of the Applications Team in charge of defining, designing and implementing the necessary infrastructure to sustain Aistech Space applications dedicated to the clients.

This new position offers the opportunity to rotate through each applications' project supporting the development, testing and deployment of software modules related to our in-house and/or cloud infrastructure.

In this role, you are expected to work as a team functioning as an agile, highly collaborative unit focused on short, client-driven development iterations.

You will also be responsible to follow internal standards and good practices in terms of project management (Jira), documentation (Confluence) and time management (Tempo) following an agile approach in your daily work.

The key objectives to be achieved during the rotational period are:

Understand Aistech Space mission objectives.

Work closely with the applications development team.

Engage with internal and external stakeholders to continuously improve the back-end infrastructure.

Recommend adoption of new technologies, products, and services.

Definition and analysis of back-end software and infrastructure requirements and correspondence implementation in code using an Agile methodology.

Write testable code, documentation and presentations.

Actively engage in the development of documentation to build out the company procedures and specification manuals.

Follow your curiosity to suggest new ideas to make our products and processes better.

WHO YOU ARE: Open-minded back-end developer with proven developments.

Interest in space technologies.

MUST

Strong knowledge of Python/Bash/Go/NodeJS.

Experience in API design, concurrency, and distributed systems.

Experience in data modeling and storage with both NoSQL and relational databases.

DESIRABLE

Experience working with containerized applications (e.g. Docker).

Knowledge of orchestration systems (e.g. Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform).

Knowledge of cloud integration, cloud computing, and storage.

Knowledge of "infrastructure as code" tooling (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, etc.).

PLUS

BsC/MsC in Information Technologies, Computer Sciences, Engineering and/or Physics, or equivalent experience.

Knowledge in Disaster Recovery and Backup.

Knowledge of system performance monitoring tools (Nagios, ELK, etc.).

Knowledge of DevOps principles and tools (CI/CD, Jenkins, Git, etc.).

WHERE YOU WILL BE: You will be located and based in our Edinburgh, Scotland office. Some travel between offices and other potential Aistech and customer locations worldwide may be required. We are open to remote employees, to be evaluated on a case by case basis.

If your profile fits, send us your cv to: ******

title: Software Engineer II
description:
About The Role & Team

On any given day at Disney Entertainment & ESPN Technology, we‚Äôre reimagining ways to create magical viewing experiences for the world‚Äôs most beloved stories while also transforming our media business for the future. Whether that‚Äôs evolving our streaming and digital products in new and immersive ways, powering worldwide advertising and distribution to enhance flexibility and efficiency, or delivering Disney‚Äôs unmatched entertainment and sports content, every day is a moment to make a difference to partners and to hundreds of millions of people globally.

A few reasons why we think you‚Äôd love working for the team:


Building the future of Disney's media business: DE&E Technologists are designing and building the infrastructure that will power our media, advertising, and distribution businesses for years to come.Reach & Scale: The products and platforms this group builds and operates delight millions of consumers every minute of every day ‚Äì from Disney+ and Hulu, to ABC News and Entertainment, to ESPN and ESPN+, and much more.Innovation: We develop and execute groundbreaking products and techniques that shape industry norms and enhance how audiences experience sports, entertainment & news.


This is a hybrid role based in the Amsterdam office.

What You Will Do

Disney‚Äôs Android team is seeking an expert Software Engineer who is excited to build apps enjoyed by millions around the world. You will be building scalable, sophisticated solutions for the Android applications on Disney+ and Star+ across a wide array of devices including phones, tablets, and TVs. Our highly collaborative group works in tandem with many cross-functional teams. We value pristine communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as a bias for action. We are exceptionally invested in maintaining high code quality standards with unit tests, automated tests, modern libraries, and a Kotlin codebase. We strive to build the best Live and Video-on-Demand (VOD) applications in the world, and we look forward to hearing more about your skills and how they can help us achieve this lofty goal.

As an Android Engineer working for Disney, you are comfortable with the Android SDK and are ready to own entire features. You have a solid foundation of skills including debugging skills, familiarity with Android Studio, and how to maximize it. You are prepared to dive into moderately complex issues such as memory leaks and lifecycle issues. You understand the value of being organized, planning ahead, and accompanying features and fixes with tests and documentation. You are eager for constructive feedback from mentors and are willing to collaborate with less experienced engineers all the same.

Required Qualifications & Skills


2+ years of production experience with Kotlin and the Android SDKSome experience with Reactive Programming and Dependency InjectionFamiliar with architectural patterns (MVI/MVVM or equivalent)Quality communication skills who can collaborate well across teamsCoachable and receptive to constructive feedbackExperience with: Java, Gradle, Databases, Reactive paradigms, coroutines.Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Jetpack ComposeComfortable using common Android libraries such as Dagger 2 / Hilt, RxJava2, GroupieA solid understanding of the core concepts of the Android SDK, Activity and Fragment lifecycles, thread managementExperience with unit testing, test automation, and continuous integrationFamiliarity with Android TV and, or, Amazon Fire TV developmentFamiliar with writing high-quality code, tests, and documentation


The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Software engineer - Software Orchestration
description:
Build smart tooling and automation that makes a BIG difference for the business
WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?
Our mission is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ‚õ≥Ô∏è üì∫ üé•
At our new office, you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! ü•≥ üèì ‚òïÔ∏è
We are proud to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! üöÄ üíª üíô
THE ROLE
The team is now looking for a Software Engineer. With a broad background in software development, you will be driving technical decisions within the team and taking an active part in the company‚Äôs overall architectural and strategic discussions around ensuring scalability and enabling growth. Day-to-day you will be writing code with the team.
The Software Operations teams builds software that improves scalability, efficiency and productivity for our operations.
The goal is to enable us to multiply the number of Toptracer Range ranges through solid, cleverly designed and scalable software, from building web-based tooling for calibrating our systems to automating the provisioning of physical as well as virtual servers and network devices.
We are still at the beginning of the journey to automate bottlenecks in our operations through software. This means there is a lot of uncharted area in how to develop this clever and scalable software. With a solid background in the field, you will be involved in technical decisions within the team. There will be plenty of room to take an active part in the architectural and strategic discussions and decisions, all the while keeping a close relationship with the code.
Take the chance to leave your mark on the software architecture of an innovative tech company in a unique part of the tech field, in a team with diverse expertise who are passionate about building smart software.
THE STACK TODAYAWS and Docker for running and hosting backends and APIsKubernetes platform with thousands of clusters.Python for backend and general application developmentFlask for API developmentAngular and React for web frontendPostgreSQL for databaseBash for general scriptingLinux for dev as well as prod environmentsNetbooted servers and devices.
POSSIBILITIESWork in an autonomous team with smart, engaged, driven and creative colleagues who are great collaboratorsBuild smart tooling and automation that makes a BIG difference for the businessDrive architectural decisions at team levelBuild relationships with many teams, both in operations and in developmentBroad understanding of Toptracer‚Äôs technologyBe part of a team and organization that embraces changeEnable Toptracer‚Äôs world-leading technology to grow and deliver more FUN to the world!
WE BELIEVE YOU HAVEHave several years of experience and a highly collaborative mindset.Are great at knowledge sharing and have strong abilities in coaching the other team members in order for the team to best solve technical challenges that are presented to them, together.Have experience in deploying and maintaining cloud-based and distributed systemsHave experience in AWS and building CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Gitlab) for Linux environmentCan easily understand large systems and how different components integrateExperienced in backend programming (Python + Flask/Django/FastAPI)Several years of developing for Linux environmentsLike working in an agile environmentAre skilled in architecture, but still a passionate coder and enjoys working hands-onCan knowledgeably participate and contribute to architectural decisions and solutions, helping a small team manage a significant architecture
MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER
Workplace
We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.

The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Founding Engineer
description:
Founding Engineers (2 positions) 
Are you a tech-savvy visionary leader with a passion for Earth Observation? Do you dream of disrupting the status quo and building something groundbreaking? Then this is your chance!
Driven by our mission to make it easier for businesses to utilise the full potential of space-data, we are building a revolutionary cloud platform that will change the way remote sensing engineers work.
The Problem:The current approach to Earth Observation applications is slow and cumbersome. Finding the right data, processing it, and deploying applications swallows valuable time that could be spent on scientific breakthroughs.
Our Solution:Our platform is poised to revolutionise Earth Observation workflows. It will empower engineers to:Build scalable applications up to 3x faster through seamless data access, processing, and deployment.Bridge the gap between data scientists and software engineers.Unlock new end-user applications and solutions that are beyond just maps.
We're searching for 2 founding engineers to join our team in Munich.
Why You? A visionary leader with a minimum Master's degree in Earth Observation or a closely related discipline. You are:
An expert in Remote Sensing/Earth Observation and ideally AI.A visionary leader with the drive to disrupt the status quo and redefine how Earth Observation is done.Someone who thrives in a fast-paced, startup environment and is eager to make a real impact.Ideally, you have experience within the space sector and a strong network within the Earth Observation community.
What you bring:Expertise in Cloud Infrastructure with a strong focus on Operations and Bare Metal IaaS.Experience as an HPC (High-Performance Computing) Operations Engineer.Proficiency in Data Engineering and MLOps.Strong programming skills, preferably in Python or Golang.Familiarity with Front-End development (big bonus).
The Opportunity:This is your chance to be at the forefront of innovation. You'll join a highly motivated team and:
Shape the future of Earth Observation by building a product that empowers scientists globally.Lead and build your own technical team within the company.Own a significant equity stake in a revolutionary startup.
We are in stealth mode, but development is moving fast! We have a prototype in development and are actively validating with potential first users.
Are you ready to be a pioneer? Apply now and let's chat to see how we can change the world together!
#earthobservation #remotesensing #gis #engineering #startup #cloudplatform #ai

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Description

About Us 

HiBob helps modern, mid-size businesses transform the way they manage people, giving HR and managers all they need to connect, engage, develop, and retain top talent. Since 2015, we‚Äôve achieved consecutive triple-digit year-over-year growth, all backed by our amazing team of Bobbers from across the globe, making us the choice HRIS of over 3500 midsize and multinational companies.

Our HR platform is intuitive, data-driven, and built for the way people work today: globally, remotely, and collaboratively. Fast-growing companies across the globe such as Monzo, Happy Socks, Fiverr, and VaynerMedia rely upon Bob to help them create the best work experiences for their people.

Come and be you with us 

Being a Bobber is all about being you. We want you to bring all parts of yourself to work, giving you the freedom and confidence to be the best you and do your best work. If that‚Äôs bubbly, shy, precise, funny, bold, kind, honest, brilliant, or anything in between, we‚Äôre waiting with open arms. Come join us.

What will you do? 

HiBob is a vibrant, dynamic, happy place to work. A start-up with an amazing culture, and bright and resourceful people in Lisbon, London, Amsterdam, New York, Sydney, and Tel Aviv. We‚Äôre growing fast and looking for talented and passionate Backend Engineers to join us!

As a Backend Engineer on the team, you‚Äôll have a key role in developing our product and its unique features, working closely with our Product team. You should be passionate about software engineering and building a product end-to-end. You will be responsible for owning the dev cycle from the technical design, through coding and testing, to deployment and monitoring. We work in a true continuous delivery environment with fully automated QA processes on a microservices architecture, deploying to production dozens of times every day.

Hear from Ana, a backend engineer based in Lisbon! : https://feed.teamme.io/hibob/9v17adfi

Requirements

Requirements are often considered a measure of how equipped you are to do the job, but sometimes, they aren‚Äôt the only factor. If you don‚Äôt have nearly enough experience, or not all the skills, we‚Äôd still like to hear from you. This could be the perfect fit for you and us.

Professional experience as a software engineer, with a strong emphasis on backend development.Excellent knowledge of software design and scalable architecture.Experience with testing methodologies - unit-testing, TDD, mocking, etc.Experience with relational databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.Independent, fast learner, and excited about learning new technologies.Proactive team player with a desire to impact our team, our product, and our customers.The following are a big plusGo or Kotlin experience.Experience developing a payroll / payments / HR related product.Experience with AWS or an equivalent cloud platform.Having both backend and frontend development experience

Benefits

description:

Who are we?Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. Mision:
The successful candidate will be responsible for the development, deployment, and maintenance of our cloud-based Data Warehouse platform hosted on Amazon Cloud. This includes the design, implementation, and upkeep of the Snowflake platform, which serves as a centralized hub for data management, insights, and analytics. The candidate will be expected to develop and implement automation strategies to enable use case self-service. In addition, the candidate will be responsible for automating platform management tasks. üöÄ WHY US? üöÄJoin our dynamic team of talented individuals and experience a world of growth and opportunities. title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python)
description:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe's first TV streaming service. Today, we're the world's first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We're the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn't changed, even if the world has. We're friendly, international, inclusive ‚Äì and our people say we're reliable and transparent, too. It's why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Do you want to help Zattoo increase the scope of our customer-facing product cockpit? We are searching for a Senior Backend Engineer that can push our technology to the next level. We are facing a migration from a Ruby backend to Python and in addition, have many ideas to increase the experience for our B2B customers that want to run a successful Streaming Product based on our Streaming-as-a-Service platform.

THE BRIDGE TEAM

The Bridge tool, built by the Bridge team, is the interface for our B2B customers to everything they need to run a successful streaming product. The Bridge covers all aspects of customer service needs as well as deeper quality of experience insights and analytics. In addition, the tool provides transparency of the customer's product configuration. Customers can also use it to reach out to their users and customize and personalize their product experience.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Work in a cross-functional Scrum team, alongside other backend engineers, frontend engineers, product managers and product designers.Help with the migration of the Bridge Backend from Ruby to PythonBuild services and APIs that are consumed by the team's frontend, but also by other teams like the Config teamIntegrate 3rd party services (e.g. CMS tools) into our service architecture to enable their usage in our frontendsImplement and develop improvements to platforms, infrastructure, tools, and processesDevelop clean and maintainable codeCollaborate with stakeholders and engineers across the company Become a valued member of Zattoo's Engineering team and improve our core services

WHAT YOU'LL BRING 

Expert knowledge in Python 3 programmingExperience in building highly available services and APIs that scale and work efficiently even under the highest loadExperience in Python-based web frameworks such as FastAPI, Django or similar, A deep understanding of how web-based platforms work, from client requests to server-side handling to front-end rendering,Good understanding of and experience with different data stores and data processing pipelines (Elasticsearch, Redis, MySQL, Scylla, Clickhouse, Kafka)Experience with any of the following programming languages are also a plus: Golang, RubyExperience in development and support of production systems used in a 24x7 operations environmentExperience in testing on different levels and a mindset that sees testing as a foundational part of software developmentFluent verbal and written English language skillsBonus:Experience with migrating Ruby backends to PythonExperience with service-oriented architecture and/or event-driven architectures with integrated external (3rd party) servicesBasic Frontend skills to maintain simple Admin UIs (HTML, Javascript, Bootstrap)Proficient skills and DevOps mentality with on-prem and cloud hosting experience
WHY JOIN US? 

At Zattoo, you're always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You'll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you're helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

Reward: strong market competitive salaryRecharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidaysRegulate:trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year 

Plus:

We're sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the marketWe're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack daysWe're inclusive: 'Zattooies' are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalitiesWe're healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!We're responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentalsWe're sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ's, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event

Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com
