title: Data Engineer
description:
We are a Berlin-based startup that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.
The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.
As a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents, we've recently reached breakeven and are gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up as a Data Engineer to work closely with our senior management and a highly motivated team.
Tasks
As a Data Engineer, you will join the team full-time and support the Data Team in providing data insights to the broader organizations. Specifically you will:

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Define the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product and data team members
Design & build ELT based data models using SQL & DBT
Work with Google Cloud to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.
Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.
Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.
Develop high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure.
Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.
Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.

Requirements

2+ years of professional experience in data engineering field including building data pipelines
Strong expertise in relational databases, including design and performance tuning.
Experience with Google Cloud for data storage, compute resources, and services.
Hands-on production experience with dbt
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Proficiency in Python; knowledge of JavaScript, Bash, and PowerShell is a plus.
Ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and action
Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
Experience with Looker, Tableau or other dashboarding tools
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in English

Benefits

First hand experience with an exciting Berlin tech startup on a steep growth curve
Work closely with an experienced team, keen to train and invest in you
Fast-paced environment and strong company culture for high performing individuals
Unrivaled autonomy and ownership 
Open and fun shared working environment/culture
Office located in the heart of Berlin
Competitive compensation, depending on experience

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Podspace is currently the fastest growing distribution & ad platform for podcasts in the Nordic region. Our mission is to support creators and media companies with technology to reach new heights, while simultaneously playing a crucial role in the dissemination of news, entertainment, ideas, and knowledge.We are looking for a backend developer to join our tight-knit product team and help us build the leading publishing and monetization tools for podcast creators.
In the role you will develop new features and entire areas from start to finish and have a high level of autonomy in your work. You will collaborate with a small hybrid team, mainly located in our Stockholm office.Podspace is growing quickly and offers a dynamic start-up environment with big opportunities to grow and develop alongside the business. In short, this is a unique chance to join a great team early on and shape the future of our tech, product and company.
About you:You are first and foremost a builder.You value working with people who are kind, ambitious and pragmatic.5+ years of experience working as a software developer.Strong proficiency in Ruby and/or Golang, with a preference for experience in both.Extensive experience with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or collaboratively in a team environment

What Podspace offers:A generous compensation package and benefits including stock options.We offer a hybrid workplace with flexible hours and the possibility of remote work, ideally within a time zone close to CET.A dynamic start-up environment that offers freedom, along with the necessary organization and goals, but without unnecessary processes, bureaucracy, rules, or office politics.Opportunities to grow with the company and play a key role in building something valuable together.A high-performing team and friendly, selfless colleagues without prestige and ego who work towards a common goal and take the time to celebrate the successes along the way.

Our teams are working on building the next-generation industrial data platform and applications across many different industries, such as Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, and Power & Utility. As a Data Engineer at Cognite, you will have the unique opportunity to create and deliver solutions that address the most significant challenges faced by our industrial customers. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing data infrastructure and robust pipelines, connecting data from diverse sources. Graduating with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science or similar. Relevant experience can compensate for formal educationExperience with Python, SQL, Rest APIs and GitEnjoys working in cross-functional teamsAble to independently investigate, solve problems and learn quicklyHumility to ask for help and enjoy sharing knowledge with others.

You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

If you're excited about the opportunity to work at Cognite and make a difference in the tech industry, we encourage you to apply today! We welcome candidates of all backgrounds and identities to join our team.

We encourage you to follow us on Cognite LinkedIn; we post all our openings there.

Once you've compiled these documents, we will carefully review your application and proceed with the following steps:

Final Interview

We appreciate your interest in Cognite, and we look forward to reviewing your application and exploring the next steps together. If you meet these requirements, our team will reach out to guide you through the process. Best of luck!

 A snapshot of our many perks and benefits as a Cogniter 

 Competitive salary and benefits include a pension plan, insurance, parental benefits, and more. Join an organization of 70 different nationalities üåê with Diversity, Equality and Inclusion (DEI) in focus ü§ù A highly modern and fun working environment with sublime culture across the organization, follow us on Instagram @ cognitedata üì∑ to know more Flat structure with direct access to decision-makers, with minimal amount of bureaucracy Opportunity to work with and learn from some of the best people on some of the most ambitious projects found anywhere, across industries Join our HUB üó£Ô∏è to be part of the conversation directly with Cogniters and our partners. Gain perks like a paid mobile telephone subscription and broadband connection. Get access to extended private health services with Aker Care. Hungry? We‚Äôve got your back. A subsidized lunch at the canteen is delivered by our chefs who specialise in options for both vegetarians and non-vegetarian, salads and hot soups every day Stay fueled between meals with snacks and drinks on the house. Our own Cognite exclusive coffee bar ‚òï with the friendliest baristas is here to brew coffee for coffee lovers, tea for tea lovers, smoothie for smoothie lovers, and the baristas creative concoctions when the mood strikes. We take your mental- and physical health seriously by having a broad health offering and a free membership to our fully-staffed gym on-site. A pet lover? Get the chance to meet Spot üê∂!

 Why choose Cognite? üèÜ üöÄ 

Join us in making a real and lasting impact in one of the most exciting and fastest-growing new software companies in the world. We have repeatedly demonstrated that digital transformation, when anchored on strong DataOps, drives business value and sustainability for clients and allows front-line workers, as well as domain experts, to make better decisions every single day. title: Python Developer - IQ Plus

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Bij JEX bouwen we aan innovatieve software voor de uitzendbranche. Met inmiddels acht productteams werken we in een Agile/Scrum omgeving aan verschillende webapplicaties, gebouwd op een microservice landschap met √©√©n datawaarheid. Bouw jij binnenkort als Full Stack Developer mee?
Als Full Stack Developer werk jij, met jouw front-end en back-end ervaring, mee aan het ontwikkelen van onze one-stop-shop applicaties. Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons de vrijheid om mee te denken over ons architectuur en techniek. Door naar de input van onze Developers te luisteren zorgen we ervoor dat onze software innovatief is en de meest moderne technologie√´n gebruikt.
Dit vind jij leuk om te doen:Als Full Stack Developer draai je mee in een multidisciplinair Scrum team. Met je team bouw je aan een product dat onderdeel is van een cloud-based microservice landschap. Dit ga je doen:Werken in teamverband met collega‚Äôs van verschillende expertises; Meedenken over onze technische keuzes en architectuur; Technisch uitdenken en ontwikkelen van onze webapplicaties, van front-end tot en met back-end; Buiten je functie treden en samen met je team het product tot een hoger niveau brengen. 
Je werkt samen met een productteam, bestaande uit: Product Owner, Dedicated Scrum Master, Lead Developer, Business Analisten, UX Designers, Developers en Test Automation Engineers. 
Benieuwd hoe wij bij JEX √©√©n datawaarheid cre√´ren? Neem hier een kijkje onder onze motorkap: JEXPLAIN.
Hier herken jij jezelf in:Je bent een gedreven ontwikkelaar die naast het werk in een Scrum team, ook de samenwerking opzoekt met andere teams. Dit heb je ook: Een goed stel hersens op minimaal hbo denk- en werkniveau met een relevant diploma of een sterk verhaal waarom je geen diploma nodig hebt; Kennis van de volgende technieken: C# .NET, REST API, Angular/Typescript, HTML/CSS; In ieder geval basiskennis van Entity Framework, MSSQL en SCSS; Minimaal twee jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie; Een sterke Agile mindset;Kennis van Azure en Tailwind (een pr√©).
Mis je toch iets in het bovenstaande rijtje, maar kun je goed uitleggen waarom de functie en JEX bij jou past? In gemotiveerde kandidaten investeren we maar al te graag!
Wat biedt JEX:Bij JEX werk je met de meest moderne technieken. Het upgraden naar nieuwe versies van onze gebruikte frameworks staat bij ons altijd hoog op de prioriteiten lijst. Dit kan je verwachten:Een salaris tussen ‚Ç¨3.500 en ‚Ç¨6.500 (o.b.v. je ervaring, skills en potentie); Meegroeien met JEX door onze aandelenregeling voor personeel; Mogelijkheden voor een fiets van de zaak of een volledige reiskostenvergoeding; 30 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld; Een omgeving waar ruimte is voor initiatieven, idee√´n en kennisdeling: wij moedigen je altijd aan om de beste versie van jezelf te worden; Diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden voor als je wat front-end of back-end kennis wil bijspijkeren of ineens besluit om als Scrum Master door het leven te gaan.  
JEX in het kortAls software en serviceorganisatie heeft JEX de ambitie om de arbeidsmarkt flink op te schudden. Een klein beetje omdat we dat leuk vinden, maar bovenal om uitzendorganisaties, werkgevers en medewerkers ruimte te geven om te groeien. Hoe we dat doen? Met onze zelfgebouwde software en aanvullende services. 
En waar deze software en services binnen de productstrategie het allerbelangrijkste zijn, zien we de mensen van JEX als ons grootste kapitaal. Daar zorgen we dus goed voor en dat merk je aan alles. Van ons mooie pand aan de Maas met ontbijt en lunch in ons bedrijfsrestaurant, tot aan een gebedsruimte en de mogelijkheid om feestdagen om te wisselen. En natuurlijk kunnen de vrijmibo‚Äôs ook niet ontbreken. Wat ons uniek maakt? De ruimte die we je bieden om te experimenteren, te groeien, op je bek te gaan en impact te maken. Want talent en kwaliteit excelleren in een open en ambitieuze omgeving, waar hecht wordt samengewerkt aan onze missie. Dat is waar wij in geloven!
#WorkAsOne 
Overtuigd?Logisch! Al zeggen we het zelf. Solliciteren kan snel en gemakkelijk via onderstaand formulier. We zijn vooral benieuwd naar de persoon achter de naam, jouw motivatie, skills en wat jou speciaal maakt. Een kleine tip: kort is de kunst, krachtig de key.

title: Machine Learning Scientist
description:
Hydrosat is a data analytics and satellite Earth observation company leveraging thermal infrared and multi-spectral data to deliver insights into crop health, drought and wildfire risk, industrial activity, and defense situational awareness to government and commercial customers. Our data analytics team in Luxembourg applies proprietary algorithms to thermal imagery and combines this with data fusion capabilities to extract valuable insights. We are seeking a machine learning engineer in Luxembourg to develop state of the art machine learning models in support of our commercial products. This role will appeal to candidates with a strong scientific background who are looking to use their data science and machine learning skills to make an impact on the world in agriculture, climate, and public safety monitoring applications.What you‚Äôll doConduct original research in machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence to solve complex problems.

Design, develop, and optimize novel machine learning models and algorithms.Extract valuable information from satellite imagery and turn it into actionable insights for agriculture.Work with new and emerging technologies including Python data science tools.Work with high performance computing platforms.Integrate data sources and work with the software development team to deliver data products to customer endpoints.Identify and mitigate technical and schedule risks during development.



Requirements

Ph.D. or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.3+ years of machine learning development experience using multiple tools, technologies and frameworks.Strong analytical skills and critical mindset, with the ability to build innovative solutions.Strong background in statistics and probability theory.Proficiency in Python, with the ability to learn new languages and technologies quickly.Fluency in software development tools and practices (version control, test, debugging, continuous integration/continuous development).Highly self-motivated, keen learner able to solve challenging problems with creative solutions.Extensive experience processing satellite imagery (Sentinel, Landsat, VIIRS, MODIS datasets) and using geo information technology and raster data processing tools (GDAL, Rasterio, Geopandas).Strong team player with demonstrated ability to take ownership and drive execution.Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with internal and external teams to deliver capability to users.

Desired QualificationsExperience implementing land-cover classification or time-series forecasting models.Experience deploying machine learning models in a production environment.Working knowledge with AWS or other cloud provider (GCP, Azure).Experience with containerization.Experience with high performance computing platforms (HPC).



Benefits

Competitive salary Employee equity Flexible and dynamic startup environment Professional development opportunities Access to great facilities at the Luxembourg House of Startups building

title: Data Engineer
description:
What are you going to do as Data Engineer?

Are you ready to harness your data engineering skills to optimize Employee Experience and drive organizational performance of renowned brands? We are seeking a Data Engineer who is passionate about human behavior and aspires to play Champions League People Analytics.

What are we offering?

A competitive salary and excellent benefits including performance pay, provisions for mobility, pension and leave;Sincere attention to personal development including coaching by colleagues, access to and wide range of education and training and a personal development plan with matching investments;A place within a challenging and growing organization where taking personal responsibility is valued, you have the autonomy and freedom to perform your work flexibly with short lines of communication with colleagues;A pleasant working environment with a pleasant and easily accessible office, focus on performance as a team and not on the individual and numerous social activities such as get-togethers, sports activities and team meetings.

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Mambu, we believe that banking and financial services can change the world for the better. We also know that inflexible systems are slowing innovation and limiting impact. We‚Äôre on a mission to change that, to make banking work better for everyone.

Join us as we bring banking and financial services technology into the digital-first world. Where our best-in-class, cloud-banking platform is igniting financial change globally. Where we are enabling our customers to build great banking experiences for their customers; in a faster, more flexible and more dependable way than ever before.

If this mission drives you, if you are bold, curious, customer-obsessed and ready to embrace a challenge, then we want you on our team.

At Mambu our people are the foundation! We prioritise continuous learning and development to empower Mambuvians for success and growth. We provide a learning budget by function for professional development and offer a comprehensive L&D program that enhances both technical expertise and soft skills.

Let‚Äôs rewrite the rules of banking together!

What You‚Äôll Do

 Build software that resolves real life fintech problems for a high number of customers and impacting millions of end-users, worldwide.  Deal with complex calculations which require a high degree of logical thinking on top of technical skills.  Lead end-to-end feature delivery from design to planning, implementation and deployment.  Identify, propose and contribute to/coordinate architectural improvements. 

What You‚Äôll Bring

 4+ years experience working in Java  Object Orientation: Design Patterns and SOLID principles.  Be highly adaptable and demonstrate ability to work independently  Integration/E2E (e.g. testcontainers, Playwright) testing knowledge;  Experience with TDD  Advanced knowledge of RDBMSes (e.g. MySQL);  Handling large datasets efficiently, both in Java and Databases  Exposure to AWS, Google Cloud and Azure  Knowledge of scalable and resilient application architecture  Performance testing knowledge (e.g. Gatling), skills of investigating and addressing performance issues (eg. Dynatrace)  Know-how of writing your own tests (i.e.: integration tests, end-to-end tests and so on)  Able to take ownership of customer issues reported while on-call and manage the problems through to resolution 

Your future

We aim to be the leading cloud-banking platform, powering the future of banking and igniting financial change globally. If you want to join a collaborative, inclusive team of experts changing the lives of billions, this is where you belong.

The base salary for this position is ‚Ç¨4750 gross (before taxes) monthly. This is a full-time equivalent target rate for Lithuania only. Actual rate offered will vary depending on the nature of the role and the breadth of skills and expertise the candidate brings to the role relative to existing Mambuvians.

For the rest of the locations where we advertise this role, the starting salary will be discussed during the recruitment process.

Let's connect!

Follow Mambu on LinkedIn for the latest Fintech trends and success stories. Connect with us on Facebook , Instagram , and YouTube to experience our vibrant culture. Explore our mission, values, and the world we're building at mambu.com/careers .

Follow the work of our Product and Engineering teams as they continuously make our products and platform bigger, better, faster and stronger. Check out our Medium Product & Tech Log.

As part of the recruitment (or HR onboarding) process, you will be required to obtain authorised criminal background and credit screening results, as well as be queried against a sanctions/anti-money-laundering/counter terrorism financing/politically exposed persons screening service and your employment is conditional upon approval of these results.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many job seekers (including women, people of colour and people from diverse backgrounds) are reluctant to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.

Here at Mambu we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Mambu is committed to working with and providing equal opportunities to people with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable adaptation of the process to accommodate your needs, please contact us at talent.acquisition@mambu.com and let us know how we may assist you.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Introduction to the job

Are you challenged by delivering solutions to complex engineering problems in a multi-disciplinary team? Do you enjoy capitalizing on .NET software technology in an Agile development context to create solutions that our customers appreciate? Would you like to contribute to the world‚Äôs most advanced chip production metrology equipment? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for a Software Engineer!

Role and responsibilities

Job Mission:

Within Business Line Applications, the D&E YieldStar software groups address the area of complex machine algorithms software. You will be end-to-end responsible for realization of software in C# contributing to development of the YieldStar software platform. This is done using a SAFe (Scrum/Agile) way of working.

Job Description:

In this position you are a member of the YS On-tool Application SW group. This group works on the implementation of complex machine algorithms. In the Scrum team you take the initiative to address user stories in this scope. You are guided by the Scrum Master, Software Architect, and Product Owner. Furthermore, you cooperate with other software team members, and involve Customer Support and Manufacturing representatives. You apply software engineering best practices such as requirements engineering (user story definition), object oriented analysis and design, implementation in C#, testing, and integration in the YieldStar software platform.

Main Responsibilities:

Act as Scrum team member in a SAFe organization.Demonstrate end-to-end ownership for feature/story based software engineering.Align specifications with stakeholders in the functional team.Secure both software and product quality.Software realization, including design, testing and documentation.Contribute to continuous improvement of our Agile software development for the software department as a whole.Transfer knowledge to colleagues in both D&E and sectors supporting operations (e.g. Customer Support).

Education and experience

Education:

Master degree in computer science, informatics, mathematics, physics, or electronics.

Experience:

> 5 years in object oriented development of technical software for high-tech equipment> 3 years of experience with C# and recent versions of .NET frameworkProven experience in applying SW design patterns to create robust and maintainable designsPreferably mathematical aptitude to implement complex machine algorithms

Skills

Personal skills:

Team playerAble to work in a cross-disciplinary Scrum team in a dynamic product development environmentStrong analytical view combined with pragmatic attitude (flexibility)Willing to take end-to-end ownershipQuality and value orientation, getting to the essence, setting and acting according to prioritiesCurious, fast learning (mostly on the job)Good communicational skills (both written and verbal) and good knowledge of English

Other information

Please add your complete, recent CV and cover letter for this position to your application.

We can't process your application without the above-mentioned documents.

Diversity and inclusion

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

title: Backend Developer (PHP)
description:

The SaaS platform for workforce management is currently seeking a backend developer to join our product team! Are you ready for a new challenge at a rapidly growing and international company?

Your GitHub account, for example, is more than welcome. We look forward to your application!

title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer
description:
Join our growing international team at Yieldigo, a leader in pricing optimization with a strong presence from Prague's CTU to Silicon Valley. Do you enjoy working with data and seeing it as more than just numbers? Then why not become our new Data Analyst / Data Engineer?
Who are we?
We're Yieldigo, offering clients software that allows them to efficiently manage the pricing of goods in both physical stores and e-shops. We started as a startup, but have grown into a mature company utilized by retail chains in 11 countries worldwide. We are now heading into the next phase of our go-to-market strategy with a strategic partner who will sell our software in North America. This brings increased demands on the existing team as well as new reinforcements.
And what about you? 
‚úÖ Do you enjoy reading and analyzing data, and can you explain the findings in simple terms?‚úÖ Are you comfortable talking to people and looking for solutions where others see only obstacles?‚úÖ Do you want to do meaningful work where you can see the results first hand and where you are not merely a cog in a corporate machine?
If you ticked 3 times ‚úÖ, then read on!
What will you do here? 
As the master of data at Yieldigo, you will become a valuable asset to Alina's team, our Onboarding Director. You will be responsible for ensuring the quality of processed client data, identifying opportunities to automate processes, and contributing to the overall improvement of our integration processes. Working with data will enable you to uncover insights that might otherwise go unnoticed and to think strategically in terms of business objectives.
How do we picture you?
This is not a junior role; we‚Äôre looking for candidates with proven experience, independence and problem-solving skills.You can interpret data findings and draw conclusions in simple terms that are clear to everyone, and to find business logic in data.You enjoy communicating with people, explaining problems in a structured manner, and proposing solutions.Your knowledge of Python is at least at an advanced level.You can use Pandas library to transform, clean and analyze data.We will be over the moon if your SQL (PostgreSQL) skills go beyond the ordinary.English proficiency at C1 level or higher.
What's in it for you?

title: Application Engineer
description:
Our client is a leader in Industrial Automation and Process Control technology. With a focus on temperature control and data acquisition our client offers innovative solutions to the Industrial, Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology and Healthcare organisations globally.
A bit about the role:‚Ä¢ My client is looking for a highly motivated Application Engineer, who has experience with commissioning and installation on customers sites.‚Ä¢ The Application Engineer will be responsible providing written functional analysis to define how the project will be carries out on a technical basis.‚Ä¢ Within the role of the Application Engineer, this will be to lease with the pre-sales team to make sure projects are delivered on time.‚Ä¢ In the role of an Application Engineer, it will include draft design documents, user and operating manuals, but also to ensure all technical execution of maintenance contracts throughout the year.‚Ä¢ Our client would look for the Application Engineer to develop customers manufacturing processes.‚Ä¢ Interact with clients: Collaborate closely with clients to understand their needs, effectively communicate project progress, and ensure customer satisfaction throughout the process.
What‚Äôs required: ‚Ä¢ Engineering degree in electrical engineering, industrial computer science or related field.‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience within Electricity or Power.‚Ä¢ Candidates must have worked within an Engineering Manufacturing background‚Ä¢ A valid French driving license.‚Ä¢ A track record Qualifications and commissioning: Perform FAT/IQ/OQ qualifications and carry out commissioning at customers' sites.‚Ä¢ Happy to work on-call technical support.‚Ä¢ Fluent in English speaking‚Ä¢ Proven experience in development on industrial PLCs.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
Onsite - Madrid OR Malaga
A leading global FinTech company is seeking experienced Full Stack Engineers to join their team. These positions are for a brand new Engineering team. They are looking for Engineers at all levels: Senior, Staff and Principal.
This role involves working in a wider distributed team. The selected candidate will play a pivotal role in developing and enhancing the company's core platform, focusing on the customer facingelements.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and improve the next iteration of the client platform‚Äôs services.Collaborate with team members and engineering leaders to design new services and components.Take full ownership of the products developed, including ongoing maintenance.Develop complex web applications using technologies such as Python/Django, Node.js, React, and VueJS. Experience with other languages is also valued.Communicate ideas clearly and concisely in English, both written and spoken.Establish standard APIs, incorporate monitoring systems, and integrate external systems.Build and run services, ensuring code is containerised, monitored, and alerted properly.Maintain high quality in code with thorough test coverage, using tools like Jenkins pipelines and Terraform for CI and deployment.Stay up to date with emerging technologies, tools, and practices.
Qualifications and Experience:Strong understanding of basic algorithms, object-oriented and functional design principles, and best-practice patterns.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.Over 2 years of experience applying AI to practical technology solutions (desired).Proficiency with TypeScript, Vue 3, TailwindCSS, PostCSS, Webpack, Jest, Cypress, and Storybook.Experience with Python3, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Rest APIs (desired).Strong knowledge of Linux systems, cloud infrastructure, networking, and databases.Proficiency in writing testable code with good coverage for unit and integration tests.Familiarity with SQL is a plus.Excellent communication and collaboration skills.Ability to clearly articulate ideas in English, both written and spoken.
*intro Consulting Ltd are acting as a third party recruitment agency for this position*

title: Python Developer (Senior) - Security-Focused Role

This role is based on Individual Work Contract collaboration.

title: Data Engineer
description:
SEARGIN IS HIRING!
As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!
Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for a Data Engineer!

Location: remote/Poland/SpanJob Type: full-timeContract: b2bLanguages: English
Role Overview:Complements solution and data architecture to design end-to-end data solutions with a focus on semantic interoperability and harmonization of clinical information systems for both transactional and analytical use cases. This includes identifying appropriate data standards (e.g., HL7 v2/3, SMART-on-FHIR, etc.), data models (e.g., OMOP, FHIR, etc.), terminology services (e.g., RTS, etc.) Designs and develops systems for managing terminologies, mappings, and crosswalks, and for their validation/testing.
As part or our strategy we would like to standarize Evidens Platform (EDC) we would need to have a resource supporting us on the assessment of data standards, selection and implementation support of the standards to our EDC Platform.
Qualifications:Must have:Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, data science, informaticsHands-on experience with healthcare dataIn at least one of the following disease areas: oncology, neuro, immunology, infectious diseases, ophthalmology, cardiovascular and metabolismHands-on experience with real-world data, specifically OMOPExperience with terminology integration, including OHDSI Athena and UMLSPython (NumPy, Pandas, etc.) or RSQL
Nice to have:Experience with semantic web technologies (e.g., SPARQL, RDF, OWL, Turtle)


Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!To learn more about Seargin, please visit our web page: www.seargin.com

title: Software Developer
description:
Er du en sulten og nysgjerrig backend-utvikler?

Telenor g√•r gjennom en stor transformasjon der digitalisering og teknologiutvikling er n√∏kkelen til suksess. Vi s√∏ker deg som motiveres av √• utvikle tjenester og produkter som gj√∏r nordmenns digitale hverdag enklere, bedre og tryggere.

Vi jobber i autonome, kryssfunksjonelle team med b√•de videreutvikling og drift. Gjennom innovasjon, ny teknologi, gode produkter og tjenester, utvikler vi de beste l√∏sningene for interne og eksterne brukere. Som et av Norges st√∏rste og mest kompetente IT-milj√∏er f√•r man muligheten til √• sparre med de beste hodene i hverdagen. IT Telenor Norge legger sterk vekt p√• l√¶ring og egenutvikling.

I m√∏te med det digitale skiftet trenger vi n√• flere dyktige teknologer som evner √• se det store bildet. Vi trenger deg som kan ta eierskap til deler av prosessen, utfordre det etablerte og samhandle godt med andre i teamet om kontinuerlig forbedring. 

Som Software Developer vil du bidra inn i alle deler fra utvikling, integrasjon, testing og vedlikehold av programvare basert p√• smidig utviklingsmetodikk og DevOps prinsipper. Du b√∏r brenne for faget ditt og v√¶re god til √• samarbeide med andre p√• tvers av en rekke fagfelt.

Hos oss st√•r utstrakt bruk av skyteknologi, sikkerhet og personvern i h√∏ysetet. Du vil jobbe tett med produkteiere, designere og utviklere p√• tvers av team. Du jobber ogs√• tett p√• ulike fagmilj√∏er og m√•lgrupper/brukere i omgivelsene. Du blir veiledet av andre utviklere, for √• sammen lage applikasjoner som gj√∏r en verdifull forskjell.

Hvis dette vekker din interesse, fortsett √• lese!

√Ö jobbe i Telenor handler ikke bare om √• videreutvikle og skape viktige l√∏sninger, men som Telenoransatt vil vi at du skal utvikle deg, l√¶re og ha en jobbhverdag der du opplever deg verdifull og trygg. Dette er noe av det vi kan tilby deg:

 Et arbeidsmilj√∏ der tillit og kultur st√•r helt sentralt. Du blir lyttet til og f√•r st√∏tte fra et lag med eksperter med h√∏y yrkesstolthet innen ulike fagmilj√∏er. Du har alltid folk rundt deg som er villige til √• strekke ut en h√•nd. I Telenor er folk det viktigste vi har, s√• det jobbes kontinuerlig og iherdig med √• skape en kultur og et milj√∏ der du skal ha det godt. En smidig arbeidshverdag med full fleksibilitet til √• jobbe der du √∏nsker. En velutstyrt digital rigg gj√∏r det mulig √• jobbe hjemme eller fra hytta n√•r du trenger det - men vi har ogs√• superflotte lokaler og trives sammen, s√• det er skikkelig fint √• m√∏tes p√• jobb ogs√•! Muligheten til √• l√¶re masse og skape en karrierevei i den retningen du √∏nsker. Telenor betyr utvikling for deg som har ambisjoner om √• vokse og l√¶re gjennom √• ta ansvar og initiativ. Som teknologer flest har du sikkert egne preferanser i forhold til arbeidsverkt√∏y / -plattform og hos oss kan du selvsagt velge det som passer best for deg enten det er Mac, Windows eller Linux-basert. Og s√• alt det som egentlig er hygienefaktorer: God l√∏nn, sv√¶rt gode ordninger for pensjon, forsikringer og foreldrepermisjon, juleferie og p√•skeferie i tillegg til vanlig ferie og firmahytter i hele Norge. Vi har idrettslag for alt fra cricket, padling, golf og yoga, treningssenter p√• jobb, og ikke minst en behagelig arbeidshverdag i topp moderne lokaler med sosiale soner, en av Norges beste kantiner og kaffebar.  

Hvis du kan gi en tommellopp p√• disse sp√∏rsm√•lene b√∏r du s√∏ke!

 Har du kjennskap til og erfaring med Java og Spring Boot? Du er enten nyutdannet eller har noen √•rs efaring og har et √∏nske om √• jobbe smidig med utvikling etter DevOps-prinsipper. Mangler du formell utdannelse kan dette helt fint kompenseres med relevant erfaring samt vilje og evne til √• l√¶re ‚Äì vi er ikke s√• veldig opptatt av hvor du har l√¶rt det du kan.  Er du modig nok til √• stille sp√∏rsm√•l og utfordre oss n√•r du mener at vi tenker i gamle m√∏nstre? Er du klar for √• ta en rolle i en avdeling som s√∏ker √• jobbe innsiktsdrevet og agilt? Vi skal pushe grensene for teknologi enten det er √• skape bedre opplevelser for gamere gjennom redusert latency, bringe underholdningstjenester til kundene uavhengig av hvor de er, gj√∏re fjernoperasjoner mulig med lavere responstid eller utvikle tjenester vi per n√• bare ser konturene av.   Liker du folk? Er du nysgjerrig p√• hvordan kundene tenker? Og liker du √• bygge relasjoner og gode team p√• arbeidsplassen slik at vi kan vokse, l√¶re og sammen skape tjenester som overg√•r det kundene forventer av oss?  

Da gleder vi oss til √• bli kjent med deg!

 S√∏knadsfrist: Snarest. Vi vurderer s√∏knader fortl√∏pende Arbeidssted: Fornebu (Oslo) For sp√∏rsm√•l rundt stillingen ta kontakt med:
 John Johnsrud - john.johnsrud@telenor.no / +47 402 04 300 Vi utf√∏rer bakgrunnssjekk av relevante kandidater via Semac AS Stillingen krever sikkerhetsklarering

title: Full Stack Developer
description:

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
ASBIS is a pre-eminent global value add distributor, OEM, and solutions provider. We are distinguished by our in-depth industry insight and 32+ years of experience as a reliable global partner for clients and suppliers.
About the position: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Computer Vision. In this role, you will be responsible for researching and developing cutting-edge Computer Vision approaches for classification, detection, and segmentation tasks.
Main tasks:Research and development of Computer Vision approaches for classification, detection and segmentation tasks.Lead the development of Computer Vision and Machine Learning projects in a dynamic startup-like environment;Experimenting with innovative deep learning methods to enhance the quality of our models;Exploring techniques to augment the quality and volume of our training data;Optimizing our training and inference infrastructure to squeeze out every FLOP out of hardware.Collaborating with engineers and technicians to develop and implement robotic solutions.
Requirements:Experience in image processing, computer vision, and machine learningExpertise with traditional CV approaches (e.g., OpenCV)Classification, detection, and segmentation approachesVisual odometry and SLAMVisual object trackingModel optimization (quantization, sparsification, etc.)Expertise with Python and/or C++Building deep neural networks with modern tools, such as PyTorch or TensorflowBuilding, testing, and deploying computer vision-based solutionsPreferably 3+ years of professional level experience in the field of Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Computer Graphics or similarUnderstanding of and experience with any of the following topics but not limited to: 3D object recognition, 3D reconstruction, real-time machine vision and its application for robot guidance, pattern recognition, sensor alignment, and calibrationFamiliarity with most common programming tools such as; R, Python, OpenCV, PyTorch3D, Kaolin, Tensorflow, PCL, OpenCL/CUDA, MATLAB, Jupyter.
We offer:Opportunity to work for a financially strong, fast-growing multinational companyConstant interaction with global teams of professionals üéØInternational career opportunities üöÄAccess to continuous professional development: training, certification programs, events, and team buildingsAttractive remuneration packageLife events‚Äô gifts, corporate presents and awards, years of service bonuses üéÅSpecial prices for the Company productsSupport with relocation to Cyprus, if you're interested.
Embrace PossibilityNo matter your expertise, ASBIS offers a spectrum of career opportunities that match your skills and passions. Your journey starts here. Join us today.

title: Data and Automation Engineer
description:
As a Data and Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for building and implementing Python scripts from concept to production. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts, to address business problems and create scalable and efficient data engineering and automation solutions.
Responsibilities:1. Python ETL Script Development: Design, build, and deploy Python scripts to address specific business problems. Collaborate with data specialist to understand requirements and objectives.2. System Integration. Design and implement scripts that consume REST and other APIs in the retrieval of transactional data.3. Scalability: Develop scalable and efficient scripts that can handle large volumes of data and real-time processing requirements.4. Continuous Improvement: Implement feedback loops and mechanisms to continuously improve the accuracy and scripts. Stay proactive in identifying and addressing potential issues.5. Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and ensure that machine learning solutions align with organizational goals.6. Documentation: Create comprehensive documentation for scripts, algorithms, and deployment processes. Ensure knowledge transfer and support for other team members.
Qualifications:‚Ä¢ Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.‚Ä¢ At least 2+ years of Python development experience‚Ä¢ Extensive experience with Pandas and large dataframes‚Ä¢ Experience working with Numpy for calculations‚Ä¢ Experience calling REST APIs from within a Python script‚Ä¢ Experience with JSON data structures‚Ä¢ Experience reading and writing to RDBMS and flat flies‚Ä¢ Familiarity with big data technologies and cloud platforms.‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.‚Ä¢ Effective communication and collaboration skills.
For this you will have:- Budget of 1.200‚Ç¨ in individual training for you to use it in whatever you want (technological events, books, trainings, certifications etc.).- Follow-up with your team every month for continuous feedback.- Telework 2 days a week.- Flexible hours to help you reconcile your professional / family life.- Private medical insurance fully paid by Capitole.- Flexible remuneration (restaurant tickets, transport and/or childcare).- Andjoy (Gymforless)- Discounts on major brands for employees (Club Capitole).
To get to know the whole Capitole Team:- Team Buildings every two months - you can't miss the summer party or Christmas dinner!- Soccer team sponsored by Capitole.- Technological communities for you to share your knowledge and ideas with the other teams, sharing internal knowledge is essential!!!!- Last but not least a TEAM! title: Data Scientist
description:
Description

Position at LeoVegas Group

About The Role

We are looking for an enthusiastic junior to mid-level data scientist to join our dynamic and growing team at LeoVegas. The ideal candidate will have an open-minded attitude and be eager to learn. You will get the opportunity to work hands-on in the entire lifecycle of putting machine learning based applications in production.

Our team is responsible for providing the entire organisation, including all brands and markets, with algorithms for decision-making support, product personalization, and optimization and automation of business processes. Our project portfolio is diverse and constantly growing. Examples include churn prediction, lifetime-value prediction, player risk assessment models (responsible gaming), money laundering detection, and recommender systems to name a few.

Our data science team is not focused on reporting; we actively develop and deploy models into production that directly serve and enhance the entire organisation.

YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:

Interpret stakeholder requirements to develop, implement, and fine-tune machine learning models that address their specific needs and business objectives.Improve and maintain existing machine learning models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency over time as well as following new regulations.Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including product, engineering, and business, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of machine learning solutions with overall company goals.Analyse and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for machine learning model development and ensure data integrity and accuracy.Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.Collaborate with external parties to enable outsourced ML based applications.Perform advanced analysis on large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights and inform the business to make informed decisions

OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:

Essential Skills

Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learningExperience in apply machine learning, either in academia or industryProficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.Experience with SQLBasic understanding of Git

NICE TO HAVES

Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Airflow, Bayesian statistics, BigQuery, causal inference, Docker, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, Kubeflow, natural language processing, neural networks, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting, Vertex AI, and XGBoost

Who We Are

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We‚Äôre a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.

Benefits

Hybrid work policy4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)30 annual vacation daysOccupational Pension5,000 SEK wellness contribution annuallyParental Leave Top-UpPossibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner1,500 SEK equipment allowanceBenify - benefits portal with many offers and discountsWe offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

JOIN US!

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don‚Äôt wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

**As our company working language is English, we‚Äôd like to see your CV in English, please**

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

title: Go Backend Engineer
description:

title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
description:
Senior Backend Developer ‚Äì Stockholm, HybridAre you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?
What's in it for you?You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.
Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you‚Äôll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskv√•rd) and private pension contribution.
What you'd be doing?You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.
You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.

About you?You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI. You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.
You‚Äôd have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.
Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
A bit about them?A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.

Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.

3 stage Interview ProcessInitial ChatTechnical DiscussionFinal with CEO

title: Python Full Stack Developer
description:
Sede: Roma

Esperienza: Almeno 5 anni

Cosa aspettarti da questa posizione

Sarai inserito/a all‚Äôinterno della nostra Deda Next, azienda del Gruppo che offre alle Pubbliche Amministrazioni Centrali e Locali e alle Utilities, servizi e soluzioni per la trasformazione digitale, per la trasparenza e l‚Äôinteroperabilit√† dei dati, per la transizione ecologica ed una maggiore efficacia ed efficienza gestionale. Svolgerai le tue attivit√† in un contesto dinamico, dedicato alla consulenza e alla realizzazione di soluzioni software realizzate per i nostri Clienti, modellando i processi di business e identificando la tipologia pi√π adeguata di soluzioni ICT.

In particolare, ti occuperai di:

Collaborare con altri sviluppatori e membri del team per progettare e implementare soluzioni software;Creare e mantenere la documentazione tecnica;Partecipare attivamente al processo di testing e debugging del software;Implementare le migliori pratiche di sicurezza e performance;Collaborare con il team DevOps per garantire il rilascio efficiente delle applicazioni.

Must Have

Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria del Software o campo correlato;Esperienza comprovata come sviluppatore full stack (Backend / Frontend);Conoscenza approfondita di Python, preferibilmente con esperienza nel framework Twisted;Competenza in Javascript/Typescript con padronanza di framework come Angular/AngularJS;Conoscenza approfondita di HTML e CSS;Competenza nell'utilizzo di Bash per l'automazione di processi;Esperienza nella scrittura di unit-testing e browser testing;Competenza nell'utilizzo dei database pi√π conosciuti (PostgreSQL, SqLite, MySQL, Oracle);Esperienza con SQL Alchemy ORM e Alembic per la gestione delle migrazioni;Conoscenza approfondita dell'ambiente Docker;Competenza nell'utilizzo di sistemi basati su GNU/Linux;Conoscenza di sistemi di versioning come Git.

Plus

Competenze in ambito geospaziale (gdal);Competenze in ambito data scientist (numpy,pandas);Competenze nei processi DevOps.

Le Soft Skills Che Riteniamo Importanti

Siamo alla ricerca di una persona orientata al team working e al risultato, con ottime doti comunicative ed in grado di gestire autonomamente le scadenza e la pianificazione delle attivit√†.

Dedicated to Growth

Che si tratti di un software, di una soluzione tecnologica o di una consulenza, al cuore di ogni progetto ci sono sempre persone che lavorano insieme ad altre persone. Competenti e curiose, ambiziose e tenaci: alle Deda People piace imparare, confrontarsi, migliorare. La dedizione, per noi, √® attitudine al miglioramento continuo, ricerca di obiettivi sempre nuovi, raggiungimento di risultati e capacit√† di lavorare insieme. ll nostro impegno √® far crescere le persone perch√© possano migliorare, esprimere al meglio il proprio potenziale e contribuire alla costruzione di un futuro migliore: per s√©, per Deda e per la societ√† tutta.

description:

title: Data Scientist
description:
Job Location: Helsinki, Finland

We don‚Äôt just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with Cancer.

The Data Scientist would work in cooperation with the Elekta engineering team and product management to build production grade machine learning systems and to draw insights from data to benefit users including both cancer patients and health care professionals.

What You‚Äôll Do At Elekta

Would you like to be part of our driven global team, where we aim to attract and invite the best competences to Elekta? We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join our engineering team at Helsinki (Finland), which is currently a team of seven team members.

In this exciting and diverse role, you will participate in Elekta machine learning and data science related R&D activities including academic research conducted jointly with partner clinics and hospitals.

Responsibilities

Developing Elekta‚Äôs machine learning capabilities. Participating in product development with the Engineering team. Participating in company‚Äôs data science research, development, verification and validation work. Participating in joint academic research with partners ‚Äì as needed. 

What You Bring

Earlier experience in the field of data science, especially in machine learning from concepts to implementation. Experience with Python and libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn and Flask. Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field. Understanding of modern software development tools and technologies. Fluency in English written & verbal. 

What You Will Get

In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.

Overview of some of our benefits for Finland as below.

Flexible work @ Elekta (this is a hybrid role ‚Äì you will need to be in our Helsinki office 3 days a week) Lunch Benefit Sport and culture Benefit Occupational Healthcare OP Extra Health Insurance Mobile Phone Benefit 

Hiring process

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resum√© in English, via the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

Your Elekta contact

For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Sarkar, nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

About Elekta

Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.

We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Software Support Engineer
description:
With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.At QUALCO, we empower the financial world with innovative technology. We are looking for an experienced, self-motivated engineer to join our Software Support Team and provide high quality solutions/support to our rapidly growing client base. As a Software Support Engineer you will be working closely with our Service Management and Software Development teams to improve customer experience, provide effective integration and service request solutions as well as identify and timely resolve issues of our client's.A Day in the Life of a Software Support Engineer at Qualco will include: Understanding clients' installations and processes; Designing procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance; Building tools/queries to fulfil customer service requests and improve customer experience; Investigating and identify root cause concerning reported customer incidents; Perform service restoration actions when possible; Taking part in the investigation and Problem Management processes - during the support & maintenance phases - by implementing bug fixes, upgrades and enhancements to our existing clients; Providing second level support for Qualco software services; and Developing/Updating internal Monitoring Tools. Ensuring that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements and supporting the continued implementation of the Group Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy. 

Requirements

 Degree in Computer Science or a relevant field of study; Work experience as a Support Engineer or similar software engineering role; Experience in NET Framework, C#, databases and SQL; Microsoft ETL tools and IIS knowledge will be highly appreciated; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; High level of ownership and attention to detail; Team Spirit and passion for results;  Client facing with good verbal and written communication and interpersonal skill; and Firm command of the English language. 

Benefits

description:

title: Software Engineer
description:
Wat ga je doen?

Zo ga jij deze uitdaging aan!

We zien je graag als onze nieuwe teamlid wanneer je een gretig karakter hebt, niet alleen om kennis op te doen, ook om kennis te delen met anderen. Je staat open voor feedback geven en ontvangen en weet in je werk een passende balans tussen kwaliteit en doelmatigheid te vinden. Met jouw opgedane kennis en ervaring help jij het team verder.

‚ÄúWij communiceren met tienduizenden stukken hardware verspreid over middenspanningsstation in half Nederland, waarmee wij o.a. het net meten en openbare verlichting schakelen‚Äù



Functie-eisen

Zo pak jij het aan


Minimaal een afgeronde hbo opleiding of wo.Zeer goede communicatieve vaardigheden Goed functionerend in een ervaren team Een flexibele houdingOog voor detail en werkt accuraatAantoonbare ervaring in een Agile ontwikkelomgeving.


Daarnaast ten minste aantoonbare

kennis over / ervaring in de werking van:


Software engineering principes (SOLID, YAGNI, DRY, etc), Design PatternsC# & .NET 5 of hogerOpenAPIEvent-driven microservices architectureSecure programmingConcurrency problematiekAzure DevOps PipelinesOCI ContainersHelm

AngularAnsibleDockerLinuxBlazorKubernetesRabbitMQKafkaOpenSearchHashiCorp VaultPrometheus / GrafanaSpecflowScrumPair ProgrammingTeam & cultuur

Je zet je schouders eronder met ‚Ä¶

Jouw collega‚Äôs van de afdeling Netautomatisering. Hier vorm je een team met 15 Software Engineers en Platform Engineers. Het team is opgedeeld in twee groepen.



Wat krijg je van ons?

En wij steken natuurlijk ook energie in jou

Bij Enexis werk je in de voorhoede van een van de grootste uitdagingen van onze tijd: de energietransitie. Daarbij zorgen we goed voor je. Dat begint met een uitgebreid welkomstpakket en -programma om je collega‚Äôs te leren kennen. En met goede arbeidsvoorwaarden:


Salaris tussen ‚Ç¨ 3.863,00 en 5.519,00, - bruto per maand (op basis van 40 uur per week).Bijdrage van 70% aan je ABP Keuzepensioen.Persoonlijk budget van 10% en een 13e maand van 10,7% van je brutojaarsalaris. Deze kun je flexibel inzetten of maandelijks of jaarlijks laten uitbetalen.24,5 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband. Meer oplaadtijd nodig? Met je persoonlijk budget en 13e maand koop je tot wel 35,5 extra verlofdagen.Mogelijkheden om thuis te werken, inclusief een door ons ingerichte thuiswerkplek en een vergoeding per dag ‚Ç¨ 2,35,-.Laptop of tablet en telefoon die je ook priv√© mag gebruiken.Reiskostenvergoeding en een eersteklas ov-abonnement voor zakelijk gebruik.Vitaliteitsbudget van ‚Ç¨ 500,- voor bijvoorbeeld een sportabonnement.Ruimte om te groeien met ons interne ontwikkelplatform of externe opleidingen en trainingen.


Lees meer over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden .

Goed om te weten

Na je sollicitatie ontvang je een e-mail met meer informatie over de procedure. Meestal bestaat deze uit twee gesprekken: een eerste (online) gesprek met de manager en recruiter en een tweede gesprek met je toekomstige collega‚Äôs op locatie.

Een screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. Deze kan bestaan uit een assessment, het opvragen van referenties en een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG). Hierover ontvang je meer informatie tijdens de procedure.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
ASBIS is a pre-eminent global value add distributor, OEM, and solutions provider. We are distinguished by our in-depth industry insight and 32+ years of experience as a reliable global partner for clients and suppliers.
About the position: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Computer Vision. In this role, you will be responsible for researching and developing cutting-edge Computer Vision approaches for classification, detection, and segmentation tasks.
Main tasks:Research and development of Computer Vision approaches for classification, detection and segmentation tasksLead the development of Computer Vision and Machine Learning projects in a dynamic startup-like environmentExperimenting with innovative deep learning methods to enhance the quality of our modelsExploring techniques to augment the quality and volume of our training dataOptimizing our training and inference infrastructure to squeeze out every FLOP out of hardwareCollaborating with engineers and technicians to develop and implement robotic solutions
Requirements:Experience in image processing, computer vision, and machine learningExpertise with traditional CV approaches (e.g., OpenCV)Classification, detection, and segmentation approachesVisual odometry and SLAMVisual object trackingModel optimization (quantization, sparsification, etc.)Expertise with Python and/or C++Building deep neural networks with modern tools, such as PyTorch or TensorflowBuilding, testing, and deploying computer vision-based solutionsPreferably 3+ years of professional level experience in the field of Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Computer Graphics or similarUnderstanding of and experience with any of the following topics but not limited to: 3D object recognition, 3D reconstruction, real-time machine vision and its application for robot guidance, pattern recognition, sensor alignment, and calibrationFamiliarity with most common programming tools such as: Python, OpenCV, PyTorch3D, Kaolin, Tensorflow, PCL, OpenCL/CUDA, MATLAB, Jupyter
We offer:Opportunity to work for a financially strong, fast-growing multinational companyConstant interaction with global teams of professionals üéØInternational career opportunities üöÄAccess to continuous professional development: training, certification programs, events, and team buildingsAttractive remuneration packageLife events‚Äô gifts, corporate presents and awards, years of service bonuses üéÅSpecial prices for the Company products
Embrace PossibilityNo matter your expertise, ASBIS offers a spectrum of career opportunities that match your skills and passions. Your journey starts here. Join us today.

title: Software Engineer C++/C#/Python
description:
At Sioux Technologies it‚Äôs all about making the pieces of the puzzle fit together. We can‚Äôt do that without you, a driven and versatile Software Engineer.

At Sioux Technologies, we develop and build complex high-tech products, often at the limit of what is technologically possible. We do this together, within a close-knit team of enthusiastic specialists in electronics, software, optics & physics, mechanics, mechatronics, and mathematics. This is how we bring high-tech to life that makes society healthier, safer, smarter, more sustainable, and more fun. This could be for a large project at a renowned multinational or for a promising start-up developing the next breakthrough technology.

This is what you excites you as a Software Engineer C++/C#/Python

As a Software Engineer, you develop technical software and work together with other software colleagues, on the development of modules and complete systems for the semiconductor, analytical, or medical market. You like to get freedom and responsibility for completing your assignment successfully and contributing throughout the entire software development cycle.

This is what you bring to the table

You love your job, and you are passionate about developing software for advanced systems. You also enjoy working in a team and getting the maximum out of it together.

You have a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer scienceYou‚Äôre a team player and strive together towards the common goalYou have at least 3 years of experience in software development in the high-tech industry such as Semiconductor, Analytical or Medical You have experience with modern C++ and additionally, you feel confident using Python or C# You have knowledge with various development methods and technologies (OOAD, Agile, TDD, MDSD, etc.) 

This is what we offer

You will work within a pleasant working environment, in which High-Tech, High-Fun & High-Value are central.Within Sioux, everyone gets a lot of freedom and responsibility to perform their work in the best possible way.No matter how experienced you are, you will continue to develop yourself on a personal level and in terms of content. You have a personal training budget of ‚Ç¨6000 available for this, every year.We love continuous development, people, good ideas and Sioux!We also find it incredibly important to have fun together - no joke! We organize a lot for our employees from family festivals to inspiring knowledge sessions.You work on the Sioux Campus and can use our Sioux Labs living room every day to have lunch, play sports or music and share your knowledge with colleagues.

Sounds good so far? We'd love to tell you more...

High-Tech, High-Fun, High-Value.

We can tell you all about the typical Sioux culture and the challenging high-tech projects. About how you can develop yourself like nowhere else. But we prefer to leave this to our own employees, Robert Hendriksen, Joost Sannen, or Martijn Wijns.

Go to testimonials
