title: Backend Software Engineer - ML Data Infrastructure Cloud
description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet‚Äôs bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what‚Äôs possible for industrial robotics in the near future ‚Äì with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

Role

In this role, you will be responsible for building out infrastructure for the large-scale storage, management, and exchange of data related to Intrinsic Flowstate. Your work begins early in the process of scoping projects with our customers and partners, and drives impact by demonstrating our technology and capabilities. With a strong focus on creating utility value for partners and customers, you will help determine data infrastructure requirements, write clear specifications, review designs, and contribute to our engineering teams to design and build successful solutions. You will contribute to a project with several German industry partners and to creating a data ecosystem for robotics.

How your work moves the mission forward

Help design large-scale storage solutions that allow runtime efficient queries and flexible data analysisImprove existing systems by adapting scalable pipelines for distributed computing and data processingCollaborate with product and engineering teams in order to optimally support customer use cases

Skills you will need to be successful

Four-year degree in Computer ScienceExperience collaborating on medium to large software projects for at least 4 yearsExperience in programming C++, Python, or GolangDemonstrable experience with relational database management systems (BigQuery, DB2, or ODB), cloud storage and computing (Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), and service-oriented architectures

Skills that will differentiate your candidacy

Experience working with automation tools (Ansible, Terraform)Experience building with scalable data pipelines (Apache Beam)Experience working with Machine Learning frameworks (Tensorflow, JAX)Experience building or working with logging, monitoring toolingPractical experience debugging systems (network issues, performance problems)Fluency in German language (writing and speaking) desired

At Intrinsic, we don't just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at: candidate-support@intrinsic.ai.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Developing IT solutions for millions of students and teachers around the world. As a software developer at Drieam in Eindhoven, that is what you'll be doing. A job with real impact. You help educational institutions ‚Äì from TU/e to Yale University and from Fontys to Cambridge University ‚Äì to train future-proof professionals. As added benefits, you get to decide what you want to do and coach your less experienced colleagues.
Your colleague about working at Drieam‚ÄúAlways driven, yet without any stress. That characterises the way we like to do things. We are passionate about what we do, but we keep our planning feasible and work very well together. Whether you are a junior or a lead developer, you are involved in everything: from sparring about new products to developing initiatives to help Drieam grow. That is what makes my job so inspirational, day in and day out.‚Äù 
Martijn, Team Lead - Product & Development.
A typical day at Drieam09.00 Daily stand-up with your scrum team.09.15 Development. A challenging project: you are tasked with making our advanced product Eduframe scalable for a new client in the United States.13.00 Lunch with the team.13.30 Pair programming. You help your junior colleague so they can make new progress on the feature they are working on.14.30 Time for a workout.15.30 Refinement session. Refreshed and ready to go at it again. You work to resolve a bug in our solution for Erasmus University of Applied Sciences in Brussels.17.45 Prepare a knowledge session. Tomorrow, it is time for your weekly nerd talk for all developers.
And tomorrow?Your day will be entirely different. Sparring about a new product, assessing what is already available and what we can develop ourselves, programming software, building the architecture: you do it all. In your senior role, you not only come up with the right solutions, but also set priorities, define the task order and assess how much time the various activities will take. You involve your colleagues and offer advice to the product owner. Do you have progressive ideas about how to further improve or expand our software and tech stack? Great! We work with e.g., Ruby on Rails, React, Vite, GitHub Actions and Heroku, but we are always looking to experiment and innovate.
Did you know that Drieam...... has grown from a small startup to an organisation with a highly driven team of over sixty professionals in just eight years‚Äô time? We have an exceptionally low staff turnover? Almost all our interns want to keep working for us?
That is no surprise, because at Drieam:It is all about you! Tell us what you like, show us what you're good at and what your ambitions are. We will do what we can to take your work pleasure to the next level.You are part of a self-directed team. At the same time, you can depend on clear frameworks and the right coaching and inspiration.You can be who you are. Our team is made up of many different nationalities and authentic personalities. Can you imagine how inspirational that is?You never have to bring your own food! You get daily healthy lunches and fresh fruit and snacks.
Other perksTwenty-five vacation days for a forty-hour work week.Time off whenever you want. If you don't care about Christmas, you can come into the office and take a day off when it suits you better.Plenty of flexibility: you are free to choose when to work from home or at the office and how to plan your activities. If you want to leave earlier to pick up your kids from school or take your puppy for a walk, that's fine!A MacBook and other facilities you need to do your job effectively in the office and at home.A one-year contract to start with the intention of ultimately turning that into an indefinite contract.Various development opportunities. Whatever your learning goals or ambitions are, we will help you realise them, for example, via training and education.An attractive pension plan for which Drieam bears all the costs.An inspirational workplace at walking distance from Eindhoven's city center.Last but not least: weekly team drinks ‚Äì although it's fine if you're not up for that ‚Äì and several outings per year with the entire Drieam team.
This is why you fit perfectly in our Drieam teamWe don't have to tell you what to do. Not just because you know that already, but also because that is not how you like to do things. You want - and will get - the freedom to take the reins yourself. You will collaborate closely with colleagues in and outside your scrum team. You are also good at giving and receiving feedback. You are pragmatic: as a senior, you are able to oversee every aspect of an innovation or technical issue, but you also like to get involved.
Furthermore, you:Are good at object-oriented programming.Are good at automation. If a certain action is repeated, you immediately look for a way to automate it instead.Have excellent communication skills. There is no need to step into the limelight if that is not your thing. Even if you prefer to communicate via Slack, all that matters is that you get your message across.Possess an excellent verbal and written command of English.
Apply today!

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Created in 2016, Meero is the world expert in image quality, providing the best end-to-end visual content solutions for online sellers.
From fashion professional photography to AI-based image management and quality enhancement, we‚Äôre here to analyze, optimize and beautify all visuals in order to boost online sales.
At the crossroads of AI and creativity, Meero partners with players in diverse industries (Real Estate, Automotive, Fashion...) all around the world.
www.meero.com / www.car-cutter.com

MISSION
Position Overview
The Platform Team is a dedicated unit focused on supporting various verticals by leveraging both existing and newly developed Platform components.Our team's objectives are as follows:
Implementing new features within its components to align with the roadmaps of each vertical.Enhancing the reliability, stability, and processing speed of managed components to optimize customer experience and bolster our competitiveness.Streamlining costs and refining existing production solutions to enhance overall business efficiency.
Two prominent components maintained by the team include a media processing engine, capable of hosting multiple workflows with configurable AI-based editing algorithms, and a web application designed for post-producers to efficiently detect and assign media for manual retouching.
In the capacity of a Platform Engineer, you will be instrumental in designing, building, and maintaining our platform infrastructure. Adhering to DevOps and SRE principles, your expertise will play a crucial role in ensuring the security, scalability, and reliability of our systems, ultimately facilitating the delivery of consistent and robust products.

Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust platforms to support our high-traffic services.Implement and optimize APIs and backend systems to enhance application performance.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new features and technologies.Conduct code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure high-quality code.Stay ahead of emerging technologies and propose innovative solutions.Define our operational excellence standards.Shape the way Meero is delivering software on a scale

Profile
Minimum of 5 years of experience in platform engineering or a related field.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering.Expertise in Python development with a good understanding of Java is a plus.Experience with any cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP).Experience with containerization (docker, K8s)Expert-level experience in developing backend systems on a scale with a DevOps mindsetUnderstanding of developing resilient, scalable and secure software.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal.Eager to learn, explore and take actions

Dev @Meero
We are ambitious and we set challenging objectives for ourselvesWe grow strong, we‚Äôre aiming at getting the best talents to work with usWe are a team of passionate people, with a strong accent on collaborationWe are flexible in terms of remote-work.We have a great onboarding program, ask us about it!

Hiring process
Video call with a recruiterFirst Technical Assessment to know your knowledge on PythonVideo call with the hiring manager to get to know each other and to learn more about the roleSecond Technical Assessment which mirrors the real job you‚Äôll do at MeeroFinal interview with the CEOWelcome aboard!

title: Developer
description:
Do you have passion for creating new solutions? As a Developer at Stena Line, you will code, maintain and understand the product and its users. You will mostly be working on implementing and adding functionality to our revenue management platform, which is the interface between our predictive machine learning models and the trade management users, so we have a high demand on implementing complex concepts in a user-friendly interface.
You will work in a very competent team of Developers, UX designers and Data scientists towards a vision to make trade management processes easier, smarter and more profitable. We are now looking for two new Developers to join us. We work in close collaboration with the business side to deliver products that really drive the business forward and has a great impact on the company‚Äôs total revenue. You will work in short release cycles, often we release functionality to production several times a week.
What You Will ExperienceAt Trade management we use the latest technologies within big data and machine learning to build intuitive and user-friendly revenue management tools to support Stena Line‚Äôs continued growth. We are proud to be a high-tech team with a direct impact on both company revenue and profitability and focus heavily on being on the cutting edge, both technically and creatively.As a Stena Line employee in Sweden, we offer you an additional benefits package consisting of travel discounts, health allowance, well-being activities, access to a benefits portal, and much more.
We believe a hybrid solution between the office and working remotely will create the best environment for us to be creative, productive and find a work-life balance creating magic today and tomorrow.
Who You AreAt Stena Line your personality matters as much as how good you are at what you do. Regardless of your role, welcoming, caring and reliable guides you in your everyday work and the challenges you face. Being curious and innovative is at the core of everything you do in the role as a Developer. We also believe you are self-motivated who want to learn more about programming and love to share knowledge with others in your team.
Qualifications:Experience working as a DeveloperSome knowledge in the techniques and tools we use including React, GraphQL, Redux, .NET Core, TypeScript/JavaScript (Node.js), Kubernetes/OpenShift, Buildkite, AWS/AzureExperience with Modern software development concepts: Test driven development, CI/CD, DevOpsExperience with agile software developmentFluent in English, written and spoken
Interested?This is a full-time, permanent position based in Gothenburg within our Trade management department. To apply, please register your profile and send in your CV in English as soon as possible but no later than 8th of September, 2024. We are having an ongoing selection, so do not wait with your application. Please note that due to GDPR we do not accept applications via e-mail or postal service. We have collective bargaining agreements with Unionen, among others, who you can contact for more information.
If you have any questions regarding the position you are welcome to contact Ken Ryrbo, Engineering Manager at ken.ryrbo@stenaline.com or about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Frida Berntsson, Talent Acquisition Partner, frida.berntsson@stenaline.com.Please note that we kindly decline any offers from recruitment or staffing agencies regarding this recruitment.
About Stena LineAs a leader in sustainable shipping, Stena Line has Europe‚Äôs most comprehensive route network focusing on transportation of both passengers and freight. We have over 6,100 employees in our Stena Line family across Scandinavia, around the UK and the Baltics, making a contribution to our company.
Stena Line exists to be a trusted link between people, places and societies. We play a vital role in keeping everything connected. We make sure people and goods arrive where they need to be, enabling business to thrive and societies to grow. We connect family and friends, and make it possible to explore new destinations or revisit favourite places.
We are committed to maintaining and developing a sustainable working environment, free from harassment, that gives equal opportunities to everyone. We embrace equality, diversity and inclusion ‚Äì and welcome all applicants.

title: R&D Software Engineer
description:
Please Note:


 If you are a first time user, please create your candidate login account before you apply for a job. (Click Sign In > Create Account) If you already have a Candidate Account, please Sign-In before you apply.


Job Description:

Broadcom Inc. is one of the largest software and technology companies known for its business-to-business (B2B) software with a product portfolio focused on Agile software development, DevOps, and computer security spanning across a wide range of environments. Its computer software products are used by a majority of the Fortune Global 500 companies, government organizations, educational institutions, and thousands of other companies in diverse industries worldwide.

As an experienced R&D Software Engineer you will be responsible for working closely with management and architects to create highly complex and sophisticated software on design projects that span several groups. Provide high level research and analysis related to software design and development and solve complex problems for a product or family of products in the area of DevOps.

Responsibilities: 


Designing and coding complex modules that meet functional and business requirements on schedule and within budgetPerform unit/module testing of software to find errors and confirm programs meet specifications.Participate in test plan reviews.Fix bugs, add enhancements, and convert software to other platforms.Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise. Evaluate impact of software performance, and recommend changes to software design team.Constantly refine and stay current with emerging themes in software development and testing.Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.Provide product content to technical writers.Assist in strategic research and design as directedProvide input to establish and improve departmental processes and procedures.Develop plans outlining steps and time tables for developing programs and communicate plans and status to management and other development team members.Takes intelligent risks and learns from failure.Escalate issues to management as appropriate.Participate in design and code reviews with other engineers.Mentor, train, develop and serve as knowledge resource for less experienced Software Engineers


Skills & Competencies:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher, preferably in computer science (BS).8+ years of experience in the development of applications in C programming language.Technical proficiency in C programming and any Assembly languages (x86, ARM, RISC-V, ...).Experience with automated unit testing is needed for this position.Knowledge of REXX, ISPF, JCL, TSO, IPCS, z/XDC, Java, Python are an advantage.Practical experience in working on complex software projects.Skilled in providing technical guidance, mentoring and inspiring software engineers.Strong technical knowledge across the industry.Exposure to Agile development methodologies.


If you want to fulfill your potential, be acknowledged for your achievements, and be given autonomy to make decisions for your business and customers; if you want to work with a company that respects you as an individual - recognizing both your needs at work and your responsibilities outside of it - then Broadcom Inc. is where you belong. #BroadcomSoftware

Broadcom is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability status, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. We will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records consistent with local law.

If you are located outside USA, please be sure to fill out a home address as this will be used for future correspondence.

title: Linux Application Engineer
description:

title: Programador full stack
description:
Sobre nosotrosArfima Financial Solutions es una empresa consultora y asesora en mercados financieros y gesti√≥n de riesgos. Nos especializamos en la aplicaci√≥n de principios de ingenier√≠a financiera a problemas concretos del mundo real, cerrando la brecha entre el mundo acad√©mico y el empresarial. Nuestros servicios principales son la valoraci√≥n de productos financieros (incluyendo derivados ex√≥ticos y fondos de capital privado), el an√°lisis y gesti√≥n de riesgos financieros, y el cumplimiento regulatorio. Recientemente nos hemos embarcado dentro de un consorcio internacional en el desarrollo de una plataforma de datos clim√°ticos y evaluaci√≥n de riesgos. En cuanto al puesto El proyecto es el desarrollo de una plataforma para la valoraci√≥n de riesgo f√≠sico y de transici√≥n clim√°tico. Trabajaremos estrechamente con el equipo de Linux Foundation dentro del proyecto OS Climate (https://github.com/os-climate/OS-Climate-Community-Hub#readme). AFS es miembro de este consorcio creado por la Linux Foundation. La estimaci√≥n y valoraci√≥n de ambos riesgos ( f√≠sico y de transici√≥n ) son intensivos en datos, c√°lculos y usos de herramientas financieras y de ML. La valoraci√≥n del riesgo clim√°tico financiero es m√°s complejo que el riesgo financiero tradicional y requiere de herramientas nuevas. Buscamos a un ingeniero inform√°tico que pueda apoyarnos en este objetivo. Estamos en la b√∫squeda de alguien que trabaje en forma presencial, con la capacidad de implementar c√≥digo en python aplicado al an√°lisis de modelos de riesgo clim√°tico.  El rango de actividades puede incluir:Colaboraci√≥n en el desarrollo de la GUI existente, a√±adiendo las secciones correspondientes a nuevas caracter√≠sticas, as√≠ como la optimizaci√≥n de la base existente.Gesti√≥n de la base de datos en Postgresql que utiliza el backend.Desarrollo de las nuevas funcionalidades del backend.Desarrollo de nuevas clases de riesgos.
Competencias y experiencias requeridasGrado/m√°ster en inform√°tica, ingenier√≠a inform√°tica o cualquier otra disciplina con altos conocimientos cuantitativos y de programaci√≥n.Nivel alto de Python, idealmente con 1 a√±o de experiencia en desarrollo de c√≥digo con OOP.Experiencia con GitLab/GitHub u otras herramientas de CI/CD.Experiencia con React.Se valorar√° independencia, rigurosidad y an√°lisis cr√≠tico.Ingl√©s: C1.Capacidad para trabajar c√≥modamente en equipo en un entorno internacional.
Competencias deseablesExperiencia con sphinx, rst y markdown para generar documentaci√≥n.Experiencia en proyectos de c√≥digo abierto o colaborativos en un grupo grande de desarrolladores.Se invita a los candidatos a enviar su CV a la direcci√≥n de correo electr√≥nico:recruiting@arfimaconsulting.com.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
About us Arfima Financial Solutions is a consultancy and advisory firm in financial markets and risk management. We specialize in applying financial engineering principles to real-world problems, bridging the gap between academia and business. Our main services include the valuation of financial products (including exotic derivatives and private equity funds), financial risk analysis and management, and regulatory compliance. Recently, we have joined an international consortium to develop a climate data and risk assessment platform.
About the positionThe project involves developing a platform for the valuation of physical and transition climate risks. We will work closely with the Linux Foundation team within the OS Climate project (https://github.com/os-climate/OS-Climate-Community-Hub#readme). AFS is a member of this consortium created by the Linux Foundation. Estimating and valuing both physical and transition risks is data-intensive, requiring extensive calculations and the use of financial and ML tools. The valuation of financial climate risk is more complex than traditional financial risk and requires new tools. We are looking for a computer engineer who can support us in this goal.We are looking for someone to work on-site with the ability to implement Python code applied to climate risk model analysis.The range of activities may include:Collaboration in developing the existing GUI by adding sections corresponding to new features and optimizing the existing base.Management of the PostgreSQL database used by the backend.Development of new backend functionalities.Development of new risk classes.
Required Skills and ExperienceDegree/master's in computer science, computer engineering, or any other discipline with high quantitative and programming knowledge.High level of Python, ideally with 1 year of experience in developing code with OOP.Experience with GitLab/GitHub or other CI/CD tools.Experience with React.Valued traits include independence, rigor, and critical analysis.English: C1.Ability to work comfortably in a team in an international environment.
Desirable SkillsExperience with Sphinx, reStructuredText (rst), and Markdown for documentation generation.Experience in open-source projects or collaborative projects in a large group of developers.Candidates are invited to send their CV to the email address: recruiting@arfimaconsulting.com .

title: Junior Database Software Engineer
description:

To continue the success story of our games platform, we‚Äôre now looking for a Junior Database Software Engineer to join the Platform team.
Your influential mission. Components for success. You...Have experience in developing and maintaining databases.Possess expertise in MySQL to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval.Demonstrate understanding of AWS to leverage cloud-based solutions effectively.Have a foundation in ETL/BI technologies for seamless data management and analysis.Possess knowledge of Java or Python.Understand and embrace good development practices such as code reviews, test automation and you take pride in writing code that is easy to test, read, and maintain.Are creative person, who does not settle and is always eager to learn and develop new things.

Playtech is an equal opportunities employer. Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams. We celebrate differences and encourage everyone to join us and be themselves at work.

title: Associate Database Developer
description:
Description

Position at Premier Research

Premier Research is looking for an Associate Database Developer to join our Data Management Team. You will help biotech, medtech, and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas and breakthrough science into new medicines, devices, and diagnostics. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our team members are the most valuable asset in delivering success.

We are Built for You. We are here to help you grow, to give you the skills and opportunities to excel at work with the flexibility and balance your life requires.

We are Built by You. Your ideas influence the way we work, and your voice matters here.

We are Built with You. As an essential part of our team, you help us deliver the medical innovation that patients are desperate for.

Together, we are Built for Biotech. Join us and build your future here.

What You Will Be Doing

Assists with Quality Control (QC) of specified deliverablesCreates electronic Case Report Forms (eCRFs) according to finalized protocols for EDC studiesCreates data entry screens according to the approved annotated Case Report Form (CRF) for paper studiesParticipates in database building design and testing according to Premier Research standard operating procedures in operation at that timeAssists in programming field derivations, edit/consistency checks, and setup of screen flow in the CDMS for Data EntryAssists in writing procedures, validation and data extraction programsProduce database documentation including an annotated CRF.Ensure database documentation is maintained for the Trial Master FileWorks in collaboration with the Data Management project team, Statistician, Project Manager and the sponsor to define all technical elements of the Data Management planMay assist in maintaining the CDMS global and program libraries

What We Are Searching For

Educated to Bachelor‚Äôs degree level, or equivalent. In lieu of this qualification, 3 years of experience in clinical research, drug development or healthcare environment will be requiredKnowledge of ICH / GCP regulations Working knowledge of FDA Guidance Documents / EU Directives / ISO14155 regulations, drug / device development, and clinical monitoring procedures Knowledge of web based communication tools for conferencesFluent verbal and written English as well as the local language(s) required for clinical trial submissions. Excellent team player, collaborative and able to build an effective team. Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities. 

Why Choose Premier Research? 

Premier Research is more than a company ‚Äì it‚Äôs a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need. Our Values ‚Äì We Aim High, We Work Together, We Stay Agile, We Get It Done, We Care ‚Äì mirror the determination, flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.

meaningful & challenging -Your tasks

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about building innovative software solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products across the full stack?
What's in it for you?You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will span both backend and frontend development (split about 80/20 towards the backend), allowing you to contribute across the entire stack.Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing office time in Stockholm with remote work. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.You‚Äôll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience).They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you‚Äôll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskv√•rd) and private pension contribution.
What you'd be doing?You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers.On the frontend, you'll craft user interfaces ranging from analytical dashboards to complex 3D visualisations, using cutting-edge web technologies to create responsive and data-rich applications.
About you?You have at least 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a strong backend focus, preferably in Python including frameworks such as FastAPI, Django, RabbitMQ & Kafka. On the frontend, they work with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, so experience here would also be essential.You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.Experience with DevOps practices, cloud platforms and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools is a plus.Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
A bit about them?A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.

Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to mitch@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.

title: Data Engineer (SQL/ AWS/ Scala/ Python) - Santander Auto Software
description:
Who are we?
Santander Auto Software is a greenfield programme, where we are building a brand-new, state of the art software platform and product suite for the auto finance industry, that will be rolled out in 13 countries across Europe and the UK.
The business is 100% tech focused, remote first, and comprised of skilled cross-border software builders, and with a leadership team with accomplished backgrounds from major global tech tech players.
You will be partners with, not providers to, colleagues in product and the business. There will be no order takers and no order givers. Together with your partners in product and business, you will share equally in decisions about features, dates, and priority. More importantly, you will share equally in the results produced by the software you partnered to build and evolve. That‚Äôs a lot of responsibility, but we know that‚Äôs the new role of technology in every part of our lives and as software builders we‚Äôre excited to co-own the results, not just the effort.

What are we looking for?
We're expanding our Data function within Santander Auto Systems, and are looking for an additional Data Engineer to come and join the team. This role will in helping to build our data platform, as we expand the business and provide additional capabilities to both customers and stakeholders.
Santander Auto Systems is a fast paced environment that requires a pragmatic, iterative approach to the role, often working with a rapidly evolving technology platform, new requirements, and innovative thinking.
Our Data Engineers work closely with the wider Engineering teams in SAS, establishing best practice ingestion approaches, managing change in the evolving platform, and dealing with scaling as the platform is rolled out to new territories. You'll need a deep understanding of what good looks like, and be willing to take ownership of initiatives, seeing them through to delivery.
The role reports into the Director of Data within Santander Auto Systems.

What you will be doing:
Create and deliver ELT pipelines, working from data from multiple SAS services.Create and manage data integrations to our partners.Integration third party data into our platform.Collaborate with Engineers in the wider SAS team to ensure we're always being provided with up to date schemas from the services.Build automation to provide value both internally within SAS and to our partners.

Key technical experience:
Ability to operate in a fast changing environment.Fluent in EnglishPrevious cloud based infrastructure experience, particularly with AWS.Experience using Airflow and dbtExpert SQL knowledgeSolid understanding of Dimensional Data Modelling.Experience with at least one or more of these programming languages: Python, Scala / JavaExperience with distributed data and computing tools, mainly Apache Spark & KafkaUnderstanding of critical path approaches, how to iterate to build value, engaging with stakeholders actively at all stages.Able to deal with ambiguity and change.A self-starter who's able to work independently where necessary, without waiting for others. A strong sense of ownership is key to the way we work.Strong communication skills.Previous experience in a technology business advantageous.

What's in it for you?
Snapshot of the 'why's' for exploring opportunities with us:
100% remote greenfield development working with a fantastic cross borders team of software buildersHighly competitive packages (annual bonus+ kit/peripheral budget + comprehensive benefits)Highly accomplished leadership team (several ex-Amazon, Microsoft, amongst other top tech firm individuals within the team)Work with leading edge tech, and have direct input for adding to the current arsenalWe fund teams, not projects and while the software we build matters, the software team you help us build will matter more.Your software will be used by thousands of users and the auto financing your software enables will make a significant difference in the lives of millions of people - The software you build will matter.The skills you hone here will be relevant for the rest of your career.
Locations
The vacancy will be fully remote based out of either the UK, Spain, Portugal or the Netherlands.
#LI-DNI

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what‚Äôs possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar‚Äôs Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role‚Äôs mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you‚Äôll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You‚Äôll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways ‚Äì as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you‚Äôll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that‚Äôll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes

Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.

Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this‚Ä¶

University Degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.

With the following qualities‚Ä¶ 

A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.

What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...

1st Stage ‚Äì Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.2nd Stage ‚Äì Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.3rd Stage ‚Äì Technical interview with Hiring Managers.

Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Looking for a new challenge? Great! We are looking for you, as an ambitious professional with a clear view, ready to build tomorrow‚Äôs best digital products.

Are you the one?

Your role 

You have a continuous desire to explore new technologies, trends, and best practices in the software development industry. Going the extra mile to meet a deadline? Of course!You can keep your cool in stressful situations. Working in a motived team gives you tremendous energy. You love to collaborate with designers, developers and stakeholders to achieve product goals. You have a genuine passion for coding, problem-solving and building robust software applications. 


Your profile 

You're proficient in both front and back-end technologies with the ability to handle various parts of the development stack. You excel in communication skills to articulate ideas, explain technical concepts and collaborate effectively. Building scalable and distributed systems using microservices architecture? That's what you do. You know all about security best practices, including secure coding principles. You prioritize code quality and hold principles like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and integration testing in high regard. You're familiar with DevOps principles, tools and practices, including CI/CD pipelines for seamless integration and deployment. 


Your experience

You are experienced in building responsive and user-friendly web interfaces using HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular or Vue.js. Proficiency in server-side programming languages like Java, Python, or Node.js and frameworks like Spring Boot, Django or Express.js? No problem!You have experience in designing and developing RESTful APIs, including knowledge of API best practices and tools like Swagger or Postman. You're familiar with cloud platforms like AWS or Azure, including deployment in a cloud environment. Working with containerization technologies like Docker and/or Kubernetes is nothing new for you. You can prove practical knowledge and experience with relational databases. You're comfortable working in an Agile environment, particularly in a Scrum framework. 


What we offer

Our knowledge sessions help employees gain new insights from experts who share our values so we can come together as one team tackling tough challenges with high confidence. Next to the passion to work hard for success, we like to play hard! Look no further than our various social events! These activities will help you feel at home in the office quickly with other colleagues. One of which - our annual ski trip - is legendary, it‚Äôs one event where people always look forward to because there‚Äôs plenty of time spent together outside in the Austrian mountains. What better way to get to know your teammates than on a winter holiday?

The above perks are of course supplemented with an attractive salary, a range of fringe benefits including a premium company car, fuel card, group and hospitalization insurance and numerous group discounts.

About The Value Hub

The Value Hub is een ambitieus ecosysteem van business- en technologie-experts die zich richten op het ondersteunen van organisaties bij het ontwerpen en implementeren van partnerships met klanten. Dit om succesvol digitale producten te bouwen en te lanceren. Meer weten? Lees hier verder!

&Work will help you

The Value Hub has partnered with &Work. &Work understands that it is important to work in a place where you are valued, where you can develop further and where you are given the space to grow. By applying via &Work, you get direct access to their broad network of employers. &Work can help you with the introduction at The Value Hub, provide background information, prepare you for interviews so that you can present yourself convincingly and assist you during the negotiations to help you take a nice step forward in your career.

title: Backend Developer (Iceland)
description:
Description

Upwind is the runtime-powered CNAPP that leverages runtime data to secure our customers‚Äô cloud infrastructure. Upwind‚Äôs comprehensive approach to cloud security helps organizations mitigate the risks that actually matter, identify the root causes of threats in minutes and respond with context and automation. Upwinders are spread across the globe in all departments and work together to protect the infrastructure of our customers - we‚Äôre a strong, emerging player in a massive and growing market, and it‚Äôs still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Upwind, you‚Äôll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth.

We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our great Software Engineering team.The team faces complex engineering issues on a daily basis, both solving new challenges and constantly improving the existing solutions. We build deep integrations with container runtimes and orchestration systems and efficiently process large volumes of data to get to the root cause of threats and identify the risks that really matter. We work with all major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and use cutting-edge technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, containerd, eBPF, SQLite, Helm, Terraform and more.

Responsibilities

Responsible for the entire lifecycle of the project, from initial design and development to deployment, monitoring and maintenance in the production environmentContributing to technical and architectural decisionsConducting design and code reviewsAnalyzing and improving efficiency, scalability, and stability of various backend system componentsInterfacing with other teams (e.g. Frontend, DevOps) to deliver best-in-class features

Requirements

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Software Engineering or related field3+ years of experience with Backend Engineering in a high-level programming language (e.g. Golang, Java, C#, Python, Node.js)Experience with cloud platforms and related products (e.g. AWS, GCP and Azure)Experience implementing data-intensive systems (databases, event systems, messaging systems, etc)Experience with LinuxExperience with Kubernetes and container technologyExperience with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD)Experience with microservices based architectureKnowledge of eBPF - An advantage Familiarity or direct experience in a cybersecurity field - An advantage

title: Senior Back End Developer
description:
We are a dynamic and innovative software company at the forefront of digital solutions. Our commitment to excellence has led us to seek a talented Senior Full-Stack/Backend Software Developer to join our dedicated team. If you're passionate about web development, have strong expertise in HTML, CSS, PHP, and Laravel, and are ready to take on exciting challenges, we want to hear from you!CodeBlack is a software house based in Malta, specialising in web-based information systems for some of the most elite companies together with our internal projects.If you would like to join a fun dynamic team and help innovate the future of web-based systems we have the job for you.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain high-quality web applications using PHP, HTML, CSS, and Laravel.Collaborate with our team to design and implement innovative solutions, including Angular when required.Create and optimise database structures for efficient data management.Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to continuously improve our applications.
Qualifications:Extensive experience in PHP development with Laravel (3+ years).Strong expertise in HTML and CSS for creating responsive, visually appealing web applications.Proficiency in Laravel for building robust and scalable back-end systems.Proficiency with database management and SQL.Ability to work independently and in a team, with excellent problem-solving skills.A keen eye for detail, delivering pixel-perfect results.Strong problem solving skills and the ability to work under pressurePositive attitude with the ability to transform specifications into a high quality, cross browser solutions

title: SRE Engineer
description:
Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years. The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans, and monetize their talents.
Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 450+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from ‚Äúone of the top‚Äù to ‚Äúthe leader‚Äù. 
The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù. We believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!). 
Do you want to join the party?
Responsibilities:You will work with technologies such as Kubernetes, Dockers, Helm etc.Design and implement solutions to improve new and existing infrastructure.Build monitoring systems, monitor the system‚Äôs health, and implement self-healing systems.Support production environments.On-call duty.Assess existing implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.You will be involved in planning, developing, monitoring, and optimizing our company's systems architecture and CI/CD.Work with large-scale applications and frameworks, and have excellent communication skills.
Requirements:Continuously seeking opportunities to improve the reliability and performance of the systemA minimum of 5+ years experience in a similar role and experience working with public cloudsStrong knowledge with Linux based systems, at least 5+ yearsKnowledge and experience with docker and container orchestration (Kubernetes ‚Äì Preferred)Experience with Infrastructure as code and deployments are done using descriptive languages such as Ansible & Terraform (Preferred)Scripting in Bash and PythonCan-do attitudeSelf-driven and eager to learnExcellent organizational, analytical abilities, and problem-solvingMonitoring tools ‚Äì Prometheus/Graphite/Datadog/VictoriaMetricsKnowledge in various system-level topics ‚Äì OS, networking, file system managementAdvanced OOP knowledge in languages such as Python, Go, Java, etc. - strong advantageGood English in written and verbal communication skillsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience

title: Software Engineer, IT Automation
description:
Job Description

The Software Engineer/Automations Engineer is a key member of the IT-Automations team at Wolt. This role involves working closely with various IT functions and stakeholder organizations within the company to develop and maintain automation solutions that enhance the employee experience. You will be part of a team of highly skilled engineers and developers dedicated to preemptively identifying and addressing the needs of over 10,000+ employees world-wide.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing (Responsibilities & Duties)

Design, develop, and deploy services and applications related to automated employee lifecycle management.Maintain and develop Wolt‚Äôs custom-built automation engine and internally directed full-stack applications.Collaborate with various stakeholder groups to provide automated solutions that assist in their day-to-day tasks.Prepare instructions and documentation for the developed applications.Maintain and improve existing codebases.Proactively identify and resolve potential needs for our employees.Work closely with other IT functions to help maintain a world-class employee experience.

Our humble expectations

We‚Äôre looking for someone highly motivated and self-driven.Strong interest and relevant experience in software engineering and automation.Someone who keeps up with automation trends and try out new technologyProfessional communication skills and fluency in English.Strong technical knowledge of Python, Flask, FastAPI, Vue.js, Pytest, and PostgreSQL (and other data storages).Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Quick thinker who rolls up sleeves and always finds solutions.Willingness to travel if needed.

Tech Stack

Languages & Frameworks: Python, Flask, FastAPI, Vue.js.Infrastructure & Tools: Kubernetes, Terraform, AWS.Testing: Pytest.Databases: PostgreSQL and other data storages.

Next Steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan.

You will fit into a truly diverse team across 27 countries - what really matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity. Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring, is on our daily agenda.

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Rafael Rosa, Talent Acquisition Partner - rafael.rosa@external.wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, We‚Äôre About Getting Things Done.

You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it‚Äôs pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you‚Äôre passionate about building things that just‚Ä¶ work, Wolt might be for you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.
