title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
I am working with a client based in Stockholm, Sweden, seeking a Machine Learning Engineer for a 6-month, renewable, fully remote contract.
Responsibilities:You will be working hands-on to optimise training and deployment of ML models to be quick and cost-efficient.You will also be at the forefront of putting our ML models on mobile devices to enhance data privacy and customer experience.You will need to collaborate with teams across company to establish best practices and tools for efficient ML model development and deployment, particularly on mobile platforms.You will be expected to help the company reach and stay at the cutting edge of ML training and deployment, as well as explore new frontiers such as federated learning.
The impact you will create:Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organisation, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.Work with various teams, enabling them to put models into production quickly and cost-effectively.Work hands-on with teams to optimise ML models for mobile devices.Be the go-to expert for developing models for mobile devices as well as deploying them.Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in ML Engineering, especially ML on mobile phones, and driving continuous innovation.
Key skills:5+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on deploying ML models in production environments.Hands-on experience deploying ML models on mobile devices (e.g., TensorFlow Lite, Core ML, ONNX Runtime Mobile).Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX) and their deployment on mobile platforms.Understanding of both Android and iOS development and how that impacts ML model deployment and usage.Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.A customer-focused mindset.Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.
If you are interested in this position and your skills match the description, kindly reply with an updated version of your CV and a contact number.
All the best,Amelia

title: Data Scientist
description:
Elevate Your Career in Operational Research and Transportation Science with Stena LineAre you passionate about pushing the boundaries of operational research, problem solving and optimization? At Stena Line, our cutting-edge Trade Management department is at the forefront of innovation, driving critical advancements in commercial optimization, automation and decision support.
As a Data Scientist with us, you‚Äôll dive deep into complex challenges, developing, validating, and refining sophisticated predictive models, simulations, and optimization algorithms that directly impact our business operations. Especially, within the fields of revenue management. Your work will be pivotal in harnessing the power of data to deliver actionable insights and strategic recommendations that shape the future of our organization.
Join us to work on projects that not only enhance our product offerings but also provide you with the opportunity to make a significant impact on the maritime and logistics industries. You will work in a very competent team of Data scientists, Developers and UX designers towards a vision of making trade management processes easier, smarter and both more sustainable and profitable.
What You Will ExperienceAt Trade management we use the latest technologies within big data and machine learning to build intuitive and user-friendly revenue management tools to support Stena Line‚Äôs continued growth. We are proud to be a high-tech team with a direct impact on both company revenue and profitability and focus heavily on being on the cutting edge, both technically and creatively.As a Stena Line employee in Sweden, we offer you an additional benefits package consisting of travel discounts, health allowance, well-being activities, access to a benefits portal, and much more.
We believe a hybrid solution between the office and working remotely will create the best environment for us to be creative, productive and find a work-life balance creating magic today and tomorrow.
Who You AreAt Stena Line your personality matters as much as how good you are at what you do. Regardless of your role, welcoming, caring and reliable guides you in your everyday work and the challenges you face.
We believe you love to share knowledge with others in your team and you find it easy to collaborate with others. We also believe you are trustworthy and ambitious when it comes to creating results. You are curious with great passion for learning, experimenting, and programming.
Qualifications:M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Operations research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or similar - Strong background in modeling, optimization and algorithmsPreferred experience in transportation, logistics and aviation, particularly in the fields of revenue management, schedule planning, crew optimization and cargo management - Experience or a strong interest in developing high-quality softwareExperience in developing optimization toolsKnowledge and experience in using Python for scientific computing, with libraries such as pandas, scipy, scikit-learn, and plotly.Familiar with general Data Science/Machine learning concepts and tools.Experience with Kubernetes or OpenShift is meritingGreat at visualizing and communicating technical resultsFluent in English, written and spoken
Interested?This is a full-time, temporary position for about one year based in Gothenburg within our Trade management department. To apply, please register your profile and send in your CV in English as soon as possible but no later than 8th of September, 2024. We are having an ongoing selection, so do not wait with your application. Please note that due to GDPR we do not accept applications via e-mail or postal service. We have collective bargaining agreements with Unionen, among others, who you can contact for more information.
If you have any questions regarding the position you are welcome to contact Ken Ryrbo, Engineering Manager at ken.ryrbo@stenaline.com or Jonas Bereketab, Head of Trade management jonas.bereketab@stenaline.com or about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Frida Berntsson, Talent Acquisition Partner, frida.berntsson@stenaline.com.Please note that we kindly decline any offers from recruitment or staffing agencies regarding this recruitment.
About Stena LineAs a leader in sustainable shipping, Stena Line has Europe‚Äôs most comprehensive route network focusing on transportation of both passengers and freight. We have over 6,100 employees in our Stena Line family across Scandinavia, around the UK and the Baltics, making a contribution to our company.
Stena Line exists to be a trusted link between people, places and societies. We play a vital role in keeping everything connected. We make sure people and goods arrive where they need to be, enabling business to thrive and societies to grow. We connect family and friends, and make it possible to explore new destinations or revisit favourite places.
We are committed to maintaining and developing a sustainable working environment, free from harassment, that gives equal opportunities to everyone. We embrace equality, diversity and inclusion ‚Äì and welcome all applicants.

title: Game Mathematician
description:
We are looking for a talented and analytical Game Mathematician to join our clients team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and analyzing the mathematical models that drive our slot casino games, ensuring they are engaging, fair, and compliant with industry regulations.
Key Responsibilities:Game Design: Collaborate with game designers and developers to create mathematical models for new slot games, ensuring they are fun and engaging for players.Mathematical Modeling: Develop and test mathematical algorithms and simulations to determine game outcomes and ensure fairness.Statistical Analysis: Perform statistical analysis on game data to ensure game integrity and compliance with regulatory standards.Payout Structures: Design and validate payout tables and game features to achieve desired return-to-player (RTP) percentages.Optimization: Continuously analyze game performance and make data-driven adjustments to improve player experience and game profitability.Documentation: Create detailed documentation of mathematical models and game mechanics for internal and regulatory use.Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and QA, to ensure seamless integration of mathematical models into games.Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all game designs comply with relevant gaming regulations and standards.
Requirements:Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.Experience: Proven experience in slot casino game mathematics.Technical Skills: Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, C++, or Java; proficiency in using mathematical and statistical software tools.Analytical Skills: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex mathematical concepts into practical game features.Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accuracy and compliance in all mathematical models.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex mathematical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Team Player: Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.

title: Data Scientist
description: ResponsibilitiesDevelop, train, and optimize machine learning models using Python and AWS SageMaker.Collaborate closely with engineers to integrate models with Snowflake and ensure seamless data flow and accessibility.Implement advanced machine learning techniques such as clustering, classification, and regression analysis.Utilize a variety of data science libraries and tools as listed (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, LightGBM).Monitor, tune, and manage models in a production environment.Work with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide data-driven insights.Contribute to Java applications using the model's output, deployed to AWS Fargate.Required SkillsProficient in Python, with experience in major data science libraries and frameworks.Strong experience with AWS SageMaker for building and deploying ML models.Experience with Snowflake for managing and querying large datasets.Familiarity with Java, particularly in the context of application deployment and integration.Strong analytical skills with a good grasp of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling.Ability to work with a variety of serialization and deserialization formats (e.g., JSON, CSV).Experience in handling large-scale data in a cloud environment.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment.Good command of Hungarian and English (spoken and written)Qualifications3-5 years of relevant experience in data science or machine learning roles.Dynata is the world‚Äôs largest first-party data and insights platform. Dynata serves nearly 6,000 market research, media and advertising agencies, publishers, consulting and investment firms and corporate customers in North America, South America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. We shall take all reasonable steps to prevent any unauthorized access to your personal data.

title: Software Engineer (Only for GR residents)
description:
As a Software Engineer at AI2CYBER, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications that meet the needs of our clients and stakeholders. You will work closely with other engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver high-quality software solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of software design patterns, algorithms, and data structures. 
Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain RESTful APIs.Implement API gateways, security protocols, and documentation.Develop and maintain scalable, high-throughput, and low-latency data pipelines using Apache Kafka.Design and implement Kafka producers, consumers, and stream processing applications to ensure reliable and efficient data flow.Monitor and optimize the performance of APIs and Kafka-based systems, addressing any issues related to latency, throughput, and data consistency.Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to API integrations and Kafka data streams in a timely manner.
Qualifications:Proficiency in Python.Proven experience in designing, developing, and maintaining RESTful APIs.Strong understanding of API security best practices, including authentication, authorization, and encryption.Experience with API management tools and frameworks.Proven expertise in working with Apache Kafka, including setting up Kafka clusters, developing producers and consumers, and implementing stream processing.Familiarity with Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams, and KSQL for real-time data processing.Knowledge of message formats such as Avro, JSON, and Protocol Buffers.Experience with monitoring and logging tools for Kafka and APIs (Kafka Manager, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Preferred Qualifications:Experience with cloud services and managed Kafka solutions (Confluent Cloud, AWS MSK, Azure Event Hubs).Knowledge of microservices architecture and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.Experience with distributed systems and event-driven architecture.Strong understanding of data serialization and schema management with tools like Schema Registry.
Benefits:Highly competitive salary reviewed upwards on a regular basis.Working from home: Hit your goals from the comfort of your home because we value performance, not the place.Participation in state-of-the-art project and tech challenges and participation in large-scale projects.Personal and professional development, amongst industry experts and talented people.Continuous learning, having access to board resources.Onboarding plan and training so that you have a smooth induction and feel confident and ready to take over your new role.Equipment support so you have all the tools to do effectively and efficiently your work.No dress code as we want you to be as comfortable as possible.
At AI2CYBER, we are a cybersecurity firm dedicated to providing cutting-edge solutions to protect businesses and individuals from evolving cyber threats. Our mission is to empower organizations to navigate the complex cybersecurity landscape with confidence. We believe that by combining robust security solutions, continuous improvement, and a proactive mindset, we can help our clients stay one step ahead of cyber attackers. We are committed to building a safer digital world and are passionate about making a positive impact in the industry.
This is a full-time position with competitive salary and benefits. If you have a passion for reinforcement learning and are looking for an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology, we would love to hear from you!
Note: All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.
To apply, please send us your CV at careers@ai2cyber.com

Starting in an NYU dorm room in the early 1990s, TransPerfect is now recognized as the largest translation and language services company in the world. From offices in more than 90 cities on six continents, TransPerfect offers a full range of services in 170+ languages to clients worldwide.
You will be part of a technology department that is comprised of a successful and multidisciplinary group of professionals located across the globe ‚Äì Barcelona, New York, London, Manchester, Bucharest and India. If you‚Äôre ready to join a growing company and make an immediate impact, we want to hear from you!
About the team you will be joining at TransPerfect ‚Äì TechOps:The TransPerfect TechOps team has been a vital part of the company‚Äôs success since its formation 10 years ago ‚Äì delivering technology and services that have drastically simplified the lives of our clients and colleagues ‚Äì from workflow improvements for colleagues to core services that form the basis of the company‚Äôs GlobalLink platform, to creating scalable client interfaces that allow novice users to navigate complex ecosystems.
To learn more about our solutions, please visit: https://globallink.transperfect.com/
Your responsibilities and tasks will include:Engage in all phases of application development, with a focus on coding and debugging in alignment with security standards throughout the entire lifecycleDesign, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code/APIs to support applications both for web and mobileCollaborate regularly in a cross-functional team made up of product managers, quality assurance teams, designers and other developers to translate business requirements into technical solutionsCollaborate with Front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logicIdentify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address issuesOptimize web applications for performance, scalability and securityImplement security best practices to safeguard sensitive data and protect against potential threatsDevelop automation tests/ collaborate with automation engineers to ensure business needs are met, and allow for regression testingWork closely with users to provide personalized software support as neededStay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve our backend infrastructureDocument application support and operational proceduresMentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance to foster their growth and development
The minimum we‚Äôre looking for (show us what you got if you aren‚Äôt a perfect fit):Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field5+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on building scalable and reliable systemsExtensive knowledge of DotNet C#, LINQ, MS SQL, Entity Framework and related technologiesCapable to use version control software such as GITKnowledge of SOLID principlesKnowledge of clean code practicesExperience using web service protocols such as Rest, API design for extensibility and integrationExperience debugging complex applicationsExperience with Agile development project management methodologiesDatabase Development in SQL Server or NoSQL DatabasesSome familiarity of DockerExperience debugging complex applicationsExcellent communication and collaboration skills with a proven ability to work effectively in a team environmentAzure, AWS, RabbitMQ and Quartz experience is a plus

title: Quantitative Developer - Risk
description:
RAP (Risk Analytics Products) implements risk models to ensure that the bank‚Äôs lending portfolios have adequate capital during crisis. We use mathematical modeling and the latest technologies to build loss forecasting and stress testing pipelines. Our systems are responsible for calculating risk on some of the largest portfolios in Citi.

We are a diverse group of professionals with backgrounds in Physics, Engineering and Computer Science. You will work alongside experienced colleagues to further develop your analytical and quantitative skills. You will build skills in building products from the ground up for solving real life problems and develop a career as a risk model expert.

Key Responsibilities:

Implement models using sound numerical and computational techniquesDevelop methodologies, algorithms and diagnostic tools for testing model stability and performance. Engage business risk managers, clients, and other partners to present the model, technology platform and tools.Participant in the analysis and interpretation of model results, incorporate partners‚Äô feedback as appropriate into the implementations.

Qualifications:

Ph.D or a Master‚Äôs degree in quantitative field e.g. physics, engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.Solid programming skills and experience modeling techniques and numerical implementations.Fluency in Python, Linux, Numerical libraries and data processing experience.Experience in numerical and quantitative methods, monte carlo simulations and analyzing large and complex data sets.Interest in developing a career in finance, financial experience is not a requirement.

Benefits:

By joining Citi Solutions Center Poland, you will not only be part of a business casual workplace with a hybrid working model (up to 2 days working at home per week), but also receive a competitive base salary (which is annually reviewed) and enjoy a whole host of additional benefits such as:

Private Medical Care ProgramLife Insurance ProgramPension Plan contribution (PPE Program)Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Parental Leave Program (maternity and paternity leave)Sport CardHolidays AllowanceSport and team recreation activitiesSpecial offers and discounts for employeesAccess to an array of learning and development resourcesA discretional annual performance related bonusA chance to make a difference with various affinity networks and charity initiatives

Alongside these benefits Citi is committed to ensuring our workplace is where everyone feels comfortable coming to work as their whole self every day. We want the best talent around the world to be energized to join us, motivated to stay, and empowered to thrive.

title: Platform Software Engineer 4
description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

At Nexthink, we provide our customers with class-leading products to enable continuous improvement of their employee experience. Our solution delivers unparalleled visibility across all environments so IT teams can consistently see, diagnose, and fix digital workplace issues. The 50+ engineering teams at Nexthink that develop our products rely on its Technical Platform to build, deploy, and scale our cloud infrastructure and services.

The Data Infrastructure team, part of the Technical Platform group, owns the data stores that support the ingestion, processing, storage, and retrieval of events collected from millions of endpoints every second. It is responsible for the operations, automation, reliability, scalability, and cost-effectiveness of all critical data infrastructure, including Kafka, Clickhouse, and Amazon Aurora clusters.

Join a small team of diverse and experienced engineers who have full ownership of their domains, from the requirements gathering and design phase to implementation, validation, and deployment. You‚Äôll be part of a group that embraces DevOps and CI/CD principles, tries to automate everything they can, cares for quality and maintainability, and is working together to build a world-class internal developer platform with modern technologies and best practices.

If this sounds challenging and interesting to you, and you want to join a vibrant group of people who are passionate and driven, then we‚Äôd love to have you with us!

As a Platform Engineer, you will have the following responsibilities:

Work with Architecture, Product Engineering and Security teams to design, develop and evolve the Data Infrastructure, following modern cloud-native best practicesHelp make the Technical Platform a self-service offering so that Product Engineering teams can easily and reliably build on top of itContribute to Nexthink's tooling and automation frameworks for provisioning and scaling the infrastructure, with particular focus on resiliency and elasticity strategies. 

Your team will also handle more operational aspects of the infrastructure, such as: 

Monitoring and Observability. Build and manage the tooling for monitoring the platform, and assessing the health of the data pipelines. Operational reliability: Manage the availability of the databases and streaming platforms. Understand and be able to communicate the scale, capacity, security, resilience and performance attributes and requirements. Incident management and response: Detect, diagnose and fix incidents at the required Service Levels. Own of the post-mortem process of such incidents by writing technical content both for customers and internal stakeholders. Have on-call responsibilities in rotation with the engineering team. 

Qualifications

BSc or MSc in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Platform Engineer, or Site Reliability Engineer with knowledge of professional software development best practicesExperience with distributed systems and streaming technologies; familiarity with Apache Kafka is desiredExpertise with database cluster deployment (Amazon Aurora, Clickhouse, etc), configuration, backup/restore, and production operationsExperience operating services on Linux systems and container technologies (e.g., Docker)Good knowledge of monitoring solutions (e.g. Datadog)Experience administering and deploying on cloud-based platforms (e.g., AWS), using infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform), configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible), and pipeline creation tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Experience with programming languages such as Go, Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, and/or BashExperience building self-service internal development platforms Experience in developing Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) solutionsAt ease with operating and managing production systems, solving issues, and striking the right balance between urgency and methodologyStrong problem-solving skills, proactive attitude, collaborative mindset and excellent organizational skillsCuriosity to learn new things and discover new technologiesWork with the agile iterative/incremental mindsetStrong communication skills and professional level of English

Prior experience with any of the above-mentioned tools is a bonus but not a must! We encourage you to apply even if you do not meet every single requirement. We welcome candidates with different levels of background and experience.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included). üìç Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium. ü©∫ Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us. üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.  üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days. ü§∏ Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription. üõ¥ Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets. üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes. üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and occasionally some soft drinks as well. üçï Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment. üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country. 

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

title: Software Engineer Big Data
description:
Als software engineer versterk je onze development community waar je mee de schouders zet onder boeiende IT-projecten. Je maakt kennis met alle aspecten van retail en bouwt applicaties met impact voor je collega‚Äôs √©n onze klanten. IT‚Äôer met een passie voor big data? Dit is voor jou!Wat doe je als Software engineer Big data?Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en onderhoudt automation frameworks en big dataoplossingen. Je doet dit met behulp van industry standard tools en technologie (Spark, Linux, Hadoop, Snowflake, Azure Synapse).Je analyseert technologie√´n om na te gaan hoe we ze kunnen gebruiken in onze platformen.Je schrijft duidelijke documentatie over de gebouwde oplossingen zodat de eindgebruikers vlot aan de slag kunnen.Je verdiept je in de integratie van applicaties met andere platformen of pakketten in ons IT-landschap en zorgt voor een vlekkeloos verloop van de uitrol van de oplossing naar productie.Als software engineer sta je ook paraat bij incidenten. Je analyseert wat er misging, je stelt een oplossing voor, implementeert die en volgt op. Je werkt nauw samen met andere experts om de projectdoelstellingen op een kwalitatieve manier te bereiken. Al eens kijken waar onze software engineers concreet mee bezig zijn? Lees dan dit interessante artikel!Je werkt in Halle, Haasrode, Mechelen of Zwijnaarde en je kan 3 dagen per week thuiswerken.
Profiel
Kennis en ervaring - Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in Computerwetenschappen of engineering of een gelijkwaardige ervaring. Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van MS Azure, Databricks, Spark, Python, Snowflake en Gitlab. Ook heb je ervaring met moderne schedulers zoals Airflow. Ervaring met Cloudera en werken in een devOps omgeving is een pluspunt.Analytisch vermogen - Je behoudt moeiteloos het overzicht en focust op de hoofdlijnen zonder hierbij de details uit het oog te verliezen.Oplossingsgericht - Je denkt in termen van oplossingen en hebt altijd een plan B klaar.Teamplayer - Regelmatig samenwerken met andere experts geeft je energie. Maar je kunt ook perfect zelfstandig aan de slag.Communicatief - Je bent in staat je boodschap helder over te brengen naar je stakeholders, zowel gesproken als geschreven.Talenkennis - Je communiceert vlot in het Engels, zo kun je makkelijk met iedereen communiceren, ook met je collega's in India. Kennis van het Nederlands is plus.
Wij bieden
Impact - Je bouwt applicaties met een rechtstreekse impact op de organisatie of zelfs de eindklant en helpt bij de uitrol van nieuwigheden in onze technologie, tools en frameworks.Fijne werksfeer - Je komt terecht in een ongedwongen omgeving waar je collega's je steunen en waar jullie samen al eens goed kunnen lachen.Ruimte om te groeien - Je technische skills kan je aanscherpen op een online leerplatform, op vakbeurzen of binnen onze communitywerking. Ook voor je persoonlijke groei hebben we een uitgebreid aanbod klaar.Aantrekkelijk loonpakket - Boven op je nettoloon krijg je ook extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname, hospitalisatieverzekering en maaltijdcheques.
Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group IT, onze interne IT-dienst. Van applicaties bouwen tot projecten beheren van a tot z, we hebben alle IT-jobs in huis. Met een team van zo'n 2000 IT'ers in Belgi√´, Frankrijk en India pionieren we met nieuwe technologie√´n en digitale innovaties. Of je nu application architect of data science engineer bent, samen met je met je collega's maak je onze organisatie wendbaar.

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Taxdoo, we value flexibility and work-life balance, and as a remote-first organization, we believe that you should not have to sacrifice either to succeed.
We are on a mission to build the #1 tax and accounting platform, helping e-commerce firms and Tax Professionals to unleash their full potential. To sum it up, we eliminate the draining bureaucracy that is acting as a barrier to their success.
At the heart of our approach is the steady commitment to prioritize our product. We seamlessly blend cutting-edge technology, extensive expertise in tax and accounting, and a profound level of empathy for our customers. This combination has resulted in the vast satisfaction and trust of thousands of customers across Europe, or as we prefer to call it ‚ÄúTaxdoo and Done‚Äù.
‚ÄúBye, Bye, Bureaucracy‚Äù stands for our motivation to free e-commerce entrepreneurs from unnecessary processes and regulations so they can entirely focus on their core competence. We are redefining the tax and accounting industry, which requires us to make bold decisions and to excel in everything we do. Even if you think you might not check every requirement of the job description, we encourage you to apply. We are more interested in your potential and passion than your previous experience.
What you will doYou will be joining team Fuego and...Lead and implement architectural and technical decisions within the team, that are aligned with the overall technical roadmap of the product using TypeScript.Inspire and contribute to a shared technical vision of designing the simplest effective solutions to the hardest problems.Inspire your team and others with technical vision and customer obsession.Collaborate with engineers and designers to solve problems and foster a balance of velocity through scalable, asynchronous decision-making practices.Develop expertise in VAT topics and become a key point of contact for building solutions.Help your Engineering Manager create a positive and supportive work culture, with a focus on knowledge sharing and personal development.

What you are good at  Technical credibility through lengthy software engineering experience with frontend, backend & distributed systems and infrastructure.Solid knowledge and experience working with Typescript, React, AWS, Serverless applications.Previous knowledge and experience working with PHP would be a plus.Experience in an early-stage product/team and building tools from scratch.Experience with working and mentoring remote and on-site cross-functional teams.Ability to thrive with a high level of self-direction, autonomy, and responsibility with a positive attitude, and you can work autonomously and overcome challenges with passion.You are well familiar with agile practices and how to apply them in building complex software products in an iterative way.Understanding of DevOps culture, and experience with implementing automation pipelines to continuously deliver well-tested software.Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.Be excited for collaborating with people across Taxdoo towards our shared mission - Building the Financial Operating System for e-commerce.
Check out our Tech Radar
Join us in saying ‚ÄúBye, Bye Bureaucracy‚Äù together!Learn more about our benefits at https://careers.taxdoo.com/benefits/
At Taxdoo, we are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. In our recruitment process, we consider applicants regardless of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, or age. Diversity is one of the core values that we embrace on different levels within the organization- from our employees to our products and clients.

title: API and EDI Integration Engineer
description:

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Company Description
Work smart, have fun and make an impact!
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world.
EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology.We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.
Why apply to EcoVadis? 
Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people.Feel valued for your contribution.Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.
Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our growing AI Center of Excellence, responsible for using machine learning to drive innovation across the organization. We welcome applications from Spain (office: Barcelona) with an option of remote work. Join us!
Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):
Leverage data to solve business problems of various business units at EcoVadisDesign, develop and maintain scalable ML systemsEnsure ML lifecycle monitoring by applying the best practices in MLOps and green ITEngage in building ML engineering infrastructure and systems to orchestrate batch and streaming pipelines, and leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to manage and provision infrastructurePartner with scientists and engineers to make ML models accessible to end-users and downstream processesBuild and enhance feature storesLeverage Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Qualifications
You have an outgoing personality along with an exceptional level of drive and a desire to pursue a career in an international and dynamic environment. You also possess excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking and analytical skills.
M.S. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related technical disciplineDemonstrable experience in designing ML systems and integrating those into business applicationsExcellent knowledge of Python, other languages are a plusDeep knowledge of machine learning lifecycle, principles, and toolingExperience in cloud technology, preferably Azure and its ecosystem (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Azure Bicep)Solid understanding of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operationsExperience in Linux OS and scriptingKnowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principlesExperience of cross-functional collaboration in the development of ML products and services (e.g., Engineers, Product Managers) is a plusFamiliarity with (non) relational databases
Bonus
Contribution to open-source libraries is a plusKnowledge of other languages, ecosystems, and CI/CD tools, experience with docker and container orchestration
Additional Information
Location: BarcelonaContract: Permanent
Our growing team in Spain is full of talented professionals from various fields who all share a desire to make sustainability real. We offer competitive salaries and support personal growth from day one. This includes extensive onboarding, teammates' support and a brand new e-learning platform bursting with courses and modules. So you can learn new skills and fine-tune old ones!
Benefits:
International and very friendly work environmentHybrid for colleagues who live near our offices (4 days per month) otherwise remote in the country you were hired inFlexible working hoursHome office allowance programIT equipment allowance90 days Working from anywhere policyMeals and Transportation Vouchers (Cobee card)Health, Wellness, and Dental BenefitsUnlimited and completely confidential sessions with psychologists and online well-being programs.Employee referral bonus policyPaid employee volunteer dayPaid moving day ( 1/year)Access to online learning libraryVirtual and in-person team building eventsCo working space with various services + opportunity to work in different locations (Europe and International)
Our hiring team looks forward to reviewing your CV, in English, with a guaranteed response to every application. A new job with purpose awaits you!
Don‚Äôt fit all the criteria but still think you‚Äôd be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. We‚Äôre interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.
Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.
Our team‚Äôs strength comes from everyone‚Äôs uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major)

title: CV/ML Engineer
description:
About us:Vexcel, founded in 1992, has more than twenty years of experience and is a leader in the geospatial industry due to our technical expertise and innovative approaches.Based in Graz (Austria), Centennial (USA), and Madrid, Vexcel stores, processes, and delivers high-resolution images for a wide range of markets (insurance, emergency services, etc.) on the scale of hundreds of PB per year. For more information, please visit https://vexceldata.com/
Job description:As a Machine Learning/Computer Vision Engineer, you will have a significant responsibility in the design, deployment, and maintenance of various distributed systems in our production chain; from internal quality control systems to the development of solutions for our clients.You will be in direct contact with geospatial analysts, software engineers, and cloud experts to ensure the correct development of solutions, as well as their monitoring and continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities:¬∑ Design and implement machine learning models for image processing, feature detection, and computer vision tasks.¬∑ Process and analyze large image datasets to extract meaningful insights.¬∑ Utilize AWS cloud services to build scalable and efficient image processing pipelines.¬∑ Develop algorithms for image analysis and object detection.¬∑ Collaborate with other developers to integrate machine learning models into broader systems.¬∑ Continuously evaluate new and emerging technologies to improve existing systems.¬∑ Write robust, readable, and reusable Python code.
Must-have requirements:¬∑ Proven experience (at least 2 years) in applying Machine Learning to image processing tasks.¬∑ Proficiency in Python and libraries/frameworks such as PyTorch (or TensorFlow), OpenCV, numpy and Pandas.¬∑ Solid knowledge of software design, development, testing, and deployment.¬∑ Knowledge of Unix systems.¬∑ Knowledge of container development and deployment such as Docker or Kaniko.¬∑ Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS or Azure.¬∑ Professional proficiency in English.¬∑ Ability to work in a multicultural team.
Valuable skills:¬∑ Experience with geospatial data.¬∑ Knowledge of Computer Vision algorithms such as 3D vision, feature extraction, optimization, post-processing, etc.¬∑ Experience with databases, preferably PostgreSQL, at a developer level.¬∑ Experience with foundational models.¬∑ Experience with Multimodal-LLMs.
Academic requirements:¬∑ High level of English (at least B2).¬∑ Degree in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, related engineering fields, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines. Or an equivalent combination of education or technical training + 2 years of experience in ML.
What we offer:¬∑ Indefinite contract.¬∑ Salary based on the candidate's experience.¬∑ 100% remote, hybrid, or on-site work, the candidate chooses the mode.¬∑ Flexible compensation:Health insuranceMealsTrainingChildcare¬∑ Access to a training platform sponsored by the company.¬∑ Stimulating environment:You will be part of a multinational company in full expansion.You will be part of a Machine Learning/Computer Vision team with access to a vast amount of data to carry out your projects.You will work with real problems from day one, with the responsibility and freedom to carry them out.

title: Software Engineer Robotica
description:
De wereld om ons heen verandert in een snel tempo. De inzet en ontwikkeling van robots en artifici√´le intelligentie zijn in veel sectoren niet meer weg te denken. Daarom is er bij VDL ETG een nieuw bedrijf CropTeq Robotics opgezet gespecialiseerd in autonome robots voor de agricultuur sector. Heb jij een passie voor de laatste stand van de technologie in robotica en artifici√´le intelligentie? Wil jij je kennis en ervaring inzetten om werkende robots te bouwen? In je rol als Software Engineer Robotica krijg je de kans om mee te werken aan de verder ontwikkeling van onze robots. Ga jij de uitdaging aan?

Functieomschrijving:

Binnen deze rol ben je dagelijks bezig met het ontwikkelen, integreren en testen van software voor onze robots. Je werkt binnen een multidisciplinair team met expertise op vlakken als software, hardware en mechatronica. Nieuwsgierig naar onze robots, bijvoorbeeld onze bladkniprobot? We vertellen je graag meer over deze bijzondere robot. Op onze website https://www.vdlcropteqrobotics.com/nl/product kun je alvast wat meer informatie vinden.

Jouw profiel:

Relevante technische hbo-opleiding met minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring √≥f een WO-opleiding in Software Engineer of Systems & Control.Hands-on ervaring met softwareontwikkeling (C++ en Python).Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Ervaring met HW/SW integratie, sensoren en sensordata.Kennis van het roboticadomein en ervaring met ROS is een pr√©CropTeq is een startup omgeving, hierbij is flexibiliteit van belang.Incidenteel ga je naar een kas/ klant om je ontwerp te toetsen en domeinkennis op te doen.Ervaring met agile werken.

Wij bieden:

Een competitief salaris, passend bij je leeftijd en ervaring (CAO Groot Metaal)27 vakantiedagen en 13 ADV dagenEen jaarlijkse winstdeling en een goede pensioenregelingÔªøÔªøJe bent onderdeel van het internationale, industri√´le familiebedrijf VDL Groep, waar continu√Øteit hoog in het vaandel staat.Je werkt in een startup binnen VDL. Je kunt je hier snel technisch verbreden binnen de disciplines software, elektro en mechanica.Samenwerken op een professionele manier in een informele, no-nonsense omgeving waar open communicatie de boventoon voert.Veel ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en ondernemerschap.Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden en goede doorgroeimogelijkheden.

Interesse?

Klaar om als software engineer actief bij te dragen aan de ontwikkeling en bouw van onze nieuwste robotica machine? Solliciteer eenvoudig via de sollicitatiebutton op deze pagina. Eerst nog vragen? Neem contact op met onze recruiter, Mandy, via 06-57187690 of m.joppen@vdl.nl

Bedrijfsinformatie:

Denk jij graag mee over hoe je de productie van een prototype op een innovatieve manier omzet naar een industrialisatieproces? Dan ben je bij VDL ETG Projects aan het juiste adres. We realiseren unieke mechanisatieprojecten in binnen- en buitenland. Daarbij ben je betrokken bij het gehele proces, van idee tot realisatie van een complete productielijn. Bijvoorbeeld voor de (massa)productie van chips, flexibele zonnecellen of het omzetten van plantenresten in biogas. We bieden jou uitdagingen op het gebied van engineering (mechanisch, elektrisch en software). Hou jij van variatie in je werk en technische uitdagingen binnen een open en informele werksfeer? Ga dan met ons de uitdaging aan!

title: Data Scientist
description:
Euronext Euronext is the leading pan-European market infrastructure, shaping capital markets for future generations. Its mission is to connect European economies to global capital markets, to accelerate innovation and sustainable growth. Euronext is located in 18 countries across Europe, US and Asia, with regulated exchanges in Belgium, France, Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway and Portugal. The group has expanded organically and externally, with a revenue growing from ‚Ç¨458 million in 2014 to ‚Ç¨1.5 billion in 2022, with 2,200 employees and 55 nationalities. With close to 1,900 listed issuers and around ‚Ç¨6.5 trillion in market capitalisation as of end June 2023, it has an unmatched blue-chip franchise and a strong diverse domestic and international client base, as well as a large Tech companies community, Euronext Tech Leaders. Euronext closely accompanies corporates thanks to its pre-IPO programmes and a full suite of innovative corporate services. Euronext operates regulated and transparent equity and derivatives markets, one of Europe's leading electronic fixed income trading markets and is the largest center for debt and funds listings in the world. Its total product offering includes Equities, FX, Exchange Traded Funds, Warrants & Certificates, Bonds, Power, Derivatives, Commodities, Advanced Data Services and Indices. The Group provides a European multi-asset clearing house through Euronext Clearing, and custody and settlement services through Euronext Securities central securities depositories in Denmark, Italy, Norway and Portugal. Euronext also leverages its expertise in running markets by providing technology, corporate and data services to third parties. Euronext is engaged in an ambitious ESG policy, translated into its "Fit for 1.5¬∞" commitment to net zero, supported by SBTI approved targets. Euronext Corporate Services Euronext Corporate Services, is at the core of Euronext's Growth for Impact 2024 strategy. It has delivered ‚Ç¨46m of revenue in 2023, growing +12% vs 2022, being one of the most important growth engine of the Group. Euronext Corporate Services already serves more than 4,500+ clients including over 1000 listed companies, private companies, advisors and public organisations. Clients are located across all Euronext markets (Belgium, France, Italy, Ireland, Netherlands, Norway Portugal,) but also beyond (e.g. UK, Germany, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Spain). The team is composed of over 170 professionals across Europe. They help listed companies make the most effective use of capital markets, and support private and public organisations run more efficiently.Euronext Corporate Services already serves more than 4,500+ clients including over 1000 listed companies, private companies, advisors and public organisations. Clients are located across all Euronext markets (Belgium, France, Italy, Ireland, Netherlands, Norway Portugal,) but also beyond (e.g. UK, Germany, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Spain). This unique and comprehensive value proposition is articulated around three main pillars: * Governance services: To public and private organizations we provide our board portal solution "iBabs" to help secure, organize and run board meetings more efficiently (save time preparing agendas and board packs, collaborate easily with annotations, voting, meeting summaries).Our advanced video technology allows you to easily broadcast your meetings, from webinars, townhalls and studio events, we provide the right solution * Investor relations and communication services: we help our clients to increase their visibility, engagement and international coverage with shareholders, investors and all stakeholders with leading digital communications and streaming solutions. We also provide flexible and customized market data components for Investor Relations websites of listed companies. Our IR.Manager tool provides a complete and intuitive IR management and targeting platform for corporate IR teams to professionalize the workflow and engagement. Our advisory team provides high-touch advisory, ESG advisory, market intelligence and decision making analytics for listed companies willing to be more active on capital markets. * Compliance services : our ComplyLog products helps companies simplify their EU regulatory duties, speed up workflows and ensure compliance by automating the management of inside information and insider lists for both issuers and their professional advisors ensuring compliance with the European Market Abuse Regulation (MAR). Euronext Corporate Services is a fully integrated division of Euronext, including all the resources to pursue its business activities: Revenue, Growth Marketing, Product, Technology & Operations, Client Services and Transformation. It also relies on Euronext support functions to accompany its growth. Role and Key Accountabilities As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets to provide actionable insights, developing predictive models, and contributing to the overall data strategy. The accountability includes:Lead and manage data science projects from concept to deployment.Be hands-on to build and maintain the data platform from the pipeline itself to the documentation, dictionary, and critical support processes.Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.Develop, test, and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms.Own the process of gathering, extracting, and compiling data across sources via relevant tools (e.g., SQL, R, Python). Independently format, re-structure, and/or validate data to ensure quality, and review the dataset to ensure it is ready for analysis.Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products .Mentor other data engineers, drive excellency and software craftsmanship within the team and across the organizationEstablish a data-driven culture by driving the definition, tracking, and operationalizing of metrics.Develop data visualizations and socialize dashboards, reports, and other ways of enabling the team and company to answer product data questions in a self-serve way.Partner with other data scientists across the company to share knowledge and continually synthesizing learnings across the organization.Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Knowledge, Personality, Skills and Experience Required Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.Minimum 5+ years of experience in data science, dba role or related field.Excellent understanding of relational databases and NoSQL databases, performance tuning and database optimization.Expertise in data integration techniques, including ETL processes, data pipelines, and data synchronization.Strong expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).Proven hands-on programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).Excellent understanding of Column-Store RDBMS (DataBricks, Snowflake, Redshift, Vertica, Clickhouse).Extensive knowledge of data governance principles, data quality management, and data privacy regulations.Demonstrated ability to handle large datasets and perform data wrangling.Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen analytical mindset.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at various levels, Fluency in English. Euronext ValuesUnity We respect and value the people we work withWe are unified through a common purposeWe embrace diversity and strive for inclusion Integrity We value transparency, communicate honestly and share information openlyWe act with integrity in everything we doWe don't hide our mistakes, and we learn from them Agility We act with a sense of urgency and decisivenessWe are adaptable, responsive and embrace changeWe take smart risks Energy We are positively driven to make a difference and challenge the status quoWe focus on and encourage personal leadershipWe motivate each other with our ambition Accountability We deliver maximum value to our customers and stakeholdersWe take ownership and are accountable for the outcomeWe reward and celebrate performance We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Solution Engineer in Defence, Finland
description:
Do you want to work with military C4I systems including land and artillery systems? Are you looking for a role where you can apply your broad IT technical skills and experience? If so, then seize this opportunity to join our Defence Services team in Tampere, Finland, and become part of a professional team of customer-focused technical experts.

We are a team of technical specialists within a global, market-leading organisation, and working to implement our command-and-control software to support critical decision-making on the battlefield. 

Deliver solutions to support critical decision-making on the battlefield
As a Solution Engineer, you will play a key role in delivering and supporting our SitaWare software products within our customers‚Äô environments in Finland and the Baltic countries.

Working closely with colleagues and our customers, you will collaborate with project teams in Tampere and internationally. Your tasks will cover a broad range of responsibilities within areas such as solution design, configuration, installation, technical support, training and testing.

Your key tasks will include:

implementing and supporting technical solutions as well as designing solutions ensuring alignment, effective communication and coordination with customers and colleagues within Systematic training and supporting our customers, both in classroom environments and during customer exercises and other eventsproviding support to ensure that projects are delivered within the agreed scope and on time. 


You will work out of Tampere, Finland, and should expect both domestic and occasional international travel to customer sites as well as visits to our company headquarters in Aarhus, Denmark. We offer a hybrid working model, providing flexibility with a blend of office-based and remote work.

Strong Communicator With Broad Technical Skills And Experience
We are looking for a new team member with experience at delivering advanced software applications in customer environments. Whether you have a few years of experience or extensive expertise, this role could be the perfect fit for you.

To succeed in this role, you are a team player and a strong communicator in both Finnish (as native language) and English. Ideally, you also have:

a relevant IT technical educationpreferably artillery or other military domain knowledge a flexible mindset, an independent and reliable work style combined with a self-starter approach to tasks and assignments a high willingness to travel, and you enjoy working in an agile and international environment. 


You probably also have experience within some or all of the following:
 tactical communications systems, software development, IT infrastructure, software and system testing, training and delivering services and consultancy in the IT sector.

We work with security classified projects, and therefore, as a Systematic employee in Finland, you must have a clean criminal record and meet the relevant security check requirements.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives, delivering it to our many customers and supporting them in its use. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, we are committed to being more than just a workplace ‚Äì Systematic is a community where professionalism and personal involvement go hand in hand to provide a sense of belonging and pride.

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions concerning the position, please feel free to reach out to Marko V√§lim√§ki, Senior Project Manager, at marko.valimaki@systematic.com.

title: Application Engineer
description:
About ACMA 
ACMA, headquartered in Bologna, Italy, is one of the leading manufacturers of packaging machines in the consumer goods market, with a large international share.
ACMA designs and manufactures automatic packaging machines for a range of industries, including: confectionery (chocolate, baked goods, candies and gums), personal and home care (liquids, powders and bars), tea and coffee.
ACMA is part of Coesia, a group of innovation-based industrial and packaging solutions companies operating globally, headquartered in Bologna, Italy.
Coesia has operating units in 36 countries, a turnover of 2,015 million euros in 2022 and over 8,000 employees.

About the role
Joining the Engineering and R&D department in a team of 5 Application Engineers, and reporting to the Application Engineer Leader, you will support the development of new applications and define new technical solutions, in coordination with the technical department, sales department and after sales department.
You will be responsible for:
Carrying out technical feasibility studies in order to define the technical-commercial solutions to be proposed for sale;Designing and developing complete lay-outs and flow charts of products;Developing quotations of complete lines or partial ITEM for specific machines;Analyzing the customer‚Äôs requirements specifications;Analyzing the technical proposals of the suppliers of parts included in the offer and proposing new suppliers;Realizing technical presentations to support sales during negotiations with customers and developing technical specification of machines or automatic distribution systems.
The position will be based in Bologna, Italy.

What you need to be successful
10 years of experience in automatic machines for primary or secondary packaging;Master‚Äôs degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent;Good command of mechanical drawings and CAD software;Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, Power Point);Proficiency in the English language both written and oral;Effective communication skills to easily build trust towards colleagues;Flexibility in managing priorities.

Coesia is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity and inclusion.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Job Description

About the Role:
We are seeking a Data Analyst with a strong business mindset to join our team, focusing on providing analytical insights for our client's Claims department in the insurance industry. The successful candidate will leverage their expertise in data analysis to solve complex business problems, drive decision-making, and support process improvement initiatives within the Claims function.
Key Responsibilities:
Claims Payout Analysis: Analyze claims data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that impact business operations, enabling data-driven decisions and process improvements.AI & Advanced Data Analytics: Contribute to cutting-edge AI and data analytics projects, applying innovative techniques to enhance claims management.Ad-hoc Analysis: Conduct targeted analysis on claims-related topics, such as claims disputes, fraud detection, and the impact of new regulations or industry trends.Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with Claims department stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into analytical requirements, and deliver actionable insights.Data Quality Monitoring: Continuously monitor and ensure the accuracy and integrity of data, proactively addressing any discrepancies.

Qualifications

Education: Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business) with a strong focus on data analysis.Experience:
2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a business setting.Proficiency in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.Strong experience with data analysis techniques and tools, including SQL, Power BI, R, and Python.Familiarity with SAS is a plus.Experience in Non-Life insurance or working with Claims data is preferred.Technical Skills:
Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques.Expertise in SQL, Power BI, R, and Python.Business Acumen:
Ability to understand and communicate business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.Soft Skills:
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.Strong ability to work independently and as part of a team.Capable of managing multiple priorities and meeting tight deadlines.Language Skills:
Fluent in English.Good to fluent proficiency in Dutch and/or French.

Join our growing group developing our next-generation products and solutions for the Retail Fuel Industry.

For over 30 years, Orion has been solving complex business problems for our clients. Our transformative business solutions are rooted in digital strategy, experience design, and engineering, empowering our clients to operate with agility at scale.We work with a wide range of clients across many industries including Hi-Tech, Telecom and Media, Professional Services, Financial Services, Healthcare and Life Sciences, Sports and Entertainment, and Education.

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
Gjensidige er et ledende nordisk forsikringsselskap som er et av de st√∏rste selskapene p√• Oslo B√∏rs med om lag 3800 medarbeidere i Norge, Sverige, Danmark og Baltikum. I Norge tilbyr vi ogs√• pensjon og sparing. Hos oss kan du v√¶re med p√• √• sikre flere liv, mere helse og st√∏rre verdier enn hos noen andre forsikringsselskaper i landet.

I Gjensidige engasjerer vi oss i kundene v√•re, og i b√¶rekraftige l√∏sninger. Fremtiden avhenger av at vi forvalter verdiene v√•re riktig, og vi trenger alltid flinke folk til denne viktige oppgaven. Vil du v√¶re med?

I Gjensidige har vi en cloud first strategi, og vi er godt i gang med √• etablere en ny plattform i Azure basert p√• Data Lakehouse arkitektur. Dette inkluderer blant annet Databricks og Data Build Tools.

Vi er n√• p√• jakt etter en dyktig Data Platform Engineer som vil bli sentral i etablering og videreutvikling av denne plattformen. H√∏res dette g√∏y ut? Les videre!

Gode grunner til √• jobbe i Gjensidige

Visste du at v√•rt fagmilj√∏ innen IT best√•r av cirka 300 engasjerte kollegaer som jobber med den aller nyeste teknologien?

Vi jobber blant annet med √• flytte v√•re l√∏sninger ut i skyen, innf√∏ring av nytt kjernesystem, utvikling av analyseplattformer, digitalisering av produkter og tjenester, design, integrasjon og prosessautomatisering, samt IT-sikkerhet og beredskap. Vi b√•de utvikler nye l√∏sninger, og jobber med √• forbedre de vi allerede har. I tillegg bygger vi en stadig st√∏rre og sterkere organisasjon hvor m√•let er √• ha de mest engasjerte teknologimedarbeiderne i bransjen!

Du vil bli en del av avdelingen Teknologi og plattformdrift, og det er vi som blant annet har teknisk ansvar for analytisk infrastruktur i Gjensidige. Vi er en avdeling med 14 erfarne og h√∏yt motiverte medarbeidere som jobber for √• tilrettelegge analytisk infrastruktur, generiske kapabiliteter, selvbetjening, best practices og governance. Dette for at brukerne av plattformen kan lage gode dataprodukter enkelt og effektivt. Vi er opptatt av √• lage gode brukeropplevelser for v√•re utviklere og analytikere.

I v√•r avdeling sk√•rer vi h√∏yt p√• engasjement og l√¶ring i Gjensidiges medarbeiderunders√∏kelse. Hva forteller dette deg? Jo, det forteller deg at vi er et team som er spesielt opptatt av nytenkning, utvikling, motivasjon og trivsel p√• arbeidsplassen! Vi jobber tett sammen med v√•re brukermilj√∏er som best√•r av rapportutviklere, analytikere og data scientists.

Din hverdag som Data Platform Engineer

Har du stor interesse for analytics og skyteknologi? Da kan dette v√¶re jobben for deg!

Som Data Platform Engineer vil du f√• en sentral rolle i √• etablere nye kapabiliteter og kontinuerlig forbedre v√•r nye data- og analyseplattform i Azure. Plattformen er bygd p√• ledende teknologier hvor hovedkomponentene er Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, Data Build Tools, GitHub, Azure Data Factory og PowerBI.

Som en del av data plattformteamet vil du jobbe med blant annet infrastruktur, sikkerhet og governance, samt stabilitet og ytelse. All v√•r infrastruktur kodes i Terraform. I tillegg vil du v√¶re leverand√∏rkontakt som inneb√¶rer teknisk oppf√∏lging og √• holde seg oppdatert p√• roadmaps og releaser.

Om deg som s√∏ker

Vi er p√• jakt etter deg som synes det h√∏res spennende ut √• designe og utvikle en moderne skybasert data- og analyseplattform, og som blir motivert av kontinuering l√¶ring og faglig utvikling. Kanskje du har relevant utdanning som passer godt til arbeidsoppgavene, eller s√• har du opparbeidet deg god praktisk erfaring i tidligere stillinger.

Erfaring med noen av f√∏lgende teknologier er en fordel:

 Skykompetanse i Azure Datalakehouse med Azure Databricks Infrastructure-as-code med Terraform Erfaring med streaming ved bruk av Kafka Erfaring med CDC l√∏sninger Programmeringserfaring helst innenfor SQL og Python Versjonskontroll og deploymentprosesser ved bruk av GitHub eller lignende Data Build Tools Azure Data Factory


Vi jobber tett mot v√•r applikasjonsplattform GAP (gap.gjensidige.io), s√• det er ogs√• en fordel om du har kjennskap til Kubernetes.

Videre kjenner du deg igjen i f√∏lgende:

Du er analytisk, strukturert og n√∏yaktig.Du trives med en arbeidshverdag der du f√•r kaste deg ut i tekniske utfordringer og varierte arbeidsoppgaverDu blir motivert av kontinuering l√¶ring og faglig utvikling.Du √∏nsker √• dele kunnskap og erfaringer med dine med kollegaer, og v√¶re med p√• √• dra fagfeltet v√•rt fremover.


Intervjuer vil v√¶re fortl√∏pende.

I Gjensidige √∏nsker vi √• gjenspeile bredden av mangfoldet i samfunnet. Oppgavene er varierte, ofte langsiktige og ikke minst samfunnsviktige. Det fineste vi har er felleskapet, og den du er, er viktig for oss. Hos oss f√•r alle like stor plass, og mangfoldet v√•rt beriker b√•de oss selv og kundene v√•re. Gjennom √• v√¶re deg selv, og f√• muligheten til √• utvikle ditt fulle potensial, kan du utnytte evnene dine langt bedre.

Se fremover. Skap verdier. Bli en av oss.

Trond Walhovd, (+47)97192250, Trond.Walhovd@gjensidige.no

title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning in Cloud Infrastructure
description:
Intrinsic is Alphabet‚Äôs bet aiming to reimagine the potential of industrial robotics. Our team believes that advances in AI, perception and simulation will redefine what‚Äôs possible for industrial robotics in the near future ‚Äì with software and data at the core.

Our mission is to make industrial robotics intelligent, accessible, and usable for millions more businesses, entrepreneurs, and developers. We are a dynamic team of engineers, roboticists, designers, and technologists who are passionate about unlocking the creative and economic potential of industrial robotics.

Role

In this role, you will be responsible for building out infrastructure for the training and deployment of large-scale robotic foundation models. Your work begins early in the process of scoping projects with our customers and partners, and drives impact by demonstrating our technology and capabilities. With a strong focus on creating utility value for partners and customers, you will help determine data and ML infrastructure requirements, write clear specifications, review designs, and contribute to our engineering teams to design and build successful solutions. You will contribute to a project with several German industry partners and to creating a data ecosystem for robotics.

How your work moves the mission forward

Help design solutions for training large-scale robotic foundation modelsImprove existing systems by adapting scalable pipelines for distributed computing and data processingCollaborate with product and engineering teams in order to optimally support customer use cases

Four-year degree in Computer ScienceExperience collaborating on medium to large software projects for at least 4 yearsExperience in programming Python / C++ Experience with KubernetesDemonstrable experience with Google cloud computing (Google Cloud), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), service-oriented architectures, and Experience with machine learning frameworks (Tensorflow, JAX)

Skills that will differentiate your candidacy

Fluency in German language (writing and speaking) preferredExperience in roboticsExperience with deploying ML services at scalePractical experience in debugging distributed systems (network issues, performance problems)

At Intrinsic, we don't just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. title: Mechanical Engineer
location: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visit‚ÄØwww.topsoe.com.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We are looking for a mechanical engineer who is deadline and solution-oriented and has an eye for detail.

You will be working at the headquarters' engineering office and traveling to destinations all over the world several times a year. By doing so, you will have the opportunity to explore the world of Topsoe's many complex technologies and work on a range of interdisciplinary projects.

This Means, That You Will

Work with traditional mechanical disciplines such as mechanical design, metallic materials, solid mechanics and weldingTake part in the design and development of our proprietary equipment such as convection reformers, ammonia converters, MeOH reactors and sulfuric acid equipmentDo calculations, select materials and prepare technical documentation for procurementReview supplier drawings and specifications as well as inspection at fabrication workshopsPerform supervision of site installations on a global platform. 

What You‚Äôll Bring

You are detail-oriented and goal-oriented. As a specialist, you understand the importance of ensuring that advanced mechanical projects, like ours, function flawlessly. Simultaneously, you possess the ability to efficiently complete tasks and meet our customers' deadlines. You are driven and curious, always seeking opportunities to improve designs, workflows, and products to meet future demands.

In addition to the above, it is important to us that you:

Hold a B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in mechanical engineeringAre willing to travel frequently for both short-term and long-term (4-6 weeks in a row) customer supportPossess knowledge of the Inventor 3D platform. If you have experience working with it, that would be even betterHave strong calculation skillsHave a proficient level of English language proficiency.

It Would Be Advantageous If You

Have relevant work experience with metallic materials, solid mechanics, and weldingHold an apprentice certificate or skilled worker certificateHave work experience with pressure equipment, pressureless equipment, and site supervision.

Why join us

As a member of our team, you will be involved in all aspects of our mechanical solutions. You will contribute to the entire Topsoe journey, starting from the design of proprietary equipment and extending to providing on-site guidance to our customers in large-scale chemical plants. You will have the opportunity to work with various genres of the renowned Topsoe process. This role will require regular communication with colleagues in affiliated offices worldwide, as well as our international suppliers and customers.

However, it's not just about the work process. Your future colleagues genuinely value each other and their craftsmanship. Additionally, if you wish to engage outside of the workplace, you can participate in one of Topsoe's many social clubs.

How You Can Apply

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English and enclose a copy of your references through our website www.topsoe.com.

Please contact Group Manager Nina M√∏hler, phone +45 2527 6624 email nmo@topsoe.com if you want to know more about the position.

Application deadline

September 25th, 2024.

title: Application Engineer
description:
