title: Multiplayer (Netcode) Game Developer
description:
Multiplayer (Netcode) Game Developer (Unreal Engine 5/C++)
About MetaGravityMetaGravity is a deep-technology startup headquartered in London which is solving the concurrency problem in distributed simulation to handle immense virtual worlds and games with dense player, AI and physics interactions. We are fully funded and have grown to over 60 employees over the last 12 months. Very rarely for a deep tech start-up we are earning significant revenues in our first year of operation.
Current game engines and game servers can handle a peak of ~100 players in a self-consistent ‚Äúinstance‚Äù. However, the next generation of online games and metaverse experiences demand much larger simulated realities beyond what is currently feasible ‚Äî think, tens of thousands to millions of players and AI beings in a single instance. MetaGravity is solving this problem. We‚Äôre working from first principles to build distributed computing infrastructure that is limitless in its ability to scale, thus empowering creators to craft truly living, breathing worlds. We are also dog-fooding our tech by building our own mediaeval fantasy sandbox MMO game called Edge of Chaos, leveraging all of the potential of the MetaGravity infrastructure and blockchain platforms.
MetaGravity was founded by experienced entrepreneurs and long-term collaborators Rashid Mansoor (Chief Executive Officer) and Tobin Ireland (Chief Business Officer). Our team is composed of seasoned entrepreneurs and innovators with decades-long experience in distributed systems, supercomputing, decentralised infrastructure, game engine development and AAA game production. We are deeply committed to our cause, believe in its immense upside potential and embrace bold, first-principles thinking in our approach to problem-solving.
Job SummaryWe are looking for experienced Unreal C++ Multiplayer Programmers with mid- to senior- levels of netcode experience to join MetaGravity. You will be advancing and maintaining MetaGravity‚Äôs in-house server/engine technologies while also developing our internal and partner game projects. You will relish the opportunity to make an impact by delivering the biggest concurrent gameplay experiences in history. You will have a love for games and an intuition for optimising and tuning gameplay that looks and feels great in a fast-paced multiplayer or MMO game. The ideal candidate will be an excellent problem solver who takes delight in writing elegant, high-performance code.
What We‚Äôre Looking ForMultiplayer Game Programming Experience:Mid-Level: 5+ YearsSenior: 10+ Years
Must-Have:Expertise in developing replication logic and net code for fast-paced multiplayer game genres (e.g. FPS, third-person combat or racing)Strong experience in C/C++ programmingStrong knowledge of Unreal Engine 5Understanding of network protocols and architecture, specifically TCP/IPShipped at least 1 titleStrong debugging, problem-solving, and optimization skillsStrong communication skills and ability to work well in a team environmentGood verbal and written English skillsThe Ideal Candidate Will Also Have One or More of the Following:Experience designing and implementing code for complex gameplay scenarios. e.g.Networked destruction systemsMultiplayer racing physicsReplicating root motion systemsNice-to-Have but Not Required:Experience optimising games/assets for the Unreal rendering pipelineStrong computer science background in data structures, algorithms, performance optimisation or distributed systems designExperience working at lower levels of the TCP/IP stack
ResponsibilitiesContributing to our server technology and the MetaGravity-UE5 networking pluginGoing from higher level goals to working codeWorking with stakeholders, design and code team to understand requirements and dependenciesTesting and iterating with the team as requiredSolving problems through the application of sound processPlan, write, maintain, test and document code and toolsFunction as an integral part of the development team, actively contributing towards the development of our tools, services and platformsDevelop and maintain our technology integrations with industry-standard games engines to enable our customers to build and operate games and online experiences supporting millions of users in a single shared reality.Implementing game systems in close cooperation with the design and QA team.Profiling and optimization of the code base.Resolving technical issues, debugging, and bug fixing.
Join us and: A Shape the future: Be at the forefront of cutting-edge technology, architecting the fabric of virtual worlds for generations to come.Make a real impact: Contribute to a mission-driven company that's levelling the playing field and empowering creators to push the boundaries of what's possible.Work with the best: Collaborate with a brilliant team of experienced game developers, PhDs and professors who are passionate about innovation.Develop exceptional expertise: Work with the most seasoned experts to solve some of the hardest and most important open problems at the intersection of multiplayer games and high-performance distributed systemsEnjoy a supportive and rewarding environment: We value diverse perspectives and foster a culture of collaboration, growth, and professional development.
LocationWe are headquartered in London, UK and have an office in Warsaw, Poland - where our development and product teams are based. Fully remote opportunities (work anywhere in Europe or worldwide) are available for exceptional candidates.
We offer competitive salary and equity, as well as opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you have a passion for network programming and a drive to work with cutting-edge technology, we encourage you to apply.
ApplicationPlease apply with Your CV and include links to your Github and portfolio within your CV

title: Software Engineer (VZS)
description:
Ben jij een Software Engineer die wil bijdragen aan de verandering van de wereld met jouw talent voor softwareontwikkeling? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Visma Verzuim zoekt een Software Engineer die gedreven is in het cre√´ren van hoogwaardige oplossingen die een verschil maken in het dagelijkse leven van verzuimbegeleiders in Nederland.

Functieomschrijving

Als Software Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en implementeren van nieuwe features in onze agile-omgeving. Je werkt in een internationaal development team en krijgt de ruimte om te experimenteren met nieuwe technologie√´n. We organiseren meerdere keren per jaar een innovation week, waarbij jij jouw innovatieve idee√´n kunt omzetten tot een werkbaar product. Door voort te bouwen op de gevestigde code van ons product, kun je de functionaliteit van ons product blijven verbeteren en onze klanten de best mogelijke ervaring bieden. Wij bieden jou een omgeving waarin je kunt groeien en jouw technische vaardigheden kunt ontwikkelen, terwijl je samenwerkt met enthousiaste collega's.

Je komt bij Visma Verzuim te werken in een van onze development teams. Dit zijn kleine teams van 4 tot 5 engineers die samen de uitdaging aangaan om onze roadmap werkelijkheid te laten worden. We hechten er erg veel waarde aan dat we goede teams

hebben samengesteld, we kijken hierbij veelal naar cultuur, persoonlijkheden, groeiambities en natuurlijk ook de skills. Deze aandacht voor de samenstelling van de teams zorgt ervoor dat we steeds beter worden!

Samen met je team ontwikkel je nieuwe features in onze cloud native, web-based, applicatie Dotweb Cloud. Je zorgt ervoor dat elke ontwikkeling voldoet aan onze hoge kwaliteits- en veiligheidseisen. Je draagt actief bij aan het ontwerp en de oplossingsrichting van nieuwe features. Je gaat werken in een agile omgeving, waarin we verwachten dat je ons ook uitdaagt om steeds betere en prettigere ontwikkelprocessen neer te zetten.

Wij vragen

Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van software met PHP, Git en relationele databases (MySQL is een pr√©).Een goede kennis van datastructuren en algoritmes.Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van software en het bijblijven met de nieuwste trends en technieken in het vakgebied.Verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel voor je eigen werk en de kwaliteit daarvan.Een open-minded en leergierige houding, waarbij je nieuwe idee√´n deelt en experimenteert met nieuwe technologie√´n.


Wij bieden

Een aantrekkelijk salaris en goede secundaire voorwaardenDe ruimte om bij te blijven met de nieuwste trends en technieken in jouw vakgebied en deze toe te passenEen informele bedrijfscultuur waarin je alle mogelijkheden hebt om je idee√´n te realiseren en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen en waar we ook houden van een potje tafelvoetbalSamenwerken in een internationale omgeving met enthousiaste collega'sFlexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om vanuit huis te werken


Over Visma Verzuim B.V.

Visma Verzuim is een Visma-bedrijf en helpt meer dan 3,5 miljoen werknemers veilig, gezond en duurzaam inzetbaar te blijven. Dat doen wij door samen met onze klanten de meest flexibele, complete en gebruiksvriendelijke online-software en apps te ontwikkelen voor verzuimbegeleiding, verzuimpreventie en het inzetbaar houden van werknemers. Daarbij geloven wij sterk in de kracht van eenvoud, connectiviteit en data. Wij groeien sterk en zijn met meer dan 300.000 actieve gebruikers marktleider in Nederland. Vele grote en minder grote Nederlandse bedrijven gebruiken onze software en daar zijn we trots op!

Onze organisatie biedt je een innovatieve omgeving waarin je samen met je team werkt aan de uitdagende visie en roadmap van Visma Verzuim. Je zult aan de slag gaan met moderne frontend frameworks zoals Vue.js, samen met het populaire Laravel PHP framework waar de kern van onze cloud native applicatie in geschreven is.

Binnen Visma Verzuim combineren we het maatschappelijke aspect rondom het langdurig gezond houden van de bijna 4 miljoen werknemers in ons systeem, met een sterke drang naar innovatie. Zo plannen we tweemaal per jaar onze R&D afdeling voor een gehele week vrij en houden we de Visma Verzuim innovatieweek! In deze week werkt iedereen aan zijn eigen innovatieve idee√´n, de engineers bepalen het onderwerp dus volledig zelf. Ze kiezen er voor om individueel of samen met een andere collega hun idee uit te werken en op het einde van de week presenteren we het resultaat aan elkaar. Deze innovatie weken leiden vaak tot gave nieuwe inzichten, die dan weer kunnen doorvloeien naar onze product roadmap.

Hoe nu verder?

Ben jij geinteresseerd in bovenstaand profiel voor Software Engineer (VZS)? Visma Verzuim B.V. ziet graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet! Door middel van het klikken op de solliciteerbutton kom je in een overzichtelijk sollicitatiescherm waar je met jouw CV kan reageren op de vacature van Software Engineer (VZS).

title: Backend developer
description:

title: Junior Credit Risk Modeller *
description:
BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 2.1 million customers. As a dynamic employer, we promote talent and drive technological innovations quickly. Flat hierarchies, a flexible working environment and equal opportunities for our employees are particularly important to us.

TASKS

Develop and maintain quantitative models for credit and market risk management, focusing on IFRS9 parameters, Value at Risk (VaR), cashflow and time series models.Conduct regular calculations of risk parameters, ensuring accuracy and adherence to established methodologies. Implement robust and reconcilable processes for parameter calculations.Ensuring compliance with existing regulatory requirements (IFRS 9, EBA/ECB, CRR/CRD etc.) and participation in external and internal audits of own models.Create and maintain efficient and well-documented code for quantitative models and risk parameter calculations. Work with databases and SQL to extract, manipulate, and analyze data necessary for risk modeling.Generate reports and analyses derived from quantitative models, providing insights and recommendations to key stakeholders. Ensure timely and accurate delivery of risk-related information.


PROFILE

University degree in a relevant area (math, statistics, economics with financial focus etc.)Interest in handling big data and solving of statistical problems by developing quantitative modelsAny programming language (R, C#, SAS/SQL, Python, etc.) is advantageousExcellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex quantitative concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, contributing to a collaborative work environment.


OUR OFFER

FlexOffice is our motto! Work in your private environment whenever it is compatible with the job. We support you with high-quality equipment and a financial allowance. You spend your office days in our modern, easily accessible office at Vienna Central Station. Here you can also place your little ones in the company's own kindergarten, which is run by the Wiener Kinderfreunde. We support your personal development and career planning with an individual, attractive training program. Visit our BAWAG Academy and use our eLearning-Plattform GoodHabitz for your professional and also personal development. In addition, we offer interesting and lucrative additional services (company health care, group insurance, BAWAG sports club, vacation accommodation, preferential conditions for employees and their close relatives, meal subsidy).


We guarantee a competitive salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications, starting at ‚Ç¨ 44.476,88 gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement. Salary requests above this amount will be considered depending on your previous experience and qualifications.

Your contact person: Martina Simek +436648099832162

* We value people.

Would you like to work in a team where good cooperation and diversity are actively practiced? Then you've come to the right place. Equal opportunity is important to us - regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, physical impairment, religion or origin.

Jobb√∂rse | Xing | LinkedIn | Facebook | whatchado | Instagram

title: Fullstack Developer with an interest in AI
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective.
Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
About the roleOur product development department is experiencing significant growth and is home to an engineering team of 100 highly skilled professionals. As our department continues to grow in Sweden and internationally, we are looking for an experienced Fullstack Developer to further strengthen the Nordic teams.
We work on projects in small, cross-functional teams that are responsible for different areas where you will always be involved in decision-making. We work in agile, one to two-week sprints, where close teamwork and communication are critical. Helping each other is an integral part of Odevo‚Äôs culture, and you will play a key role in every aspect of the development process, from idea to architecture to release.
We work closely with our customers, and through collaboration and close communication, we get feedback that helps us to constantly improve. As part of our team, you will work from a holistic perspective and get a lot of space to think creatively and come up with your own solutions.
Who you areYou enjoy working in a business that is constantly evolving and where you have the freedom to take initiative and implement your ideas. You strive for quality in everything you do, and always want to deliver your best. You are not concerned with prestige and enjoy working in a team environment.
ExperienceMinimum three years of fullstack development experience.Proficiency in several technologies from our stack and frameworks (Angular, PHP, MySQL, Linux, Apache) is preferred.Experience in PropTech or FinTech sectors is a plus.Experience or interest in AI tech is a plus.Fluency in Swedish and English is required, Finnish is a plus.
What we offerRemote friendly - you'll be part of a team that values collaboration and communication.Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development
LocationWhile we're remote-friendly, we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person, most of whom are located in and around Stockholm and Gothenburg. Our headquarters, in Stockholm, is on the top floor of the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over the city.

title: Data Engineer
description:
AI Platform EngineerAn exciting biotech company dedicated to discovering and developing medicines for neurological disorders specifically within the small molecule space is looking for a new AI based Platform Engineer to join their growing team on a hybrid/remote basis. 
Responsibilities:Collaborate with the AI team to set project goals, develop strategic plans, and create product roadmaps.Understand platform components to guide decisions and enhance scalability and interoperability.Apply MLOps principles to transition machine learning models to production.Write production-quality code, maintain documentation, and report progress.
Required Skills and Experience:Advanced Python skills, with knowledge of Tensorflow, PyTorch, and Pandas.Experience in ETL processes, data modeling, data architecture, and data pipeline development.Proficiency with graph databases (e.g., RDF, Neo4j) and query languages (e.g., SPARQL, Cypher); knowledge of relational databases is a plus.Proven experience deploying machine learning models, especially in NLP or deep learning, in production.Ability to work independently within a cross-functional team.2-3 years of industry experience, preferably in life sciences.[Preferred] Experience with life science/drug discovery data and biomedical ontologies.[Preferred] Ability to collaborate with data scientists, data architects, bioinformaticians, and cheminformaticians.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Does this sound like you?
You are an engineer with a pragmatic attitude. You feel the weight of responsibility that comes with taking systems into production. You easily switch between scripting and structured programming in typed languages. You understand cloud, provisioning and automation. And you know how to build robust systems.
How you will help to create value with Data & AI
At Xebia Data we build strong Data & AI practices to deliver value to our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, built advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinational corporations. We enjoy great success in making top companies AI-driven ‚Äî just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team!
As data engineer you are responsible for the implementation of the foundations of data-intensive systems. You develop enabling infrastructure to store, transform and process data at scale and in the cloud. You make sure that data is stored safe and secure using the technology that you see fit for the job.

What you will do to make data-intensive applications work effectively and securely?
With your knowledge of software engineering, cloud, clusters, queues, containers, streaming, or graphs you work on the backbone of the data infrastructure. There is lots of data to store, many jobs to run and schedule, much configuration to be dealt with. You work with the client in teams that are a mix of people from Xebia Data and the client and pick up the work that is related to that backbone on which the team is building.When you're working on-site with a client, you may come across something that is really difficult to solve. We‚Äôve got your back as we work as a team and will help you solve your problems, because everybody at Xebia Data is just a quick message away and ready to help at any time.
Who Are We Looking For?The Data Engineer role is a senior position with a central role in our clients' teams, and therefore we require at least 3 years of relevant professional experience. Having said that, we like to be amazed: so if you have done something outstanding, like contributing to open source projects or starting your own company, we encourage you to apply no matter what the level of your experience is.

The Xebia Data WayAt Xebia Data, we treat each other with respect, cooperation, and a view towards creating an enthusiastic, self-empowered, dynamic working community. Our culture exudes creativity and ambition, and our colleagues share an insatiable thirst for knowledge. We‚Äôre especially proud of our generous training budget and our ‚ÄúHack-What-You-Want‚Äù Fridays.In addition to a great culture, we provide competitive primary benefits:
competitive salary;lease car;pension plan;5k educational budget. And please, do spend every bit of it.extended insurance;pick whatever laptop or MacBook you likechoose your phone;
Our core values are people first, quality without compromise, sharing knowledge, and customer intimacy. At Xebia Data, you‚Äôll find like-minded colleagues at the forefront of their fields with the courage to veer from the beaten path; they are the people who put organizations into motion
THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶‚úÖ If you like working with new data processing tools, like Airflow, Spark, Flink, and Druid.‚úÖ If you understand the importance of cloud and know your way around or want to learn that.‚úÖ If you like working for different clients and enjoy the excitement of regularly getting to learn new environments and know new people.‚úÖ You live in the Netherlands (we are not relocating) 
THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶‚ùå if you do not like working under pressure to get things done in the best way possible with limited time you have to finish it.‚ùåif you do not like working with open source technology.‚ùåif you do not like coding, scripting, templating.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Virtual Sensors
description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer with prior experience in applied Research?
Are you passionate about the automotive landscape and how IA can revolutionize it?
By joining us, you will develop and integrate cutting-edge IA solutions that will power the mobility of tomorrow!
Your Future Tasks 
Developing virtual sensors for automotive applications, including static and dynamic mass estimation, wheel adhesion detection, and motor identification.Developing state estimation algorithms and AI-based sensor fusion techniques to enhance the accuracy and reliability of virtual sensors.Building and testing prototypes of virtual sensors, ensuring they meet performance and reliability standards.Integrating developed sensors into the vehicle's existing systems, ensuring seamless operation and compatibility.Testing and validating the sensors in simulated and real-world environments, documenting results and refining designs when necessary.Working closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, hardware engineers, and data scientists, to develop innovative sensor solutions.
 What we Offer 
Varied projects with many well-known customers in France and abroad.Extensive training & learning opportunities.A structured career progression towards more managerial and technical responsibilitiesA flexible and vibrant work environment with management close to the team.A community of enthusiasts gathering via Hackathons, Code Challenges, Lab Camps and trade shows in France and abroad.
 You Have 
A PhD in Computer Science, Robotics, Mechatronics, or a related field.A strong background in developing machine learning and AI algorithms, particularly for sensor fusion and state estimation.Proficiency with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.Expertise in developing and implementing sensor fusion algorithms to combine data from multiple sensors.Experience in embedded software development using MATLAB, C/C++ and Python.Fluent in French; a good level of English will be highly regarded.
Who We Are 
Autonomous Reply is the entity of the Reply specializing in developing and integrating Autonomous Things (AuT).
We offer consulting, software development and integration of autonomous solutions to major players in the industrial, automotive, and new mobility sectors
Our expertise includes ROS applications, edge computing, and collaboration with leading cloud infrastructure providers.
By submitting your application for this position, you agree that your personal information will be collected and processed in accordance with GDPR regulations, ensuring the standards of data privacy and security with recruitment purposes at Reply Group.

description:
Nira Control - looking to further strengthen our resources within Embedded HW, SW and Application tool development.
http://www.nira.se/#career
Nira Control takes its customers to highergrounds! You find Nira Control in battery-powered trains, trucks, criticalbackup gen-sets, diesel-powered outboards, and super sports cars. title: Data Engineer
description:
Omega CRM Consulting is looking for a Data Engineer that would like to collaborate with one of the top global pharmaceutical companies. 
We're currently seeking a talented Data Engineer to join a newly formed Product Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to scale up and globally rollout our Customer Data Platform (CDP), a key solution used for Marketing Automation in both our Human Pharma and Animal Health business units. Your Role and Impact as a Data Engineer, you'll play a crucial role in both the Development and Operations of our CDP platform. You'll ensure high-quality deliverables and leverage state-of-the-art technologies to keep the platform running stable and compliant. Your work will directly impact our ability to enhance the platform based on business requirements.What You'll Do?
Manage and organize data, building and maintaining data infrastructure and pipelines.Collaborate with our internal team and external implementation partner to proactively drive problems to resolution.Influence and negotiate scope and requirements, championing innovative process changes and technology-enabled solutions. Excellent SQL and analytical SQL Functions knowledge.Experience with Python scripting, Pandas & Dig Dag scripting.Proficiency in Agile delivery and software development lifecycle in a DevOps environment.Familiarity with Atlassian suite (Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence).Experience in incident management and test automation, preferably in the context of a data platform.Knowledge of Treasure Data CDP platform is a strong plus.Strong communication skills and relationship development and management capabilities.Bachelor and/or Master degree or equivalentProgressive IT and business experience of 5-10 years preferred.2-5 years Data Engineering experience in big data solutions. WHAT DO WE OFFERPermanent contract.Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life.Trainings & Certifications. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention. About usOur mission is to accelerate the business experience (BX) of its customers. In concrete terms, our 360 solutions allow business transformation and acceleration by means of technology and data applied to Customer #OmnichannelExperiences in fields such as #CustomerServices, #eCommerce, #Analytics or #Marketing. We target companies from different fields such as: #Retail, #LifeandSciences, #Manufacturing but also #Education, #NonProfit, #NGO etc. We are one of the top 3 partners of #Salesforce in Europe. Our team is composed of more than 500 people of 24 nationalities based in Spain and France, who have wide knowledge and experience that understands business processes and technology while enjoying what it does. Key to our success is the knowledge of our people. We are an innovation and Outstanding Knowledge award-winning, Salesforce Consulting Partner. Our priority is the well-being of the team. We foster a collaborative culture, involved and supported by our company values: #Talent, #flexibility, #commitment and #innovation. We bring them to everything we do. #TogetherWeGrow

title: Backend Engineer/Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Intro

As experts in legal e-learnings, lawpilots creates innovative learning experiences that employees remember. Topics like data protection, compliance, ESG, IT security, and occupational safety are too important to be complicated. Lawpilots' e-learnings deliver relevant content in an easily understandable manner. Using practical examples, gamification, and storytelling, the knowledge sticks longer with employees than even the catchiest tune.

lawpilots - Setting New Standards in Employee Training

We are looking for a Backend Engineer with 5+ years of experience in developing web based applications. As a member of our engineering team, you will play a crucial role in developing, and scaling our Learning as a Service platform. You will collaborate closely with our front-end engineers, product managers, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to build robust and efficient backend solutions. A natural sense of curiosity to learn and work with new technologies is one of your trademarks, and your clear and analytical mindset helps you to apply your experience in a goal oriented manner. Above all, you value teamwork and believe that working together is more important and leverages better results than a team of individualists.

Your mission

Your key responsibilities in the position of a Backend Engineer at lawpilots include:

Develop and scale individual modules and services of our web based Learning as a Service platform using best practices.Work with modern backend languages like Python and frameworks like FastAPI. Knowledge in other backend languages like Java or Go and web application frameworks such as Django, Spring, or similar is a plus.A clear advantage is the ability to work with modern frontend languages and frameworks such as Typescript/Javascript and React that you would apply building components for your backend business logic.Utilise Python's asyncio library for asynchronous programming and develop highly performant and scalable backend code.Develop and optimise complex SQL queries to ensure efficient database operations.Implement automated testing and embrace test-driven development to ensure the quality and stability of the backend codebase.Participate in code reviews, design discussions, and provide constructive feedback to peers.Utilise cloud native technologies and work with our Cloud.Ops team to deploy, maintain, and run our applications in Kubernetes clusters on AWS or GCP.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement backend requirements and APIs.Troubleshoot and debug backend issues, identify performance bottlenecks, and implement effective solutions.Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in backend development ‚Äì you will be provided with dedicated time for research.

Your profile

What We Need You To Bring To The Company

5+ years of experience designing, developing, and scaling distributed applications.A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field is a clear plus.Strong experience with asynchronous programming using Python's asyncio library.High proficiency in relational databases (e.g. Postgres) and experience in optimising complex queries.Solid understanding of automated testing and experience with test-driven development.Highly skilled with Python and strong experience with frameworks like FastAPI.A clear advantage is experience with modern frontend languages & frameworks like Typescript/Javascript and React.Experience with cloud native technologies from the AWS or GCP suite.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex issues.Good communication and collaboration skills.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Why us?

We are an international team that values diversity and inclusion. Our core values are Inspiring, Excellence, Ownership, Learning & Trust.

Working Environment

Welcoming office near Berlin Central Station with a hybrid work model option.Two days per year for social engagement.28 vacation days + an additional day per year until reaching 30 days.Office closed on Christmas and New Year's Eve.Your choice if you want to subsidize public transport, sports or lunch options.Access to our e-learnings.Focus-Friday with no meetings.

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:

Lawpilots GmbH is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, ethnic or social origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, caregiving responsibilities, or physical abilities, to apply. We believe that diversity strengthens our team and fosters an inspiring atmosphere that promotes innovation and success. We continuously work to create an environment characterized by respect, fairness, and equal opportunities.

Join Us

We invite you to become part of our dedicated team and revolutionize the e-learning industry with us! Our office near Berlin Central Station is well-connected and accessible.

title: Data Engineer
description:
On behalf of our client, a software house leader in Internet Services and Solutions with a large clientele in the private and public sector, we are currently looking for a talented Data Engineer, to join its highly-skilled team of professionals in Athens.

A day in the life of a Data Engineer

In this role, you'll be responsible for building and maintaining data pipelines and robust data solutions to support our client's operations and analytics needs. We are seeking a Data Engineer with a solid understanding of SQL Server Development. The ideal candidate should be proficient in T-SQL scripting, ETL processes, and have hands-on experience with data migration projects.

Your day-to-day

Craft efficient and accurate SQL Server scripts and processes to facilitate seamless data transferDesign and implement ETL processes using SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) as part of our data orchestrationTranslate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring alignment between data engineering and organizational goalsConduct performance tuning and optimization of SQL queries and SSIS packagesCreate and maintain comprehensive documentation for data migration processes, including data mappings and transformation rulesEnsure data integrity and consistency throughout the migration process by performing validation and reconciliation activities


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field2-3 years of professional experience as a Data EngineerGood understanding of SQL Server, including stored procedures, indexes, job management, execution plans, tables, databases, and keysFamiliarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)Understanding of data modeling and database design principlesProblem-solving skills and attention to detailStrong communication and teamwork skills


Competencies

Exposure to SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BIUnderstanding of DAX measures for data analysis


Benefits

You will be part of a company with amazing culture, people orientation, strong team work and plenty of room for career and personal development. Among others, the main perks are:

Competitive Remuneration PackagePrivate medical insurance planFriendly and professional workplace environmentCareer development within a stimulating and growing working environmentContinuous training

title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world‚Äôs largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages ‚Äì and we‚Äôre continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:

Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutionsDemonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation

We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:

 An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres) Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management) Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and data-driven individual to join our team as a junior / mid-level Data Scientist. As a Data Scientist at Viezo, you will work on developing cutting-edge asset maintenance algorithms and have the opportunity to make a significant impact to our data pipelines and backend.
Responsibilities¬∑ Contribute to the development of analytics engine which predicts the health of asset maintenance (railway wheelsets, industrial motors, CNC spindles, etc.).¬∑ Investigate & research new diagnostics & predictive maintenance approaches related to railways and industrial applications.¬∑ Analyse current client data to spot trends and extract insights which could contribute to the improvement of the analytics backend.¬∑ Writing reports on case studies using numerical and statistical tools. Qualifications¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs/Master degree in an Engineering, Computer, or Data Science fields.¬∑ Demonstrated numerical approach, statistical thinking & analytics skills (projects, other work experience).¬∑ Experience working with time-series data is a must.¬∑ Experience working with real world sensor data is greatly appreciated.¬∑ Knowledge of signal-processing techniques is a plus.¬∑ Knowledge of AWS is a plus.¬∑ Python, SQL, batch scripting skills is a requirement. ProjectsTo give you a sense of the type and scale of the problems you will be working on, we provide a non-exhaustive list of projects you could tackling:¬∑ Investigate relationships between wagon operational parameters (speed, operator, loading, etc.) and wheel damage severity from high sample rate sensor data.¬∑ Explore feature extraction methods for sensor data that describe information content of acceleration data packet.and others.¬∑ Developing statistical and/or numerical models to predict the size of a wheelset defect. If you are passionate about solving complex open-ended and, most importantly, eager to learn in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you!

title: Data Analyst- DRI Team
description:
At Similarweb, we're revolutionizing the way businesses interact with the digital world by revealing to them everything that happens online. Our cutting-edge platform and unique data empower over 4,300 customers globally, including industry giants like Google, eBay, and Adidas, to make game-changing decisions that drive their digital strategies.

In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven‚Äôt stopped growing since!

We're expanding our global presence with a brand-new site in Prague - home to Europe‚Äôs top tech talent - and seeking exceptional pioneers to help build a new dynamic team. At Similarweb, you'll innovate fast, collaborate with brilliant minds, solve big problems, work with cutting-edge technologies and data at incredible scales, and make a tangible impact on the world's most innovative companies.

We‚Äôre looking for a talented and dedicated Data Analyst who will be a part of the Core Solutions Data group.

As part of this role, you will help us process rich and complicated datasets. Will explore and validate new features and data sources. Be part of the data science and data engineering force creating new features for our solution.

What does the day-to-day of a Data Analyst (Data Research) at Similarweb look like:

You will work in a data research team alongside other data engineers, data scientists and data analysts. Together you will tackle complex data challenges and bring new solutions and algorithms to production.Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and data mining to turn data into insights.Understand the customers needs, evaluate the quality of our features and communicate the results.Conduct research and develop tools that will ensure the quality of Similarweb‚Äôs data and algorithms.Utilize your deep understanding of Similarweb‚Äôs data in order to evaluate and improve novel algorithms produced by the data scientists in your team.Partner with Big Data Engineers to establish an infrastructure to scale solutions.

What will I bring to the team?

Passionate about data.Holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science/Mathematics/Physics/Engineering or any other relevant field - RequiredAt least 1 years experience in Python scripting - MustExperience with SQL for data analysis -MustKnowledge and understanding of the statistical principles, concepts, methods, and standards- MustExcellent communication skills (in English) with the ability to provide constant dialog between and within data teams.Hadoop/Spark/AWS Infrastructure experience - Big AdvantageAbility to visualize data and experience with a visualization tool and modules (mlplot, matplolib, sns) - Big Advantage

About The R&D Team

As part of our R&D team at Similarweb, you'll have the opportunity to work on challenging algorithmic problems with no play book solution, solve problems for real customers, and work alongside the best engineers and scientists in the industry.

*All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model, so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face to face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.*

Why You‚Äôll Love Being a Similarwebber

 You‚Äôll actually love the product you work with:  Our customers aren‚Äôt our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said ‚Äúthe product.‚Äù Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.

 You‚Äôll find a home for your big ideas:  We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You‚Äôll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.

 We offer competitive perks & benefits:  We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.

 You can grow your career in any direction you choose:  Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it‚Äôs Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you‚Äôll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.

 Diversity isn‚Äôt just a buzzword:  People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.

We will handle your application and information related to your application in accordance with the Applicant Privacy Policy available here .

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
In the cloud, every second counts. On the leading edge of security, Sysdig stops attacks in real-time by instantly detecting changes in cloud security risk with runtime insights and open source Falco. We are passionate open source enthusiasts at heart and technical problem-solvers who are innovating and delivering powerful solutions to secure cloud-native applications.

We value diverse opinions and open dialogue to spur ideas. We believe in working closely together to achieve our goals, and since our launch, we have been flexible with when and where we work. We‚Äôre an international company that understands how to cultivate a strong culture across remote teams.

And we‚Äôre a great place to work too ‚Äì we‚Äôve been named a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù by Inc.,the San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal, and we won six workplace awards from Comparably this year. We have been recognized by Deloitte as one of the 500 fastest-growing organizations for the last four years.

We are looking for driven team members who want to join us on our mission to lead cloud security globally. Does this sound like the right place for you?

What You Will Do

Architect efficient and reusable code that drives complex applicationsDesign, implement and deliver cross-functional features built on top of our data architectureContribute with high quality code and promote best practices around developmentManage complex projects in close collaboration with Product Managers and other Software EngineersParticipate in an on-call rotation to address any urgent issue

What You Will Bring With You

Experience with the Go programming languageIn-depth knowledge of Backend foundations, such as RESTful API design and microservice-based architecturesProficiency with testing methodologies, such as unit testing and integration testingExperience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred)Experience with graph databases (Neo4j preferred) is a plusExperience operating in Kubernetes and Cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus

What We Look For

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related field7+ years of experience in developing scalable and secure Backend servicesA positive ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude and collaborative mindsetAbility to work effectively in a cross functional team environment

Why work at Sysdig?

We‚Äôre a well funded startup that already has a large enterprise customer baseWe have an organizational focus on delivering value to customersOur open source tools are widely used and loved by technologists & developers

When You Join Sysdig, You Can Expect

Great compensation package, including equity opportunitiesAn international culture with employees in more than 40 countriesFlexible work arrangementMental well-being support for you and your family and company-wide recharge daysDevelopment opportunities

We would love for you to join us! Please reach out even if your experience doesn‚Äôt perfectly match the job description. We can always explore other options after starting the conversation. Your background and passion will set you apart, especially if your career is unconventional.

Some of our Hiring Managers are globally distributed, an English version of your CV will be appreciated!

Sysdig values a diverse workplace and encourages women, people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. Sysdig is an equal-opportunity employer. Sysdig does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status.

title: Software Engineer, Chrome Autofill
description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.Typically 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.Typically 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.Experience with C++ and browser development or web standards.

Preferred qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Computer Science, or a related technical field.Experience developing accessible technologies.Experience with Web Browsers, Android Development, iOS Development, Windows Development, Chrome, Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS, Scaffolding, Objective-C, Flume. 

About the jobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. In this role, you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. We‚Äôre focused on making a better browser (on both desktop and mobile) to help users take advantage of all the web has to offer in a safe and secure way.Chrome is available across all major platforms ‚Äî iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and Chrome OS. title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Sinch is a global leader in the growing market for Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. We are specialists in allowing businesses to reach everyone on the planet, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.

With presence in more than 50 countries, whether you know us or not, you've definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.

Requirements

A strong software engineering backgroundIn-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystemExpertise in modern front-end technologies.Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.Experience building services on the backendFluency in English

Big Plus!

Experience using design systemsExperience making architectural decisions that have high impactExperience with Web components and the latest Web APIsExperience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies

Our Hiring Process

description:

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe‚Äôs all about. title: MLOps Engineer - Remote
description:
Who We Are:

Persado provides the only Motivation AI platform that generates personalized communications at scale, inspiring each individual to engage and act. Many of the world's largest brands, including Ally Bank, Coach, Dropbox, Kate Spade, JP Morgan Chase, Marks & Spencer, and Verizon, rely on Persado to engage customers across their journey, from acquisition communications to online cart conversion. Persado's Generative AI for the enterprise is trained on more than 100 billion digital business language impressions across industries, enabling marketers to motivate customers and drive significant business value. Persado has been recognized by CB Insights as the top Leader for Generative AI Text Content Generation.As an employer, Persado is committed to creating a place where everyone's unique perspective is valued. We understand that our team members and our inclusive culture are what make Persado special. Persado is proud to be named on Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies list in 2020 and Built In's Best Places To Work in 2021, 2022 & 2024.

What We Are Looking For:

Persado is looking for a Senior MLOps Engineer to join a team that helps build the company's AI-based products.

What You Will Work On:



Main responsibilities:

 Build data pipelines and infrastructure to support Persado's DS teams, e.g. model training and evaluation pipelines. Leverage the models that the DS teams builds in building production grade ML systems. Develop, document and deploy tools and services for other teams at Persado to integrate with the ML systems.  Improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of Persado's ML systems. Apply software engineering practices to ML systems, e.g. automated testing, CI/CD, service oriented architecture, etc. Support Persado's model governance and ML security posture. Communicate with stakeholders on project requirements. 

Technologies you will use:

 Workload management: Linux, Docker and Kubernetes. Cloud computing: AWS, Azure, GCP. Software engineering: Python, and to lesser extent Java, Ruby, JS. Workflow: Airflow, Airbyte. Frameworks: Pytorch, Ray, vLLM. Observability & Monitoring: Prometheus, ELK, OpenTelemetry. Configuration management: Terraform, Helm, Kustomize. Databases: PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Citus DB, AWS Redshift, Redis, etc. 

What You Bring:

 Minimum 5 years work experience in a technical role, including experience in a role such as: MLOps Engineer, Platform Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Data Engineer or equivalent.  Experience with cloud computing, storage and database systems.  Experience using Web APIs (e.g. REST).  Experience with container workload management systems like Kubernetes.  Experience with workflow engine tools, either general or ML Specific, such as: Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow, Argo Workflows, etc. Experience with performance engineering and monitoring.  Experience with CI/CD.  Familiarity with Linux or Unix systems administration.  Basic software engineering skills (including Python software development).  Understanding of machine learning fundamentals. Understanding of software testing concepts, such as unit testing, integration testing etc. 

What We Offer:

Achieve your life goals and work goals at Persado. Persado's hybrid working model empowers both remote and in-office work equitably! Competitive and equitable compensation Generous benefits packages globally 401k matching (USA); Pension Scheme (Certain EU locations) to prepare for your future We encourage professional growth through our dedicated enablement and training teams, as well as on demand tools and resources Employee Enrichment Fund to pursue a passion or upgrade your home office! Structured onboarding program to ensure a confident start and long-term success for new hires! Strong emphasis on career development and mobility, continuous feedback loops and performance management  Flexible time off to support work-life harmony (including Summer Fridays and a one week Winter Holiday Break) #PersadoCares! 2 paid Volunteer days per year and charitable donation match Robust Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives; culture month celebrations, monthly diverse speaker series, commitment to bias-free recruitment, ERGs (#culture, #mindsmatter, #parents, #women, #green, #pride and growing)! Valuing diversity at Persado means recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Persado is committed to diversity with respect to all aspects of employment. All decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee training and development, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, religious beliefs, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, physical and mental disability, age, ancestry or place of origin.

title: IT-Traineeship Software Engineer
description:
Zoek jij een stevige uitdaging en de mogelijkheid om veel nieuwe dingen te leren in een dynamisch vakgebied? Doe mee aan ons IT Professional Program en ontwikkel jezelf tot software engineer!

Er wordt veelal volgens SCRUM gewerkt en je gaat als volwaardig teamlid bezig met het bouwen en aanpassen van (nieuwe) software. Na √©√©n jaar heb je de mogelijkheid om bij de opdrachtgever in dienst te treden en vervolg je je carri√®re. Wij helpen je dus om een mooie start te maken in de IT!
Wat bieden wij?Professionele begeleiding op het gebied van je technische en persoonlijke skillsEen informele werksfeerDe mogelijkheid om diverse certificeringen te halen in o.a. talen als Java, C# en platformen als Azure en AWSDe optie om onbeperkt deel te nemen aan Sogyo Studiegroepen en Sogyo SeminarsEen fulltime (40 uur) baanEen salaris vanaf de eerste dag dat je start met je opleiding in onze academyEen goede basis voor een carri√®re in de IT!
Meer over onsWe zijn een technisch inhoudelijk gedreven IT dienstverlener met een passie voor software ontwikkeling en design. We werken samen met opdrachtgevers in diverse sectoren, van grote bedrijven tot bedrijven uit het MKB. Vakmanschap vinden we belangrijker dan feitenkennis. Het (verder) ontwikkelen van IT-talent is wat we leuk vinden en waar we goed in zijn.
Wij zijn een informele organisatie en vinden het belangrijk om, naast hard te werken, te ontspannen! Daarom ondernemen we graag activiteiten als game- en spelletjes avonden, sporttoernooien en we spelen graag een potje tafeltennis in de lunchpauze. Meer informatie vind je op www.sogyo.nl. 
Ben je ge√Ønteresseerd?

title: Software Engineer - Web Application Developer
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact ‚Äì on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we‚Äôre pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.

We are looking for a skilled Web Application Developer proficient in .NET Core, C#, and React to join our development team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of web application development processes, from the layout/user interface to relational database structures. You will design, develop, and implement high-quality web applications for our clients, ensuring the integration of crucial technologies and upholding our standards of excellence.

Responsibilities

Design and develop scalable web applications using .NET Core, C#, React and Typescript.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs in new and existing applications.Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.Stay up-to-date with the latest web application development trends and technologies.

Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.Proven hands-on experience as a Web Application Developer or similar role.Strong knowledge of .NET Core and C# programming.Experience with front-end development using React.Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server or other relational databases.Understanding of RESTful APIs for connecting applications to back-end services.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Experience with Agile development methodologies and tools (Azure DevOps).Experience with cloud platforms (ideally Microsoft Azure).Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work well in a team environment.

Nice To Have

Knowledge of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker).

What We Offer

An open environment where you are expected to work independently and with possibility to influence the work content.Attractive salary and benefits package (private medical care for you and your family, life insurance, lunch card, access to MyBenefit platform where you can choose Multisport or other vouchers, etc.).Flexible working hours, you can start between 7:30 and 9:30 am.Hybrid work schedule (2 days a week from the office on Przybyszewskiego 56, Krak√≥w).No formal dress-code.Annual integration events.Employee volunteering opportunities and interesting CSR projects.Relocation support if needed.

For further information please contact Olena Mykytsey, Talent Acquisition Partner at olena.mykytsey@alfalaval.com

We review applications continually so please submit your application as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications sent via email - please submit your application online.

We care about diversity, inclusion and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:

On the leading edge of security, Sysdig stops attacks in real-time by instantly detecting changes in cloud security risk with runtime insights and open source Falco. And we‚Äôre a great place to work too ‚Äì we‚Äôve been named a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù by Inc.,the San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal, and we won six workplace awards from Comparably this year. We have been recognized by Deloitte as one of the 500 fastest-growing organizations for the last four years.

title: Cloud Technical Solutions Engineer, Storage
description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience.2 years of experience troubleshooting and advocating for customers' needs, and triaging technical issues (e.g., hardware, software, application, operational, process).2 years of experience coding in a general purpose coding language (e.g., Java, C, C++, Python, Shell, Go or JavaScript, etc.) or in system design.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience with object storage systems (e.g., Google Cloud Storage).Experience in Network Troubleshooting, including collecting and reading packet captures.Experience writing and executing SQL queries against large datasets and log files, troubleshooting technical issues and analyzing usage patterns.System/Network Administrator level knowledge of Linux/Unix or Windows systems from Kernel to Shell and beyond, file systems and client-server protocols.Knowledge of core data structures and concepts: HTTP Protocol, Web frameworks, and common Web Technologies.

About The Job

The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

In this role, you will develop knowledge of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization‚Äôs ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google‚Äôs cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Manage customer issues through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customers on Google Cloud Platform products.Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in engineering, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.Work closely with multiple Product and Engineering teams to find ways to improve the supportability, products, and interact with our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams to drive high-quality production.Work as part of a team of engineers/consultants that globally ensure 24-hour customer support. Work non-standard work hours or shifts, including weekends, as needed.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Data Scientist - Generative AI
description:
Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients‚Äô data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it‚Äôs investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients‚Äô data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. You will work with state-of-the-art open source and proprietary tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment approaches. Whether it‚Äôs investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.


 Communicating with internal and external clients to understand and define business needs Initial project analysis, setting up project activities in the data science area and monitoring their delivery Implementing, validating and maintaining predictive, prescriptive and generative (foundation) models with a focus on big data Evaluating modelling results and communicating the results to technical and non-technical audiences Working with both open source and proprietary technologies (such as IBM Cloud, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, AWS...) Assisting clients in leveraging their data resources and acting as an advocate of data-driven application development Working in an agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists, engineers, consultants and specialists of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the data-drive application development


Required Technical and Professional Expertise


 You have at least 2 years of experience in the data science field You have a strong understanding of the core data science algorithms and statistics fundamentals You're proficient at at least one of the key programming languages used in data science such as R or Python (Python is preferred) You have a demonstrated knowledge of data manipulation, data mining and a variety of supervised and/or unsupervised modeling techniques You have strong technical and analytical abilities, a knack for driving impact and growth You're comfortable with solving problems by looking at things differently, debugging, troubleshooting, and designing & implementing solutions to complex technical issues You have a proven record of transforming user requirements into production-ready analytical applications You are able to communicate with a wide range of audience in both English and Czech


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


 You thrive on teamwork and have excellent verbal and written communication skills You have experience with NLP techniques and generative AI You have a solid knowledge of one or more cloud computing platforms such as IBM Cloud, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, or AWS You have experience with additional programming languages or other data science tools, such as big data processing frameworks


About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients‚Äô businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM

IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Automation Engineer
location: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
description:
Do you want to use your technical knowledge to work with complex systems related to hydrogen production plants (water electrolysis)? Do you have the motivation and ambition to make the world a better place to live?
At Everfuel, they work to make the world a better place by showing the way to a fossil-free future. They work actively for the green energy transition by making green hydrogen commercially attractive both as a sustainable fuel in the transport sector and as a green solution for industry. They are growing rapidly and are looking for the next Everfueller.
You have technical knowledge and thrive working with complex systemsAs Automation Engineer at Everfuel you will be responsible for developing the automation architecture, specifications, designs, tools, and processes. You should expect focus to be on control loop optimization, functional safety, specifications design, and validation processes.
Everfuel is a young entrepreneurial company working on projects across Europe, giving you the opportunity to be working in an international environment, where you have the possibility to influence the growth strategy and the results in collaboration with your dedicated colleagues. You will be part of the Technology department at Everfuel, where you will have the possibility to build and professionalize procedures and tools for your own areas.
Your tasks:Configuration of hardware and softwareFunctional safety design and implementationProject management within automation engineeringTroubleshooting and optimization of existing equipmentDevelop automation architecture and functional descriptionsFollow up, test, and validate the programming from vendorsEnsure installation and testing on site
Your place of work will be at ‚ÄúEverfuel Tech‚Äù in Fredericia, Denmark, at the HySynergy PtX Site. There will be a mix of desk work and site-related tasks. You will report to the Technology Director, and you will be part of a growing team who are all dedicated to ensuring that green hydrogen becomes a competitive alternative to fossil fuels.
Who are you?You might have an educational background as electrician/automation technologist and with a continuing education as Electrical Engineer, Marine Engineer or similar. You must have a solid understanding of industrial PLC (Siemens, Allen Bradley or similar) and control programming as this knowledge will give you the ability to set the framework for collaboration with the external vendors. If you have experience with site related tasks it is an advantage.
We are looking for a person that has the talent to work both on the strategic level setting the optimal architecture and on the operational level preparing specifications and documentations. You are detail oriented, disciplined, works in a structured way and are a trustworthy team player.
The position will be perfect for you if you enjoy working in a dynamic and flat organization. Everyone is equally vital at Everfuel‚Äì because together, they can achieve so much more and with even better results.
About EverfuelEverfuel supplies green hydrogen to larger car fleets such as buses, trucks, and taxis and as a green solution for the industry. Green hydrogen is a 100% clean fuel produced from renewable energy sources and will play a key role in overcoming Europe's climate challenges. They are based at the Everfuel Farm in H√∏gild near Herning and in Fredericia, where they are building Europe's largest electrolysis plant to date and new attractive offices. As an employee at Everfuel, you get the opportunity to work in a dynamic company and they offer you:
A good work environmentFlexible working hoursExciting work assignmentsOpportunity to influence decisions
Application and contactPlease send your motivated CV as soon as possible to PRO&CO via the button ‚ÄúAns√∏g/Apply‚Äù. PRO&CO is handling the recruitment process for Everfuel.
We encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, ethnicity, or religion. We process all applications with confidentiality, we carry out interviews on an ongoing basis.
Starting date: As soon as possible.
If you want to hear more about the position, please feel free to contact Kristian Reinevald ‚Äì PRO&CO: +45 9660 3200.
