title: Decision Support Cloud Developer
description:
Are you an entrepreneurial team player who loves IT? Do you have the bright ideas it takes to bring our existing decision support systems to the next level in order to maximize our revenues? Get on board with Air France-KLM where you‚Äôll work with the latest technologies and the best colleagues on challenging projects.

What will you do?

Together with your colleagues, you will provide valuable insights and analysis to support (senior) management and business in making complex decisions. You will maintain our current Decision Support Systems, but at the same time you work on defining and developing the next generation systems in the Google and Azure cloud.

You will be working in a Scrum/Agile environment with the latest technologies. You know the business, take care of needs and talk to many different people; from analysts to directors. As a consultant you could say that you are business, business analyst, product owner and software engineer in one. When you receive a request from senior management or have a new idea, you go for it. Possible organizational-, hierarchical- or political barriers won‚Äôt stop you. This way, you deliver continuously improving products.

We serve a broad customer base throughout the entire Air France and KLM organization. Varying from Pricing and Revenue Management to Cargo, Digital, Distribution, Sales and Offer innovation.The Decision Support Systems you‚Äôre developing will be generating insights that form the basis for achieving revenue targets. This is the reason why our team plays a crucial role in the profitability of Air France-KLM.

Tasks & responsibilities

You design, develop and implement Decision Support Systems, based on your knowledge of relevant business processes and operations research modelsYou look for moments that offer commercial opportunities and/or that contribute to the efficiency of the companyYou implement new techniques in the field of cloud development, advanced analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learningYou will be involved in various business projectsYou maintain contact with various stakeholders inside and outside of Air France-KLM from your colleagues in Paris to partners who work with your systems

Where do you land?

You will join a young, international team operating in the heart of the commercial organization. You can count on 25+ colleagues of different nationalities, a positive work atmosphere and after work drinks. You will be based at our head office in Amstelveen, but you will occasionally fly to Paris and sit at the table with your fellow consultants at Air France.

Your profile

You are an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial team player that excels in a fast-paced environment. Logical thinking and analysis come naturally for you, so does IT. That's a good thing because you will develop and implement our decision support systems yourself. Existing processes are not a given for you. You‚Äôre someone who is always looking for ways to innovate or improve existing processes. Sure, changes may create some resistance, but with your continued persuasion and excellent communication skills, there‚Äôs no doubt about achieving your goals. On top of it all, you‚Äôre great at building and maintaining relationships with cultural sensitivity. Last but not least: no way will you say ‚Äúno‚Äù to working on location in Paris. Un croissant et un caf√©, and let‚Äôs go!

Educational and professional background

A master degree in econometrics, operations research, business analytics, (applied) mathematics, computer science or a similar degreeMaximum of 5 years of relevant professional experienceKnowledge of cloud native developmentsExperience in one or more programming languages is an advantage, especially Java, C++, Python or the MEAN/MERN/MEVN Stack environment

What Do We Offer

A gross salary between ‚Ç¨3.712,- and ‚Ç¨5.304,- per month;Plenty of scope for personal development and great advancement opportunities;Labour market allowance;An excellent pension scheme and 8% holiday allowance;A year-end bonus of 8.33%;A profit-sharing scheme, up to 20%;25 leave days and 5 extra days off;7 extra days off if you work irregular shifts;Substantial discount on airfare (when you have been employed for at least 6 months);A travel expense scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;If your job allows it: working from home and up to 8 weeks working from abroad (EU and Caribbean);2% development budget;

Ready for your next destination?

Don‚Äôt wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 09/08/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and ‚Äìpossibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application.A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.

title: Senior FullStack Engineer
description:
Why Recharge.comAt Recharge, we're revolutionising prepaid payments! From call credits to gaming, entertainment and more, we make online recharge easy, anytime, anywhere.Join us in our exciting journey of an ambitious scale-up in a state of rapid growth & make a real impact. What we offer30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme, and one of the best relocation packages in AmsterdamFlexible working hours and an office overlooking the AmstelMacbook Pro or Windows LaptopBudget for noise-cancelling headphones, travel to and from the office, opportunities to work-from-home and self-learningFree healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chefUnlimited access to mental health support by certified psychologists via OpenUpFree Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the NetherlandsRegular parties, celebrations and other events

Location Madrid, Espa√±a

Experiencia level: >3 years in the functions described.

Requirements: English C1; Portuguese and Italian are a plus. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field with a Master's or postgraduate.

The team that you join:

Repsol Low Carbon Generation (Renewables), which is positioned as one of the four business pillars of the Repsol Group in the framework of the Strategic Plan 2024-2027, which aims to decarbonize our product portfolio and strengthen the position of the Company as a multi-energy supplier at national and international level, selects a Performance Analyst for its work centre located in Madrid, Spain.

You will have the opportunity to participate in the ambitious Repsol LCG project with a broad growth plan in an inspiring environment together with qualified and widely experienced professionals from other leading companies in the sector.

Functions

Performance Analysis engineer monitors and analyzes through standard indicators underperformance issues related to the operation of the Wind, Solar and BESS assets. Manage and track the resolution of the underperformance detected issues, continuously present and communicate status and results to regional platforms from North America and Europe & Latam.

Main functions:

Definition and develop performance standard indicators and methods to detect and analyze underperformance issues as power curve deviation, yaw misalignments, blades alignment, anemometer deviations, inverters underperformance, backtracking issues, MPPT issues, combiner and string underperformance, rack BESS underperformance issues, implementing processes to improve the accuracy of detections. Manage detected underperformance issues to track resolution and added value. Monitor main standard KPIs of the Wind, Solar and BESS fleet from Repsol LCG as PBAs, TBAs, POI Production, WTG/INV Production, Electrical losses, Predicted, Expected, standard type energy losses and events, specific technology KPIs to identify possible performance improvement projects, fleet technical optimization and complete detailed comparisons against targets. Elaboration and presentation of performance monthly reports to regional platforms. Working with large datasets and be comfortable querying datasets to databases. Write ad-hoc queries to capture data. Develop reporting capabilities and create interactive business intelligence (BI) reports. Support the development of performance modelling software tools and other areas in the analysis, calculation, or programming specific properly indicators or results. Definition and update technical specifications based on international standards, methodology procedures and support to Handover team in the definition of technical specifications related with pre-toc tests. Work with performance improvement, RCA, and Technical Support to identify improvements or modifications that can increase the performance to quantify the financial benefit of the project. Interaction with Regional platforms, IT/OT and Control Centre, Market Operations, rest of areas from Technical Optimization and other internal and external staff. 


What we offer: 

Permanent contract Bonus according to objectives Medical insurance Pension plan contribution Digital disconnection Conciliation measures Legal advice Employee support services 


You will fit the position if: 

Additional/valuable training: Master's degree, graduate degree or Ph.D. (desirable); Power BI Data Analyst Associate certified by Microsoft. Proficient knowledge of Excel and Power BI (Tableau will be valued). Must be proficient with SQL and Python, programming skills. Minimum 4 years working by a company involved in the Solar or Wind sector. Experience in performance analysis must be demonstrated. It will be added value experience in manufacturing companies, maintenance service companies or energy utilities with strong technical duties which must be demonstrated. Required soft skills: strong statistical and analytical abilities, problem-solving skills, and an open-minded attitude.

title: API Software Engineer ‚Äì Mid/Senior
description:
Your new workplace: "Simplicity. Applied." is more than just a slogan at M2M Services‚Äîit's the driving force behind our global tech leadership. Recently, we expanded our horizons by joining forces with Uplink and Alula, two prestigious American companies. Our mission is to accelerate the widespread adoption of smart security through universal and affordable IoT solutions. We are known in the security industry for our unwavering commitment to engineering excellence, and our partners rely on us for top-quality products and services. The company works with over 10,000 businesses across 50+ countries, providing millions of clients with dependable and affordable smart security solutions. At M2M Services, we value people as much as we value technology. We foster curiosity, intellect, proactiveness, and common sense because we know it's the human element that truly drives innovation and progress. 
Your new role: The Software Engineer position requires an experienced, reliable, and results-oriented person who enjoys making new things and helping to make old things work better. This role will be a significant contributor to our platforms through your coding, planning and collaboration skills. We have challenging problems to solve and love working with smart people who can help us solve them.
‚Ä¢ Write well designed, testable, efficient code that‚Äôs easy to understand and well tested‚Ä¢ Understand the needs of our business and help us find the best path to meet them while building awesome software‚Ä¢ Build guard rails so we can move fast ‚Äì we want to be the most responsive team in the industry and need help automating our manual tasks and having enough coverage to allow us to refactor the code as needed‚Ä¢ Work on a variety of projects with minimum supervision, perform effectively from sprint planning to DevOps‚Ä¢ Provide support and participate in the Scrum process to ensure quality work plans for each sprint and into the future
Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science Engineering or related field or equivalent work experience‚Ä¢ 3+ years modern JavaScript in an API setting or as middleware‚Ä¢ Experience with modern applications (CI/CD, instrumentation)‚Ä¢ Experience in REST API design and development‚Ä¢ Understanding of Relational Databases, SQL (MySQL, MariaDB)‚Ä¢ Git with Git Flow or similar branching strategies

Here is how you benefit from being a part: Receive initial onboarding by the internal HR team ‚Äì we will fully support you within the process. Be part of a constantly growing global leader with a series of international awards in the security field; Constantly develop crucial skills, and meet new challenges and people. Be rewarded with a year-end bonus (13th salary) ‚Äì we also have a flexible salary increase policy; Additional premium benefits such as a luxury health insurance package; free parking spot or a subsidized public transport card; sports venues membership card (Multisport); monthly food vouchers; complimentary drinks and breakfast, as well as a number of corporate discounts; And last, but most significant ‚Äì our positive company culture and refreshing team office gatherings, Easter & Christmas parties, and annual Team-buildings!  Sounds like you? Send us your CV/Resume.  All applications will be treated as strictly confidential. title: Senior Software Engineer (Python) - Remote from Poland
description:
Job Description:

We are AML RightSource, the leading technology-enabled managed services firm focused on fighting financial crime for our clients and the world. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, and operating across the globe, we are a trusted partner to our financial institution, FinTech, money service business, and corporate clients.

Using a blend of highly trained anti-financial crime professionals, cutting-edge technology tools, and industry-leading consultants, we help clients with their AML/BSA, transaction monitoring, client onboarding (KYC), enhanced due diligence (EDD), and risk management needs.

We support clients in meeting day-to-day compliance tasks, urgent projects, and strategic changes. Globally, our staff of more than 4,000 highly trained analysts and subject matter experts is the industry's largest group of full-time compliance professionals. Together with our clients, we are Reimagining Compliance.

About The Position

We are solving important problems in the anti-money laundering space through our suite of SaaS solutions. As a Senior Software Engineer, you‚Äôll be an individual contributor building and maintaining the services that make up our product suite. You‚Äôll have an impact that extends beyond the code you write, acting as a force multiplier for the rest of the team.

Our technologies:

Python 3.11 (with typing) is used in the new services, along with some older versions in legacy systems.Our own micro-framework is built on the top of Werkzeug.The scheduling engine is responsible for the allocation of millions of events per day.Postgres is used in almost all services. We collect a lot of data, care a lot about database performance, and don‚Äôt use any ORM.AWS for infrastructure and various AWS services such as S3, SQS, EventBridge, ElasticCache, OpenSearch, EKS etc.High level of test coverage.Splunk, Sentry and Grafana for logs and observability.


Primary Responsibilities

Collaborating with product managers, designers, and other developers to define functional and non-functional requirements.Creating, articulating and improving the design of our systems.Implementing features in clean, well-crafted, appropriately tested, efficient, and maintainable code.Mentoring and supporting other members of the team, through pair programming and thoughtful code review.Contributing to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools.


Required Qualifications

Degree in Computer Science or similar.Excellent communication and collaboration skills.Proactive with a strong sense of accountability and ownership of the systems you build and maintain.Robust systems design skills.Experience working with distributed systems and systems that can operate at scale.Experience with PostgreSQL (or a comparable RDBMS), including database design and performance optimization.Expert in Python.Experience working with DevOps principles and best practices, including familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment processes.Experience developing software to run on AWS (or a similar cloud platform).Robust testing knowledge and skills.Proficiency with version control systems, such as Git.


Preferred Qualifications

Experience with ElasticSearch/OpenSearch.Ability to work on the frontend would be beneficial, but not required.


AML RightSource is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Mid FullStack developer
description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies.

Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Full-Stack Developer with strong experience in React JS and backend development using Node JS. The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of modern web technologies and frameworks, excellent problem-solving skills, a passion for creating exceptional user experiences, and effective leadership abilities with good communication skills.

Responsibilities

Project Collaboration: Work closely with leads and delivery teams to ensure overall project delivery.

Agile Participation: Engage in project planning and agile activities.

Full-Stack Development: Develop and maintain responsive web applications using React JS for the frontend and Node JS for the backend.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with designers and backend developers to translate user requirements into high-quality, scalable code.

User Interface Implementation: Implement and maintain efficient, intuitive, and visually appealing user interfaces.

Performance Optimization: Optimize web applications for maximum speed and scalability.

Testing and Debugging: Conduct thorough testing to identify and fix bugs, performance issues, and security vulnerabilities.

Technology Research: Continuously research and evaluate new technologies, tools, and best practices to enhance the development process and improve code quality.

API Development: Collaborate with the backend team to design and develop APIs to support frontend functionalities.

Code Review: Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality and ensure adherence to coding standards.

Industry Trends: Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in frontend and backend development.

Profile / Requirements

Proven experience as a Developer with strong expertise in React JS.

Solid understanding of JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and responsive web design principles.

Experience with backend development using Node JS.

Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases, such as MySQL, MongoDB, etc.

Proficiency in version control tools like Git.

Ability to provide their GitHub link with projects.

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Good communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.

Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and handle multiple projects simultaneously.

Why To Join Algoteque?

Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values creativity and innovation.

Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.

Collaborative Culture: Work in a collaborative and inclusive environment where your ideas and contributions are valued.

Hybrid Work Model: Enjoy the flexibility of working both remotely and on-site in Prague.

AO2987

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
At Mambu, we believe that banking and financial services can change the world for the better. We also know that inflexible systems are slowing innovation and limiting impact. We‚Äôre on a mission to change that, to make banking work better for everyone.

Join us as we bring banking and financial services technology into the digital-first world. Where our best-in-class, cloud-banking platform is igniting financial change globally. Where we are enabling our customers to build great banking experiences for their customers; in a faster, more flexible and more dependable way than ever before.

If this mission drives you, if you are bold, curious, customer-obsessed and ready to embrace a challenge, then we want you on our team.

At Mambu our people are the foundation! We prioritise continuous learning and development to empower Mambuvians for success and growth. We provide a learning budget by function for professional development and offer a comprehensive L&D program that enhances both technical expertise and soft skills.

Let‚Äôs rewrite the rules of banking together!

What You‚Äôll Do

 Build software that resolves real life fintech problems for a high number of customers and impacting millions of end-users, worldwide.  Deal with complex calculations which require a high degree of logical thinking on top of technical skills.  Lead end-to-end feature delivery from design to planning, implementation and deployment.  Identify, propose and contribute to/coordinate architectural improvements. 

What You‚Äôll Bring

 6+ years experience working in Java  Object Orientation: Design Patterns and SOLID principles.  Be highly adaptable and demonstrate ability to work independently  Integration/E2E (e.g. testcontainers, Playwright) testing knowledge;  Experience with TDD  Advanced knowledge of RDBMSes (e.g. MySQL);  Handling large datasets efficiently, both in Java and Databases  Exposure to AWS, Google Cloud and Azure  Knowledge of scalable and resilient application architecture  Performance testing knowledge (e.g. Gatling), skills of investigating and addressing performance issues (eg. Dynatrace)  Know-how of writing your own tests (i.e.: integration tests, end-to-end tests and so on)  Able to take ownership of customer issues reported while on-call and manage the problems through to resolution 

Your future

We aim to be the leading cloud-banking platform, powering the future of banking and igniting financial change globally. If you want to join a collaborative, inclusive team of experts changing the lives of billions, this is where you belong.

The base salary for this position is ‚Ç¨5950 gross (before taxes) monthly. This is a full-time equivalent target rate for Lithuania only. Actual rate offered will vary depending on the nature of the role and the breadth of skills and expertise the candidate brings to the role relative to existing Mambuvians.

For the rest of the locations where we advertise this role, the starting salary will be discussed during the recruitment process.

Let's connect!

Follow Mambu on LinkedIn for the latest Fintech trends and success stories. Connect with us on Facebook , Instagram , and YouTube to experience our vibrant culture. Explore our mission, values, and the world we're building at mambu.com/careers .

Follow the work of our Product and Engineering teams as they continuously make our products and platform bigger, better, faster and stronger. Check out our Medium Product & Tech Log.

As part of the recruitment (or HR onboarding) process, you will be required to obtain authorised criminal background and credit screening results, as well as be queried against a sanctions/anti-money-laundering/counter terrorism financing/politically exposed persons screening service and your employment is conditional upon approval of these results.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many job seekers (including women, people of colour and people from diverse backgrounds) are reluctant to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.

Here at Mambu we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Mambu is committed to working with and providing equal opportunities to people with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable adaptation of the process to accommodate your needs, please contact us at talent.acquisition@mambu.com and let us know how we may assist you.

title: {Dev}School - Java Edition @ING Hubs Romania
description:
Discover ING Hubs RomaniaING Hubs Romania offers 130 services in software development, data management, non-financial risk & compliance, audit, and retail operations to 24 ING units worldwide, with the help of over 1700 high-performing engineers, risk, and operations professionals.
We started out in 2015 as ING‚Äôs software development hub ‚Äì a distinct entity from ING Bank Romania ‚Äì then steadily expanded our range to include more services and competencies.Now we provide borderless services with bank-wide capabilities and operate from two locations: Bucharest and Cluj-Napoca.
Our tech capabilities remain the core of our business, with more than 1500 colleagues active in Data Management, Touchpoint Channels & Integration, Core Banking, and Global Products.We enjoy a flexible way of working and a highly collaborative environment, where fair and constructive feedback is encouraged.
For us, impact isn't a perk. It's the driver of our work.We are guided and rewarded by a shared desire to make the world a better place, one innovative solution at a time. Our colleagues make it their job to do impactful things and they love doing it in good company. Do you?
About {Dev}School{Dev}School is all about developing your programming skills in an intense and fun learning experience.
During this edition, we will focus on the most used programming language, Java. This could be your starting point, where you will learn:Design patterns, clean code, unit testing and the Agile way of working;Basic notions about cryptography applied in Java (encryption / decryption - symmetric / asymmetric, hashing, etc.);How to automate the creation of a deliverable (jar) and sending it to production;Spring Framework notions: connecting to a database, creating a REST application, etc .;
If you successfully complete the training program, you could put your skills at work in our IT Team in ING Hubs. Here are the logistical details:You will be part of a team of 10/12 students;The learning experience will last 8 weeks, between October-December 2024;The program is organized in 2 sessions/week (on Tuesdays & Thursdays);Each session will last 3 hours and will take place on-site
What we are looking for in {Dev}SchoolWe welcome any IT passionate who is:A student in final study year or a recent graduate (2 years max, Bachelor or Master) of Computer Science/Cybernetics University;A good team player and a logical thinker, who has a good eye for details;‚Ä¶and who hasKnowledge of Object Oriented Programming (OOP);Good understanding of algorithms and/or programming in any of the following languages: Java, C, C++, C#;Basic knowledge on database concepts;Good command of English.
We are waiting for you to join us and to:Learn Java and related concepts in a program entirely sponsored by ING;Apply everything you have learned. Yes! At the end of the edition, following a selection process, the most talented candidates will have the opportunity to join the ING team in ING Hubs.
What happens after graduating {Dev}SchoolThese are the things that will count in deciding whether we work together after the programme in ING Hubs:Your Progress ‚Äì the trainer‚Äôs positive feedback on your class interactions and attendance (audio & video);Your Results - very good technical results during the training programme;Your Interest and Availability to work full-time/part-time (flexible work schedule).
* Recruiting Process Timeline:You can apply until the mid-September;If your CV is selected, you will participate in an online technical testing phase;If you pass the testing phase, you will participate in an interview scheduled by us;The selected top 10/12 students will start their {Dev}School adventure in mid-October

If you want to deep dive into the processing of personal data conducted by ING Hubs Romania during the recruitment process and your rights related to it, read the privacy notices on our website (make sure to scroll until you reach the Data Protection section/ Candidates tab).

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python)
description:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe‚Äôs first TV streaming service. Today, we‚Äôre the world‚Äôs first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We‚Äôre the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn‚Äôt changed, even if the world has. We‚Äôre friendly, international, inclusive ‚Äì and our people say we‚Äôre reliable and transparent, too. It‚Äôs why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Do you want to help Zattoo increase the scope of our customer-facing product cockpit? We are searching for a Senior Backend Engineer that can push our technology to the next level. We are facing a migration from a Ruby backend to Python and in addition, have many ideas to increase the experience for our B2B customers that want to run a successful Streaming Product based on our Streaming-as-a-Service platform.

THE BRIDGE TEAM

The Bridge tool, built by the Bridge team, is the interface for our B2B customers to everything they need to run a successful streaming product. The Bridge covers all aspects of customer service needs as well as deeper quality of experience insights and analytics. In addition, the tool provides transparency of the customer‚Äôs product configuration. Customers can also use it to reach out to their users and customize and personalize their product experience.

What You‚Äôll Do

Work in a cross-functional Scrum team, alongside other backend engineers, frontend engineers, product managers and product designers.Help with the migration of the Bridge Backend from Ruby to PythonBuild services and APIs that are consumed by the team‚Äôs frontend, but also by other teams like the Config teamIntegrate 3rd party services (e.g. CMS tools) into our service architecture to enable their usage in our frontendsImplement and develop improvements to platforms, infrastructure, tools, and processesDevelop clean and maintainable codeCollaborate with stakeholders and engineers across the companyBecome a valued member of Zattoo‚Äôs Engineering team and improve our core services


What You‚Äôll Bring 

Expert knowledge in Python 3 programmingExperience in building highly available services and APIs that scale and work efficiently even under the highest loadExperience in Python-based web frameworks such as FastAPI, Django or similar,A deep understanding of how web-based platforms work, from client requests to server-side handling to front-end rendering,Good understanding of and experience with different data stores and data processing pipelines (Elasticsearch, Redis, MySQL, Scylla, Clickhouse, Kafka)Experience with any of the following programming languages are also a plus: Golang, RubyExperience in development and support of production systems used in a 24x7 operations environmentExperience in testing on different levels and a mindset that sees testing as a foundational part of software developmentFluent verbal and written English language skillsBonus:Experience with migrating Ruby backends to Python Experience with service-oriented architecture and/or event-driven architectures with integrated external (3rd party) services Basic Frontend skills to maintain simple Admin UIs (HTML, Javascript, Bootstrap) Proficient skills and DevOps mentality with on-prem and cloud hosting experience


WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, you‚Äôre always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You‚Äôll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you‚Äôre helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

What We Offer You

Reward: strong market competitive salaryRecharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidaysRegulate:trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year


Plus:

We‚Äôre sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the marketWe're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack daysWe‚Äôre inclusive: ‚ÄòZattooies‚Äô are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalitiesWe‚Äôre healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!We‚Äôre responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentalsWe‚Äôre sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ‚Äôs, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event


Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

title: Senior Algorithm Developer

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
Create moments that matter. Decode the future.

Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world. Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!

The Challenge

As an enterprise producing millions of connected appliances each year, we are generating massive amounts of data. As part of our data mesh journey, your task as a Data Platform Engineer is to build, develop, operate, and maintain a self-serve data platform that will support data and AI products. You will establish foundational capabilities for development teams to apply data engineering practices effectively and facilitate analytics work. There are plenty of exciting use cases to be considered!

The Team

The Data Product team supports business functions across the company, turning raw data into valuable insights and actions. This team is a key enabler in supporting the company‚Äôs digital transformation, driving and operationalizing the data products strategy within the Digital Experience organization. As the center of enablement for data handling and advanced analytics, the team is instrumental in implementing the data mesh framework within our domain.

The role 

As a Data Platform Engineer, your primary mission will be to help us build a self-serve data platform tailored to different data personas, including both tech-savvy users ("Coders") and non-technical users ("Clickers"). You will be instrumental in crafting services that meet the diverse needs of these personas, ensuring that our platform is accessible, efficient, and robust. Your role will involve architecting and developing scalable data solutions, providing technical guidance to other team members, and continuously monitoring and optimizing the platform performance. Your expertise will enable our teams to leverage data more effectively, empowering them to turn raw data into actionable insights.

What you'll do as a Data Platform Engineer:

Design cloud solutions and architecture using AWS services and databricks.Optimize cloud costs and ensure efficient resource utilizationKnowledge of data platform engineering to integrate and manage data pipelines in AWSEnsure interoperability and integration of various systems and applicationsEnsure scalability, reliability, and performance of enterprise systemsEnsure data quality and integrity across various platforms and systemsMeasure the success and performance of built capabilitiesBuild and maintain scalable and reliable self-serve Data PlatformCollaborate with Data Product manager, Engineering lead and engineering community in order to establish and maintain effective working relationships.Work in established agile product management framework

Required experience:

Experience in building cost effective and performant data pipelinesProficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (e.g. Terraform)Experience with DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes)knowledge of AWS security best practices and compliance (multi regions data transfers)Proficiency in PII management (pseudonymization, anonymization, ‚Ä¶.)Experience in data governance principles (policy-as-code)Proficiency in database management and data warehousing solutionsKnowledge of data governance practices (data cataloging, access control, lineage, audit,‚Ä¶.)Programming experience in SQL and Python, preferably in an Apache Spark setupDecent experience in developing and maintaining Databricks platformA Master- or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in in Computer Science (or equivalent)

You demonstrate:

Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations.Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.

Where you'll be:

While embracing a hybrid work model, your main location will be our state-of-the-art office in Warsaw's vibrant Wola district. The office is purposefully crafted to support neurodiversity and is conveniently positioned near "Fabryka Norblina".

You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.

Benefits Highlights

Flexible work hours/hybrid work environmentDiscounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and servicesFamily-friendly benefitsExtensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

Find out more:

Electrolux Group

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
Cognism is a market leader in international sales intelligence. Access to our premium data, has helped a wide variety of global revenue teams change their approach to prospecting, resulting in predictable and prosperous outcomes.

Following multiple successful funding rounds and the acquisition of Mailtastic (2020), an email signature solution provider, and Kaspr (2022), a Paris-based sales prospecting tool, there has never been a more exciting time to join us.

As we grow, one of our main objectives is to continue hiring individuals, who are both a professional and cultural fit for our Company. Our values are at the core of everything we do!

 Our people; 

 Are Nice!  Are Collaborative. We‚Äôre in this together!  Are Solution-Focused. For every problem, we‚Äôve got a solution! Are Understanding.Celebrate Individual Contributors.

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, which encourages you to achieve any goals you may have, while having fun along the way!

Job Overview

As an Application Security Engineer Level 2, will play a critical role in ensuring the security of applications throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You will work closely with cross functional teams and members of the information security team to identify vulnerabilities, design secure applications, and implement security best practices. This role requires a deep understanding of application security principles, risk assessment, and remediation techniques.

Key Responsibilities

 Vulnerability Assessment & Remediation: Conduct in-depth security assessments of web, identifying vulnerabilities using automated tools (e.g., SAST, DAST) and manual techniques. Provide actionable recommendations to development teams for remediation. Security Design Review: Collaborate with application and security architects and developers to ensure security is integrated into the design of applications. Conduct threat modelling and provide guidance on secure coding practices. Penetration Testing: Coordinate application-level penetration tests to identify security flaws. Document findings and work with relevant teams to ensure timely remediation. Security Code Reviews: Analyse source code for security vulnerabilities, focusing on secure coding practices and providing feedback to developers on how to mitigate risks. Automation & Integration: Work with DevOps teams to integrate security testing tools and processes into CI/CD pipelines, ensuring that security is continuously monitored throughout the development process. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including development, DevOps, QA, and IT operations to foster a culture of security within the organization.

Required Qualifications

 Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Security, or related field (or equivalent work experience). Experience: 3-5 years of experience in application security or software development with a focus on security. Technical Skills: Strong understanding of common application vulnerabilities (e.g., OWASP Top 10, SANS CWE Top 25). Proficiency in security testing tools (e.g., SonarCloud). Experience with secure coding practices in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, C#, JavaScript). Familiarity with DevSecOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git, Docker). Knowledge of web application architectures and cloud security principles (e.g., AWS, Azure). Understanding of encryption protocols, authentication mechanisms, and access control models. Certifications (preferred but not required): Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) Soft Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex security issues to non-technical stakeholders. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with container security (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Experience with cloud security frameworks and tools (e.g., AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Centre). Familiarity with microservices architecture and API security. Hands-on experience with incident response and forensic analysis related to application security breaches.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Junior Software Developer
description:
Overal waar je solliciteert word je afgewezen omdat je nog niet voldoende ervaring hebt en je kunt geen ervaring opdoen omdat je overal afgewezen wordt. Bekend verhaal? Hier is de oplossing!

Vertel verder...

Er is een kloof tussen het onderwijs en het bedrijfsleven. De theorie sluit niet meer aan op de praktijk. Gelukkig helpt dit bedrijf jou die kloof te overbruggen.

In √©√©n jaar word jij begeleid tot een volwaardige Software Engineer en doe je hands-on ervaring op met ieder onderdeel van het development proces. Van micro-services tot containerization en cloud architectuur. Iedere vrijdag is er weer een nieuwe masterclass over de echte wereld van software engineering. Door daarnaast direct aan de slag te gaan met een interessant project voor een bedrijf dat bij jou past, kun je jouw opgedane kennis meteen in de praktijk brengen.

Klinkt gaaf, wat moet ik meenemen?

Passie‚Ä¶ Jouw passie voor software development in combinatie met de absolute wil om te slagen en jezelf te ontwikkelen tot een Software specialist. De basis in een van de volgende programeertalen; Java, .NET, C, C++, Python of JavaScript, de rest leren wij je. Daarnaast ben je in het bezit van minimaal een afgeronde Master in de richting van Computer Science of Informatica of een vergelijkbare opleiding. Je wil de allerbeste worden en staat hierdoor open om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen en te blijven leren. Sociale skills moeten ook niet vergeten worden, je gaat namelijk aan de slag met hoogstaande bedrijven en een vlotte babbel bij de koffiemachine is altijd mooi meegenomen. En goed om te weten, voor deze job dien je vloeiend Nederlands te spreken en schrijven.

Dat wil ik!

Wie wil dat nou niet? Direct aan de slag met een gaaf project terwijl je alle ins-en-outs van het vak leert en daar ook nog een voor betaald krijgen. Niet te zuinig ook. Je begint namelijk met een maandsalaris tot ‚Ç¨3.500 bruto per maand en daarnaast wordt er minstens evenveel aan opleidingen aangeboden. Bovendien geniet je daarnaast alle luxe van een groot bedrijf: premievrijpensioen, 25 vakantiedagen, laptop, reiskostenvergoeding, vakantiegeld en een hele hoop leuke uitjes. Dus waar wacht je op? Druk op Apply en ga aan de slag!

To our foreign friends, speaking Dutch is a must for this role. Please don‚Äôt apply if you‚Äôre not fluent in Dutch.

title: Senior Research Engineer
description:
Our partner is an applied research center providing companies involved in technological innovation processes with numerical simulation methods and tools to invent and design more competitive products.
To support the expanding research activities focusing on aero-mechanical turbomachinery applications, they are looking for a senior research engineer and offer a permanent contract (CDI) in Belgium.
Your responsibilities :
Working on a daily basis on challenging projects with their clients and research partners.
These projects are often integrated in a multi/pluridisciplinary context that relies on a strong CFD-centric expertise, involving aerodynamic, aeroacoustic, aeroelastic, aeromechanical and/or aerothermal analyses.
Improving the aerodynamic performances of turbomachines while ensuring the mechanical integrity of the engine is a priority to reach new environmental regulations by 2050. In this context, the aeromechanical coupling will be of particular interest in the first activities of the candidate, with the enrichment of dedicated tools and methodologies for coupled aero-mechanical optimization. 
Your aerodynamic expertise and skills will allow you to set up and further develop CFD/CSM simulation strategies that require complex meshing and/or efficient coupling methods. 
You will be responsible for the technical progress as well as for the project management, in order to meet the clients‚Äô expectations and in line with the Quality Management System (EN9100).

Your profile:
An aeronautical engineering master degree (or equivalent), with a PhD degree as a valuable asset A solid background in numerical methods for CFD and/or CSMA working experience (industrial or academic) of at least 4 years on CFD/CSM-centric projectsA strong affinity with turbomachinery design and an interest in optimization and data miningA proficiency in different CFD and/or CSM software and pre/post processing tools scripting and programming experience (C++, Python, bash,‚Ä¶)Excellent analytical skills and solution-oriented thinking capabilitiesAutonomous working skills with an aptitude for team workGood command of French and EnglishAn interest for applying reduced order methods

Our offer:
Competitive salary package;Opportunity to participate in international projects;Opportunity for a position in growing and leading technological sectors, with direct interaction with industry players and technical experts;A stimulating and dynamic work environment.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Start jouw Informatica-stage in het najaar van 2024? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou.
Wat houdt de stage in?Funle.nl is het grootste platform met IT-opdrachten voor freelancers in Nederland. Uit de grote hoeveelheid ongestructureerde, tekstuele data willen we trendanalyses kunnen maken.Jouw taak als stagiair bestaat uit het analyseren en modelleren van de (deels ongestructureerde) data voor rapportage- en visualisatiedoeleinden. Jij doet voorstellen voor de tooling, zoals programmeertaal, database, visualisatieplatform.Deze stage is geschikt voor 3e-jaars en afstudeerstagiaires en start in de periode september of november 2024.
Wie zoeken wij?Ieder schooljaar nodigt Semantica talentvolle HBO-studenten Informatica uit om een 3e-jaars- of afstudeerstage bij ons te doen. Per stageperiode bieden we plaats aan maximaal 2 studenten.
Wie zijn wij?Semantica is het leukste softwarebedrijf van Leiden. Dat komt omdat je hier alle vrijheid en vertrouwen krijgt om coole software te maken die impact heeft op klanten, want daar worden we blij van. We noemen onszelf niet voor niets happy software people.

title: Low-code Software Developer
description:
Low-code Software DeveloperAs a Software Developer at Greenhouse Sustainability, you have the opportunity to leverage your programming skills for a more sustainable future. You will be part of a small team specialized in calculating footprints (Life Cycle Assessments or LCAs) and developing online footprint tools. In this role, you will further develop existing footprint tools and program new tools to provide our clients with advanced and effective solutions.
About Greenhouse SustainabilityGreenhouse Sustainability is a growing and ambitious company with an informal work environment. We emphasize collaboration instead of working in islands (leave that for vacations); we prefer action over excessive meetings. This is crucial, as action is needed!While many companies are considering investing in sustainability, they often lack clarity about their current standing. Through Life Cycle Assessments (LCAs), we provide companies with insights into their environmental impact, resulting in a footprint. We also offer various (online) footprint tools that enable companies to calculate their own footprint at a large scale.Our primary focus is on the Netherlands‚Äô pride: the agriculture and horticulture sector. One of the most innovative sectors in the Netherlands, it serves as a shining example for other countries, as highlighted by Sir David Attenborough in the film 'A Life on Our Planet.' Consequently, we not only assist Dutch agricultural and horticultural businesses, but also companies worldwide ‚Äì from Japan to Colombia. Additionally, we are currently expanding into other sectors.
Your ResponsibilitiesAs part of our team, you will have the opportunity to utilize your software development expertise to maintain and further develop our existing tools.Responsibilities:¬∑ Developing and maintaining software tools for footprint calculations.¬∑ Collaborating with the team to define technical specifications and establish development priorities.¬∑ Identifying and resolving bugs and technical issues.¬∑ Documenting the developed tools and providing clear user instructions.¬∑ Actively contributing to technical discussions to devise innovative solutions. E.g. Integrating AI into our products.
What you offer:Competencies and Experience:¬∑ Relevant hands-on experience in software development, preferably using low-code platforms like Zoho Creator, Mendix, OutSystems, PowerApps, among others. Experience with Zoho Creator is highly desirable.¬∑ Knowledge of HTML, CSS, relational databases and rest API‚Äôs. Javascript (React) is a plus.¬∑ Familiarity with Zoho Deluge scripting or a strong willingness to learn.¬∑ Affinity with UI/UX is a plus.¬∑ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to tackle complex technical challenges.¬∑ Independence and the ability to manage projects from start to finish.¬∑ Enthusiasm for sustainability.¬∑ Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Dutch and English.What we offer:¬∑ Competitive salary and benefits package depending on experience.¬∑ A position of at least 32 hours per week.¬∑ 25 vacation days (based on full-time).¬∑ 2 annual events and other spontaneous activities.¬∑ A challenging role that combines your programming skills with sustainability.¬∑ Hybrid working: 40% working from home and 60% at our office in Nieuwkoop (soon in Alphen aan den Rijn).¬∑ Space for professional growth and development.¬∑ The opportunity to work in a small, ambitious team with a passion for making an impact.¬∑ Working with a diverse and interesting array of companies.¬∑ A chance to start as soon as possible!
If you're excited about the prospect of working with us and are eager to grow in the field of sustainability, we encourage you to apply, even if your background isn't a perfect match. Send your CV and cover letter to info@greenhouse-sustainability.com. We're interested in your potential and your enthusiasm for creating a greener future. *For this position you must be living in The Netherlands and have the right to work in The Netherlands. This company is not a recognized sponsor by the IND.*

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact on the company?Join Odoo, a growing software company with an open source product, a huge global community, as well as a fun and exciting work environment.
A WIDE RANGE OF INTERESTING PROJECTS:
We develop open source apps to help millions of employees save time in their day-to-day job.Our projects include:
--> Business Apps: from point of Sales, to logistics and accounting, we have plenty of projects around business apps (improvement, creation of new features,...)
--> Frontend UI: Odoo Spreadsheet (an open source Google Spreadsheet alternative), a react/vue style JS framework (the fastest VDOM ever developed).
--> Python Framework: It's all about perf and optimizations. (ORM based on PostgreSQL)
--> Mobile: All Odoo apps run on iOS and Android hybrid mobile apps.

MUST HAVE:Several programming languagesObject-oriented programming languagePassion for developmentQuick & Autonomous learnerRead & Written English

title: Applied Researcher - Artificial Intelligence
description:
Summary

About the role :

The AI & Computational Sciences (AICS) is the dedicated AI and ML team at Novartis Biomedical Research (BR) innovating across the drug discovery continuum. We aim to accelerate discoveries of transformative medicines for patients worldwide. AICS is seeking a highly motivated contributor to the domain of AI/Machine Learning to push the frontier in Life Sciences and drug discovery. At AICS, you will take on a hands-on role at the intersection of science, R&D and real-world impact.

You will be a part of a truly unique organization with an inter-disciplinary team made up of accomplished scientists who are at the forefront of AI in drug discovery. You will have the opportunity to shape the next wave of drug discovery, combining insights from a wealth of data modalities including diverse omics types like genomics, transcriptomics (including spatial and single-cell), proteomics, compound structures, compound activity, protein structures, measurements from cellular experiments and safety studies, histopathology, clinical imaging, and clinical readouts.

About The Role

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Implement, Validate, and Deliver AI and Deep Learning models to ensure project success.Quickly learn the data science environment important to each project: Compute, Data Management, Data Interpretation, etc.Evaluate and recommend technical approaches (algorithms and architectures) to solve domain data science problems.Evaluate and Communicate critical results to non-data science SMEs

Essential Requirements

Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs+) required in a technically relevant program: e.g. Computer Science, Computational Biology/Chemistry, Physics, etc.Solid experience in Python and general AI Modelling/tooling expertiseExtensive experience in developing and training Deep Learning models and familiarity with the state of the art DL architecturesProven track record of publishing in the domain of AI / Deep Learning or implementing state of the art architecturesProven ability to work and collaborate with a cross functional, multi-disciplinary teamProficiency in English (written and oral)

Nice To Have

Algorithms and advanced mathematicsExperience with graphs or chemistry dataExperience with multi-modal data is a bonus (e.g. EEG, text, multi-omics (scRNA, transcriptomics, etc))

Why consider Novartis?

769 million. That‚Äôs how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we‚Äôre proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people‚Äôs lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you‚Äôre given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you‚Äôre empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you‚Äôre surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world‚Äôs toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients‚Äô lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we‚Äôll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

title: Data Scientist
description:
About I¬≤ at ItinerisI¬≤ is the innovation hub at Itineris, focused on developing cutting-edge data and AI-driven solutions. We operate across Europe, the UK, and North America, validating our ideas in real markets. Promising innovations are integrated into our UMAX product suite, enhancing our service offerings.
Role OverviewAs a Data Scientist within the I¬≤ team, you will play a pivotal role in the end-to-end development of data-driven solutions. This includes data collection, analysis, model experimentation, deployment, dashboard creation, and MLOps to deliver value to our customers. You‚Äôll receive mentorship and support from our Data Science Lead.
Key ResponsibilitiesCollaborate: Work closely with the use case lead, customers, and subject matter experts to understand and analyse business challenges.Data Integration: Identify and integrate data sources into our data layer, ensuring data quality and optimal performance.Data Analysis & Modelling: Conduct data exploration, analysis, and modelling to support ideation and proof business value.Experimentation & ML: Experiment, train, tweak, and test machine learning models and assess real-world performance.Dashboarding: Design and develop intuitive dashboards for internal teams and clients using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Python.Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, coordinating effectively with various stakeholders across teams.MLOps & Deployment: Collaborate with our DevOps team to integrate, deploy, and maintain solutions, utilizing MLOps best practices.
Ideal Candidate ProfileExperience: Minimum 3 years in data analysis, data science, or data engineering roles.Machine Learning (ML): Proficient in Python and essential ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch). Strong experience in building, validating, and deploying ML models. Experience with NLP and LLMs is a plus.Data Engineering: Skilled in SQL and familiar with data engineering tools like Apache Kafka, Apache Airflow, and SQL/NoSQL databases. Experience with cloud-based data stores is an advantage.MLOps: Knowledgeable in Git and Azure DevOps. Familiarity with MLflow for model tracking, Docker for containerization, and Kubernetes for orchestration is a plus.Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving abilities with a data-driven approach to addressing business questions.Visualization Expertise: Skilled in creating visualizations with tools like Power BI, Tableau, or within Python.Autonomy & Initiative: Capable of working independently with a hands-on approach, while proactively taking initiatives.Flexibility: Willing to travel occasionally and collaborate directly with clients.
As a member of the fast growing I¬≤ team, you will join a dynamic group of 6 individuals with a strong intrapreneurial mindset. Our team thrives on innovation and a proactive approach, constantly driving new ideas that will enforce our core Itineris products.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
We are PHOENIX Pharma ‚Äì a leading integrated healthcare provider in Europe. Our approximately 45000 employees make an important contribution to comprehensive healthcare in Europe. In a total of 29 countries, we supply pharmacies, doctors, and medical institutions with pharmaceuticals and health products through 224 distribution centers. Millions of people across Europe can rely on our services every day.
Our international IT Hub in Sofia, Bulgaria is growing. You will be able to work with different teams within the PHOENIX Group in Europe, being involved in projects related to SAP, Security, Infrastructure, Cloud, Network, OCC, Business Intelligence, ERP, and CRM Solutions. You will have the chance to participate in the development of projects and products that are diverse, visible, interesting, and for the public welfare and health. You will work in an international environment and culture with a constant exchange of onsite-/offsite knowledge.
We are looking for an Automation Engineer to join our international team in Sofia.
Your Responsibilities:
Administration, operation, and maintenance of the automation platform - based on Ansible and GitLab.Extension, further development, and tuning of the platform(s) primarily based on open-source solutions(git, eda, ee, awx, podman).Building and supporting container subsystems based on Kubernetes orchestration and Podman engine.Customization of container images for ansible execution environment based on centos and rhel.Supporting business partners in implementing automation in playbooks for DB Clusters, IBM Power Aix, Linux, and Windows products.Management of external providers and cooperation with other service departments.
Your Profile:
Successfully completed studies in (business) computer science or a comparable field or training as an IT specialist with several years of professional experience.Experience as an automation specialist in the area of Ansible, GitHub, or other automation platforms and tools are an advantage.Good understanding of YAML syntax.Good knowledge of open-source technology, administration, user management, performance optimization, and scripting.Good knowledge of operating systems.Python programming knowledge is an advantage.Confident troubleshooting skills, analytical approach, understanding of business processes and procedures as well as a team-oriented and structured way of working.Good communication skills in English (spoken and written), natural curiosity, motivation, and openness to new things.Willingness to work occasional nights and weekends and to participate in on-call duties.
What We Offer:
26 days paid annual leave.Health insurance.Food vouchers.Flexible working time and options to work from home.Free parking.Sports venue pass.Learning and development.Employee discounts for company products and services.Others will be added in the course of establishing the hub.
Send us your recent resume if you recognize this role as a career opportunity for you. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

title: Backend Developer (Node.js) | Able
description:
About Us

Able empowers individuals to achieve lasting weight goals and optimal health through a personalized program unlike any other. Combining proven science with dedicated 1-on-1 coaching, we go beyond traditional weight loss apps by addressing all aspects of well-being: sleep, nutrition, movement, stress, and medication. Our data-driven approach and expert guidance ensure a tailored experience, while user-friendly technology keeps you connected and supported. Join Able and make a real difference in people's lives, one healthy step at a time.

About The Role

We are looking for a skilled Backend Engineer with a strong background in Node.js and TypeScript. In this role, you‚Äôll be responsible for designing and implementing key backend features, optimizing system performance, and contributing to the architecture of our event-driven and distributed systems.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain backend systems using Node.js and TypeScript. Design and implement robust, high-performance SQL queries and optimize database interactions. Build and maintain services using ORMs like Sequelize or TypeORM. Architect and implement event-driven solutions for distributed systems. Apply expert-level knowledge of design patterns to build maintainable and scalable code. Improve existing codebases and systems by diagnosing performance bottlenecks and fixing critical issues. 

Qualifications

4+ years of experience as a backend engineer. Proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript. Strong experience with SQL and ORMs like Sequelize or TypeORM. Solid understanding of event-driven architecture and distributed systems. Expert knowledge of design patterns and best practices for clean and maintainable code. 

Nice to have

Experience with frameworks like MedusaJS, AdminJS, Refine, or similar tools. Prior experience with React. Familiarity with Golang. 

Location

Able operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ¬± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:

Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance. üè°‚è∞Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days. üå¥üíºPaid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge. üéâüåüCompany-provided MacBook: Experience seamless productivity with top-notch Apple MacBooks provided to all employees who need them. üíªüöÄFlexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://wiki.rubylabs.com/s/b11227c3-fa74-4c39-bd1d-3e59056a2cf4 üìàüíº

Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Life at Able

At Able, we're more than a team, we're a dynamo; united in pushing the boundaries of health innovation. Our combined passion fuels our ambition for excellence, driving impact that resonates around the globe.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that a diversity of thought and backgrounds builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
