title: Data Scientist
description:
AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!
Job Description
Responsibilities Develop statistical and machine learning models to assess and optimize the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.Analyze and interpret data to identify potential improvements in marketing strategies.Apply uplift modeling methods to target specific customer groups to maximize ROI.Collaborate with marketing and sales departments to understand business goals and translate them into analytical tasks.Prepare and present reports on analysis results and recommendations for marketing strategy enhancements.Evaluate and continuously improve analytics and modeling methodologies in line with the latest trends in Data Science.Participate in the development and implementation of systems and tools to automate analytical processes.
RequirementsOver 2 years of experience in Data Science, with a focus on uplift modeling and causal effect analysis.Deep knowledge and practical experience with Python and data analysis libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn), as well as specialized libraries for causal analysis, for example CausalML or others.Understanding of A/B testing principles, including planning, conducting, and analyzing test results.Knowledge of SQL and experience with databases, including ClickHouse, for effective data extraction and processing.
Nice to haveKnowledge and experience with Apache Spark and Apache Airflow for processing large data volumes and workflow automation.Experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform, for scaling and managing analytical solutions.Familiarity with CI/CD principles, experience with model versioning, and understanding of MLOps fundamentals.Bachelor's or higher degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or a related field.Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively interact with both technical specialists and business stakeholders.

What do we offer?Competitive salaries based on your professional experience Fast growing international company with stable employment Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday Mental Wellbeing Program ‚Äì the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coachingFree English and German language classes - Flexible working hours and hybrid work

Join us today and let‚Äôs create a success story together!

title: Oil Research - Data Scientist
description:
The LSEG Oil Research Team is a part of global Research team of 130+ analysts committed to delivering insight and intelligence to the physical and futures commodities markets. Combining deep domain expertise, vast data resources, and the LSEG's Workspace platform, analysts are trusted partners of commodities professionals worldwide.

JOIN OUR ENERGETIC TEAM! Are you eager to drive your career forward? We are inviting a dynamic and dedicated Analyst to improve our Oils Research team. This role is essential in shaping the dynamics of the oils' market with insightful analysis and impactful strategies. A career with the LSEG Research team presents a unique opportunity to develop and apply new knowledge and skills to better understand the production, flow, and consumption of the world's most basic materials.

We are seeking a dedicated Analyst with advanced Python programming skills and expertise in market modelling to join our dynamic team. This role requires developing and analyzing market models, identifying key factors driving market trends, and leveraging data analytics to provide strategic insights. While industry-specific experience, particularly in oil and gas, is helpful, it is not required. The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background, proficiency in database management, and a passion for using data to solve complex business challenges.

in LSEG Oils Research we offer in-depth insights into the diverse world of oil products, including crude, middle and light distillates, and also biofuels. Your role will involve dissecting global production trends, market demands, and trade dynamics. You will get a significant opportunity to build production frameworks and provide a narrative around supply-demand dynamics with a global perspective.

Key Responsibilities:

Market Modelling and Analysis:

Develop and maintain advanced market models using Python to analyse market trends, price movements, and key drivers.Conduct in-depth analysis of market data, identifying significant factors and trends that impact business decisions.Implement statistical methods and machine learning techniques to enhance forecasting accuracy and model performance.Build and maintain comprehensive documentation detailing market data descriptions, specifications, requirements, content, and procedures for each model.Ensure documentation accuracy and accessibility, facilitating efficient knowledge sharing and operational continuity across teams.

Data Management and Database Skills:

Manage and manipulate large datasets using Python, SQL or other database technologies.Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality control processes.Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from multiple sources to support analytical needs.

Strategic Insights and Reporting

Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on market analysis and model outputs.Prepare and present reports, visualisations, and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate analytical findings into business strategies.

Technical Skills Development:

Stay updated with the latest advancements in Python programming, data analytics, and market modelling techniques.Continuously enhance technical skills and explore innovative approaches to improve analytical processes and models.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or related fields. A Master‚Äôs degree or a certification in Petroleum Studies is a plus.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in Python for data analysis and modelling.Solid understanding of databases, including relational database management systems, and experience working with structured data.Knowledge of statistical analysis, ML techniques, and their application in market forecasting.Proven Ability to work with large datasets and proficiency in data manipulation and visualisation tools (e.g., Pandas, Matplotlib, Power BI).Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.Knowledge of Eikon and Workspace (API) is an advantage.

YOUR PACKAGE WHEN JOINING GDYNIA TEAM:

Bonus: Quarterly or annual bonus plan assigned to every position Wellbeing: monthly wellness and work-from-home allowance, and employee assistance program Healthcare: private medical care with Medicover, premium package fully covered by employer and life insurance with Generali Future: corporate pension plan supported by Fidelity International offering additional 5% of base salary to invest in selected funds, and LSEG Employee Share Purchase plan available Reward and Recognition: additional awards and vouchers available for extra achievements Referral: Bonus between 8,000 to 10,000 PLN for successful recommendation of a new colleague Development: E-learning platforms access with a range of training and certified courses LSEG Products: availability to access to real-time economic data through our flagship Workspace platform Diversity: Inclusive culture built by colleagues from over 40 countries representing various age, gender, race, and beliefs Charity: 2 additional days off for voluntary jobs Office: brand new, sustainable office with cafeteria and chillout space. Location 3T Office, Gdynia is less than 200m to PKM station and a walking distance to SKM station. Underground car park with 122 spaces for LSEG employees Activities: sport teams and social events to join e.g. weekly yoga classes in the office Company events: Annual Summer and Winter Parties for colleagues and Family Day for employees with partners and children 

Proud to share LSEG in Poland is Great Place to Work certified (Feb ‚Äô24 ‚Äì Feb ‚Äô25).

Learn more about life and purpose of our company directly from the Gdynia colleagues‚Äô video: https://www.lseg.com/en/careers/where-we-work/gdynia-poland‚ÄØ

Follow us on Facebook, Carers at LSEG Gdynia

LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.

Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.

LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone‚Äôs race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Cloud Data Engineer (3 months contract)
description:
Who We Are:At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.
Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.
We are VML Enterprise Solutions - a group of talented engineers, tech experts, and creators who combine our passions and contribute to the IT world. You may know us better as Wunderman Thompson Technology ‚Äì in 2024 we changed our name, but at the same time, we remained a great team of people who deliver our best. We design, build, manage and run complex technology platforms and help our clients to benefit from our work and creativity.
The opportunity:We are investing massively in developing next-generation AI tools for multimodal datasets and a wide range of applications. We are building large scale, enterprise grade solutions and serving these innovations to our clients and WPP agency partners.
As a member of our team, you will work alongside world-class talent in an environment that not only fosters innovation but also personal and professional growth. You will be at the forefront of AI, leveraging multimodal datasets to build groundbreaking solutions over a multi-year roadmap. Your contributions will directly shape cutting-edge AI products and services that make a tangible impact for FTSE 100 clients.
We are hiring across all experience levels in data science, from entry-level to seasoned professionals, and offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and skills.It is a great time to be joining as the industry transforms itself in what we believe is a generational moment for technology and AI.
What you‚Äôll get to do:Collaborate closely with data scientists, architects, and other stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.Provide data engineering support for AI model development and deployment, ensuring data scientists have access to the data they need in the format they need it.Implement and optimize data transformations and ETL/ELT processes, using appropriate data engineering tools.Work with a variety of databases and data warehousing solutions to store and retrieve data efficiently.Implement monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintenance procedures for data pipelines to ensure the high quality of data and optimize performance.Participate in the creation and ongoing maintenance of documentation, including data dictionaries, data catalogs, data flow diagrams, and process documentation.
What you should have:Proficiency with the Python and SQL programming languages.Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure, and familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark.Experience working with relational databases and NoSQL databases.Strong knowledge of data structures, data modeling, and database schema design.Experience in supporting data science workloads and working with both structured and unstructured data.Familiarity with containerization technologies, such as Docker or Kubernetes.Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
You will collaborate with our UK project team, so we‚Äôll need you to be available until 18:00 PL time.
If you feel like you don‚Äôt tick all our boxes but know you‚Äôd make a fantastic Data Engineer at Satalia, please do apply! We know the value of transferable skills and experiences and would love to hear about these in your cover letter. As an equal opportunity employer we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of our wider community. Please let us know at any time if you require reasonable adjustments to your interview process and feel free to let us know the pronouns you use.
What we offer:Salary depending on presented skills: 13 000 - 17 000 PLN (B2B contract for 3 months)Fully remote job as well as possibility to visit our offices in Pozna≈Ñ, Katowice and BydgoszczWork equipment with delivery to your doorOpportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world 
Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Poland, but the selection process will be conducted in English. Please send over your CV in English.
We are a part of VML Enterprise Solutions. Learn more about our us on dedicated social media: Instagram VML Enterprise Solutions, our LinkedIn page and YouTube channel.
At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization‚Äîcreators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers‚Äîwho drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.
VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.
When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

I tillegg bygger vi en stadig st√∏rre og sterkere organisasjon hvor m√•let er √• ha de mest engasjerte teknologimedarbeiderne i bransjen!

En av grunnene til at vi har lyktes i s√• lang tid, er at vi hele tiden jobber med √• utvikle oss i takt med ‚Äì og helst i forkant av ‚Äì de stadige endringene i forsikringsbransjen og samfunnet ellers. Hos oss vil du v√¶re en del av et stort fellesskap som trekker i samme retning mot et tryggere samfunn for alle, hvor du kan v√¶re stolt av at vi gj√∏r mange konkrete grep for verden rundt oss.

Din hverdag som senior backend-utvikler

Du vil jobbe i konsernteamet Kommunikasjon, - Dokument, - & Arkivsystemer, som leverer l√∏sninger til de nordiske forretningsomr√•dene. Teamet er i vekst, og har behov for en dyktig backend-utvikler. I rollen f√•r du b√•de utvikle og drifte teamets applikasjoner.

Du f√•r mulighet til √• jobbe allsidig med programmering med fokus p√• backend og integrasjoner. Hos oss jobber vi mest med Java og Kotlin, men vi er alltid √•pne for √• teste ut nye ting. Mesteparten av tiden din koder du, men du bidrar ogs√• i valgene som gj√∏res rundt utforming, design og arkitektur.

Om deg

Vi ser etter deg som har en ekte lidenskap for programmering og liker √• spille andre gode. Det forventes ikke at du kan alt, men at du er fleksibel og opptatt av l√¶ring og utvikling.

Du har minst 4 √•rs erfaring som utvikler, og er alltid sulten etter √• l√¶re mer for √• stadig bli en bedre utvikler. Hos oss verdsettes kunnskapsdeling og du deler gjerne av din kompetanse med dine kolleger. Du behersker et skandinavisk spr√•k godt i tillegg til engelsk.

Vi h√•per at du er kreativ, l√∏sningsorientert og elsker teamarbeid. Du er kvalitetsbevisst, misliker teknisk gjeld og vet hva som er godt h√•ndverk. Du er samtidig opptatt av fremdrift og s√∏rger for at leveransene til teamet kommer godt i m√•l. Og du vet hvordan du skal balansere dette i en hektisk hverdag. Du leverer effektivt p√• egne oppgaver, samtidig som du evner √• sparre med og hjelpe andre i teamet for √• n√• v√•re felles m√•l.

Og ikke minst bidrar du aktivt til et hum√∏rfylt og raust arbeidsmilj√∏ b√•de i teamet ditt og i hele Gjensidige. Det er viktig for oss!

I tillegg er det en fordel √• ha en interesse for CI/CD (Github Actions), skyplattform (Azure/Kubernetes), datastr√∏mmer (Kafka), API-design og/eller arkitektur.

V√•re applikasjoner og tjenester kj√∏rer p√• v√•r skyplattform: https://gap.gjensidige.io/

Hos oss f√•r du

Vi garanterer en arbeidsgiver som bryr seg om sine ansatte og legger til rette for god personlig og faglig utvikling. Vi s√∏rger for at du kan utvikle deg innenfor rollen du allerede har, men ogs√• bygge din karriere ved √• bevege deg p√• tvers av organisasjonen.

For √• koble p√• og yte best mulig n√•r det virkelig gjelder, trenger vi √• koble av mellom slagene. Derfor er vi opptatt av at du skal ha rom for √• v√¶re deg, og til √• dyrke det som er betydningsfullt i ditt liv - hva enn det m√•tte v√¶re.

Vi gir deg ogs√• muligheten til √• jobbe delvis fra hjemmekontor etter avtale. Vi tror p√• fleksibilitet i arbeidshverdagen, noe vi legger til rette for gjennom gode samhandlings- og arbeidsverkt√∏y.

Du vil ogs√• f√• flere goder, som blant annet spesielt god pensjonsordning, forsikringsordninger med behandlingsforsikring, personalrabatter, firmahytter i inn- og utland, aksjespareordning og sommertid - i tillegg til fleksibel arbeidstid, som nevnt.

Vi holder til i flotte kontorlokaler (Huset v√•rt) sentralt i Oslo sentrum. Her finner du treningsmuligheter i eget treningsstudio og gymsal, i tillegg til bedriftsidrettslag med for eksempel klatregruppe, turgruppe og fotball, kulturaktiviteter og andre sosiale grupper.

I Gjensidige √∏nsker vi √• gjenspeile bredden av mangfoldet i samfunnet. Oppgavene er varierte, ofte langsiktige og ikke minst samfunnsviktige. Det fineste vi har er felleskapet, og den du er, er viktig for oss. Hos oss f√•r alle like stor plass, og mangfoldet v√•rt beriker b√•de oss selv og kundene v√•re. Gjennom √• v√¶re deg selv, og f√• muligheten til √• utvikle ditt fulle potensial, kan du utnytte evnene dine langt bedre.

Se fremover. Skap verdier. Bli en av oss.

Har du sp√∏rsm√•l til stillingen, ta kontakt med:

Joachim Brattst√∏l, (+47)91855623, joachim.Brattstol@Gjensidige.no

title: Data Operations Engineer
description:

The company develops cloud-based state-of-the art software applications in different areas such as IoT, energy management, RPA & Machine Learning.

Property-based testing is a plus;Solid understanding of observability such as logging, metrics, and alerting;Solid understanding of the management of ELT data pipelines in the context of data lakes;Solid understanding of IT infrastructure, networking, security architectures and related process knowledge.

title: Big Data Engineers
description:
Why Ness
We know that people are our greatest asset. Our staff‚Äôs professionalism, innovation, teamwork, and dedication to excellence have helped us become one of the world‚Äôs leading technology companies. It is these qualities that are vital to our continued success. As a Ness employee, you will be working on products and platforms for some of the most innovative software companies in the world.  You‚Äôll gain knowledge working alongside other highly skilled professionals that will help accelerate your career progression.  You‚Äôll also benefit from an array of advantages like access to trainings and certifications, bonuses, and aids, socializing activities, and attractive compensation.
Requirements and responsibilities 
We are looking for a self-motivated, enthusiastic, and passionate software engineer to develop technology solutions for the Ness marketplace product. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly technical role and will design and develop software using cutting-edge web applications, data pipelines, big data, machine learning, and multi-cloud technologies.
The development is already underway, so the candidate would be expected to get up to speed quickly and start contributing.
You will enable Ness business to showcase our proprietary Ness data, combine it with ‚Äúcurated‚Äù alternative data, further enrich it with value-add services from Kensho and others, and deliver it via the clients‚Äô channel of choice to help them make better investment and business decisions, with confidence. 
What you can expect: An unmatched experience in handling huge volumes of data, analytics, visualization, and services over cloud technologies along with appreciation in product development life cycle to convert an idea into revenue generating stream.
What you'll do
Design & Build ingestion pipelines using ELT and schema on read in Databricks Delta lake;Design & Develop ‚ÄúTransformations‚Äù aspects using ELT framework to modernize the Ingestion pipelines and build data transformations at scale;Provide technical expertise in the areas of design and implementation of Ratings Data Ingestion pipelines with modern AWS cloud and other technologies such as S3, Hive, Databricks, Scala, Python, and Spark;Build and maintain a data environment for speed, accuracy, consistency, and "up" time;Work closely with other data teams & Data Science team and participate in the development of Ingestion pipelines;Ensure data governance principles are adopted, data quality checks and data lineage are implemented in each hop of the data;Be in tune with emerging trends Big data and cloud technologies and participate in the evaluation of new technologies;Ensure compliance through adopting enterprise standards and promoting best practices/guiding principles aligned with organization standards.
What you'll bring
A minimum of 8+ years of significant experience in application development;Development, design, and architecture exposure & the ability to ensure quality across various technology components that are developed by geographically diversified software engineers with superior knowledge of system architecture, object-oriented design, and design patterns;Proficient with software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies like Agile and test-driven development;Experience working with high-volume data and computationally intensive systems;Garbage collection friendly programming experience - tuning Java garbage collection & performance is a must;Proficiency in the development environment, including IDE, web & application server, GIT, Continuous Integration, unit-testing tools, and defect management tools Domain knowledge in the Financial Industry and Capital Markets is a plus;Excellent communication skills are essential, with strong verbal and writing proficiencies;Mentor teams, innovate and experiment, give a face to business ideas, and present to key stakeholders. Not checking every single requirement?
If this role sounds good to you, even if you don‚Äôt meet every single bullet point in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. For most of the candidates that applied, we found a role that was a very good fit with their skills. Let‚Äôs meet and you may just be the right candidate for one of our roles. At Ness Digital Engineering we are willing to build a work culture that is based on diversification, inclusion, and authenticity.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
For our client Sapiens, we are looking for Site Reliability Engineer
In Poland we are located in: Katowice, Szczecin, Gdynia, WarszawaDue to our increased expansion globally, Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to work with us in Poland.Do you want to be part of an awesome team of engineering professionals, building and delivering an award-winning insurance solution used by more than 100,000 users daily? Are you passionate about tools and technologies for continuous integration and delivery? Is your first thought to automate stuff instead of fixing? Are you flexible with technologies and eager to learn what is required to finish the task at hand? Do you observe the value created by pipelines and processes that you own? If you answered Yes! to the questions above, you are the profile that we are looking for to join our great Ops team in Sapiens Technology. More about the Role:As an Ops Engineer at Sapiens Technology, you will be part of a team that continually improves the way our company develops and delivers software. Our company develops software, that consultants implement for our customers and we also run production systems for our customers as part of our Sapiens Cloud offering. At every step of the way, we are involved technically and helping the wider organization to encompass the DevOps culture and mindset. As an expert you will be working on a wide range of areas, giving you plenty of room to grow. Our team is a virtual team, split across Poland, Portugal, Israel, and India. We run a smooth and simple process to manage our task flow. We continually improve our own team processes and we find that a good work environment without too many outside disturbances is vital for productivity and job satisfaction. The tasks you will be working on, include but is not limited toImprove the software development process, including source control structure, build scripting, quality assurance, security, etc Improve continuous delivery pipelinesSeek and work on opportunities to further automate our processes and operational routines Making agile product teams more self-sufficient, by teaching them and helping them with automationConfiguration management of infrastructure and software Operate and continually improve our infrastructure in the cloud Operate and continually improve our Cloud offering for our customersOur tech stackCloud infrastructure and services on Microsoft Azure (leading platform), Amazon AWS and Oracle OCILinux, Windows k8s, DockerMSSQL, Oracle DB, PostgreSQL, MongoDB Terraform, Ansible, Bicep Azure DevOps, Jenkins Git and SVN DataDog , Azure monitoring stack, Prometheus, GrafanaBash/Python, JSON, PowerShell About You You are the perfect candidate for this job if you have embraced the DevOps mindset and love automation and continuous improvement. Your first instinct should be to go for automation and Infrastructure-as-Code, rather than doing things manually. Other skills and competenciesOur working language is English. Proficiency is important Experience, practical or educational, within several of the above-mentioned tech stack items Proven skills with related tools and technologies Analytical approach to solving complex problems A team player, but able to take independent initiatives as wellQuality over quantity thinking ‚ÄúI build it, I run/own it‚Äù attitude. Full responsibility for own buildsWhat we offer you in return Stable employment ‚Äì permanent job contract Flexible working hours to help you keep the work-life balance and find time for your hobbies Partnership approach & communication respecting individual needs and employee development plan ideasPossibility to gain professional experience and learn from global industry expertsStable project & diversified working environment Periodical events and contests for employees (business runs, paintball, etc.) Private medical healthcare & Multisport card IT-specific, friendly dress code that you will become a fan of Attractive employee referral program and bonuses About SapiensSapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is a global leader in intelligent insurance software solutions. With Sapiens‚Äô robust platform, customer-driven partnerships, and rich ecosystem, insurers are empowered to future-proof their organizations with operational excellence in a rapidly changing marketplace. We help insurers harness the power of AI and advanced automation to support core solutions for property and casualty, workers‚Äô compensation, and life insurance, including reinsurance, financial & compliance, data & analytics, digital, and decision management. Sapiens boasts a longtime global presence, serving over 600 customers in more than 30 countries with its innovative SaaS offerings. Recognized by industry experts and selected for the Microsoft Top 100 Partner program, Sapiens is committed to partnering with our customers for their entire transformation journey and is continuously innovating to ensure their success. For more information visit us at www.sapiens.com.Sapiens is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment that embraces individuals from diverse backgrounds. Please send your resume in English.

title: Performance Engineer
description:
What you‚Äôll be doing & where

Where are you? 

Welcome to your future team. As a Performance Engineer (employee or freelancer) you will become an indispensable asset to our Banking Solutions division headed by Sabrina Defraene.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Performance Engineer (performance testing, improving monitoring capabilities) you'll work on our multi-bank payment platform. This includes activities around the processing of several types of payments, fraud detection, digital signatures with various types of tokens, ‚Ä¶

You will take part to the implementation of our roadmap which includes the roll-out of new security tokens, enhanced anti-fraud detection, further advances in instant payments, a renewed technology architecture, a new mobile App, the addition of new services like e-invoicing, self-servicing, ‚Ä¶

As a reliability engineer, you will ensure that all our solutions meet our performance targets and potentially improve existing flows. You will setup automated performance testing, propose and/or implement optimizations in the codebase and improve the observability of our applications.

title: Monitoring and Observability Engineer
description:
Breakwater Technology is a technology solutions company passionate about Customer tailored product development. From requirements definition and specification, software coding and development, to application support and maintenance; we can understand and assist with the entire product lifecycle. With a drive fuelled by curiosity, engagement, and an agile mindset, we strive to deliver the highest possible business output of every task and project.
We are looking for an experienced professional to improve the Monitoring and Observability area of our IT services. As part of the Service Delivery team, you‚Äôll collaborate with Platform Engineering and Development teams, ensuring that Service Delivery Managers‚Äô and our clients‚Äô monitoring and observability needs are met using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo and Alertmanager. Your contributions will be critical in maintaining and enhancing the operational health of our services. Additionally, you‚Äôll have a say in architectural improvements of our monitoring stack to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
As a Monitoring and Observability Engineer at Breakwater you will:Develop, integrate and maintain observability of distributed systems using Grafana stack, Prometheus and Alertmanager.Create and manage dashboards and visualisations to provide actionable insights into system health, performance and operational efficiency.Assist in managing incident and problem related issues, making sure that we can preemptively act on events before they impact our customers.Translate business requirements into technical solutions using best practices and standards.Conduct performance analysis, proactively track and modify thresholds, diagnose issues and provide input to the Architecture, Platform Engineering and Development teams regarding observability requirements.
The profile we are looking for:Proven experience with Grafana observability stack (Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo), Prometheus and alert management.Proficiency in creating monitoring scenarios, managing dashboards, and setting up alerts.Some background in scripting and automation.Strong communication skills to facilitate communications with stakeholders.Excellent written and spoken English.
You will stand out if:You have experience with other monitoring and observability tools.Strong understanding of cloud environments (AWS and GCP).You have experience with distributed systems and microservice architecture.You have no trouble in getting your needs across to developers to expose the metrics that you need in the way you need them.You know your way around ITIL and ITSM.
Why us?At Breakwater Technology you are not recruited to work for us, you are hired to work 'with' us this means we are fully invested in your professional growth and development and ensuring your work is engaging, fulfilling and funIn this dynamic and collaborative work environment, we foster a culture built on the pillars of honesty, where transparent communication is valued; growth, as we invest in the continuous development of our team members; respect, ensuring an inclusive and supportive atmosphere; and freedom, empowering individuals to contribute their unique perspectives and ideasOur working language is English and we work hard to create an inclusive environment, at BWT you never lunch alone (unless you really want to)We are a social bunch, whatever your sport or whatever your game, you will be sure to find someone to join you. We even compete as a team in different sporting events (and we like to win)Our benefits are industry leading and we value our employees offering competitive salaries and incentivesOur modern office has a stunning view of √úlemiste lake and Tallinn Airport; and as if that was not enough, we have breakfast together once a week and you can always find fresh fruit and snacks in our kitchen
At Breakwater, we‚Äôre passionate about creating an inclusive workplace for everyone, no matter their age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, or ethnicity. Join us in creating a workplace where your contributions are recognized, and you can thrive as your true self.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Only apply when located in or nearby Rotterdam, The Netherlands!
What will you be doing?As a DevOps engineer, you will collaborate with 2 DevOps engineers in your team, providing support to our product teams. You will assist them with technical issues related to websites or the underlying infrastructure. Keywords for your responsibilities include optimization and automation. We are constantly working on optimizing our websites, platform, and the infrastructure that supports everything. We expect you to stay updated on the latest developments in security and other DevOps-related matters and assess whether the latest trends are relevant to our company.Our main focus at the moment is on improving our platform in the cloud (Google Cloud Platform), documenting our infrastructure as code using Terraform, and facilitating insights into our Kubernetes cluster.
Who are you?Our ideal candidate has at least 3 years of experience as a DevOps engineer or a similar role (such as Systems Engineer) and is eager to further advance in this field. Ideally, you have knowledge of the following products and/or mastery of the following techniques:Kubernetes (Google Kubernetes Engine)DockerGCP (Google Cloud Platform)CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions)TerraformLinux (mainly Ubuntu/Debian)Bash and at least one other scripting or programming languageBut most importantly, we value your willingness to continuously expand your knowledge and expertise. We cannot expect you to master everything we apply.
About UsFirst, a bit about us! Meet TreeHouse: a leading digital enterprise specializing in the real estate market, with a focus on the rental market. We help over 3 million home seekers find a new home monthly in the Netherlands through our labels and high-traffic platforms Pararius.nl, Huurwoningen.nl, and the CRM package Pararius Office and Leadflow developed for real estate agents. We are also active in the UK with our platform RentaRoof.co.uk!We are an informal company with about 75 enthusiastic employees. We work in small teams, aiming to switch quickly and collaborate extensively. This approach allows for a lot of freedom in the way we work, and our teams are constantly improving themselves. Our headquarters is in Rotterdam on the 22nd floor of Blaak 555, providing a guaranteed beautiful view of Rotterdam!Although we are growing significantly as a company, we operate in small teams where we try to switch quickly and engage in a lot of collaboration. This provides a high degree of freedom in the way we work. You should be comfortable with this way of working: communicating with your team members, providing input, engaging in discussions and collaborations with other engineers and product teams, ensuring smooth software deployment. Weekly meetings for an optimal workflow are not uncommon, allowing you the space to shape your own work method.
Not convinced yet?Are you convinced yet? Alright, a bit more information about our terms and culture:You will receive your own laptop to work on.There is a daily lunch with plenty of fresh and healthy products.Table tennis and gaming (Towerfall!) are daily activities. Outside working hours, there are regular sporting events planned.We have frequent drinks, dinners, and team outings (to counterbalance the sports).You are expected to be in the office at least 3 days a week.Good secondary employment conditions, such as a pension plan where 70% is covered by us.A pleasant workplace in Rotterdam, in the fantastic building at Blaak 555, with a stunning view over our beautiful city!
Sounds great?Does this sound like the ideal job for you? Then we would love to receive your motivation and your recent work experience.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (all genders) - Golang
description:
The opportunity 

We're so much more than just a sports aggregator platform. We're on a mission to disrupt the way people connect with sports, and we do it with a mix of creativity, passion, and a whole lot of tech.

As our Senior Backend Engineer you will work in a dynamic team of engineers who share a passion for technology and for providing the best experience possible to our stakeholders. Urban Sports Club engineers are smart, flexible and great problem solvers. We follow software development best practices to build a well-specified, scalable product based on strongly modularized architecture, automated testing, and deployment. Join our team and help us continue to inspire people to lead an active and healthy life!

Your responsibilities 

Be a valued member and technical lead of an autonomous agile team to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives.Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, and designers to identify and solve challenging problems, creating an awesome sports experience for users worldwide.Deliver testable, maintainable and high-quality code and take operational responsibility for the components that you develop.Be a strong participant in the Urban Sports-wide backend cluster affecting and driving best engineering practices across the company.

What you need to succeed 

You have proven working experience as a Senior Backend Engineer with Golang.You have worked with GCP/AWS and corresponding cloud managed services.You have experience working directly with stakeholders to understand, document and develop APIs and systems to meet their requirements, driving increased adoption and reducing reliance on custom one-off implementations.You have written distributed, high-volume services and know how to deploy and keep them running in production.You believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.You have a deep understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms.

Our offer to you 

Relocation support for you and your familyAn interesting Tech Stack. Check it out here.We're working in hybrid mode offering you flexibility to work onsite and from homeWorkOUT Life Balance: 30 days paid vacation per year, flexible working hours, free access to our Employee Assistance Program, plus up to 3 months of remote working from anywhere in the EU, desk swap policy allowing additional remote working time from our other European officesRegular team events and other initiatives helping employees to stay productive, healthy and engaged during hybrid modePersonal development perks including regular internal trainings, German and English language classesMany additional perks including: choice of computer/technology, employee referral bonuses, monthly home office allowance, private health insurance, and moreA free Urban Sports Club L Pro Membership

Urban Sports Group is committed to providing a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who applies for a position or already works with us, regardless of their sports preferences, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Our Electronics Tech Center in Brasov focuses on the innovation, development and testing of electronic applications in the Passive Safety area (Seatbelts & Steering Wheels), coordinating end-to-end projects for European OEMs. We are looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer ‚Äì Embedded C to join our team on a challenging journey as we move towards the future of the automotive industry (remote work/relocation available).

What will you do? 

 Involved in the V-model lifecycle of software development:Specifications: analysis and creation of requirements in line with customer and internal specifications and constraints.Design and implementation of software components according to defined requirements and coding rules.Module and integration testing: creation of the test specifications, test execution and report generation. Work with specific software development tools: specifications (DOORS), debugging (WinIDEA, IC5000), versioning and integrity control (PTC). Take an active part in defining and planning the activities, while collaborating with the team to develop and implement innovative and Best-in-Class products.

What will you bring? 

 Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in Electronics, Computer Science or similar field Strong Embedded C programming skills, good coding practices and thorough understanding of embedded software design principles and Real-Time Operating Systems Fundamental knowledge in Electronics and Microcontrollers Automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN) and safety standards (ISO26262) knowledge Experience with AUTOSAR is a plus Analytical thinking, team collaboration, problem solving

Being onboard our journey of saving more lives will reward you in many ways:

 An attractive salary package with additional benefits such as meal tickets, lunch subsidy, 13th salary and other bonuses throughout the year Health & Wellness focus through a private medical cover, remote work, social events and competitions, sport activities and discounts Professional development, including training and talent management, so that we are all growing together Autonomous working environment, with task diversity & challenging projects, to keep things interesting

title: Integration Engineer Internship
description:
Why join Ericsson?

We are a world leader in the rapidly changing environment of communications technology ‚Äì by providing hardware, software, and services to enable the full value of connectivity.

You‚Äôll play a part in using your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible. To build never-seen-before solutions to some of the world‚Äôs toughest problems.

Join a team of like-minded innovators driven to go beyond the status quo to build what‚Äôs next.

At Ericsson, you can be an explorer, a change maker and a force for good.

Our purpose: To create connections that make the unimaginable possible.

Our vision: A world where limitless connectivity improves lives, redefines business and pioneers a sustainable future.

Our values: Our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded in the walls and where our core values of professionalism, respect, perseverance and integrity shine through in everything we do.

Join our Team

About This Opportunity

We are now looking for New Graduates that will contribute to the creation of customer solutions in the IT domain for Ericsson. During the internship period, you will be involved in all phases of the software development lifecycle to gain competences in the major programming languages and best practices for code development and product integration. We organize in cross-functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.

You‚Äôll get the opportunity to

Perform continuous analysis and requirement handling,Develop and test high quality products,Perform trouble shooting and customer support,Drive continuous improvements of products and processes,Develop competences in technical domain.

Key Skills

Basic knowledge of one of the main programming languages like JAVA, Python, JavaScript/HTML, page design tool,Basic knowledge of SQL and DBRMS,Basic understanding of Information technology and IT page design is considered a plus,Business understanding,Working with people and networking,Innovating, adapting and responding to change,A good knowledge of English.

What We Offer

Interns:

Interns who join us will enjoy an outstanding chance to make connections, to make change, to make a real difference. We are always looking for interns to become permanent members of our Ericsson team, so you‚Äôll have the opportunity to discuss your future with us during your internship.

Grads:

As our future grads, we‚Äôll give you the freedom to think big and the capability to fulfill your potential at Ericsson. We are always looking for graduates with inquiring minds who can contribute to our industry-leading solutions and help shape the future of connectivity.

To put it simply, we change how people, businesses and societies connect ‚Äì and the results are genuinely exciting, challenging and often, awe-inspiring.

title: Platform Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
The Company

HP is a Fortune 100 technology company with $58+ Billion in revenue, with over 50,000 employees operating in more than 170 countries around the world. We provide technology and services that help people and companies address their problems and challenges, and realize their possibilities, aspirations and dreams. We apply new thinking and ideas to create simpler, more valuable and trusted experiences with technology, continuously improving the way our customers live and work.

Position background

In the GTM analytics COE our mission is to deliver impact by building machine learning products to optimize pricing and marketing investments and provide guidance to our sales organization.

As a Platform Engineer you will focus on ensuring that our systems and infrastructure are operating at peak performance, and you will collaborate across teams on various projects. You will also help investigate various issues and put together and execute remediation plans. Also, part of your work will be to offer L2 support helping users with technical issues or questions as well you will put together documentation regarding various platform features.

We offer an international experience, collaborative culture, top rate experience in AI and ML and opportunity to create significant real-world impact.

What You Will Do

Perform server administration activities, security permissions, group policies.Build, test, and maintain new servers as needed.Investigate and resolve technical issues.Perform regular system maintenance backups, upgrades audits.Implementing and managing security or integrity and backup procedures in collaboration with other stakeholders.Design procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand customer requirements and come up with solutions.Develop libraries and scripts to automate platform environment deployments and backups.Develop and maintain code libraries, plugins which help automate engineering workloads.

What You Will Need

Bachelor‚Äôs in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field.3+ years on a similar role.Strong problem-solving and communication skills.Experience with AWS Services as (IAM, KMS, S3, Glue, EC2).Experience working with IaC technologies such as Terraform.Proficient to code using technologies like pySpark, Python, SQL.Knowledge of working with Jira and Jira Service Desk is welcomed.Understanding of Big Data technologies like Hive, Hadoop, Spark is an advantage.Experience on working with DataIku DSS or Databricks platform is an advantage.

Who We Are

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone ‚Äì at every level in every function, is encouraged to think big, have original ideas and express and share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company. At HP, we work across borders and without limits. Global virtual teams share resources, pool their big ideas to solve our biggest business opportunities. Everyone is valued for the unique skills, experiences, and perspective they bring. That is how we work at HP. And this is how ideas and people grow.

title: Nissan Formula E Team - Full stack developer
description:
Ready to trade your routine for racing thrills? If you're a full-stack developer craving a fast-paced, cutting-edge team, look no further than Nissan Formula E! Nissan Formula E Team has been competing in motorsport and the FIA Formula E World Championship for many years and is looking for a full stack developer to contribute to the team‚Äôs development. 
Role We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Full Stack Developer with expertise in Matlab, Python, and VBA to join our dynamic team. As a Full Stack Developer at Nissan Formula E Team, you will play a key role in developing and maintaining software solutions that drive innovation and efficiency within our organization. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining software applications, as well as collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.  Responsibilities Software development Full stack development Testing and validation Problem solving  You will have to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and analysts, to understand project requirements and objectives.  As part of a competitive environment, you will have stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies as well as proactively suggest improvements and innovative solutions.  Qualifications Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with expertise in Matlab, Python, and VBA Experience in database design and management (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) Experience in web and app development is a plus Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills Strong communication and teamwork abilities Attention to detail and commitment to producing high-quality code Understanding of physical systems is a plus  What we offer : Hybrid work (on site and at home)Health insurance50% of Navigo pass paidTeam buildingFree coffee The speed and excitement of Formula E
This role requires excellent attention to detail and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines. We require a full-time person for our office located in Viry-Ch√¢tillon, France. This role will also include an element of being on call and will not sit strictly between normal office hours due to the reactive nature of the business.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Ons bedrijf: WEngage is een vaste waarde in het domein van de contact centers dankzij ruim 30 jaar ervaring. We zoeken keer op keer de ideale combinatie van menselijke overtuigingskracht en technologische innovatie. Zo staan we garant voor een perfecte klantbeleving. Met kantoren in Diegem, Hasselt,Antwerpen, Oostende, Gent, Luik en Leuven helpen we opdrachtgevers in alle sectoren.
Jouw rol: Jij zorgt ervoor dat gegevens toegankelijk zijn, in de juiste vorm, op de juiste plaats en op het juiste moment.Je transporteert data en verrijkt deze, zodat mensen en organisaties over de benodigde, betrouwbare, data beschikken om de juiste strategische beslissingen te kunnen nemen.
Jouw verantwoordelijkheden: Je bedenkt, modelleert, bouwt en onderhoudt de data-architectuur die nodig is voor een bepaald datavraagstuk. Daarbij ga je de behoeften van de business vertalen in duidelijke specificaties voor nieuwe rapportering.Je brengt verschillende gestructureerde en/of niet-gestructureerde databronnen bij elkaar en maakt ze op het gewenste moment beschikbaar. Je maakt data schoon, zorgt dat ze betrouwbaar zijn en bewaakt de datakwaliteit.Je zorgt ervoor dat de gebruikers tijdig over gepaste analytische gegevens en hulpmiddelen kunnen beschikken (rapporten, dashboarden, analyses en gegevensmodellen) en ondersteunt hen dmv gerichte analyses om inzichten en kennis te verwerven en zo de juiste beslissingen en acties te kunnen nemen. Je zorgt er voor dat bronbestanden, behoeften, specificaties en bestaande analyses correct worden gedocumenteerd en levert gebruikersdocumentatie aan.Je hebt een bachelor denk niveau en vult dit aan met minimum 3 jaar relevante ervaring.Je drukt je vlot uit in het Nederlands of het Frans. Uiteraard heb je een goede kennis van het Engels.Je kan werken met SQL Server technologie en bent bedreven in het schrijven van query‚Äôs hierin. Je maakt gebruik van SSIS voor het ETL proces en het data model van SSAS voor Power BI. Kennis van Power BI report server is een plus.Hoewel je deel uit maakt van een team, werk je graag en goed autonoom. Je deelt uiteraard informatie met je team en met je klant.Je hebt oog voor details en tracht steeds de beste kwaliteit af te leveren voor je klant, of deze nu intern of extern is.Je analytisch inzicht en systematische methoden helpen je structuur te brengen in een veelheid aan gegevens. Onvoorziene omstandigheden zijn geen obstakel maar een uitdaging voor jou.
Aanbod:We verwachten heel wat talenten van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug: niet zomaar een job, maar een supertoffe job in een groot maar hecht & collegiaal team.
De kans om elke dag te leren en te groeien in jouw rol dankzij continue coaching, feedback en trainingen. Je kan daarnaast ook gebruik maken van een groot aanbod aan e-learning modules die je helpen in jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling.Een vast WEngage contract met een marktcoform loon aangevuld met extra legale voordelen.Ben je goed in je job? Dan zijn er doorgroeimogelijkheden naar andere functies en/of projecten.

title: Python Developer
description:
Undelucram.ro on behalf of:

LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group) Romania

Divisions/Projects

Our team in LSEG Romania is building financial technology which is deployed to the world. The technology we deliver is supporting the finance world ecosystem and is shaping the global financial markets. We promote agility, innovation, and speed to market by supporting businesses across the Group with robust data a reliable infrastructure.

How? Through our different divisions:

Capital Markets operates a broad range of international equity, fixed income, related exchange-traded funds (ETFs)/exchange-traded products (ETPs) and foreign exchange markets that enable customers, communities and economies to grow.

The division combines LSEG‚Äôs Capital Markets division with trading platforms and the Tradeweb fixed income trading platform, supporting customers which seek to trade and raise capital on a global basis.

Post Trade operates a group of multinational clearing houses that provide counterparty risk mitigation across multiple asset classes for sell-side clearing members and buy-side clients in conjunction with trading venues globally. Our regulatory reporting services help clients comply with multiple global reporting regimes all through one platform.

LCH is a multi-asset class clearing house, serving major exchanges and platforms and a range of OTC markets, OTC and listed rates, credit-default swaps (CDS), FX, fixed income, commodities, cash equities, and equity derivatives.UnaVista is a regulated platform that helps customers meet their reporting compliance obligations and reduce operational and regulatory risk through reporting, reference data and analytics solutions. In addition, it provides regulatory solutions, confirmation matching, data solutions, MIFIR each-way reconciliations and Rules Engine.

Index Technology

Benchmark & Index Solutions consists of FTSE Russell and Refinitiv Benchmark Services. FTSE Russell is a global provider of benchmarks and indices with industry-leading capabilities across asset classes, styles, and strategies. Refinitiv Benchmark Services provides interest rate and FX benchmarks including WM/R closing spot rate, CDOR and Refinitiv Term SONIA.

Our vision is to be the leading index solutions provider of choice across asset classes and investment objectives. We help investors make better-informed investment decisions.

Role responsibilities:

Engaging with product owners, architects and other specialists you'll design and build world-class cloud native solutions;You will assist your workstream by writing user stories, refining and estimating them as part of an agile process;You'll build and maintain efficient, reusable, reliable and secure enterprise software, adhering to company standards;Demonstrating a consistent focus on quality, you'll ensure that you deliver reliable software through static analysis, unit testing and other industry standard ways of working;You'll provide technical support to operations or other development teams;To help the team develop and learn, you'll review work of peers, providing advice and guidance for the benefit of the team as a whole;Through agile retrospectives and reviews, you'll adapt and find innovative ways to make your team work more effectively;Through participation in refinement and planning sessions, you'll work with other team members to analyse development requirements, provide design options and complexity estimates, and agree how to deliver the requirements.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience required:

At least 3 years experience in developing in Python;Experience in API design (REST, GraphQL);Familiar with network protocols: WebSocket, Socket, https;Strong communication skill;Good problem solving & analytical skills;Agile oriented;Experience in CI/CD in Cloud such as Azure, AWS or GCP (nice to have);Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform (nice to have);Knowledge about machine learning (nice to have).

Benefits:

We are looking for intellectually curious people, passionate about the bigger picture of how technology industry is evolving, ready to ask difficult questions and deal with complicated scenarios. If you are creative and a problem solver, this is the place to be as will be supporting you to fast-forward your career.

We maximise each employee‚Äôs potential through personal development and through a wide range of learning tools both formal and informal. We believe that remunerating our people with competitive salaries and a range of attractive benefits such as:

At least 25 days‚Äô holiday per year;Annual wellness allowance;Annual performance Bonus;Share Purchase Plan;Medical Health Insurance;Medical Subscription (preventive medical services);Dental Coverage;Life insurance;Pillar 3 Private Pension;Meal Vouchers;Learning opportunities (O'reilly, Udemy, and more);Flexible Benefits;Bookster;Volunteering Events;Team Buildings.

LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.

Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.

LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone‚Äôs race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Software Developer intern
description:
If you're passionate about development, then it's time to come and do your internship in a company with a great Open Source project where your work will count:
You'll start with 3 weeks of training. The goal is to let you discover Odoo and our development environment.
You'll join a technical team. We have ~20 teams, one team for each Odoo group of apps (HR, accounting, inventory, marketing, etc)
You will develop at least a new functionality for one of the apps.  You'll be in charge of the project from A to Z and we'll ask your opinion, exactly like if you were an employee. You'll be surrounded by talented and smart people that will guide and help you.
Odoo is Open Source so you write public code and contribute to the development community. Moreover what you develop will be used by millions of people all over the world. You have the chance to see the impact of your work and make a real contribution to the success of the company.
Our stack:- Programming languages: Python & Javascript- Database: postgresql (with object relational mapping)- Collaboration plateform: GitHub- Development model: open with external community- Framework: Odoo (ORM, Workflows, Report Engine, Bi, AI)

RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and improve AppsBe responsible of what you developBack and/or front-end
MUST HAVE:Several programming languagesObject-oriented programming languageIn the last year of your studiesPassion for developmentAvailable 3 months min / 5 days per weekRead & Written EnglishValid work permit for Belgium
NICE TO HAVE:Contributions to Open Source projectsUnix/Linux PlatformPython, JavaScriptHTML5 and CSS3Linux, GitHub

title: Software Engineer
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
Lenus is looking for a Software Engineer for our Copenhagen office.

Are you passionate about engineering, curious about product development, and eager to contribute your unique perspective? We‚Äôre looking for talented software engineers with diverse experiences to join our dynamic team.

Who are we looking for?

We‚Äôre looking for someone who not only loves engineering but also brings a unique blend of creativity and collaboration. We value diverse backgrounds and experiences and believe that different perspectives make us stronger. If you see yourself as a natural problem-solver with a passion for technology and recognize yourself in our Engineering manifesto "Engineers at Heart‚Äù, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Responsibilities

Work closely with Engineers, Designers, Product Managers, and Support Engineers to move our product forward.Contribute to delivering high-quality features that make a meaningful impact.Play an active role in improving our practices in software engineering design, testing, documentation, build, deployment, and operations.Contributing to our product through sketching out solutions, coding, and implementing them as well. For that we use well-established technologies e.g. Express on Node and PostgreSQL and we are keen on trying out new things to challenge how we do things today. You‚Äôll get to work with:Technologies - Node.js (TypeScript), PostgreSQL, GraphQLFrameworks - React, React Native, Styled components, ExpoServices - Github, CircleCI, Amazon Web Services
You will have a playground for you to grow, learn and develop as an Engineer in the direction you prefer. In a growing team, there will be a demand for both a high degree of specialization as well as a broader perspective of a generalist.

Qualifications

1+ years of experience in professional software development building products.Experience with one or more of our core components within the JavaScript ecosystem (Typescript, React.js, React Native and Node.js).Familiarity with relational databases like PostgreSQL is a plus.Experience working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment.

We encourage all applicants to apply, even if you don‚Äôt meet every single qualification. We believe that skills can be learned, and we are committed to supporting your growth.

Why Join Us?

Inclusive Culture: We believe that diversity drives innovation. Our team is built on mutual respect, collaboration, and a shared goal to make a positive impact.Flexible Work Environment: We understand the importance of work-life balance. While we value in-person collaboration in our Copenhagen office, we offer flexibility to support your personal and professional needs.Professional Growth: We provide continuous learning opportunities through quarterly feedback sessions and training opportunities to help you grow in your career.Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is our priority. We offer various sports activities to keep you healthy and energized.Team Spirit: From geeky meetups and Hackafun events to monthly socials, we foster a sense of community and fun in everything we do.Security and Support: You will get insured through AP Pension and receive a voluntary pension plan. Also we offer an attractive parental leave policy.

The Team

You‚Äôll be part of a diverse and supportive team in Copenhagen that values open communication, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We embrace new technologies and encourage experimentation to drive innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels welcomed and valued. Your voice matters here.

We'll be going through applications frequently, so if this sounds like a great opportunity for you, hit apply and our talent team will go through it and be in touch with you. We look forward to reading your application.

About Lenus

Lenus was founded in Denmark by Bertram Thorslund, in 2016. We are a health technology company that empowers health coaches to scale their businesses through the use of pioneering technology and our in-house business, health and innovation expertise.

We‚Äôre inspiring a new generation of health coaches. People who have the power to move not only bodies, but minds too. We are at the forefront of an industry under rapid transformation and our strategic innovations pave the path for the change we want to see. Happier and healthier people.

Today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in New York, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, Madrid, Helsinki, Oslo, Toronto, Miami, Southern California & beyond.

At Lenus, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. Even if you don‚Äôt meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and background could be just what we need to make a difference together.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We care about your privacy, personal data and information at Lenus.

For specific details on how your personal data and information is processed by Lenus during any recruitment process, please see our privacy policy.

Specific To EU Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation. We rely on the lawful basis of Art. 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR to process the information provided by you in the recruitment process.

Specific To California Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Fleet Remarking)
description:
Job Description

About the Team:

The Fleet Sales team focuses on developing innovative solutions for managing the selling vehicles process across Europe and the US. The team collaborates closely with third-party vendors and partners to optimize sales flows and ensure seamless integration with backend systems. This dynamic group of developers is dedicated to enhancing the fleet management experience through cutting-edge technology.

We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack engineer to join our dynamic team at SIXT, a global market leader in the mobility space. As a Full Stack engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both the front-end and back-end of our web applications. You will work closely with our team of designers and developers to build innovative and user-friendly web applications that transform the industry to become fully digitalised and offer our customers an answer to all mobility needs they have. Our fuel is them having a great experience.

DO WHAT YOU LOVE:

Develop and maintain the front-end and support the team on the back-end development. Write clean, efficient, and well-documented codeDebug and troubleshoot issues as they ariseOptimize web applications for maximum speed, scalability, resilience, and security

Qualifications

COME AS YOU ARE:

Proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and ReactKnowledge in any Object-Oriented programming language for the back-end, open to work with Java and Spring BootFamiliarity with version control systems such as Git

Additional Information

Working at SIXT not only means creating the future of mobility, but also offers personal benefits. This means especially for you: 28days of vacation, no dress code, a hybrid working model andflexible working hours.In our modern office,with new equipment, you can stock up on coffee at any time.

Moreover, we offer you a super international working environment, numerous trainingsfor your individual development, participation in external conferences and we even organize internal dev & tech talks. It is very important to us that you can develop personally and grow within our company.

Furthermore, you can benefit from our Coverflexadvantage system. With this system you can selectthe benefits you want- This way you can decide for yourself what you want to use your benefits for!

In addition, your colleagues are pretty awesome. Which is important when you spend so much time together, and besides, no wonder when you get a bonus for referring friends as new employees. Otherwise, we live "work hard, play hard" - our parties are legendary! We also demand and promote DiverSIXTy, a corporate culture of acceptance, appreciation, and respect, in which everyone can develop their personality and ideas.

About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of ‚Ç¨3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

title: Software Support Engineer (CAE/CAD Systems - Paris or Lyon)
description:

Role Overview:
We are seeking a skilled Support Engineer to join the Adoption Team within our client's Customer Success division. This is a pivotal role, newly established as part of our client‚Äôs ongoing transformation efforts.
You will be instrumental in providing top-notch first-line product support, focusing on understanding customer goals and troubleshooting issues. In collaboration with the sales team, you‚Äôll serve as a vital conduit between our client‚Äôs customers and the technical teams, including product development and professional services. This role primarily involves working with clients in the Automotive sector.

title: R&D IT Semantic Data Engineer
description:
Job Description

Our company seeking a semantic data engineer into the Knowledge Graph & Semantic Engineering Services team for our Prague Tech Center. This team focuses on making use of research data efficient in support of data-driven drug discovery. We create reusable data products that provide analysis-ready data to our data scientists advancing pharmaceutical research. We design and implement tools for data acquisition, integration, and enrichment using semantic web technologies and data exchange standards to reduce the friction and duplication of application-specific data engineering effort.

We are looking for a semantic data engineer to support integration of laboratory instrument data using the industry standards from the Allotrope Foundation. In this role, the data engineer will enable frictionless data flow by using automation, data standards, and by following FAIR principles.

Key Responsibilities

Build ETL pipelines to integrate data from laboratory instruments in a knowledge graphCreate database queries to support effective use of the laboratory instrument dataImplement internal and industry best practices for DevOps and cloud engineeringDevelop our extensions of the Allotrope Foundation‚Äôs standards

Required Experience And Skills

Semantic web technology stack (e.g., RDF data format, SPARQL query language)Amazon Web Services, particularly the serverless services (e.g., Lambda, Glue, Step Functions)Data engineering (e.g., SQL queries, ETL jobs)Programming in PythonExperience with DevSecOps practices like continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD), source code version control (e.g., Git), infrastructure-as-code (e.g., CloudFormation, Terraform), and containers (e.g., Docker).

Desired Experience And Skills

Cheminformatics and familiarity with the pharmaceutical researchGood communication and collaboration skills, and ability to collaborate with other teams to develop solutions.Experience with Atlassian stack of tools for agile software development (e.g., Jira, Confluence).Demonstrate growth mindset and ability to work with enterprise teams.

What We Offer

Exciting work in a great team, global projects, international environment Opportunity to learn and grow professionally within the company globally Hybrid working model, flexible role pattern (e.g., even 80% full-time is possible in justified cases) Pension and health insurance contributions Internal reward system plus referral programme 5 weeks annual leave, 5 sick days, 15 days of certified sick leave paid above statutory requirements annually, 40 paid hours annually for volunteering activities, 12 weeks of parental contribution Cafeteria for tax free benefits according to your choice (meal vouchers, L√≠taƒçka, sport, culture, health, travel, etc.), Multisport Card Vodafone, Raiffeisen Bank, Foodora, and Mall.cz discount programmes Up-to-date laptop and iPhone Parking in the garage, showers, refreshments, massage chairs, library, music corner Competitive salary, incentive pay, and many more
