title: FS Programmer (Remote)
description:
Orion Innovation is a premier, award-winning, global business and technology services firm. Orion delivers game-changing business transformation and product development rooted in digital strategy, experience design, and engineering, with a unique combination of agility, scale, and maturity. We work with a wide range of clients across many industries including financial services, professional services, telecommunications and media, consumer products, automotive, industrial automation, professional sports and entertainment, life sciences, ecommerce, and education.

Our Partner

Our partner delivers comprehensive solutions to oil companies and commercial fleets, improving profitability and optimizing performance from the forecourt to the head office. Be it the single transaction, network optimization or business analytics, our hardware, software, and services enhance the entire retail fuel network and fleet management value chains.

Our partner's solutions are powered by IoT, secure cloud-based data storage, machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) engines. Their solutions include cloud-based retail solutions including business insight, fuel retail network and convenience store management, service station automation and management, home-based station and fleet management, forecourt payment terminals and vehicle identification.

Our partner's field-proven products are installed in more than 40,000 service stations and 7 million vehicles across 60 countries. Their solutions are distributed via an international network of subsidiaries and value-added partners.

Overall Objective of the Role

Join our growing group developing our next-generation products and solutions for the Retail Fuel Industry.

Responsibilities

Developing infrastructure for the solutions‚Äô architecture.Constructing low-level designs of development features.


Requirements

Must Have:

B.Sc. / B.A. in Computer Science / Software Engineering or related field.4+ years of hands-on experience in C# (.NET) software development.4+ years of hands-on experience in Angular Development.Experience with MS-SQL (complex queries, stored procedures etc.).Experience with Rest API.Experience with Entity framework.


Nice To Have

Experience with Dependency injection.Experience with DevExtreme, DevExpress Reporting (xtra Reports), OAuth 2, Mediator Pattern.Experience working in an AGILE environment.


Reasons to Work with Us

Motivating financial conditions.International projects with worldwide recognition.A good work-life balance with flexible schedule and work from home / remote as much as possible.Exciting new career in a friendly, dynamic, growing organization.Professional development in a friendly multicultural environment.Private medical subscription @ Medlife or Regina Maria.Meal tickets.Gift Vouchers for your birthday / wedding / childbirth.Wellbeing Programs (sick days, 7Card, relaxation facilities in the office).Team buildings & other social experiences.Referral bonuses.Budget granted for certifications required in the project.Workshops on different topics and internal courses.Access to LinkedIn learning platform, at request.Access to Udemy platform, if required in the project.City center office location.Shared parking spaces.


As a global digital transformation company, Orion values creating a productive, diverse work environment. We are committed to maintaining a positive work environment where our people value traits that make each one of us different from one another. We all bring a diverse set of perspectives, work and life experiences, and our differences make us more valuable both internally and for our clients.

Orion is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Tech Talent Program ‚Äì turn your passion for software into an exciting career journey
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
Are you ready to shape the future? 

Apply to our Tech Talent Program if you want to work with clients on solving their most challenging tech problems and accelerate your learning curve when applying your skills into practice. You will be part of a collaborate community of leaders and peers who are ready to mentor, coach and encourage you to be your best.

The Tech Talent Program is a two-year program, starting in March 2025, where you will receive tailored training together with other graduates, while working on one to three different projects being part of an Accenture team implementing business critical IT systems to our clients.

We are looking for passioned developers for the graduate program, who want to work in these areas and technologies:


Java, Java EE, Spring Framework, Python, C#, .NET, SQL / PLSQL, MySQL, 

Development using TDD, Clean Code, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles 

DevOps with Vagrant, Docker, Chef, Stomach, Git, Puppet and Jenkins 

Frontend development with HTML5, CSS3, REST, React.js, Angular.js, responsive design, and more 


At Accenture, we invest heavily in developing your professional skills. More than just a first step, we‚Äôre ready to help you turn your passion into an exciting career.

Four ways we‚Äôll help you succeed and develop as a technical consultant:


 You‚Äôll receive ongoing training that continuously extends your skills, allowing you to develop tailored expertise quickly.

 You‚Äôll learn from day 1 as you‚Äôll be part of projects where we implement complex technology for our international clients, transforming their business.

 During your graduate period, you‚Äôll go through an intense learning process ‚Äì with a buddy and people lead helping you figure out exactly how to develop your career. Want to be a specialist or a generalist? In Denmark or abroad? The sky is the limit.

 Opportunity to build your professional network across the organization by taking part in our communities or by joining our social events in the Graduate group, social gatherings at the office, company parties and not to forget our monthly Friday bar. We thrive to have fun at work!


What will my workday as a graduate consultant be like? 

Dependent on the client, the expectation is that you work from the client site four days a week, while at other projects you will have the possibility to work remotely from your home office or the Accenture office located in Carlsberg Byen in Copenhagen.

You will be an integral part of our projects and play a role ‚Äì as you learn ‚Äì in helping companies accelerate their enterprise transformation with innovative technology services to deliver lasting value. Depending on your skills and growth focus areas, you may:


Understand, design, and develop large IT solutions from a technical coding side or from the architectural side 

Work side by side with clients to understand and meet their needs 

Test advanced technology systems 

Configure standard solutions and build custom interfaces between systems 

Analyze and present complex data 

Work closely together with colleagues in our delivery centers in e.g., India, the Philippines and the Baltics throughout an implementation project 


Our client portfolio includes some of the biggest companies in Denmark across the financial sector, public sector, product industries, health industry, and resource industry. In your project you will be working with like-minded people on complex technological problems, applying the latest technology in Cloud, Security, Data, AI, Digital, Industry X, Enterprise platforms and Intelligent automation.

You‚Äôll find yourself at the intersection of business and technology as you help our clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders while you grow expertise within a specific field.

We Hire For Passion And Train For Skills

What we are really looking for is a strong team player who is motivated by challenges and who is eager to learn and develop professionally. You are flexible in taking on new roles as you and your career develops and you take pride in delivering high quality on time while enjoying the ride together with your colleagues.

If that sounds like you, you will fit right in.

Furthermore, we imagine that you:


Are eager to develop your technical skills within IT development and the technologies mentioned above 

Have a good understanding of data structures and want to learn more about software architecture and data modelling 

Are finishing up your master‚Äôs degree in engineering, computer science or another discipline related to information technology ‚Äì and can show us solid results from your studies 

Are fluent in English and preferably in Danish 


Ready to shape the future? 

Then submit your application no later than 11th of October 2024.

Please upload all the following documents in the CV/Resume section of the application process:


CV 

Cover Letter 

B.Sc., and M.Sc. grades 


Please note that applications without all the required documents will not be considered.

Recruitment process: 

The recruitment process consists of three interview rounds. Based on screening, selected candidates will be invited to our TTP Information & Speed Interview event on the 5th of November from 16.30 to 19.30 at our office in Carlsberg Byen.

Selected candidates from the speed interviews will be invited for specialization interviews in weeks 46 and 47 and final interviews will be finalized in week 49.

Kindly note that while we aim to adhere to the specified dates, they may be subject to adjustment if necessary.

Ready to learn more? 

Visit our Tech Talent Program page for further details on how to kickstart your career with us.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Python/React)
description:
Senior Full-Stack Developer ‚Äì Stockholm, HybridAre you passionate about building innovative software solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products across the full stack?
What's in it for you?You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will span both backend and frontend development (split about 80/20 towards the backend), allowing you to contribute across the entire stack.
Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing office time in Stockholm with remote work. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
You‚Äôll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience).They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you‚Äôll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskv√•rd) and private pension contribution.
What you'd be doing?You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers.
On the frontend, you'll craft user interfaces ranging from analytical dashboards to complex 3D visualisations, using cutting-edge web technologies to create responsive and data-rich applications.
About you?You have at least 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a strong backend focus, preferably in Python including frameworks such as FastAPI, Django, RabbitMQ & Kafka. On the frontend, they work with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, so experience here would also be essential.
You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.Experience with DevOps practices, cloud platforms and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools is a plus.
Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
A bit about them?A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.

Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.

3 stage Interview ProcessInitial ChatTechnical DiscussionFinal with CEO

title: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligente)
description:
About Prysmian

Prysmian is the world leader in the energy and telecom cable systems industry. Each year, the manufacturers thousands of miles of underground and submarine cables and systems for power transmission and distribution, as well as medium low voltage cables for the construction and infrastructure sectors. We also produce a comprehensive range of optical fibers, copper cables and connectivity for voice, video and data transmission for the telecommunication sector.

We are almost 30.000 employees, across 58 countries. Everyone at Prysmian has the potential to make their mark; because whatever you do, wherever you are based, you will be part of a company that is helping transform the world around us.

Who are we looking for?

From 1 to 3 years of experience in managing Data Science Projects and Teams

Alternatively, from 3 to 6 years of experience in the delivery of Machine Learning Projects

Bachelor‚Äôs or master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related fields

Advanced knowledge of Python and Machine Learning libraries (e.g. Scikit-learn, Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Pytorch)

Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases

Advanced knowledge of Machine Learning, Deep Learning and statistical techniques

Knowledge and experience of AI Governance and Best Practices

Responsibilities And Main Duties

Support the Team along the development of technical solutions required by AI Projects

Collaborate with Data Engineer and Infrastructure Engineer in the design the architecture for Machine Learning Projects

Implementation of DevOps/MLOps principles

Implementation of Data Governance principles

Establish Best Practices for Machine Learning development and production infrastructure

Train business and IT resources on basic data science principles and technique

Promote collaboration with business and IT Teams within the Company

Work close to the Business and Business Partners in the identification of business opportunities

Scope and manage data science projects KPIs

WHY TO APPLY?

Develop Your Skills And Grow Within The Company

Earn advanced technical certifications

You are rewarded with a competitive salary package and relocation benefits

You will operate on a digitized campus near the factories

You will be able to travel to other Prysmian locations

Depending on the expertise required for the job, you can benefit from different levels of compensation.

Prysmian is committed to the development of an organization that prioritizes talent, where people feel respected, appreciated and free to fully express their human potential. Prysmian strongly believes that diversity drives meritocracy and brings significant value at all levels of the organization, increases the possibility of capturing market opportunities and maximizing value for our customers and shareholders. Prysmian bases its decisions on principles of equality, with evaluations based on the type of position and with a focus on best practices so individuals succeed based on their efforts and skills and their alignment with applicable job requirements.

Line Mangers, Hiring Managers, HR Corporate and HR Local are responsible for ensuring that diversity and inclusion are respected during the recruiting process. title: SENIOR BACKEND DEVELOPER (PYTHON)

About

Mago is an AI-native, fully controllable tool revolutionizing video production through style transfer.

We empower creators to transform and stylize any video - from live-action films to 3D animations - into any aesthetic, seamlessly blending cutting-edge AI with human creativity from concept to final cut.

Founded by veterans from creative industries, Mago is not just changing how videos look, but how they're made. Our software streamlines, simplifies and accelerates non-realistic production workflows, dramatically cutting costs for stylized content in animation, film, game cinematics, advertising and more.

Our prototype, Warpfusion, has already captured more than 150 millions views across social media. Now, Mago is set to redefine creative possibilities for professionals and hobbyists alike, making state-of-the-art video stylization accessible to all.

description:

title: System and Cloud engineer
description:
Join Our Team as a Windows Systems Engineer at Getronics!
Are you passionate about system engineering and cloud technology? At Getronics, we are looking for dynamic Windows Systems Engineers to support, maintain, and enhance our Client Workspace at the Operating System level. You'll be driving automation, integration, and business continuity, all while delivering exceptional customer experiences.
Role PurposeAs a Windows Systems Engineer, you'll focus on system engineering, bringing value through your expertise in Microsoft Windows Server and Windows Client. We're particularly seeking candidates with experience in Azure, especially in managing storage accounts and storage account technology.
Key ResponsibilitiesProvide subject matter expertise in operating systems engineering.Offer advanced technical support and serve as an escalation point for IT incidents and service requests, including coordination with third parties.Develop and maintain systems standards, policies, and procedures.Design, program, and modify scripts in various scripting languages.Document engineering work, incident resolutions, and recurring incidents, creating technical analyses and performance reports.Lead project teams and act as a resource for other team members.Plan, implement, and carry out maintenance for core operating systems and related components.Ensure performance and reliability by monitoring systems for high availability, load balancing, and satisfactory response times.Collaborate with other IT professionals to resolve performance issues and optimize performance.
Technical and Specific Skills / ExperienceIn-depth knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server (2008/2012/2016/2019/2022).Extensive experience with Windows 10-11 suites.Proven engineering support for enterprise-level configuration management.Proficiency with Microsoft System Center Operations Manager (SCOM) and previous versions.Expertise in Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM)/ Intune, OS deployment, packaging, collection, and application deployment.Automation and scripting skills using PowerShell.Experience with Office 365 suite, Teams, SharePoint, and Microsoft Data Loss Prevention (DLP).Familiarity with Windows Defender.Experience with Active Directory (Azure AD is a plus) and Identity Management with ADFS and MIM.Knowledge of Exchange 2019, change management, and upgrades.Certifications such as Microsoft MDAA and/or MCSE Messaging.Strong Azure experience and certifications.ITIL V3.1-V4 foundation certification is a plus.A minimum of 7 years of relevant experience.
About GetronicsGetronics is a global ICT integrator with over 135 years of history. With approximately 4,000 colleagues across Europe, Asia Pacific, and Latin America, we reimagine the digital future, one customer at a time. Our secure-by-design portfolio spans Digital Workplace, Business Applications, Smart Spaces, Multi-Cloud, Field & Onsite Support, Service Desk, Network Infrastructure, and Security & Compliance, serving more than 1,400 customers in both public and private sectors.As the founder and leading member of the Global Workspace Alliance, Getronics delivers consistent IT services across 185 countries, providing a single point of contact, contract, and billing entity while maintaining the flexibility and cultural fit of a local partner.
Why Join Us?Work with cutting-edge technology in a supportive and innovative environment.Be part of a global team with opportunities for growth and development.Contribute to exciting projects that impact customers worldwide.
Ready to Make an Impact?Apply now to become a part of the Getronics team and help us shape the future of digital innovation!

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:

At Transporeon - A Trimble Company - we embrace transformation and change in total sync with one another. title: Founding Senior Data Engineer - SaaS Unicorn, 100% Remote
description:
Job descriptionSaaS ‚Äì Blue Ocean Supply Chain Unicorn, 100% Remote
Our client is a rapidly expanding supply chain startup, which has recently secured significant funding, is in search of a Senior Data Engineer to work closely with the CTO - in founding their new Data Team. This position is crucial to the company‚Äôs growth as it strives to launch innovative features that will provide immediate value to its customers.
The platform is designed to elevate the logistics industry, transforming routine tasks into strategic operations enhanced by AI. By offering a turnkey SaaS solution with no implementation costs or extensive customizations, the company enables small carriers to adopt digital transformation at an affordable rate, avoiding the complexities associated with traditional ERP or TMS systems.

Position Overview:We are looking for a passionate and skilled Software Engineer who thrives on solving complex problems that have a global impact.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining comprehensive solutions that align with our business objectives. You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software products.
As the most senior member of this newly developing team - you will be building the foundation for the Data Department in the organization - with autonomy over methodology and the tools that the company will be using going forward. 
Responsibilities:Develop and execute plans for feature implementation and system maintenance/upgrades.Participate actively in engineering efforts to enhance product experiences.Support team members through pair programming, code reviews, and mentorship.Adapt to changing priorities and work toward reducing technical debt, while communicating the need for larger refactors when necessary.Understand the purpose behind features and ensure clarity among team members by asking the right questions.Break down large tasks into smaller, actionable parts and structure code to anticipate scalability and maintenance needs.Promote open communication, adapt your style to suit the audience, and share credit for collaborative efforts.Engage closely with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to gather and refine project requirements.Maintain an iterative feedback loop with product managers and designers throughout the development process to ensure alignment with evolving needs.Communicate technical concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical team members, tailoring your approach as needed.Lead discussions and Q&A sessions to address any uncertainties about the technical direction of projects.
Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Master‚Äôs degree is preferred.Proficiency in at least one programming language, with a preference for Python.Experience with ETLs, data migrations, and both SQL and NoSQL databases.Familiarity with distributed event systems such as Kafka or AWS SES.Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git) and collaborative development workflows.Experience in quality assurance and performance debugging.Experience serving machine learning models in a cloud environment.Experience working as a Data Engineer within a cross-functional or data-focused team.
Compensation:A competitive package & chance to make a big impact, in a thriving startupComprehensive health and wellness benefits.Opportunities for professional development and mentorship.A dynamic, innovative, and inclusive work environment.Flexible work-from-anywhere policy.

title: Internship/Placement in Software Engineering
description:
At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation.

Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive.

Join F5‚Äôs Mission for a Safer Digital World! 

Ready to dive into the world of cybersecurity and make a real impact? The F5 NGINX Business Unit is looking for passionate computer science students to join our dynamic Software Engineering Internship Program in February/March 2025.

This internship opportunity is designed to provide you with a hands-on opportunity to help us build real-world solutions across our enterprise and open-source projects, in a range of teams such as backend systems engineering or DevOps.

You‚Äôll collaborate with leading software engineers to undertake challenging projects that will provide the opportunity for you to learn about new technologies, develop or enhance your skills, and help making the internet a safer place for everyone.

Whilst you are part of the program you will not only develop your technical skills but we also provide you with training to improve your soft skills. And to ensure you get the support you need, you‚Äôll be assigned a personal mentor.

Your Typical Day May Involve:

Work with a team in either Development, Testing, or DevOps in real-world projectsWork closely with your team to design, code, and test robust, scalable, loosely coupled components that integrate into public and private cloud infrastructures and servicesWork on automating operational aspect of the services running in the cloudFocus efforts to optimize on-time delivery of features and fixes with high qualityWork in an agile environment that enables development teams to iterate rapidly


You Are:

Currently studying for a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering or related fieldKeen to apply your programming knowledge in Python, Go, C#, or Java, and further grow your technical skills.


We‚Äôd Love to Hear from You If You:

Have a desire to learn new skills and develop yourself for future growthHave the aptitude to learn and adapt quickly to working in a constantly evolving environmentAre highly motivated and goal-orientated to succeed both individually and as part of a highly successful fast growing team and company


Why You Will Love Working For Us:

Training - You'll receive training to develop your technical as well as soft skillsWellness Weekends - we give you additional two days off per quarter (Friday and Monday) for you to regenerate. It's an 8 additional days per yearContinuous Learning - you'll have the responsibility and autonomy to learn every day as we provide many opportunities for learningMentoring - you'll get support from an experienced employee throughout the internship programAnnual intern showcase event - you'll get the chance to work with other interns within the EMEA region on projects, present them to our leadership team and other F5 employees, and have fun togetherFlexibility - we offer an hybrid working environment including home-based work and collaboration time at our local office.Permanent role ‚Äì if you enjoy working with us there is the possibility of converting into a permanent employee as we always try to stay with our best interns.


This will be a paid Internship for 8-9 months starting in February or March 2025.

Don‚Äôt miss your chance to make the internet a safer place while boosting your career. Apply now and be part of something bigger!

The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.

Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. F5 offers a variety of reasonable accommodations for candidates. Requesting an accommodation is completely voluntary. F5 will assess the need for accommodations in the application process separately from those that may be needed to perform the job. Request by contacting accommodations@f5.com.

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in coding, developing test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases, and debugging. Experience in coding/automation using Python, Shell, or Go. Experience building testing automation solutions. Experience with people leadership and management.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field.2 years of experience providing technical leadership and leading projects (e.g., test, release, etc.).Experience in Android programming (e.g., Java or Kotlin).Experience with test development or test automation.Experience in Android test environments.

About The Job

At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.

You use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote proper engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, testability, accessibility, privacy, and other advanced quality concepts across products.

The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google‚Äôs artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.

Responsibilities

Lead the utilization or development of automation tools or scripts to improve product and engineering health.Define the test framework, test preconditions, and other test control and reporting functions to enable others to test functionality. Ramp up a Test and Validation team within the Pixel GPU Software group in Warsaw from scratch.Work with executive engineers and stakeholders to identify and plan steps improving general and problem specific test coverage for Pixel devices.Define long-term test and validation plans for Pixel GPU Software.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Fund Data Specialist
description:
About the role:

The Managed Investment Data Team requires a Senior Data Consultant to drive Morningstar data in the German, Swiss and Austrian market. The employee will collaborate with all global and local teams. The Data Consultant is responsible for the relationships with asset managers and other actors of the industry, demonstrate our capabilities and quality, and return the voice of the local market to the global and central teams. The consultant is the main point of contact between our centralized data team and the asset managers. The position will be based in our Frankfurt office.

Job responsibilities:

Representing and explaining the Data workflows, processes, and methodologies (ESG, SFDR, MIFID and other regulatory requirements, Morningstar sustainability rating‚Ä¶) towards asset managers and clients.

Take ownership of acquiring and onboarding new data sets as we keep expanding the quality of analytics delivered to clients.Partner with product, sales & support teams to help resolve client data questions.Collaborate with members of the Data & Development Centres and global teams to align priorities based upon local business requirements.Business analysis on market and regulatory changes to design data collection plans & meet client and industry needs.Monitor competitor behaviour, trends, and services to ensure Morningstar is well placed to act on any opportunities that may arise. 


Qualifications:

Fluent English and German; other European language preferable3- 5 years of relevant experienceSolid understanding of the local German, Swiss and Austrian investment management industry.Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills.Significant experience within a financial data role.


Nice to Have

Data expert on investment data points, processes, methodologies, calculations and different fund structuresPrevious experience in project management and relationship management roleExtra European language


Hybrid Work

Morningstar‚Äôs hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We‚Äôve found that we‚Äôre at our best when we‚Äôre purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

title: Senior API Solutions Engineer (Python, Node.JS)
description:
Binance is the leading global blockchain ecosystem and cryptocurrency infrastructure provider whose suite of financial products includes the world‚Äôs largest digital-asset exchange.

Our mission is to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

If you‚Äôre looking for a fast-paced, mission-driven organization where opportunities to learn and excel are endless, then Binance is the place for you.

We are looking for a motivated individual to join the Matching Engine Tech team as a Technical Solutions Engineer (API Specialist). This role is a combination of Software Development duties and the Binance Trading API community-facing role.

You will be working in a fast-paced environment with a small team, covering the largest clients of the exchange all around the world.

The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and a strong command of programming and exchange API mechanics, with a strong interest to work in a community facing role.

Location is flexible.

Fluency in other popular languages would be of an advantage, for communication with customersExcellent communications skillsHighly self driven and disciplined Curiosity and drive to learn and try new things

Working at Binance

title: Data Scientist
description:
This job is with E.ON UK, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.  

E.ON ƒåesk√° republika, s.r.o. provides professional service and consulting to all other companies of the E.ON Czech Group. The key services relate mainly to support and delivery of services in the areas of HR, IT, finance, legal, business administration and communication. Approximately a thousand managers, specialists, experts and administrative staff work here to help drive the entire E.ON Group forward towards a modern, digital company that can easily meet the challenges of today's energy industry and succeed in the Czech energy market. We are looking for experts in the position of "Data Scientist / Mathematical Modeling" to join the Energy Markets Hub team at E.ON Energy Markets, formally under E.ON Czech Republic. Our team of experts focuses on mathematical modeling, energy-economic issues, and data science. Our main role is to understand and manage market risks for retail sales. We use modern technologies to enhance our work and continuously improve and bring new solutions. Our goal is sustainable energy and supporting business decisions using modern statistical methods. We offer this position as a full-time or part-time job opportunity, and we welcome everyone to apply regardless of their background.

What will you be doing with us? 

The foundation of the role is to understand the dynamics of energy markets, risks, and fundamentals. You will create data-driven solutions from design to commercial deployment. You will be involved in the continuous improvement of machine learning methods and their applications for predicting energy prices, energy consumption and production, with applications for risk assessment and portfolio analysis. You will be programming in Microsoft Azure in close collaboration with the DevOps team. 

Our Tech Stack

We currently use typed Python 3.10 (pytest, flake8, and mypy in our continuous integration process). For data analysis and machine learning, we use pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, and other related tools. We use FastAPI, Dash, and Streamlit for web services. Our cloud infrastructure is built on Microsoft Azure, which includes Azure ML, Azure DevOps, Data Bricks, Kubernetes and Snowflake 

What we need from you?

You don't have to be Superman but there are a few qualities / knowledge we need from you ...

successfully completed university degree or comparable qualification in natural science, mathematics, economics or a related technical discipline proven experience in programming, preferably in Python strong commercial mindset, which you combine with an analytical and structured way of thinking and strong motivation to deliver commercial results excellent communication skills in combination with assertiveness and engagement statistics enthusiastic embracing opportunities to learn and develop yourself through working with colleagues across all of E.ON‚Äôs operating regions excellent spoken and written communication skills in English, another European language is seen as a plus place of work: Prague 

Please apply with CV in English.

It is necessary to have a valid work visa if you are a foreigner to apply for this role.

We offer

A crucial role in shaping E.ON‚Äôs future in a green and sustainable energy world. A space to develop ideas and create personal impact. An agile and hands-on environment. An opportunity to work with colleagues in multiple E.ON operating regions. 5 weeks of holiday You won't just leave home with your paycheck, but also with pleasant benefits. Flexible working hours. 

job ID: 222997

Start: as agreed Are you interested in this job position and are you wondering where to send your CV? Just click on the blue box Login and create an online application in our database. If you have any questions, you can contact David Kapin: David Kapin, tel.: 705 868 630

E.ON is commited to equal opportunities and actively promotes diversity, equality and flexibility.

E.ON is a privately-owned international energy company. Our 75 000 colleagues in 15 countries work daily towards the improvement of technical innovations and user-friendly customer solutions for the new energy world. We are the first large energy company to focus more heavily upon the energy of the future through our three business areas of energy networks, renewable energies and customer solutions.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Looking for a new challenge? Great! We are looking for you, as an ambitious professional with a clear view, ready to build tomorrow‚Äôs best digital products.

Are you the one?

Your role 

You think innovatively and love to solve problems. You are an excellent communicator and love to collaborate with the customer to make a difference. You are analytical and love to tackle complex problems, break them down into manageable parts, and analyze data systematically. You have a strong sense of responsibility. Working independently and in a team to deliver quality is what you do. 


Your profile 

You are familiar with the basic principles of the world of Agile (Scrum/Kanban). You collect and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations. Creating compelling data visualizations and reports to effectively convey findings and insights to stakeholders. You design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses and quantify the impact of data-driven solutions. You possess proficiency in analytical programming languages, including Python, (Py-)Spark, and R, and have the capability to work with libraries such as keras or tensorflow. Commited to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and related technologies. 


Your experience

You possess a minimum of 3 years of experience in the role of a Data Scientist. You understand the importance of leveraging information to drive value for organizations, and your previous experiences have equipped you with the relevant skills to do so. You can give presentations with confidence and you communicate clearly. You have advanced experience in pattern recognition and predictive modeling


What we offer

Our knowledge sessions help employees gain new insights from experts who share our values so we can come together as one team tackling tough challenges with high confidence. Next to the passion to work hard for success, we like to play hard! Look no further than our various social events! These activities will help you feel at home in the office quickly with other colleagues. One of which - our annual ski trip - is legendary, it‚Äôs one event where people always look forward to because there‚Äôs plenty of time spent together outside in the Austrian mountains. What better way to get to know your teammates than on a winter holiday?

The above perks are of course supplemented with an attractive salary, a range of fringe benefits including a premium company car, fuel card, group and hospitalization insurance and numerous group discounts.

About The Value Hub

The Value Hub is een ambitieus ecosysteem van business- en technologie-experts die zich richten op het ondersteunen van organisaties bij het ontwerpen en implementeren van partnerships met klanten. Dit om succesvol digitale producten te bouwen en te lanceren. Meer weten? Lees hier verder!

&Work will help you

The Value Hub has partnered with &Work. &Work understands that it is important to work in a place where you are valued, where you can develop further and where you are given the space to grow. title: Backend Developer Intern
description:
Campeœån Gaming is an innovative Greek iGaming Hub with offices in Athens, Thessaloniki, and Nicosia, boasting 7 years of expertise and a strong international presence. We stand at the forefront of the iGaming industry, delivering a world-class gaming experience through our immersive technology stack and operational services.
We are a diverse, dynamic team of over 160 Campeones, representing more than 10 nationalities, from around the world. Our core philosophy, "We are our People," reflects our values of diversity, equity, inclusion, and transparency, earning us recognition as one of the Best Workplaces in Greece for 2021, 2023, and 2024 and being certified as a Great Place to Work for 4 consecutive years.
We are also proud of ranking 6th Best Workplace for Women Hellas 2024 and 2nd Best Workplace in Tech Hellas for 2023.
Internship Program ‚Äì The Next Campeœån 2nd Cycle
At Campeœån Gaming, we are committed to empowering the younger generation, bridging the gap between education and the job market, and offering young talent the opportunity to shape their future and gain invaluable practical experience.
"The Next Campeœån" is our award-winning paid Internship Program, designed to support the younger generation as they take their first steps into the business world or switch their career in the iGaming industry.
Following the success of the 1st Cycle in Athens and Thessaloniki, we expand the 2nd Cycle in Cyprus, further enhancing the program‚Äôs inclusive nature and the opportunities it offers.
During the 3-month paid Internship Program, interns will develop both soft and hard skills, applying their academic knowledge to real-world business scenarios. Through tailored mentorship and continuous learning opportunities, they will embark on a transformative journey that equips interns for future career success.
Let‚Äôs start with the role
As a Backend Intern, you will be a vital member of our Programming & Development team and analyze and implement back-end solutions, backing up the team by integrating new features and conducting code reviews.
What you will do:
Assist with the implementation of back-end solutions in alignment with business requirements.Help with the integration of new gaming and payment providers into our systems.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including front-end developers, designers, and product managers, to deliver comprehensive i-gaming solutions.Stay updated on industry regulations and compliance standards related to iGaming.
What you will bring:
Education from Greek or foreign universities.Fluency in English, both written and oral.Analytical thinking with problem-solving abilitiesFamiliar with Java, GraphQL, Redis,Postgres.

title: Software Development Engineer with Data Analytics Focus
description:
Company Description

Tesco Business Services & Technology (TBST) and Tesco Technology were established in Budapest in 2019, supporting the Tesco retail business in Central Europe and the Tesco Group. TBST and Tesco Technology are part of our global business services and technology organisations within Tesco.

In the UK, Ireland, India, Hungary, Poland, the Czech Republic we operate to offer great value to our customers every day.

In Budapest, our Technology hub currently employs near 100 ‚Äì and a growing number ‚Äì of highly trained software engineers and managers who are implementing global software development projects across fulfilment, supplier and product management, online and in-store loss prevention, and our online grocery sites.

Our goal is to bring significant changes to the market by using the latest technologies. We are focusing on a large variety of modern technologies from the backend space and frontend to UX, UI and even data science and engineering.

We are aiming to drive business value through innovation and to create an organization that fundamentally transforms the retail environment.

We put accountability and ownership on the individuals and their teams in order to run a horizontal organization where teamwork is extremely important. With an end-to-end approach, we offer our colleagues opportunities for self-development and career growth.

Our colleagues are the key to our success at Tesco. We foster an environment of openness and collaboration. We draw from the diversity, knowledge and experience of our colleagues. It is all about equal opportunities, no matter who you are, or where you come from, you can get on at Tesco.

Our teams consist of individuals who can truly make a difference. Focussing on building a world-class business services centre alongside cutting-edge technology capability, they are working towards our goal of serving our customers and colleagues a little better every day.

We are expanding our operations locally and we are looking for the best talent.

 Let‚Äôs {code} the together at {Tesco Technology}! 

Additional Information

What's in it for you

Tesco is a diverse and exciting employer, dedicated to being #aplacetogeton, providing career-defining opportunities to all of our colleagues. If you chose to join our business, we will provide you with:


Permanent contract from the go ‚Äì as a sign of our trust in your abilitiesYearly salary bonus ‚Äì based on both individual and business performanceMinimum 25 days of paid holiday/year for everyoneExtensive private healthcare - complex care package including a wide range of specialists, medical services, and free flu vaccinationCafeteria Relocation Help - professional service to secure relevant working permits and other necessary documentsLearning opportunities - certified technical training and learning platforms like Udemy, Pluralsight, and O'ReillyReferral BonusA learning culture and excellent opportunities to develop your career within your chosen field or something altogether newVaried and exciting projects to play a part in ‚Äì there is always something new and exciting in the pipeline


Tesco is committed to celebrating diversity and everyone is welcome at Tesco. As a Disability Confident Employer, we‚Äôre committed to providing a fully inclusive and accessible recruitment process, allowing candidates the opportunity to thrive and inform us of any reasonable adjustments they may require.

If that sounds exciting, then we'd love to hear from you!

Job Description

As a Software Development Engineer focusing on data analytics, I have strong mathematical and statistical skills. I have experience with Data Analytics tools, data analysis and visualisation techniques.

I'm expected to contribute to projects by completing tasks assigned to me with little guidance. I take ownership and accountability for developing the products in my domain. I participate in activities that build capability across the organisation: coaching and mentoring existing colleagues and interviewing/hiring new colleagues. In this role, I'm also expected to quickly learn new tools, methodologies, and best practices (e.g., version control and test-driven development).

I am starting to produce my work by understanding the team's problems and am beginning to support other engineers with their delivery and development. I prioritise sharing my skills and knowledge. I also prioritise quality of work, helping your team to set the standard continually. I understand and apply best practices within Tesco and across the industry.

In this job, I am accountable for

In this role, my work will focus on analyzing sophisticated business problems, identifying and collecting the required data, and validating business hypotheses via statistical methods for technology products at scale.

As a Software Development Engineer focusing on data analytics, I'm responsible for:


Completing Data Analytics tasks with little guidance.Contributing to framing Data Analytics problems and designing complex software systems.


As a Software Development Engineer focusing on data analytics, I will have the opportunity to work on problems in the Loss Prevention domain, minimizing losses due to theft, fraud and operational errors in stores and online space. I will build solutions with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers.

This is a hands-on position where I must demonstrate my analytical approach to solving sophisticated problems. I must understand complex business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support. I will work with data lakes and build data streams from data sources to the lakes. I will extract, clean and analyse data from several sources, including data lakes, logs and metrics. I will design, modify and apply statistical models to tackle business problems, a core component of the role.

I am comfortable supporting other engineers in their delivery and taking the lead on significant components or small services as appropriate. At this level, I display a degree of ownership for the work conducted by the team and am experienced enough to know when I need support. I can identify risks and raise these as appropriate.

I contribute to raising the quality bar of my team‚Äôs codebase, both in the code I produce and by helping peer review code written by other team members. I proactively provide constructive and valuable feedback on their code to other team members.

I understand best practices across the industry and Tesco architectural standards well. I make sure to put these principles and standards into practice when completing my work. I know the best testing and deployment strategies in the industry and have a view on the suitability of implementing these within my team. I am comfortable working in a group context and can communicate technical concepts to key stakeholders.

Qualifications

We are looking for ambitious individuals with a mix of statistics, programming and data analytics skills.

An ideal candidate will have a scientific mentality and the ability to ask and answer the right questions. A higher degree in a mathematical, scientific, engineering or computer science field and a proven understanding of mathematics and statistical principles are preferable.

Strong programming experience is expected in Java. Python programming and SparkSQL, Tableau, Alteryx experience is a plus.

Successfully had an impact across a software engineering team. Demonstrated experience designing, developing and running components of software systems. Experience implementing standard design and architectural patterns. Experience supporting other engineers in their work.

title: Automation System Engineer
description:
Are you driven by the desire to see your ideas come to life? Join us in an exciting, technology-focused environment where your expertise will make a real impact. title: Fullstack Engineer - LiveOps Automation
description:
Description

Scopely is looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our LiveOps Automation team in Spain on a hybrid or remote basis.

At Scopely, we care deeply about what we do and want to inspire play every day - whether in our work environments alongside our talented colleagues or through our deep connections with our communities of players.

We are a global team of game lovers who are developing, publishing and innovating the mobile games industry, connecting millions of people worldwide daily.

Scopely's Midcore Division operates the award winning and industry leading Star Trek Fleet Command, Marvel Strike Force and WWE Champions games. We're moving cross platform and have two exciting and ambitious games in development to further strengthen our position and reputation within the industry.

What You Will Do

You‚Äôll be joining the LiveOps Automation team at Scopely. We are responsible for building a sophisticated suite of LiveOps tools driven by Machine Learning (ML) automation and decision-making. This will change how Midcore manages its games in the future. We are looking for a creative and highly motivated Fullstack Engineer to join the Scopely LiveOps Automation Team. This is a Fullstack role with focus on backend technologies to serve as the integration glue of Live Services ML powered toolsuite to different gaming platforms.

Work with LiveOps and other development teams in each game to implement new featuresBuilding API services that are highly scalable and consistent to support ML capabilitiesWork with other developers to implement tools to empower our Live Operators and Game Design teams in the creation of new and exciting game-play experiencesLive Services toolsuite support & troubleshootingContributing to technical plans and discussing the workflows and requirements with stakeholders


What We‚Äôre Looking For

Deep understanding of backend technologies development and best practicesHighly experienced delivering production quality, highly performant web application platformsStrong knowledge of PythonExperience on at least one major public cloud providers (AWS / Azure / GCP)Experience writing and maintaining automated unit, integration and end-to-end testsFull understanding of how to build and deploy RESTful servicesFull understanding of Relational and Non-Relational databasesYou've developed and co-designed web frontend tools and interfacesYou‚Äôve developed secure web applications with RBAC controlsYou‚Äôre a great tech communicator who knows how to share knowledge with non-technical peopleYou have a desire to seek out and take on user feedback to drive world class application development


Bonus Points

Experience writing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for web applicationsExperience on Serverless architecturesExperience working with ML systems and data pipelinesYou‚Äôve mentored less experienced team members


About Us

Scopely is a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," ‚ÄúStar Trek‚Ñ¢ Fleet Command,‚Äù ‚ÄúStumble Guys,‚Äù ‚ÄúMARVEL Strike Force,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYahtzee¬Æ With Buddies,‚Äù among others.

Scopely creates, publishes, and live-operates immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer‚Ñ¢ experience across multiple platforms--from mobile, web, PC and beyond.

Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform, Playgami, that supports one of the most diversified portfolios in the games industry.

Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies,‚Äù Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting game experiences that players enjoy for years.

Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents.

Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 for $4.9 billion, and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy.

For more information on Scopely, visit: scopely.com

Notice to candidates: Scopely, Inc and its affiliates will never request payment or ask for financial information as a condition for applying to a position or receiving an offer of employment.All official Scopely, Inc. recruiters only use email domains that end with @scopely.com.

Our official website is www.scopely.com. Please only apply to positions posted on our official website and ensure the recruiter only communicates via the official email domain.

Should you have any questions or encounter any fraudulent requests/emails/websites, please immediately contact [email protected].

title: Data Scientist / ML-Engineer
description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies.

Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

Algoteque is seeking a talented Data Scientist / ML-Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves working on innovative projects for our clients, focusing on deep learning, model optimization, and production deployment.

Responsibilities

Deep Learning: Utilize deep learning techniques for tasks such as image, text, and video classification using neural networks.

Model Development: Collaborate with the team to develop, train, and research new and existing machine learning models.

ML-Ops: Implement and maintain ML-Ops practices to ensure models are effectively brought into production.

Data Science Ecosystem: Utilize the Python data science ecosystem, including tools like pandas and numpy, to analyze and manipulate data.

Feedback Loops: Develop and implement feedback loops to generate new training data as part of the machine learning lifecycle.

Best Practices: Apply best practices in machine learning and data science to ensure robust and reliable models.

Profile / Requirements

Deep Learning: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow.

Python: Proficiency in Python and familiarity with its data science ecosystem, including pandas and numpy.

Statistics: Solid foundations in statistics to support data analysis and model validation.

ML-Ops: Experience in ML-Ops, including bringing models into production and maintaining them.

Production Models: Proven experience in implementing and optimizing machine learning models for production environments.

Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on complex tasks.

Preferred Qualities

Innovative Thinker: Ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions to complex problems.

Team Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with other team members and stakeholders.

Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying updated with the latest developments in machine learning and data science.

What We Offer

Innovative Projects: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects for leading clients.

Professional Growth: Continuous learning and development opportunities.

Flexible Work Environment: Remote work.

If you are a dedicated Data Scientist / ML-Engineer with a passion for deep learning and model optimization, we would love to hear from you.

AO2901

title: Managed Services Engineer
description:
We are seeking a Managed Services Engineer to join our Managed Services team and work with our clients to deliver high-quality solutions. The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years of experience in automation, with a strong analytical and problem-solving mindset. You should be eager to learn and grow in the field of consulting, with a passion for solving complex business and driving client success.

General responsibilities and tasks for this role:
 Ensure prompt ticket follow up and action for L2 issues, ensuring active work toward resolution while time counting and prompt response to stop clock when need input or action from client; ensure clear info in all tickets and knowledge base update after ticket closure.
 Use your data analytics skills to analyze the automated business processes of our clients and identify and eliminate potential ‚Äútroublemakers‚Äù before they become problems
 Technically extend, improve, and customize automation solutions while maintaining close and regular contact with our clients
 Collaborate with L1 support and development teams to address complex technical challenges.
 Conduct routine maintenance checks on existing automations to ensure optimal performance.
 Coordinate operations and maintenance activities for large client accounts
 Test and optimize the software design, code, and reusability of our automation artifacts

 Provide clear and concise communication to end-users and stakeholders regarding issues resolutions and maintenance schedules
 Consult, Provide expertise, guidance, and participation during the Onboarding and Service Transition of clients 


Requirements
 Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in UiPath, any additional OCR/IDP knowledge is a big plus.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and creatively.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 Experience in programming IT solutions, preferably .NET, C#, VBA, Java, Powershell or Python.

 Native Swedish Skills that are a big plus

 Experience in process consulting.
 Experience in IT support or IT projects.


BenefitsBenefits
 Competitive salary package
 30 days paid vacation
 Recognition and reward for individual and team achievements 
 Regular team events
 You‚Äôll love coming to our cozy office to meet your colleagues

title: Back End Engineer
description:
Back End Engineer @ instacar 

At instacar, we're not just transforming the way people move‚Äîwe're pioneering the future of transportation and mobility. Established in 2018 and officially launched in September 2019, instacar is the first fully digitized mobility-as-a-service scale-up. Our vision is to be the ultimate one-stop mobility app, providing comprehensive services for all drivers. Our mission is to revolutionise perceptions of new - age mobility through technology and a customer-centric approach. At instacar, we are focused beyond just leasing cars, we are dedicated to serving drivers.

Our Core Values:

instacar is guided by our core values: Be Fair, Be Bold, Be Patient. We're committed to fairness in all our collaborations, bold innovation and patience in our growth.

Our Milestones:

In less than five years, we've achieved significant milestones, establishing four prominent instacar points, investing in micro-mobility, and developing our own tech tools like instafleet, a fleet management solution, crafted in-house to streamline operations. Additionally, our all-in-one app provides instadrivers with a centralised platform to manage every aspect of their vehicle subscription seamlessly.

Why Join #instateam?

As we experience rapid growth rates of over 100% annually, supported by esteemed investors like Autohellas, Elikonos Capital, Olympia Group, and Velocity Partners, and aiming for a revenue of 20+ million euros by 2024, we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals to join our #instateam. At instacar, your voice matters, your creativity thrives, and your impact is tangible. With a human-centered approach and an unwavering commitment to excellence, instacar offers an environment where innovation flourishes, and every contribution is valued.

Your Role: 

For our Engineering Team, we're on the lookout for an adept Back End Engineer with a specialization in Golang to become an integral part of our Back End team. Your role will be pivotal in executing the back-end aspects of large scale applications, leveraging the latest technological advancements. As a valued member of our team, you'll collaborate closely with talented colleagues in a supportive and inclusive environment. Together, we tackle challenges head-on, leveraging our collective expertise to continuously refine and enhance our applications.

What you will need to do: 

Develop and Maintain Backend Services: Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance backend services, ensuring our applications run smoothly and efficientlyCollaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with frontend developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust solutions that meet business requirementsOptimize and Scale: Identify bottlenecks and optimize existing code to improve application performance and scalabilityEnsure Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, and testable code. Implement unit tests and participate in code reviews to ensure the highest qualityStay Updated: Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in backend development, and suggest new tools and technologies to enhance our development process


Requirements

Degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related fieldMinimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in back-end developmentProficiency in backend programming languages, particularly Go (Golang)Experience with RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)Familiarity with database technologies (SQL, NoSQL)Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesAbility to collaborate effectively within a team environment


Benefits

Ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment

We offer:

Collaborate with industry experts in a supportive and inclusive environmentA competitive benefits package, including premium private health & life insurance programAdditional perks such as significant discounts on various health, exercise, and nutrition services, a birthday

gift card, and more.

Opportunities for career growth and advancement with a commitment to promoting from withinExperience firsthand the convenience of instacar with 10 free rental daysExclusive cost rates for renting a car from instacar, because why drive anything else?

instacar is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to diversity, inclusion, and creating an environment where

all employees can thrive, regardless of background or identity.

If you're ready to contribute your skills and expertise to our dynamic team, we'd love to hear from you!

Fasten your seatbelt and join this ride, with our core values as your fuel: Be FAIR. Be BOLD. Be PATIENT.

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
Who we areA coaching and learning ecosystem for talented and passionate tech professionals where you can find your next career goal in a diverse and multidisciplinary environment. At Agile Actors, you will experience continuous growth and development through coaching, learning, and practice! An innovative self-paced personal development and rewarding model will support your advancement along with the necessary tools, appropriate learning material, and real projects from organizations that are leaders of the industry (both domestic and international), such as RedHat, Swissquote, Austrian Post, etc, cultivate a continuous growth mindset!Be part of both the customer's and the Agile Actor's team, providing high-quality deliverables for the former and contributing to the cultivation of an inclusive and developmental culture in the latter!Who we are looking for We are looking for passionate, multi-talented Java Software Engineers, with a strong technology background, as well as a great propensity for creative problem-solving. Joining our teams, the successful candidates will work closely with domestic and international development teams in exciting and challenging projects across multiple domains.


Requirements

A self-sufficient starter with a passion for technology coupled with insightful skills and breakthrough ideas is a must! We are looking for people with a good understanding of core Computer Science concepts and problem solving skills who can put this knowledge to practice, creating efficient, maintainable and secure software.
Required technical expertise : Experience with Java 8+. Strong computer science skills (OOA/OOD, data structures, algorithms) Good understanding of relational databases concepts and knowledge of SQL. Experience with build tools (Maven, Gradle) and Git. Knowledge of basic design patterns and principles and understanding of how to write clean and maintainable code. 
For more experienced colleagues, we are also looking for : Experience with at least one Java framework (preferably Spring 4+ or JEE 6+) and an ORM framework. Experience in implementing REST or SOAP APIs. Experience with automated testing (unit tests, functional tests and integration tests) and CI / CD experience is a plus. 
Finally, in addition to your technical skills and knowledge, we pay attention to the following : Precise and efficient communication skills in English (written and verbal). A disciplined approach and ability to work with cross-functional multicultural teams. A desire to keep learning, growing and teaching. 

Benefits

Why join us?Join us if you enjoy being part of a people-centered culture that empowers you to work on the most important product; yourself! Continuously grow with the support of tech experts and maintain a matching skill set to market needs. 
 Personal Development Plan crafted with your dedicated coach  360¬∞ continuous feedback model; drive your developmental pace  Unlimited personal training/learning budget to cover all your career developmental needs  Chapters (internal communities)-share knowledge, create training material, help others grow and shape our technological future  Vast roster of customers/accounts, providing more opportunities for growth and development within the AA ecosystem  Onboarding Buddy-Continuous support from day 1! A dedicated buddy to help you navigate through the first few weeks  Tailored remuneration package according to your level and expertise  Private Health Care Insurance for physical wellbeing  Professional helpline for our professionals and their families for mental wellbeing  Flexible working conditions (fully remote work according to assigned account) 
By clicking "Apply" for this Job, you agree that you have read and accepted our Data Protection Statement relating to job applicants and that you provide your consent for the processing of your personal data for the purposes described therein.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Medius is a Swedish origin company but currently we have offices spread around the world - Europe, North America, and Australia. We provide our solutions as SaaS.

We work with Microsoft Azure, ASP.Net Core, React, TypeScript, Azure DevOps.

Medius is a leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions.

Spend management doesn‚Äôt ring a bell? This term describes the process from placing an order through its delivery, verification, invoicing to its payment. Our products help companies at every step of the purchasing process, increasing their security and speeding it up. We use latest advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to automatically capture and process invoices.

The most important thing to our organization is our employees ‚Äì and we really mean it!

In Cracow office, the heart of our company, we work in R&D, DevOps, Customer Success, HR and IT, we are already around 100 people and still growing!

We currently look for a few experienced software engineers to join our teams!

What will you do? 

Take a key part in the development of our true cloud service based on Azure, .NET Framework/Core, React, TypeScript Choose the best technologies and solutions to build our cloud service - the future of the product will be in your hands Provide solutions for over 1 000 clients over the world using our cloud service every day Working in a cross-functional team of professionals who really care about their work and support each other 

What kind of experience should you have?

Solid knowledge in C# and .NET technologies Commercial experience in frontend frameworks like React (or similar) and JavaScript Experience in relational databases Experience in code testing practices Experience in designing REST web services 

Nice to have

Experience with DDD, CQRS Experience in Azure CloudExperience in Python

What are we offering? 

International environment with Swedish working culture Spacious office near Rondo Grzeg√≥rzeckie in a unique building (no open spaces) Equipped kitchen with all things that help (tea, coffee, milk, Nutella, etc.) Individual training budget: 3 000 net PLN + 5 days off Additional 1 day off for your birthday (B-Day)Multikafeteria program, private healthcare (LuxMed), life insurance Integration Parties (Summer Party, Xmas Party, Game Board Party, and other spontaneous events) Team building budget Hybrid working model

Sounds interesting? If so, send your application!

Medius links invoice capture, processing, and payment to replace the worry and wondering of managing AP with calm and confidence. Medius goes far beyond basic automation by using artificial intelligence to do most of the work ‚Äì so invoices get coded, approved and paid; customers get to go home and rest easy; and businesses can trust budgets and forecasts.

For more information, please visit medius.com.
