title: (SENIOR) DATA ENGINEER (M/F/D)
description:
'- Full-time in Vienna as soon as possible -

Become part of a revolutionary change! We have decided to do something incredible. We're transforming our business towards a smoke-free future and it's not just about establishing a strong brand - the excitement is about building something new, innovative and unprecedented.

Big changes bring big opportunities: wherever you join us, at Philip Morris Austria you'll be given the freedom to work on new and innovative solutions and to advance your career in very different directions. Become part of our vision and join our Data Intelligence Team in Vienna.

WE OFFER YOU:


 Employees are our top priority. Within the framework of a coordinated development plan, it is our goal to promote and advance you in the best possible way - always with your individual situation in mind. Start-up mentality in a large corporation. As part of the biggest transformation in the history of Philip Morris International, you will enjoy the benefits of a global company, international exchange and that with a great, dynamic and motivated team, with flat hierarchies and the chance to take ownership of yourself and your ideas. An all-in employment contract with flexible working hours, a wide range of benefits, demanding activities and exciting challenges are an integral part of our everyday working life. We offer you an attractive basic salary of at least ‚Ç¨ 65,000/year gross, with the willingness to overpay in line with the market depending on experience and qualifications - regardless of gender. We are the first international enterprise to be Equal Salary certified.


THE ‚ÄúDATA INTELLIGENCE‚Äù TEAM:

We are looking for a ‚Äú(Senior) Data Engineer‚Äù to join our ‚ÄúData Intelligence‚Äù team based in our headquarter in Vienna, Austria. The team is building analytics capabilities to enable data driven decision making with focus on delivering high quality data for different business functions. The Data warehouse platform currently hosted on AWS and levering the Microsoft Business Intelligence stack will be moved to Snowflake and Matillion.

THE ‚ÄúDATA ENGINEER‚Äù ROLE:

As a ‚Äú(Senior) Data Engineer‚Äù, you will join a growing team where you maintain and further enhance our Data warehouse using AWS services (S3 etc.), Terraform, Microsoft Services (SSIS, ETL, SQL etc.). You will also need good business understanding and communication skills for the day-to-day work with internal business functions, central expert teams, and vendors.

One of the key projects will be to lead the migration towards a global Enterprise Data Platform (Data Ocean) and leveraging tools such as Snowflake, Matillion and AWS.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Creating, Testing and Deploying Pipelines: Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines for efficient data ingestion, processing, and delivery. Ensure Data Completeness and Quality: Implement mechanisms to ensure data completeness, accuracy, and consistency across all data sources and processes. Optimizing and Maintaining Warehouse: Continuously improve the performance and scalability of the data warehouse, implementing optimization techniques and best practices. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation, striving for continuous improvement in data management practices. Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders, supporting data-driven decision-making processes. Work with Vendors: Collaborate with external vendors to integrate new data sources into the data ecosystem, ensuring seamless data flow and integration. Problem-Solving: Leveraging innovative approaches to optimize processes and enhance data quality. Proactive Role: Actively anticipate and resolve potential data issues before they escalate, demonstrating a proactive approach to data.


YOUR PROFILE:


 You have graduated in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field. You have at least 3 years of hands-on experience in a Data Engineer and Data analytics role, working with SQL Server, Snowflake, at least one ETL/ELT tool, S3 buckets, CI/CD pipelines, and Git. Proficient in SQL and with data warehousing concepts and best practices. Proficiency in at least one scripting/programming languages such as PowerShell or Python for data manipulation, automation, and scripting tasks. Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for deploying and managing data infrastructure and services. You are fluent in English, both written and spoken ‚Äì German is a plus Uphold professional conduct and integrity in all interactions, demonstrating accountability, respect, and professionalism, even in challenging situations. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities and tight deadlines. Demonstrate resilience in overcoming obstacles and setbacks, maintaining a positive attitude and persevering towards goals.


INTERESTED? APPLY ONLINE AT WWW.PMICAREERS.COM WITH YOUR CV, A LETTER OF MOTIVATION AND YOUR CERTIFICATES IN ENGLISH!

JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER

Philip Morris Austria GmbH, founded in Austria in 2012, is a company of Philip Morris International Inc. (PMI), the world's leading international tobacco company. The company's portfolio includes six of the world's top 15 brands of the world's leading cigarette brands. PMI sells its products in approximately 180 countries around the world. Philip Morris Austria GmbH is the market leader in the Austrian cigarette market. Philip Morris is also involved in the development and distribution of heat-not-burn tobacco products. Further information is available at www.pmi.com/markets/austria/de.

title: Data Analyst Intern, EMEA
description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Solutions & Innovation Analytics team, you won't just analyze data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions.

What You'll Do:

Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.Collaboration at Its Core: Work side by side with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that not only drive revenue but also foster client success.Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.Diverse Projects: From user need identification to scaling complex data solutions, your role will be dynamic, impactful, and full of opportunities to innovate.


Who You Are:

A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.

State-of-the-art open office with a cozy, collaborative vibe.Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.Choose your hours: start early or a bit later, as long as the work's done.Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

title: Automation Engineer
location: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
We are seeking an Automation Engineer based in our Headquarter in Hedehusene location to join our technology team.

Ready to help build a better future for generations to come?

In an ever-changing, fast paced world, we owe it to ourselves and our future generations to live life responsibly. At ROCKWOOL, we work relentlessly to enrich modern living through our innovative stone wool solutions.

Join us and make a difference!

Your Future Team

You will become part of Cold end Department. We are a diverse team of 13 colleagues with 6 different nationalities across 3 locations, mainly in Denmark and Poland. We have expertise in mechanical, electrical, automation and process engineering as well as project management.

We are working with all the various project phases within our own developed and produced machines and specification for Turnkey solutions, i.e. conceptual studies to design, testing, commissioning, troubleshooting and providing engineering support for our production companies.

What You Will Be Doing

As an Automation Specialist you will be programming the inhouse designed machines as well as securing integration of sub supplier equipment in the ROCKWOOL production line. The primary programming tool in this position will be Siemens S5, S7, TIA portal and WinCC. If you are enthusiastic about tuning the functionality of single machines and working with Human-Machine Interfaces (HMI) then this will be the position for you.

More specifically you will :

Study the ROCKWOOL processes and understand the high volume and complicated material flows.Design AutomationProgram PLCDevelop control strategy and functional descriptions.Conduct programming of the control systems ‚Äì or in other case review supplier code.Service and support ROCKWOOL production facilities onsite.Operate in the field between automation, mechanics, IT and processes, as the machines become more and more intelligent.Travel approx. 60-80 days per year (US, Asia, Europe)


What You Bring

You enjoy technical analysis and thrive when solving a technical issue. Always ensuring a high quality in your deliveries, you are not afraid to contribute your own ideas to our processes while remaining loyal to our overall standards. Moreover, your great communication skills ensure that you can navigate cross-functionally and at all levels of our organisation.

Furthermore, we imagine that you :

have experience and good skills within PLC and SCADA systems (Siemens perhaps also S5, else S7, TIA and WinCC)take ownership of the automation scope for our projects.develop, implement, maintain, and support software systems and utilize your proficiency in PLC, SCADA and control systems.lead the entire lifecycle of one of our projects, from designing, testing (FAT), installation, commissioning (SAT), and to apply full documentation.communicate with suppliers and follow up to secure compliance with specific design needs and our company automation design guidelines & standards.have a keen interest in IT program development.are curious on manufacturing processes and production efficiency.perhaps have knowledge of advanced servo configuration and programming of e.g. Lenze and Siemens Servo drives.are professional proficient in English (additional language would be an advantage)have the ability and are motivated by driving the task/process


Ready to apply? 

Apply with your CV and motivational letter before 15 September 2024. Do not hesitate to reach Hiring Manager Lars Bjerk√©n Section Manager, +45 29263371 or via lars.bjerken@rockwool.com.

Who We Are

We are the world leader in stone wool solutions. Founded in 1937 in Denmark, we transform volcanic rock into safe, sustainable products that help people and communities thrive. We are a global company with more than 12,000 employees, located in 40+ countries with 51 manufacturing facilities‚Ä¶ all focused on one common purpose ‚Äì to release the inherent power of stone to enrich modern living.

Sustainability is central to our business strategy. ROCKWOOL was one of the first companies to commit to actively contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG‚Äôs) framework and are actively committed to 11 SDGs, including SDG 14, Life Below Water. Through our partnership with the One Ocean Foundation and in connection with our sponsorship of the Denmark SailGP team, we will help raise awareness around ocean health challenges in an effort to accelerate solutions to protect it.

Diverse and Inclusive Culture

We want all our people to feel valued, respected, included and heard. We employ 79 different nationalities worldwide and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees, promote diversity, and work against all forms of discrimination among ROCKWOOL employees.

title: Commercial Data Analyst
description:
Are you passionate about transforming complex data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in analytical roles and have a knack for driving strategic decisions through data-driven analysis? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
At Flying Tiger Copenhagen, we're dedicated to using data to drive growth and optimize profitability. As a Commercial Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our Pricing & Analytics team, working closely with key stakeholders across Category, Retail, Commercial Leads, Finance, and Franchise teams. Your insights will directly influence our pricing and trade strategies, helping to shape the future direction of our business.
What You‚Äôll Do:Data Analysis & Insights: Dive deep into large datasets to perform statistical analysis, basket analysis, and other data-driven studies to support and inform our pricing and trade strategies.Tool Development: Collaborate in the creation and refinement of reporting and pricing tools, ensuring that new tools are effectively communicated and implemented across teams.Reporting: Develop and manage comprehensive reports and dynamic dashboards that deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders.Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with pricing and trade departments to seamlessly integrate data insights into decision-making processes.Pricing Optimization: Support the development and implementation of pricing strategies, providing insights into product, pricing, and KPIs to guide future business directions and mitigate margin leakage.
What You‚Äôll Bring:Educational Background: A master‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field.Experience: 2-3 years of experience in a data-centric analytical role, ideally within pricing or retail.Technical Skills: Proficiency in tools such as Power BI, SQL, Power Query, VBA, Python, or similar, is essential to be able to manipulate large datasets and develop sophisticated analytical models.Statistical Analysis Expertise: Strong experience in statistical analysis and working with large datasets is crucial.Analytical Mindset: A strong aptitude for analytical thinking and problem-solving, coupled with a structured approach to tasks.Business Acumen: An understanding of business principles and a preference for data-driven decision-making.Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required to be able to present complex data in a clear and compelling way to various stakeholders.Attention to Detail: High attention to detail is necessary to ensure accuracy and reliability in your analyses and reporting.Language Proficiency: Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is a must for effective communication across our global teams.
What We Offer:Commercial Planning is a newer, highly international department within the Commercial team at Flying Tiger Copenhagen. We are a team of +30 analytical professionals supporting the business globally across merchandise planning, range building, forecast & ordering, trade analysis, pricing and more. We are entrepreneurs and not afraid to test new ways of working or thinking out of the box.Flying Tiger Copenhagen is a company with strong values founded in Scandinavian culture. We aim to be fun and relevant, putting our hearts into everything we do. Here are some of the perks we offer:Great Location: Our vibrant head office is in the heart of Copenhagen.Flexibility: Enjoy a flexible work environment with options to work from home.Perks: Special discounts in our Danish Flying Tiger Copenhagen stores, an attractive pension plan, and private health insurance that also covers children.Delicious Food: Enjoy tasty meals in our canteen every day, with cake on Thursdays.Fun Environment: A social, fun, and informal workplace with parties, Friday bars, staff clubs, and more.International Culture: Be part of a dynamic, international team that values Scandinavian culture and strong company values.Unique Benefits: Delicious restaurant food in our own canteen every day, including cake on Thursdays, and many other occasions to celebrate and enjoy sweet treats together.
Did you knowWe take climate change very seriously and work very hard to minimize our carbon footprint. We do this by buying less plastic and more renewable materials (everything that grows) ‚Äì and we also want to make sure that all stores are run on renewable energy. We walk the talk ‚Äì and make sure that what we do is validated by external experts, in the Science Based Targets initiative. You can read more about our work with climate action here https://flyingtiger.com/pages/sustainability-eco-friendly

title: Software Engineer
description:
Kaiko offers its clients trusted digital asset market information, empowering businesses with actionable, reliable data. Our data products can be used to inform trading strategies, meet compliance requirements, or assist regulators in market surveillance. Founded in 2014, Kaiko is a global fintech company with offices in NYC, London, Paris, and Singapore.

What We Do

Kaiko provides financial data products and solutions, across four main pillars:

Market Data: We gather, organize, and distribute market data from over 100 cryptocurrency trading platforms to give our clients a comprehensive view of the centralized digital assets market.

DeFi and Blockchain: We operate blockchain infrastructure to collect, process, and distribute detailed market data directly from DeFi protocols giving our clients a comprehensive view of the DeFi market.

Analytics: Our analytics products build on our Market Data and DeFi and Blockchain data products to offer additional analysis for risk assessment, accurate pricing, or market condition evaluations.

Rates and Indices: Trusted benchmark rates and indices for financial professionals and product issuers, compliant under EU BMR regulation.

We take pride in the flexibility of our delivery methods, enabling us to offer Kaiko's products globally on all networks and infrastructures. Whether our clients require public APIs, private or on-premises networks, private or hybrid cloud setups, or blockchain-native solutions with Kaiko oracles, we have them covered. Our goal is to provide clients with seamless access to the insights they need to succeed in the digital asset market.

Kaiko's Research publications are read by thousands of industry professionals and cited in the world's leading media organizations. We provide original insights and in-depth analysis on crypto markets using Kaiko's data and products.

Who We Are

We're a team of 80 (and growing) passionate individuals with a deep interest in building data solutions and supporting the growth of the digital finance economy. We're proud of Kaiko's talented team and are committed to our international representation and diversity. Our people and their values are the foundation of our continued success.

About The Role

You will be joining a fast-paced engineering team made up of people with significant experience working with terabytes of data. We believe that everybody has something to bring to the table, and therefore put collaborative effort and team-work above all else (and not just from an engineering perspective).

You Will Be Able To Work Autonomously As An Equally Trusted Member Of The Team, And Participate In Efforts Such As

Addressing high availability problems: cross-region data replication, disaster recovery, etc.

Addressing "big data" problems: 200+ millions of messages/day, 160B data points since 2010

Improving our development workflow, continuous integration, continuous delivery and in a broader sense our team practices

Expanding our platform's observability through monitoring, logging, alerting and tracing

What You'll Be Doing

Design, develop and deploy scalable and observable backend microservicesReflect on our storage, querying and aggregation capabilities, as well as the technologies required to meet our objectivesWork hand-in-hand with the business team on developing new features, addressing issues and extending the platform

>

Our Tech Stack

Platforms (packaged in containers): Golang but we also recently started Rust for some specific use casesProtocols: gRPC, HTTP (phasing out in favor of gRPC), WebSocket (phasing out in favor of gRPC)Database systems: ClickHouse (main datastore), PostgreSQL (ACID workloads), ScyllaDBMessaging: KafkaCaching: RedisConfiguration management and provisioning: Terraform, AnsibleService deployment: Terraform, Nomad (plugged in Consul and Vault), KubernetesSecrets management and PKI: VaultService discovery: ConsulProxying: HAProxy, TraefikMonitoring: VictoriaMetrics, GrafanaAlerting: AlertManager, PagerDutyLogging: Vector, Loki

About You

Significant experience as a Software/DevOps EngineerKnowledgeable about data ingestion pipelines and massive data queryingWorked with, in no particular order: microservices architecture, infrastructure as a code, self-managed services (eg. deploy and maintain our own databases), distributed services, server-side development, etc

You'll notice that we don't have any "hard" requirements in terms of development platforms or technologies: this is because we are primarily interested in people capable of adapting to an ever changing landscape of technical requirements, who learn fast and are not afraid to constantly push our technical boundaries.It is not uncommon for us to benchmark new technologies for a specific feature, or to change our infrastructure in a big way to better suit our needs.The most important skills for us revolve around two things:What we like to call "core" knowledge: what's a software process, how does it interact with a machine's or the network's resources, what kind of constraints can we expect for certain workloads, etcHow fast you can adapt to a technology you didn't know existed 10 minutes ago

In short, we are looking for someone able to spot early on that spending 10 days to migrate data to a more efficient schema is the better solution compared to scaling out a database cluster in a matter of minutes if we are looking to improve performance in the long term.>

Nice to have

Experience with data scraping over HTTP, WebSocket, and/or FIX ProtocolExperience developing financial product methodologies for indices, reference rates, and exchange ratesKnowledgeable about the technicalities of financial market data, such as the difference between: calls, puts, straddles, different types of bonds, swaps, CFD, CDS, options, futures, etc

Location: Paris (hybrid)

Type of contract: CDI

What We Offer

25 paid holidays & RTTs

The hardware of your choice

Great health insurance (Alan)

Meal vouchers (Swile)

Contribution to your monthly gym subscription

Contribution to daily commuting

Remote-friendly

Multiple team events (annual retreat, casual drinks, etc.)

An entrepreneurial environment with a lot of autonomy and responsibilities

Talent Acquisition Process

 Call with the People team (20 mins) Interview with the CTO (30 mins- 1h) Tech discussion with the members of the team (1h30) Cross team interviews with 2-3 team members (45mins - 1h) Offer, reference check

Diversity & Inclusion

At Kaiko, we believe in the diversity of thought because we appreciate that this makes us stronger. Therefore, we encourage applications from everyone who can offer their unique experience to our collective achievements.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer - InsightIDR

Rapid7 are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our expanding Detection and Response (D&R) practice in Prague. You will be joining an experienced team of engineers working with our SIEM and XDR solution - InsightIDR.

InsightIDR is an AWS cloud-based, microservice-designed architecture built with the mandate to ingest, monitor, and review log data from an organisation's environment in real time in order to raise the alarm if and when attackers hack their way into their network. We've achieved a lot but the threat landscape is always evolving, and we must continually grow and improve our product to meet customer‚Äôs needs.

The Role

This is a great opportunity for someone who is adaptable, embraces a variety of challenges and enjoys problem solving. You will be joining a growing team of enthusiastic engineers that are building and maintaining the integrations that power InsightIDR. You will gain experience and exposure to a wide range of technologies, products and development processes.

Alongside this, you will help mentor junior InsightIDR already has an extensive library of Java based integrations that customers leverage to ingest their security log data. We are continually maintaining and expanding this library to meet the growing needs of our customers.

We are also in the process of modernising our cloud based ingestion pipelines. Working in partnership with the Platform Practice teams we are creating innovative and modern solutions to managing cloud based customer integrations. This project makes use of multiple AWS services alongside Kubernetes, Go and Python.

It is an exciting time for the team and we‚Äôre growing to accommodate the increased expansion of both the InsightIDR customer base and the remit of the team. It's a great time to join us and help to shape the future direction of our product.

Experience with back end development, agile development, AWS infrastructure, and the security industry are strong plusses.

Our Team

The team will be based in Prague and will work alongside other D&R teams in our Belfast and Boston officesWe collaborate with other Rapid7 Practices to deliver services and ensure a joined up approach to customer integrations We focus on cross-functional team collaboration where engineers, product managers, and designers all work together to solve customer problems and build exciting featuresWe love new ideas and are eager to see what your experiences can bring to help influence our technical and product outcomes

In This Role You Will

Work in a team of talented engineers to design, implement, release, and monitor production code changes at massive scale in a continuous deploymentHelp to scope and brake work into well-defined milestonesMentor and coach junior team membersCollaborate with other teams within InsightIDR and products within Rapid7 to design integration touchpoints and features which span multiple development teams and stakeholdersBe a contributor to architecture/execution of major component(s) from conception to release

What You Should Bring

At least 5-8 years of experience in software development, including active or recent Java experienceA demonstrable passion for the craft of software developmentAn ability to pick up new technologies and processes quicklyA history demonstrating a team-based approach to problem solvingExperience helping to define contracts for coordinating development of software projects across multiple teamsExperience in cloud-based architectureA strong sense of ownership and responsibility for the quality of the software you createEmpathy for our users and the Rapid7 missionGood written and verbal communication skills

Even Better If You Have

Interest and/or experience in the security industry 

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That‚Äôs because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional

experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don‚Äôt be shy - apply today.

About Rapid7

Rapid7 is creating a more secure digital future for all by helping organizations strengthen their security programs in the face of accelerating digital

transformation. Our portfolio of best-in-class solutions empowers security professionals to manage risk and eliminate threats across the entire threat

landscape from apps to the cloud to traditional infrastructure to the dark web. We foster open source communities and cutting-edge research‚Äìusing these

insights to optimize our products and arm the global security community with the latest in attacker methods. Trusted by more than 10,000 customers

worldwide, our industry-leading solutions and services help businesses stay ahead of attackers, ahead of the competition, and future-ready for what‚Äôs next.

title: Software Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
At Universal Quantum we aim to make the world a better place by developing new computer technology. Together, we are creating truly impactful quantum computers. Our machines will be capable of solving problems until now considered impossible, with applications ranging across a broad range of industries including healthcare, materials and aerospace. We are looking to hire a Software Engineer (f/d/m) to develop software across the stack from hardware to end-user interfaces. Are you passionate about helping create technologies which can change the world? We may be the right place for you so get in touch!‚ÄØ

What You'll Accomplish

Join our talented and enthusiastic team of scientists and engineers in designing our operational systems for flexibility, high reliability, and serviceability Working closely with the physicists and applied scientists to run experiments on the quantum machine and its components Write full provable, reliable software to be deployed across our real-time system to interface with our custom FPGA-based electronics Enjoy developing efficient algorithms to be executed within the constraints of low-memory or otherwise resource-constrained computers Become conversant with designing, testing, and efficiently deploying software across a heterogeneous, multi-node, Linux-based cluster Develop Ethernet-based communication protocols for low latency control and data transfer within our networks Maintain code quality, documentation, and testing standards 


Requirements

Solid programming experience in languages such as C/C++, Rust, Python, Golang across the software stack Experience in designing, developing, debugging, testing, maintaining, and profiling commercial-quality software Collaborative team player with good communication skills 

Must-have Skills

5+ years of experience in delivering commercial-quality software from hardware to end-user interfaces Experience in working with databases Polyglot with extensive experience in Python and at least one of C/C++, Rust, or Golang Writing readable, dependable, efficient, well-tested and documented code Pragmatic approach to decision-making and design choices Previous experience in start-ups or fast-paced dynamic work environments 

Nice-to-have Skills

Experience in working with cloud platforms such as Azure/GCP/AWS Experience with web services Bachelor's/Master's degree in computer science, electronic engineering, or a related discipline 


Benefits

Competitive salary, equity options, unlimited holiday allowance, direct insurance, flexible working, and a relocation allowance.

We are committed to nurturing diversity and inclusion

At Universal Quantum, we're passionate about working with and for all kinds of minds. As a proud signatory of the Tech Talent Charter (TTC), we have made a number of formal commitments to help to hold ourselves accountable to both our team and peers. This includes pledging to collaborate and share best practices with others, to continuously develop plans to drive inclusion across our business, and to collect and share our diversity data annually. We welcome team members from all backgrounds, and work to create an environment where everyone can flourish freely.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer - Workflows
description:
Front is the modern customer service platform that helps companies delight their customers, engage their teams, and build stronger businesses. We‚Äôve reimagined the help desk for real-time team collaboration across every customer communication channel, then powered it up with AI and automation to resolve issues and help teams work faster. Customers get exceptional service whether they‚Äôre looking for a simple, instant answer, or personalized help on their most complex issues ‚Äî and you get the analytics and insights your business needs to optimize your customer experience. Over 8,500 businesses of all shapes and sizes, from ClickUp to Branch Insurance, Echo Global Logistics to Reed & Mackay rely on Front to deliver game-changing service that wins and retains customers for life.

Backed by Sequoia Capital and Salesforce Ventures, Front has raised $204M from leading venture capital firms and independent investors including top executives at Atlassian, Okta, Qualtrics, Zoom, and PagerDuty. Front has received numerous Great Place to Work accolades, including Y Combinator's list of Top Companies in 2023, #4 on Fortune‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Bay Area‚Ñ¢, Inc. Magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces list, Forbes Best Startup Employers 2022 List, and Best workplaces for Millennials 2022 list.

At Front, our mission is to help people work happier. In the ‚ÄúWorkflows‚Äù pod, we drive happiness through Front's powerful rules system, which helps users to automate repetitive tasks, intelligently assign conversations, and even allows customers to build their robust no-code integrations.

What will you be doing?

Collaborate closely with product managers, product designers, and other engineers to deliver on our product roadmap, turning rough specs into features that we can leverage in our rules engine.Find elegant solutions to usability problems.Ramp on new web technologies that will make Front better.

What skills and experience do you need?

Product-minded: committed to building the best user experience.5+ years of industry experience working on complex software systems. Knowledgeable about modern web technologies and excited to learn new ones, e.g. Node.js ES6, TypeScript, React.Understand the trade-offs between different engineering solutions when solving a problem, value pragmatism over idealism.Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, collaborative, and high-growth environment.Full professional English proficiency.

What We Offer

description:
Heilbronn

ab sofort

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer - health tech
description:
Platform24 is on a mission to unlock healthcare's potential by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available. We aim to enable AI precision while maintaining a human touch, allowing medical doctors and nurses to focus on what they do best‚Äîpracticing medicine ü©∫.

We have an uncompromising focus on making every day better for patients and clinicians and together create healthcare 2.0 üöÄ.

Joining our team as a Data Infrastructure Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech companies. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a large scale.

You will, in this role, be

Part of a core team working with initiatives spanning the entire company üåêDrive data democratization, both internally and externally, creating informative workflows for us as an organization and our customers, the healthcare organizations, giving them data and insights to help them learn and improve so they can do the right things üîçBe part of a team of individuals with diverse expertise within Analytics Engineering üß†Take on a broad spectrum of responsibilities in developing and maintaining our data platform infrastructure üíæEmpower other teams and our customers by enhancing their analytical capabilities and promoting a culture of ongoing learning and improvement üìä

We invite you to join us on this exciting journey, where your contributions will significantly impact the future of healthcare üåü.

Meet Per, the Engineering Manager of the Data & Analytics team, talking about what they do in the team

We‚Äôre looking for

Proficiency in managing and optimizing core platform technologies such as Kubernetes, Helm, and ArgoCD üõ†Ô∏èInterest in learning and applying those learnings in essential data platform components such as Minio, Spark, and Presto üî•Strong understanding of workflow orchestration tools like Airflow for efficient data processing and transformation üîÑProficiency with version control systems and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) üîóCompetence in or willingness to learn monitoring and observability tools such as Grafana and Prometheus to ensure the data platform's health, performance, and reliability üîçProficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation, complemented by knowledge of Python for scripting and automation tasks within the data platform environment üêçExcellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams üí¨Proactive problem-solving attitude and drive to identify and address challenges within the data platform environment üéØ

What's In It For You

At Platform24, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to accommodate different life plans ‚è≥We host Demo & Beers every other week to celebrate our achievements (participation in beers is optional) üçªRegular personal growth and knowledge-sharing sessions are organized, along with other benefits like office snacks, parties, and the opportunity to spend five workdays a year doing voluntary work to help others ü•≥

Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work with intelligent, friendly, and skilled colleagues from around the world üåç.

This position is located in our Stockholm office. We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. (Please note that our team will be on vacation, which may cause some delays in our response times. We will be back by mid-August and will move the process forward as soon as we return).

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs üåà.

Platform24 develops system support for cohesive digital care chains that facilitate increased accessibility, efficiency and medical security. title: Data Engineer with Machine Learning
description:
My client is looking for a Data Engineer who has experience and a desire to work with Machine Learning, to join their vibrant team in their sleek Stockholm office.
The company's main focus is working alongside businesses (small, medium and enterprise) to ensure that they are maximising their business operations; this includes anything from auditing, payroll to VAT accounting, declaration or business acquisition.
They are now looking to build their impactful technology dept with somebody who can utilise new data techniques to further improve their data-driven company mind-set.
ResponsibilitiesEnhance MLOps environment: Continuously improve the machine learning operations (MLOps) environment to streamline model deployment and monitoring processes.Work with Large Language Models (LLMs): Develop and optimize models using large language models to meet various project requirements.Deploy ML models to production: Manage the end-to-end deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient in production.Collaborate with internal teams: Partner with internal business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions.Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.
QualificationsMinimum of 2 years working as a Data Engineer or similar, which could include a Data Scientist who's heavier on the engineering side (very confident with Python) or Software Engineer who's built ML algorithms2 years engineering experience with PythonConfident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and othersWorked with supervising models in productionFamiliar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMsIt's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to productionBSc/MSc in a relevant fieldFluency in Swedish and English
In this position, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.
This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.
Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

title: System Engineer
description:
Overall Purpose Of Role

To take care of submarine cable systems design and engineering at both tender and contract stage. This includes the definition of technical solutions, in compliance with Customers requirements and with environmental constraints and their optimization balancing competitiveness and technical risks.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Definition of technically acceptable and commercially competitive cable, cable system designs and in line with Customer enquiry requirements.Carry out calculations and studies in the Thermal, Electromagnetic and Mechanical fieldsPreparation of technical documentation for Customer and specifications for internal or sub-contractor‚Äôs use.Participation to meetings with Customers‚Äô representatives at all stages of the enquiry and contract to ensure compliance with Customers‚Äô requirements, and Customer‚Äôs satisfactionProduction of detailed costing of all materials and services and production of the technical content to be submitted to Customers.Support to Contracts Engineering Execution Manager in the preparation of formal documentation and design information for the manufacture of cable, accessories, and for cable installation activities.Occasionally, work on details of specific aspects which are typically not completely defined at offer stage e.g. design of special parts, definition/coordination of qualification testing, design of prototypes, etc. This part includes the optimization of cable and system design, to reduce project costs.Participation to technical presentations to Customers, to technical conferences, seminars and workshops.Development of new calculation procedures and computer methods for determining product and system technical proposals and ensure that all calculation and working procedures comply with the necessary technical and quality standards and procedures.

Qualifications & Experience

Master degree in Engineering (Electrical and Energy are preferred)3-5 years‚Äô experience in engineering fieldGood attitude to calculation and computer solutionExperience with Electromagnetic, Thermal or Mechanical design calculation methods and computer solutions (e.g. FEM, CFD, circuit analysis,‚Ä¶) is considered a plusExperience in dealing with relevant national and international standardsAbility to combine technical knowledge with communications and liaisons skills, both internally and with Customers representatives (both technical and commercial)Availability to business travels

title: Data engineer
description:
Jouw nieuwe baan

Dat de wereld van Data & Analytics zich steeds aan het ontwikkelen is, schrikt jouw niet af. Sterker nog, dat is de reden waarom deze baan jou ook zo gaaf lijkt! Jaarbeurs is een omgeving waar het hebben van relevante data van groot belang is en het staat hoog op de agenda. Alleen daarmee kunnen we waardevolle ontmoetingen voor onze bezoekers en exposanten organiseren.

De afgelopen twee jaren is hard gewerkt aan het opzetten van een Azure datawarehouse en PowerBI dashboarding. We maken zoveel mogelijk gebruik van ons eigen automation framework om repetitieve taken te vereenvoudigen. Daarnaast is een customer data platform ge√Ømplementeerd waarmee we de customer journey van onze klanten kunnen verbeteren. Het aantal dashboards en gebruikers is aan het groeien en er liggen nog veel mooie uitdagingen om het data platform verder te ontwikkelen. Ook op gebied van data integraties, welke we ontwikkelen met Make. Op dit moment onderzoeken we hoe we data governance gaan inrichten en bekijken we de mogelijkheden van een lakehouse architectuur met Microsoft Fabric. De ambitie is om beslissingen te nemen op basis van data en een toekomstbestendig data platform op te zetten om aan de veranderende eisen te kunnen voldoen. We kijken hierbij niet alleen in de achteruitkijkspiegel, maar ons vizier is vol op de toekomst gericht. Jaarbeurs is hard op weg de meest duurzame en technologische venue te worden en we zoeken iemand die energie krijgt om hieraan mee te bouwen.

Dit vind je leuk om te doen

Ons Data & Analytics team bestaat uit 6 collega‚Äôs. We werken volgens de scrum methodiek en zijn ook echt zelfsturend. Het team is multidisciplinair, maar ieder heeft zijn eigen specialisme. We werken hard, houden elkaar scherp en vullen elkaar aan. Er kan en mag veel, en we houden van slim samenwerken. Je gaat het volgende doen:


Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van het data platform. Je ontsluit databronnen, automatiseert ETL processen en modelleert data t.b.v. datamarts, dashboards en analysesOntwikkelen en onderhouden van data integraties tussen applicatiesOp basis van informatiebehoeften adviseren over (nieuwe) functionele en technische oplossingsmogelijkheden. Je kan de functionele vraag omzetten naar de techniek en bent in staat om verwachtingen te managen door goede proactieve communicatieHet bewaken van de kwaliteit van de opgeleverde functionaliteiten en reviewen samen met teamleden en eindgebruikers


 Wat breng jij mee?Jij hebt kwaliteit hoog in het vaandel staan, hebt aandacht voor detail en werkt nauwgezet. Je hebt goed ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden en houdt van een omgeving die volop in beweging is. Je laat je niet snel uit het veld slaan als zaken anders lopen, maar bent oplossingsgericht.


Je beschikt over hbo/wo denk- en werkniveau met sterke analytische en technische vaardigheden en je hebt minimaal 2 tot 5 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke rol zoals bijvoorbeeld Junior Data Engineer of Junior BI Specialist Je hebt ervaring met data en dashboarding platformen, bij voorkeur de Microsoft stack (SQL Server, Data Factory, PowerBI)Je bent bekend met concepten zoals data management, data modellering (dimensioneel modelleren), delta lakes, row level security, ELT en data lineageJe weet je goed in te leven in de (interne) klant en bent professioneel kritisch. Je kunt goed luisteren en vraagt actief doorJe vindt het leuk om jouw kennis te delen en weet complexe materie op een eenvoudige manier te communiceren


Dit krijg je van ons

Plezier in je werk en je persoonlijke ontwikkeling vind je belangrijk en dat natuurlijk het liefst in een duurzame omgeving. Vandaar dat je van ons alle ruimte krijgt om jouw ambities waar te maken en te groeien in je vak. Je doet dat in een team van betrokken collega‚Äôs, in een informele werksfeer, met vers fruit op de werkvloer, gezellige borrels en leuke activiteiten. Daarnaast kun je samen met ons bouwen aan een betere wereld. Jaarbeurs heeft als ambitie om in 2030 de meest duurzame organisator en facilitator van beurzen en evenementen van Europa te zijn. Maar Jaarbeurs biedt je nog veel meer namelijk:


Een salaris tussen ‚Ç¨3.130 en ‚Ç¨4.470 o.b.v. 40 uur per week, afhankelijk van je ervaringWerken op een centrale toplocatie naast station Utrecht Centraal2 dagdelen‚ÄØper jaar kun je als vrijwilliger bijdragen aan de Jaarbeurs Goede Doelen en je daarnaast heb je de mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan het medewerkers Green Team (het team waarin Jaarbeurs collega‚Äôs actief meedenken over duurzame initiatieven)27 vakantiedagen bij een werkweek van 40 uur8% vakantiegeld en een pensioenEen collectieve bedrijfssuccesregeling (max. 5%) bij behaalde jaarresultatenDuurzame mobiliteitsregeling: o.a. OV 100% vergoed en de mogelijkheid voor het leasen van een fietsJe krijgt een laptop en ontvangt een smartphone naar keuze (max. budget ‚Ç¨850,-)15% korting op je aanvullende verzekering en/of tandverzekering bij de collectieve zorgverzekering van CZGratis toegang tot al onze eigen evenementen & beurzenDe mogelijkheid om 4 offici√´le feestdagen in te ruilen voor algemene feest- en gedenkdagen, behorende bij jouw levensovertuigingEr valt altijd wel wat te beleven met jouw collega‚Äôs. Zo is er √©√©n keer per maand een borrel, een zomerfeest en kun je deelnemen aan dagjes weg en andere sportieve en culturele activiteitenDe mogelijkheid tot deelname aan de diversiteitsweek, vitaliteitsweek en de Jaarbeurs Summer- en Winterschool; divers aanbod van (live) trainingen en workshops om elke dag weer een beetje beter te worden


Hebben we je interesse gewekt?

We horen graag van je. Reageren op deze vacature kan via de sollicitatiebutton. Jouw sollicitatie wordt direct doorgestuurd en je kunt snel een reactie van ons verwachten. Wil je eerst meer weten over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Nikki de Coole (Recruiter) via nikki.de.coole@jaarbeurs.nl.

Wij zoeken zelf, dat betekent dat acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature niet op prijs wordt gesteld.

Een assessment en referentiecheck kunnen tot de werving en selectie procedure behoren van deze vacature.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Agristo is op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Data Scientist om ons Data & Analytics team te versterken. Je speelt een belangrijke rol in onze groeistrategie door diepgaande inzichten te verwerven uit data met behulp van advanced analytics. Hiermee til je onze besluitvorming naar een hoger niveau.

Wat zal je doen bij Agristo?

Agristo is in volle groei, daarbij komend ook onze rol van Data Scientist. Dit betekent dat je tijdens je opleiding ook kennis zal maken met onze business intelligence tools & aspecten van data engineering. Samen met je team binnen Data, sta je in voor volgende core responsabilities:

Het vertalen van zakelijke problemen naar data-analysevraagstukken en het voorstellen van passende oplossingen. Het verzamelen van grote hoeveelheden gegevens uit diverse bronnen en deze omzetten tot een bruikbare bron om te analyseren. Ontwikkelen, testen en valideren van modellen met behulp van machine learning en statistische methoden. Op de hoogte blijven van de laatste trends en technologie√´n om zo altijd de meest optimale en future-proof oplossingen te kunnen voorstellen. Werken in multidisciplinaire teams, waaronder domeinexperten, IT-specialisten en andere stakeholders, om projecten effectief te implementeren. 

Je werkt hiervoor binnen ons modern dataplatform, uitgerust met geavanceerde tools zoals Databricks. Samen met een team van data- en businessexperts benut je deze middelen om waardevolle inzichten te genereren.

Hier herken jij jezelf in:

Je kan je professioneel uitdrukken in beide het Nederlands & Engels. Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit waarmee je in probleemstellingen duikt, terwijl je kritisch blijft nadenken. Je bent niet bang om initiatief te nemen, waarbij je de uitdagingen durft aan te pakken. Je hebt een kritische mindset waardoor je de uitdagingen en risico‚Äôs binnen advanced analytics constructief aan kan pakken. Ervaring met statistiek of machine learning modellen, en relevante programmeertalen zoals Python wordt sterk gewaardeerd. Je bent ge√Ønteresseerd in onze diverse bedrijfsdomeinen, zoals sales, supply chain en operations, en je hebt een sterke motivatie om je te verdiepen in tastbare use cases. 

Wat krijg je ervoor terug?

Een succesvolle familiale onderneming in volle groei waar de energie en het enthousiasme in elk hoekje voelbaar is. Een paar extra kilo‚Äôs op de weegschaal, want je koopt voortaan diepvries frietjes, kroketjes en andere aardappelproducten aan voordelig tarief. Een uniek fietsplan waardoor je nooit meer in de file staat en de kilo‚Äôs er weer afvliegen. Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met extra smakelijke voordelen (maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, flex income plan, fietslease, ‚Ä¶)Op tijd en stond een oprecht compliment en een deugddoende schouderklop voor jouw inzet. Een ‚Äòleger‚Äô collega‚Äôs die jou met raad en daad bijstaan.

title: Asset TD
description:
Position Responsibilities:

Assess early concepts, briefs, and other references to assist in breaking down Asset requirements and making a roadmap for them in a timely fashionThe creation of high-end assets will be overseen from a technical perspective, followed up on, directed, and influenced across numerous disciplines. The delivery of shot-ready assets from the Modelling, Surfacing, and Rigging disciplines is directly the responsibility of this positionFoster the development of new prototype Rigs. Develop modular Rigging systems through Python. Develop and maintain rigs for a wide range of styles. And that's from stylized cartoon characters to realistic creatures as well as props. Develop publishing workflows/tools for Rigging, Surfacing, and Animation. Set up test procedures to minimize problems with the Rigs further down the pipelineCollaborate with the CG Supervisor and other Asset Leads and Artists in Asset Departments (specifically in Rigging), provide clear technical directives and objectives on how to integrate Rigs into our pipeline, and monitor progressWork closely with the Asset Coordinator on delivery schedules and Asset quality standards in close collaboration with the CG Supervisors and LeadsWork closely with the Production Manager and Asset Coordinator to evaluate the Surfacing and Rigging bids and/or project estimations as the production developsCollaborate with the Art director, Departmental Leads, and CG Supervisor(s) to ensure every asset is stress tested and meets the brief. QC the Assets (Characters, Sets, and Props) published from rigging and look-dev!Collaborate with the CG Supervisor and Production Manager and cross-verify the ShotGrid to ensure the right assets and versions are being usedTroubleshooting cross-departmental issues focusing on Asset-related concerns is getting addressed along with any inefficiencies. Document tools, codes, and workflow and train creative staff on those processesWork closely with Production Manager, CG Supes, Pipeline Team or Pipeline Supervisor to illustrate project requirements and ongoing needs and help set up tasks as needed in ShotGrid and ServerAttend client meetings and calls and represent the Asset Department from a technical front as necessarySupport a collaborative and creative environment that produces awesome Giant projects. And that included coaching and mentoring department Leads and other crew members


Requirements

Minimum 5 years of experience working in CG/Animation productionMinimum 2 years of experience working in a supervisory or TD capacityStrong working knowledge of 3D software, preferably including Maya, ZBrush, Substance Designer and Painter, Mari, Photoshop, Ziva, Yeti, or XGen in Maya, Arnold, and Houdini (preferred)Well-versed in mGear and Shotgrid Production Management SoftwareProficient in Python and MelDemonstrable understanding of the full CG pipeline, especially Asset ProductionStrong leadership skills and a measurable track record of delivering against project goals or tight deadlines

title: Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power team
description:
Join the team as MFT Energy's new Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power teamIn MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our ambitious Intraday power team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.
The job as Machine Learning EngineerYou will be a part of our great Intraday power team and as a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be one of the driving forces behind designing and maintaining a robust machine learning setup encompassing over 100 models. Your role is pivotal in bringing our ML setup to the next maturity stage, significantly expanding our model portfolio. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, platform engineers, quants, and traders to achieve these goals.
Your key responsibilitiesDesign, implement, and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure.Support, manage and optimize a portfolio of 100+ ML models.Work with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into trading systems.Enhance the maturity and scalability of our ML setup.
Your core skillsProficiency in Python.Hands-on experience with Docker for containerization.Experience with public cloud services (Azure, AWS, GCP).Experience with Git for version control.Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.Familiarity with Bash and Linux environments.Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
Beneficial skillsProficiency in core ML frameworks/tools is a plus: MLFlow, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.Strong SQL skills or similar database tools.Familiarity with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).
Your qualificationsMinimum of 2 years of relevant experience.MSc or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Business Intelligence, Economics, or similar).
Working in MFT EnergyYou will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, Austin, Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best and our work culture is based on collaboration, transparency, and a proactive mindset.
We offer:A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.
Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!If you think there is a match between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.
Start date: As soon as possible.
We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefitsPorto (2 days per week in the office)
Our client
Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.
With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.
Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.
The role
The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.
This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.
As a Data Analyst, you will: 
Monitor and report on key KPIs.Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.
To apply, you should have
Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.Intermediate SQL skills.Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).Advanced Excel skills.Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.
Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Stel je voor: Jij bent de drijvende kracht achter baanbrekende BI dashboards die de toekomst van LKQ in Rotterdam vormgeven. Als Data engineer kom je binnen met ongekende kwaliteiten en de expertise om data om te zetten in kansen. Je gidst het BI team door complexe datastromen en tilt ons samen naar ongekende hoogten. Dit is jouw kans om een blijvende impact te maken! Voor jouw talent bieden we een aantrekkelijk bruto maandsalaris van ‚Ç¨4.500 tot ‚Ç¨6.500, een telefoon en laptop van de zaak en 25 welverdiende vakantiedagen. Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken?

Wat ga je doen?

Als Data Engineer bij LKQ in Rotterdam heb jij voor meer dan 100 vestigingen in Nederland, Belgi√´ en Frankrijk een adviserende en uitvoerende rol. Dit doe jij niet alleen. Jij bent in nauw contact met het business control team en alle andere afdelingen. Op deze manier weet jij binnen no-time wie LKQ is. Verder zijn dit jouw taken:


 Je beheert de SSMS en SSAS omgeving Je beheert het ETL proces Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van de BI omgeving Je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt rapportages in SSRS Je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt datamodellen in Incorta Je ontsluit nieuwe databronnen


Over LKQ

LKQ Benelux France is een innovatief onderdeel van de LKQ Corporation dat auto-onderdelen levert vanuit 120 vestigingen in Nederland, Belgi√´ en Frankrijk. We bieden een assortiment van ongeveer 250.000 verschillende auto-onderdelen en streven ernaar onze diensten continu te verbeteren en aan te passen aan de veranderende markt. Naast auto-onderdelen, hebben we diepgaande kennis van banden, olie en vloeistoffen, gereedschap en uitrusting. We waarderen de expertise van ons team en bieden de juiste route naar carri√®regroei.

Jij als onze ideale Data Engineer

Als Data Engineer bij LKQ in Rotterdam werk jij zelfstandig en zorg jij voor het beste resultaat. Met data driven enthousiasme en analytische scherpte inspireer je verandering. Verder neem je dit mee:

Je hebt minimaal hbo werk-en denkniveau


 Kennis van ETL-processen, Kimball data modelleren en architectuur Kennis van development met SQL, SSMS, SSIS, SSAS en SSRS Gewenst 3-5 jaar relevante werkervaring Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels


Wat bieden wij?

Als Data Engineer bij LKQ in Rotterdam heb je een uitdagende rol binnen een groeiende BI-afdeling, waarbij je BI-oplossingen ontwikkelt voor een datahongerige organisatie. Met een breed scala aan BI-vraagstukken en de omvang van de organisatie zijn er volop doorgroeimogelijkheden en kansen voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling via opleidingen en trainingen, binnen een internationale en ambitieuze omgeving. Verder krijg jij van ons:


 Bruto maandsalaris van ‚Ç¨4.500 tot ‚Ç¨ 6.500 25 vakantiedagen Mobiele telefoon en laptop Flexibiliteit Goede pensioenregeling, korting op diverse verzekeringen en deelname aan bedrijfsfitness


Meer informatie & solliciteren

title: Senior Engineer
description:
VGW is an interactive entertainment company, harnessing technology and creativity to deliver world-class, free-to-play games.

We have an exciting opportunity to join our Engineering team in Sydney and are currently looking for a Senior Engineer to join the team. 

As a Senior Engineer in our Games team, you will be pivotal in integrating new games into VGW's existing systems, ensuring fun and exciting new games reach our players.

What You‚Äôll Love About Our Team

Ownership and Empowerment: You‚Äôll lead projects from concept to execution; design it, build it, run it.Modern Practices: Born in the cloud, we embrace continuous integration/deployment, Infrastructure as Code, and cybersecurity.

Tech we use

In terms of our tech stack, we're hosted on AWS containerised with Docker. In these containers, we run our servers on Node.js connecting to DynamoDB. Our clients are built with TypeScript, PixiJS and use as few dependencies as possible.

What You Bring

Extensive experience with client-side web development (TypeScript/JavaScript, webpack/vite/jest/vitest).Experience with WebGL technologies (PixiJS, Three.js) and animation libraries (GSAP) is a plus.Experience in interactive visual applications, 2D game development, or animations using game engines (Godot, Unity, Unreal) is highly desirable.Ability to prototype and collaborate with stakeholders to meet feature requirements while maintaining application standards.Deliver product features effectively, focusing on lead time, deployment frequency, change failure rate, resolution time, and minimizing production bugs.Experience in designing architecture patterns tailored to system needs, with exposure to game client-specific patterns being advantageous.Understanding of cloud development fundamentals (AWS hosting) and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).

About VGW

VGW is an interactive entertainment company, harnessing technology and creativity to deliver world-class, free-to-play games.

With high-quality, acclaimed brands including Chumba Casino, Global Poker and LuckyLand Slots, we entertain and delight over one million players in North America.

As pioneers in sweepstakes promotions for online social games, we also offer our players the opportunity to redeem incredible prizes.

At VGW, one of our core values is "our players come first". This means always striving to deliver a safe, responsible and positive player experience.

Privacy Policy

title: Open Application: Backend Developer

title: Computer Vision Engineer (Health) (f/m/x)
description:
About the Company:We are Helmholtz Munich. In a rapidly changing world, we discover breakthrough solutions for better health. Our research is focused within the areas of metabolic health/diabetes, environmental health, molecular targets and therapies, cell programming and repair, bioengineering, and computational health. We particularly excel in the fields of basic research, bioengineering, artificial intelligence, and technological development. Through this research, we build the foundations for medical innovation. Together with our partners, we seek to accelerate the transfer of our research, so that laboratory ideas can reach society and improve people‚Äôs quality of life at the fastest rate possible. This is what drives us. Why not join us and make a difference?

About the Role:Germany‚Äôs largest research organization, the Helmholtz Association, launched Helmholtz AI: This dedicated, interdisciplinary platform develops and promotes applied Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods for the Association‚Äôs main research fields (Health, Energy, Earth and Environment, Information, Space, Matter) in collaboration with its external and university partners. Its central unit operates at Helmholtz Munich in Munich.Our mission is to enable research scientists to leverage AI methods optimally. The Munich AI consultant team is focussing on Health and collaborates with researchers from the whole Helmholtz Association on projects on cancer and infection research, molecular medicine, as well as neurodegenerative and environmental diseases. We offer you the unique opportunity to use your expertise in software development to answer questions of great societal importance in a vibrant international environment.To join our growing team, we are inviting applications for:Computer Vision Engineer (Health) (m/f/d
)
Responsibilities:developing machine learning (ML) methods for unique imaging data sets generated by renowned researchersapplying and disseminating emerging ML/ AI methods to deliver data-driven insights and solve concrete research questionsdeveloping and maintaining open-source scientific softwarecontinuously learning about state-of-the-art computer vision methods and their applicationsbeing a fundamental part of one of the largest scientific AI initiatives in EuropeYou will also play a crucial role in achieving our long-term goal of facilitating open access to ML expertise through interdisciplinary collaborations and disseminatio
n.
Qualifications:a master or PhD degree in computer science, machine learning or another related fielda track record in computer vision and machine learning, ideally combined with a specific background in healthcare or biologyexperience implementing state-of-the-art deep learning methods in Python, using Git/Githuba high degree of autonomy, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate clearly with different stakeholdersan open and curious mindset with a strong team spi
rit
Benefits:Career Development: scientific training & career center with tailored offersRecreation: 30 days annual leave, flexi days, plus public holidaysInternational Staff Service: Support with the relocation and integration process in GermanyHealth Promotion: Sports, company doctor, mental health initiativesScientific Resources: State-of-the-art infrastruture and Core FacilitiesWork-Life-Balance: Flexible working hours and flexi-time mo
dels
Pay range and compensation package:If you fulfil all the requirements, you may be eligible for a salary grade of up to E 13. Social benefits are based on the Collective Wage Agreement for Public-Sector Employees (TV√∂D). The position has an (initial) fixed term of 2 years but may be extended under certain circumsta
nces.
Interested in applying?If you have any questions, feel free to contact Dr Marie Piraud, marie.piraud@helmholtz-munich.de, who will be happy to
 help.
Your application should includeCVCover letterContact details for at least two r
eferees

.10.2024
