title: Senior Software Engineer (f/m/d) for Data Integration
description:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

Here at Digital Industries, one of the main pillars of Siemens, we are the market leader in industrial automation. Our products and services are used in factories across the world, from car production to pharmaceutical plants.

We know that future operation will be different than today. And we want to be the inspiring leader, building the future jointly with customers and partners. Delivering real value fast, in collaboration, solving fundamental problems, growing sustainability, optimizing systems, and living the change, this is what drives us in our daily operations.

For this, we have created the Future of Industrial Operations. Our goal is to do nothing less than transforming the industry and ourselves, Siemens.

We are crafting a portfolio for tomorrow, iterating fast over new ideas and being in close touch with our customers to integrate their feedback back to the products we built.

With this approach, we are building the bridge into a sustainable world of tomorrow. Fast, agile and purpose driven, for us and the next generations to come.

What part will you play?

In your role as ‚ÄúSenior Software Engineer (f/m/d) for Data Integration‚Äù you will be at the core, to realize our software service offerings as part of an end-to-end responsible team. You will make our customer dreams come true and build customized software solutions and services.

You will get in close interaction with customers and apply co- creationWith your guidance and coaching you help growing the knowledge base within the teamYou are responsible within an engaging and product related team for the development, advancement and operation of state-of-the-art software The close monitoring of the project success is done by you and your team and you will adapt to new challenges and requirementsYou will act as a technical expert in your domain with a high responsibility within the development environment

What You Need To Make Real What Matters.

You have a bachelor in Computer Science or a related fieldYou have long term experience in developing software services along the IT and OT space, while cloud is being your second home where you can REST.Additionally you have several years of experience with container based development and deploymentYou are proficient in Java and/or Typescript, either for backend or in combination with Angular for frontend Based on your good level of experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps principles you will ensure high quality engineering practicesExperience with data integration technologies like Apache Kafka, Apache Spark or Snowflake is an advantage. To multiply knowledge and your experience into the organization is something you are used to You are keen on working directly with customers and seeking for solutions that scale across a broad base of customersYour team can rely on you and you can count on your team Fluency in English is important for the daily communication and you have good German language skills

What we offer.

2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standardAttractive remuneration packageDevelopment opportunities for both personal and professional growth An environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work and feel a sense of belongingFind more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences. 

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
ü§ñ The JobDataroots, a leader in crafting state-of-the-art AI, data, and strategy solutions, is seeking an Expert MLOps Engineer. This specialised role focuses on developing, deploying, and optimising machine learning operations (MLOps) across diverse client projects. You will be instrumental in creating robust, scalable, and automated ML pipelines that are critical for the deployment of AI models into production.Your expertise will be pivotal in ensuring that our customers' machine learning systems are not only designed for maximum efficiency but also adhere to best practices in continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD), safety and compliance for machine learning systems. You will work closely with data scientists & machine learning engineers to implement tools and processes that streamline the transition from experimental models to reliable production-level solutions.As part of your role, you will also assess and implement advanced MLOps tools and platforms, facilitate automated testing and monitoring of machine learning models, and ensure compliance with data governance and security standards. Your goal will be to minimise friction in the ML lifecycle and maximise the reproducibility and reliability of our ML deployments.Collaboration with cloud architects and data engineers will be essential to integrate ML models seamlessly with existing cloud infrastructures and data platforms across various sectors. Your contributions will directly enhance our capability to deliver predictive insights and intelligent automation to our clients.
üéâ What you can expect at DatarootsSince its inception in 2016, Dataroots has been dedicated to enhancing its customers' operations through superior data-driven methodologies. We prioritize the well-being and development of our team, fostering an environment of diversity and continuous learning. By joining us, you'll not only contribute to our growth but also enjoy a nurturing and innovative work environment. Learn more about our philosophy at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].
üí™ The SkillsYour professional background should include:A Master‚Äôs or equivalent through experience in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related fieldA minimum of 3 years in a role with a significant focus on machine learning operations within a consultancy or client-service environment.Expertise in implementing MLOps frameworks and tools such as MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended (TFX), or similar.Proven ability in setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines specifically for machine learning projects.Strong coding skills in Python, with experience in other languages like Go or Rust considered beneficial.Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding their use in scaling ML operations.Knowledge of containerisation technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.Ability to work with large, complex datasets and real-time data processing systems.Experience with orchestration tools, such as Airflow, Prefect or Dagster, and best practices when using these tools.Familiarity with real-time endpoints and serverless computing for ML deployments.Experience with ML versioning tooling, including data versioning and model registries.Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas effectively.Fluency in English is required; proficiency in Dutch or French is a plus.Must hold EU citizenship or a permanent VISA.
üí∞ The OfferAn attractive salary package with additional legal benefits including a company car and fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, plus premium tech gear.Personal and team development funds to deepen your expertise and broaden your influence.An innovation budget for pioneering projects within your field.Active engagement in team-building and wellness activities to maintain balance and camaraderie.
üáßüá™ Our main offices are located in Leuven and Ghent, with additional co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. Remote work flexibility is coupled with necessary on-site engagements.If you are passionate about advancing MLOps and transforming industries through intelligent solutions, Dataroots is your next destination.
Apply now to become our Expert MLOps Engineer! üéâ

title: Odoo Developer / Technical Consultant
description:
Most of the time, we deliver a standard version of Odoo to our customers. However, some of them are not satisfied with the product as it is presented and they wish to implement specific elements for a customized use of it (it can be from a simple button to add, to larger projects).As Technical Consultant, you'll be responsible for developing customization of the solution, from technical analysis to development and support.
Customer relations are handled by our Business Analysts in the office next door and they present you the customization you have to bring. Your daily tasks will be undertaken from our office in Louvain-La-Neuve, you would then not have to move around to the clients' office. NICE TO HAVE:OrganisedBachelor or Master DegreePython, JavaScript, HTML, SQL, UML-Like modelingUnix / Linux platform

title: Backend Engineer - O11y, Asserts (Remote, EMEA)
description:
This is a remote position. We are looking for candidates in the Sweden only.

Backend Engineer - O11y, Asserts (EMEA, Remote)

What do we do?

Asserts.ai team joined Grafana Labs as part of an acquisition and is now growing inside the larger Observability group. The backend team is responsible for building and operating a set of low-latency microservices built in Java and databases like Graph DB. The services provide automated Root Cause Insights by actively querying the Grafana Cloud Metrics, Traces, and Logs databases and integrating with the Grafana platform components like Dashboarding and Alerting. The Asserts services are multi-tenant, highly available and process and store data in Graph and Time Series DB. We will soon be rolling it out to thousands of self-service customers, and it's critical that as we grow, we improve our performance, increase our reliability, and do it all more efficiently.

We're looking for a backend engineer who is passionate about programming.

As a company we are remote-first and global, we embrace people of different experiences and backgrounds to build diverse teams where every person brings a unique perspective to the software.

What will you be doing?

Work with your team to deliver new features, then use the results to iterate and improve.Create design documents, collaborate within and across teams. Build and operate critical systems. Own their reliability, performance, and availability.Participate in on-call rotations. Build expertise of Grafana‚Äôs observability products and systems.Gain a deeper understanding of our cloud product, our customers and get to know the codebase of a large distributed system.


What are we looking for in you?

You are a motivated self starter with a bias towards action.You have strong experience in Java programming and have built and deployed Java based microservices.You have experience with Kubernetes.You have some experience delivering projects from gathering requirements, brainstorming ideas all the way to shipping a product to the customer‚Äôs hands in a self-driven way.You have some experience in building and deploying SaaS software on any one of the cloud providers like AWS, GCP or Azure. You‚Äôre curious and enjoy learning new programming languages and frameworks, setting up examples, and figuring out how things work.


Nice To Haves

You have been responsible for operating production services and organizing/participating in on-call rotations.You like to share your knowledge by creating blog posts, giving tech talks at meetups and conferences.


In Sweden, the Base compensation range for this role is KR 580,938 - KR 697,125 Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.

Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market‚Äôs defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


About Grafana Labs: There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we‚Äôre building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we‚Äôre working hard to make sure that‚Äôs the foundation of our organization as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you‚Äôve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
I am partnering with a AI Driven Biotech startup based in the heart of Paris who are developing a generative AI Platform to discover new catalysts and molecules with the aim of disrupting carbon intensive industries. 
After a successful round of funding, they are looking to expand the team with senior hires in different areas of the business.

As a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer, you will be responsible for transforming advanced ML algorithms from theoretical concepts and shifting into practical, scalable models within the company platform.

Implementing and optimizing advanced ML models. Ensuring they are efficient and well integrated. Focus on Data Collecting, data integration and maintenance to oversee the full lifecycle of ML Models. title: Airport Development Analyst
description:
Barcelona Headquarters
Hello! We are Volotea, the airline of the small and mid-sized cities in Europe.Since our inception in 2012, we have been amongst the fastest-growing low-cost airlines in Europe. We are enthusiastic enablers of direct travel for Europeans who don‚Äôt live in big hubs. We are changing air travel from small and mid-sized cities in Europe, many previously unconnected or underserviced. We aim to connect the people in these cities with their passion for travel, in an enjoyable and increasingly sustainable way.
After over a decade in the skies, we have now flown close to 60 million passengers. Today, we serve over 100 destinations in 18 countries, actively consolidating our position among the top European airlines in the industry.
In recent years, we have raised our travel capacity more than most competitors, increasing our number of aircraft, routes, destinations, employees, and markets. Throughout this journey, our team continues to excel and grow stronger as our services gain recognition amongst an expanding European audience. We are a young, dynamic, and international team that enjoys working together to grow our company during this exciting time in the airline industry.
Our main markets are France, Italy, Spain, and Greece. We have 21 operational bases: Nantes, Bordeaux, Toulouse, Marseille, Strasbourg, Lille, Lourdes, Lyon, and Brest in France; Venice, Verona, Palermo, Cagliari, Olbia, Florence, Bari, and Naples in Italy; Asturias and Bilbao in Spain; Athens in Greece; and Hamburg in Germany.
If you feel inspired by our story and you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, continue reading!
We are hiring an Airport Development Analyst who has experience in interacting with different cultural environments and can work in a challenging high-growth atmosphere.
Are you a skilled, positive, assertive, and sociable individual who enjoys working as part of a multicultural team?If your answer is yes, apply to come on board and make Volotea your next professional destination.

What you will need:Degree or Master in Business Development, Management, Law and/or Aeronautical Engineering.Experience in Business/Airline/Airport development or procurement roles is a plus.Experience in contracts review or legal processes will be highly valued.Excellent English speaker. Spanish, French and Italian its a nice to have.Advanced skills in Office package.Very organized.Good negotiations skills.Excellent communications skills.Ability to work within tight deadlines.Able to work in a fast-paced environment.

title: Corrosion Engineer

description:

Interviews will be held next week, with the goal of filling these roles quickly. If you're ready to contribute to a dynamic and growing team, apply today!

title: Software Engineer, DevOps (Lisbon)
description:
Voleon is a technology company that applies state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to real-world problems in finance. For more than a decade, we have led our industry and worked at the frontier of applying machine learning to investment management. We have become a multibillion dollar asset manager, and we have ambitious goals for the future.

Your colleagues will include internationally recognized experts in machine learning research as well as highly experienced technology and finance professionals. The people who shape our company come from other backgrounds, too, including concert music performance, humanitarian aid, opera singing, sports writing, and BMX racing. You will be part of a team that loves to succeed together.

As a DevOps Software Engineer, you will work with the software engineering, research, and systems teams to build the backbone of our business. This role is a means to make a difference: your role will serve as a force multiplier to maximize the productivity of the personnel, tools, and workflows that deliver software at Voleon.

Responsibilities

Support Voleon's build processes and continuous delivery tools, manage software development tools, and automate systems and operationsWork with stakeholders and product teams to create robust, high-performance software and systems architecturesEstablish and promote best practices for software development and testingDesign and support implementations of production infrastructure and applications

Requirements

At least four years of experience with software development or production systems supportFluent with Python or at least two other software languages such as Groovy, R, or GoExperience implementing and supporting continuous Integration platforms such as Jenkins, TeamCity, CircleCI, or BambooExperience with automated software testing practices and toolsExtensive experience with common containerization tools such as Docker and KubernetesPower user of GitFamiliar with Agile project management conceptsAbility to initiate and lead cross-team technical projectsBachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related technical field

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with configuration automation tools, such as Ansible, Chef, and PuppetExposure to virtualization tools such as KVMExperience configuring and using the ELK stack Experience with Prometheus, Grafana, or related toolsExperience with the Bazel build systemBackground in Linux/Unix administrationExperience administering AWS or similar cloud infrastructure platforms via Terraform or other Infrastructure-as-Code toolsUnderstanding of relational databases (primarily PostgreSQL) and NoSQL data management toolsEagerness to work with diverse teams

‚ÄúFriends of Voleon‚Äù Candidate Referral Program

If you have a great candidate in mind for this role and would like to have the potential to earn USD $7,500 if your referred candidate is successfully hired and employed by The Voleon Group, please use this form to submit your referral. For more details regarding eligibility, terms and conditions please make sure to review the Voleon Referral Bonus Program .

Equal Opportunity Employer

The Voleon Group is an Equal Opportunity employer. Applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation and identity, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or any other factors prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

Vaccination Requirement

The Voleon Group has implemented a policy requiring all employees who will be entering our worksite, including new hires, to be fully vaccinated with the COVID-19 vaccine. This policy also applies to remote employees, as such employees will be asked to visit our offices from time to time. To the extent permitted by applicable law, proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment. This policy is part of Voleon‚Äôs ongoing efforts to ensure the safety and well-being of our employees and community, and to support public health efforts.

title: Game Developer - Javascript / HTML5 (f/m/x)
description:
Your tasks

We are looking for a Game Developer (f/m/x) to join our team on a two year fixed contract.

You will work on the shared web application / frontend of our existing games.Shape the design, development, maintenance and improvement of our frontend, using a wide range of technologies like TypeScript, Vue, Sass, Jest, Sentry, Sonar, Github, Jenkins, build pipelines.Collaborate in building and maintaining the roadmap.Development and improvement of company‚Äôs frontend and tools and best practices for stable, modern, testable, and maintainable codeWrite top notch code and review that of others.Guarantee live system stability and performance.Work together with other teams on system, bug & performance monitoring, tracking, data warehouse solutions, analytics, and game features.Communicate with colleagues and other teams to ensure a smooth daily workflow.Continuously modernize and professionalize the existing JS/TS code base.Profile code and tweak it to run smoothly for our growing player base.

Your profile

You bring expert knowledge in TypeScript, HTML5/CSS3 and current frontend frameworksYou hold a diploma in computer science or similar and have professional experience in software developmentYou possess the ability to operate independently, good analytical skills, and the motivation to constantly improve and learnYou are enthusiastic about games and already have experience within the industryYou have strong communication skillsYou enjoy working in an interdisciplinary team, thinking outside the box, and to constantly learning new thingsYou show familiarity with agile software development and scrum-based working environments or the wish to work with them in the futureYou are fluent in technical and business English

What We Offer

Inclusive Culture 

At Bytro, we actively champion diversity, inclusion, and empowerment through our actions and culture. We ensure an environment of equal opportunities for all, celebrating a community where people of all ages, genders, abilities, and orientations are welcomed and valued. Our commitment to diversity is reflected in our team, which includes colleagues from over 30 different countries, fostering a richly multicultural and international workplace.

Office Life

Enjoy flexible work hours for a great work-life balance. We believe in hybrid work: work from our fully equipped office in St. Pauli with home office option. Our office offers you a variety of snacks and beverages and for an affordable commute we subsidize your HVV ticket.

We love dogs - you do too? Bring your furry friend to the office. Just make sure to speak to the other dog parents first to ensure they all get along and there are not too many in each office at the same time.

Career Growth

Passion drives our work, and we offer tailored growth opportunities for everyone. Our Bytro Career Path offers a structured career model to support your professional goals. In addition, we offer a variety of training and access to professional learning platforms as well as language courses.

More than just colleagues

Work hard, play hard: We genuinely like each other and enjoy spending time together. May it be during After-Work Drinks where we gather to unwind or during Board Game Nights which can get competitive but are always fun - regular events small or big are a huge part of our culture.

About Us

‚ÄúConnect and Challenge Players. Anytime. Anywhere.‚Äù

At Bytro, our mission is to develop high-quality strategy games that are accessible to players worldwide. Game development, for us, is a promise of fun and entertainment ‚Äì it‚Äôs what drives us every day.

As a proud member of the Swedish Stillfront Group, we create grand strategy games enjoyed by over 50 million registered players across 150 countries in 13 languages. Our office, located in Hamburg‚Äôs iconic St. Pauli district, offers a breathtaking 360¬∞ view of the harbor and the Elbe River, with convenient access to public transportation.

Our team is diverse and international, fostering a culture of open communication and flat hierarchies. We support the autonomous work of our agile teams, ensuring each employee contributes meaningfully to our success. We believe in efficient work and collective achievement.

Discover more about Bytro and watch our latest company video:

To enhance our great team we are looking for you!

title: Medior Python Data Engineer
description:
Finalyse is a leading provider of financial risk management solutions specializing in risk modelling, valuation, and analytics. With over 30 years of experience in the financial industry, Finalyse has a proven track record of helping clients navigate complex financial landscapes and make informed decisions. We pride ourselves on our ability to provide customized solutions that meet each client's unique needs. Our team of experts has deep knowledge and expertise in a wide range of financial products, including derivatives, structured products, and alternative investments.

At Finalyse Managed Services, we have been valuing derivatives and structured products since 2008 and we are responsible for market data collection, products configuration in our internal solution and reporting to the clients. Currently, we look for a Medior Python Data Engineer to strengthen our team and we propose a fixed-term B2B or Umowa o Pracƒô contract with potential conversion to a permanent contract.

About The Job

Project description: As a Python Data Engineer at Finalyse, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure and data pipelines. You will work closely with quants, analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure that our data systems are robust, scalable, and efficient.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines using Python and related technologies.Optimize and improve existing data workflows and infrastructure.Collaborate with quants and analysts to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions.Implement data quality checks and monitoring systems.Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations.Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues and inconsistencies.Document data processes, workflows, and systems.


REQUIREMENTS

Required Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python and its data processing libraries (preferred libraries include Pandas, NumPy, AirflowFamiliarity with database systems (preferably Microsoft SQL Server) and ORMs (e.g., SQLAlchemy).Experience with Git and collaborative development workflows.Experience with CI/CD (preferably with GitLab CI/CD).Understanding of ETL processes and data pipeline architectures.Experience in working with Docker.Solid knowledge of Domain Driven Design and best software development practices.Strong proficiency in OOP and test-driven development.


Nice to have (optional):

Experience in working with and developing REST APIs (preferably via FastAPI library).Knowledge of cloud platforms like Azure (including Microsoft Azure DevOps Server) or AWS.Experience with ML models training and deployment.Familiarity with C#.Familiarity with Graylog or ELK.Experience with CI/CD for databases.Experience in working with financial market data or financial products, especially derivatives. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).


Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.Proven at least 2-years experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.


Communication and Teamwork:

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to collaborate with team members and stakeholders effectively.The ability to work well in a team environment and participate in code reviews, discussions, and knowledge sharing sessions.Good knowledge of the English language. It is a must as it is our everyday language.


WE OFFER

The opportunity to join a diverse, multinational, dynamic team of talented and passionate individuals with a broad range of analytical and technical skills.An excellent working environment with a space for defining your own specialization and career within our flat and flexible structure.The opportunity to take initiatives and responsibilities quickly in a fast growing company.Extensive training programs adapted to your personal needs, both on technical matters as well as on softs skills.Coaching and mentoring by more experienced colleagues.Possibility to work in a hybrid mode: both in our office in Warsaw, Rondo Wiatraczna and from home; however, we expect our resources to work in the office at least 2 - 3 days a week.

title: Knowledge Graph Engineer for Data Semantics (m/f/d)
description:
About Us

At BASF Digital Hub Madrid we develop innovative digital solutions for BASF, create new exciting customer experiences and business growth, and drive efficiencies in processes, helping to strengthen BASF¬¥s position as the digital leader in the chemical industry. We believe the right path is through creativity, trial and error and great people working and learning together. Become part of our team and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities.

JOIN THE TEAM

As part of BASF‚Äôs Data & AI Powerhouse within the Product Data Semantics team, you will contribute to strengthening and expanding our semantics capabilities. Your work will focus on implementing analytic solutions for Knowledge Graphs, as well as contributing to other semantics-related activities.


Responsibilities

Apply advanced analytics and AI techniques to extract insights from Knowledge Graphs. Support and provide technical guidance to cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts, on Knowledge Graph exploitation. Design, create and maintain Knowledge Graphs for different business objectives. Evaluate and enhance of the team‚Äôs data governance policies, standards and best practices for effective Knowledge Graphs management. Create and maintain ontologies that will serve as the foundation for future Knowledge Graphs. 



Qualifications

Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in graph analytics. Proven experience in ontology development, including designing and implementing ontologies, taxonomies, and semantic models. Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams, domain experts, and data scientists. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python. Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, with a proactive and self-driven attitude. 

Join Data Semantics as a Knowledge Graph Engineer and contribute to strengthening our semantics capabilities through the effective utilization of Knowledge Graphs, advanced analytics, and AI techniques. Be part of an innovative and collaborative environment that values your expertise and offers exciting opportunities for professional growth.


Benefits

Responsibility from day one in a challenging work environment and "on-the-job" training as part of a committed team. Adequate compensation according to your qualifications and experience A secure work environment because your health, safety and wellbeing is always our top priority. Flexible work schedule and Home-office options, so that you can balance your working life and private life. Learning and development opportunities23 holidays per yearAnother 5 days (readjustments days) and 2 days (cultural days)A collaborative, trustful and innovative work environmentBeing part of an international team and work in global projectsRelocation assistance to Madrid provided

At BASF, the chemistry is right.

Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on sustainable actions, and on connected thinking. And on you. Become a part of our formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores.We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

And this is where your ride starts‚Ä¶
YOUR MISSIONAs an Operations Analyst you will work on the Regional forecasting function (supply & demand balance). We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

Experience in Operations is a plusExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision-making is a must.Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders through excellent communication skillsProficiency in ExcelKnowledge of SQLAbility to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak.Proactive, organized, and obsessed with detailsFluent English LevelExperience in Python would be highly valuable

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.
At Glovo, we truly value diversity for the positive impact it brings to our teams, products, and culture. We're dedicated to providing equal opportunities for talent from all backgrounds.Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

title: Kafka Engineer
description:
¬°Hola Data Lover! üíô
En SDG, no solo tendr√°s la oportunidad de formar parte de algo incre√≠ble, ¬°sino que vivir√°s lo que significa ser un aut√©ntico especialista en Data & Analytics!
¬øEst√°s preparadx para embarcarte en esta emocionante aventura? con nosotrxs, podr√°s potenciar todas tus habilidades y capacidades anal√≠ticas, tecnol√≥gicas y de negocio.
¬°Es hora de despegar hacia el futuro mediante el poder de los datos! √önete a nosotros y prep√°rate para romper las reglas y alcanzar tu mejor versi√≥n üöÄ‚ú®.
Descubre el poder de SDG: l√≠deres globales en la industria del dato üí•üìä
En SDG trabajamos para la mitad de las empresas del IBEX-35, pero tambi√©n en multitud de compa√±√≠as internacionales. Gracias al boom de la anal√≠tica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento, y desde 1994 nos hemos convertido en el socio de confianza para empresas que desean maximizar todo el potencial de sus datos.
Si buscas formar parte de una compa√±√≠a 100% especializada en #Data & #Analytics, ¬°te estamos esperando!

Requisitos m√≠nimos üëá
Estar graduado en Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica o de Telecomunicaciones.Tener al menos 4 a√±os de experiencia en un rol de Big Data Engineer, implementando y productivizando soluciones de captaci√≥n, ingesta y transformaci√≥n de datos.Experiencia de al menos 2 a√±os trabajando en proyectos de tratamiento de datos en tiempo real.Experiencia en arquitectura de datos (formato, estructura, particionado, modelado, capas y ciclo de vida) en ambientes Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Kafka Topics & Partitioning, Schema Registry, etc.Adem√°s ser√° importante que tengas experiencia en algunas de las siguientes herramientas:Lenguajes: Python, Java o Scala.Conocimientos s√≥lidos en algunos de los frameworks y herramientas m√°s relevantes en el procesamiento de eventos en streaming: Spark Structured Streaming, Flink, KStreams y/o ksqlDB.Conocimientos s√≥lidos sobre Kafka u otros brokers de mensajer√≠a, independientemente de si son desplegados en on premise o en cualquier de sus variantes cloud (Confluent, MSK, Pub/Sub, Azure Event Hubs,...).Experiencia en todos los servicios adyacentes a Kafka como Kafka Connect, Schema Registry, MirrorMaker, clientes CDC...Conocimiento y experiencia en el uso de sistemas de control de versiones (VCS), esencialmente Git.Experiencia en la utilizaci√≥n de al menos una de las tres grandes nubes (AWS, Microsoft Azure o Google Cloud Platform), especialmente en lo relativo a los servicios orientados a procesamiento y disposici√≥n de datos.

Requisitos valorables üëá
Se valora de forma muy positiva tener formaci√≥n a trav√©s de un M√°ster u otras alternativas que aumenten tus skills, por ejemplo, un M√°ster en Big Data y Analytics.Hacemos muchas pruebas en local con el uso de contenedores, as√≠ que ser√° importante que puedas manejar Docker. Tambi√©n ser√° muy bien valorado conocimientos en Kubernetes.Qu√© conozcas lenguajes que est√°n tomando relevancia ahora en el mundo data como Rust o Elixir es algo que valoraremos muy positivamente tambi√©n.Conocimiento sobre DataOps, Observabilidad, patrones de dise√±o low-code/no-code,...C√≥mo trabajamos en un entorno global, ser√° un plus que puedas comunicarte en ingl√©s.Nos gusta estar al d√≠a en nuevas tecnolog√≠as, as√≠ que necesitamos personas que quieran estar en continua evoluci√≥n y que tengan ganas de aprender nuevas tecnolog√≠as y probar nuevas herramientas.Para nosotrxs el trabajo en equipo es primordial, por lo que buscamos personas que impulsen ese buen ambiente y las sinergias entre compa√±erxs y diferentes equipos de trabajo.

Acerca del puesto üöÄ
SDG Group es una firma de consultor√≠a global focalizada exclusivamente en soluciones de data & analytics, cubriendo con ello toda la cadena de valor del dato, y proporcionando planes de carrera tanto de consultor√≠a como de especializaci√≥n para todos aquellos que quieran progresar en el mundo del dato. Adem√°s, a trav√©s de nuestra cultura Smart Work tendr√°s la posibilidad de definir el modelo de trabajo que m√°s se adapte a ti y a tus necesidades personales, al mismo tiempo que puedas colaborar en iniciativas de gran impacto para clientes punteros en sus respectivas industrias.Como Streaming data engineer del √°rea de Data Technologies, tu misi√≥n ser√° formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares con el objetivo de ayudar a nuestros clientes a abordar iniciativas de datos en entornos de alta complejidad t√©cnica.Tendr√°s la posibilidad de utilizar un amplio espectro de tecnolog√≠as innovadoras para la construcci√≥n de soluciones de gesti√≥n de datos bajo diversos paradigmas de procesamiento y modelado, aplicando para ello los principios adecuados en t√©rminos de desarrollo y arquitectura.Asimismo, gracias a nuestro path de especialista tendr√°s la oportunidad de crecer como ingeniero y/o arquitecto Big Data, contando con herramientas y recursos para tu continuo aprendizaje y crecimiento profesional, al mismo tiempo que te involucras en diversos retos que permitan tanto a SDG Group como a nuestros clientes explotar al m√°ximo el valor de sus datos.

Responsabilidades ‚úç
Dar tu opini√≥n t√©cnica sobre los procesos y arquitecturas que se desarrollen para nutrir las conversaciones que se llevan a cabo durante las fases de dise√±o de los proyectos que llegan a la compa√±√≠a, teniendo en cuenta factores como escalabilidad, coste, facilidad de implementaci√≥n, mantenimiento‚Ä¶Participar√°s en la toma de requerimientos necesarios para desarrollar arquitecturas y pipelines de datos. Como persona dedicada al mundo Real Time, deber√°s tener en cuenta c√≥mo integrar soluciones en RT con el resto de tecnolog√≠as presentes en el d√≠a a d√≠a.Desarrollar√°s procesos de tratamiento de datos en streaming integrando informaci√≥n en tiempo real as√≠ como ‚Äòat rest‚Äô. Estos desarrollos se llevar√°n a cabo utilizando tecnolog√≠as de procesamiento como Kafka Streams, Flink, Spark,‚Ä¶En los proyectos en los que trabajamos la performance es un factor fundamental, por lo que tambi√©n te tocar√° optimizar la configuraci√≥n de las herramientas de procesamiento, as√≠ como de las plataformas que gestionan los datos optimizando el throughput, latencias, orden de consumo, delivery guarantees,.... Aunque actualmente apostamos por Kafka como plataforma de Streaming en nuestras arquitecturas, tambi√©n hemos desarrollado con otros proveedores como Azure Event Hubs o Kinesis.Tendr√°s que garantizar la estabilidad de los procedimientos monitorizando los pipelines de datos y generando pol√≠ticas de disaster recovery que minimicen el impacto de posibles errores.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Salupay √® una startup B2B che nasce per semplificare e centralizzare gli incassi nel mondo della sanit√† privata in Italia. Oggi le cliniche si interfacciano con tanti portali ed intermediari, ognuno con flussi e procedure diverse ‚Äì con Salupay possono gestire tutto da un solo software, direttamente integrato nel loro gestionale.
Negli scorsi mesi abbiamo avuto una validazione importante sul nostro prodotto da parte dei nostri clienti. Abbiamo tanto da fare! Questa √® una fantastica opportunit√† per entrare in un team piccolo ma affiatato e poter contribuire a costruire un prodotto con un potenziale enorme.
Il settore healthcare in Italia √® estremamente indietro tecnologicamente e dovrai fare i conti con sistemi vecchi, poco documentati e procedure complesse. La nostra forza sar√† costruire prodotti on-top che riescano a portare innovazione sul mercato.

Cosa ti offriamoRAL 50-65k per Hybrid a Milano 2/3gg a settimanaRAL 40-50k per Full-remoteBudget per libri/conferenze/training
Tech StackPHP / Laravel / LivewirePostgresDockerAWS / Cloudflare
Cosa faraisviluppo di integrazioni con assicurazioni e gestionali vecchio stamposviluppo di API pubbliche da fornire a partner tecnicisviluppo del nostro core product as-a-service
Su di tevuoi lavorare in una startup early-stagepensi che essere pragmatici sia meglio che perfezionistisai valutare l'impatto di quello che proponi, sia lato tech che businesssei consapevole che in questo stage CI/CD e tecnologie cloud native non sono la nostra priorit√†
Bonus pointshai esperienza in campo assicurativohai esperienza con pipeline ML e Python
Il Progetto e il TeamSiamo forse gli unici in Italia ad utilizzare Laravel Livewire. Ci abbiamo creduto fin dall‚Äôinizio ed andiamo ad una velocit√† elevata grazie al nostro focus su sviluppo prodotto. Nel team non parliamo di micro-servizi, Kubernetes, serverless perch√® sappiamo che sono tutte distrazioni in questo momento. Se vuoi lavorare con queste tecnologie, questa non e‚Äô la posizione per te. Detestiamo Scrum e metodologie annesse, usiamo Linear per project management ma con un approccio molto lean e responsabilit√† individuale.
Abbiamo tanto da fare e dobbiamo riuscire a costruire prodotti eccellenti con un team piccolo e super skillato. Preferiamo assumere in zona Milano, dove condividerai l'ufficio con il nostro founding team qualche giorno a settimana e respirerai vera aria di startup. La RAL √® commisurata al fatto che sarai on-site. Per i profili giusti possiamo comunque valutare full-remote.
Come candidarsiSe pensi di essere la persona giusta per unirti a noi, scrivici a hiring@salupay.it inviando il tuo CV e qualche riga su perch√® desideri lavorare con noi.

title: Security Engineer - Research Engineer
description:
Cato Networks is the first company to converge enterprise networking and security into one centralized and global service that is delivered by cloud. Cato‚Äôs unique technology inspired a brand-new product category, later named ‚ÄúSASE‚Äù by Gartner.
Cato is the brainchild of networking and security pioneers Shlomo Kramer (Check Point, Imperva) and Gur Shatz (Incapsula.) Cato Networks has raised $773 million dollars since 2015, achieving Centaur status with $100M+ in ARR, and a valuation of $3 billion dollars.
This is your opportunity to get on the rocket ship and join a company that is building a cutting-edge enterprise network and secure cloud platform and is on a fast track to becoming the worldwide market leader ‚Äì don‚Äôt miss it!
We are looking for proactive, analytical talented people to join the Cato Network Security Content team.
As a Security Engineer (Network & Apps) you will analyze protocols and application traffic (L4-L7) using network and web analysis tools (Wireshark, Fiddler, DevTool), as well as modern big data analysis frameworks.
You will be responsible for shaping and creating content signatures to Cato‚Äôs security and network products such as NGWF, CASB, DLP and more.
Joining Cato is an excellent opportunity for network security enthusiasts who are passionate about the future of Networking and Security

ResponsibilitiesFocus on solving customers' problems and painsResearch and analyze network and application behavior as part of Cato Network‚Äôs Security products (NGFW,CASB,DLP and more).Suggest and conduct new research vectorsUtilize Cato‚Äôs Data Warehouse with big-data technologies to support your workAutomate your work to improve efficiency

Requirements3-5 years of hands-on experience in the cyber/security/network industryKnowledge of networking architecture, OSI model, and protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, TLS, HTTP) ‚Äìa mustExperience with at least one scripting language such as Python(Pandas, Numpy) ‚Äìa mustExperience with signature development for IPS or Firewall - Big AdvantageExperience with SQL or data analysis tools (Kibana, Elastic,etc) ‚Äì Big AdvantageExperience (Hands-on) with Wireshark and PCAP analysis or similar toolsExcellent English and communication skillsTeam player, responsible, and well-organized

title: Driving Data & Analytics - Internship(EN)
description:
Create your own future

We are looking for an enthusiastic and compassionate intern to support the CMO Analytics team. You will directly get your hands dirty with data and programming. You will work among other highly motivated people who all aim to deliver business value by deploying data tools ready to be used.

That is what you will use your talents for as a Driving Data Analytics Intern at Van Lanschot Kempen. You will use your people & communication skills to inspire, convince and support digital and data adoption. During this internship you will work in a dynamic environment with various multidisciplinary DevOps teams and departments like the commercial colleagues of the Private Bank, Investment & Fiduciary Managers and Operations teams like Client Monitoring.

You also have the following tasks:

Work with a Product Owner and specialist to gather project requirements and implement a plan of action;Work on data visualisation using preferably Power BI;Develop or improve machine learning models;Work with Azure DevOps and Azure Data Factory; Create and maintain data engineering pipelines that fuel our ML models.

Your talents

Dynamic, outgoing and digital savvy. This is how we can best describe you in the position of Driving Data & Analytics Intern. Talents that you use to guide our customers in a constantly changing world every day. By thinking out of the box and asking questions. And all will be well if you also are analytical, result-oriented and have a hands-on mentality. In addition:

You are master's student in computer science, econometrics, statistics, data science or analytics with one or two courses in statistics, machine learning, data science or software development;You have hands-on knowledge on backend programming, preferably python/SQL and front-end implementation in JavaScript/Node JS;You have a good knowledge of PowerBI and Data Bricks; You are available for at least 5 months for 32 to 40 hours a week;You are passionate about new technology and tools and like to work with data;Finance background and knowledge is a nice to have;You have a good mastery of English, both oral and written.

Move ahead at Van Lanschot Kempen

Investing in a more future-oriented, sustainable, and data-driven way with various clients. Both nationally and internationally. With almost 300 years of experience, we make this ambition a reality at Van Lanschot Kempen. We do this with some 2,000 colleagues in various fields of expertise.

The Digital Innovation and Advanced Analytics department operates from the heart of Van Lanschot Kempen. It has four analytics teams that consist of highly skilled and motivated Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers & BI Dashboarding specialists. Enabling the entire Wealth Manager supercharging their decision-making by creating models, tools & dashboards for the commercial organisation, investment management and staff departments like Internal Control and Compliance. The teams work cloud native (Azure), with the latest techniques and languages. The department drives the organisation to work increasingly data-driven!

An organisation's degree of innovation and agility also depends on the diversity of its workforce. Our differences make us stronger together. We promote an inclusive work environment where all colleagues feel at home. With us, you can be yourself. And we are proud of that.

Curious about the stories of colleagues and how they experience working at Van Lanschot Kempen? Go to People & Projects and find out more!

Turning talent into value!

That‚Äôs what we do. The fact is, if you add value, you can obviously expect the same from us in return. In the Driving Data & Analytics Internship you will also be given:

Compensation of ‚Ç¨ 800,00 gross per month (based on 40h per week);A company laptop and first access to the most innovative tools/products;A creative and agile environment where you cooperate with ambitious teams;A lot of responsibility and a large amount of autonomy;A passionate internship supervisor who is a specialist in data science;An environment to learn, make mistakes and develop yourself;The opportunity to have an impact in one of the largest Wealth Managers in Benelux.

Working on tomorrow's capital

Just the vacancy you were looking for? Please submit your application.

Do you have any questions about the recruitment process? Please get in touch with Jessica Martins, Campus Recruiter, on +31 (0)6 57683187 or at j.martins@vanlanschotkempen.com

title: Full-Stack Developer - Typescript/ReactJS
description:

osapiens terra invites you to join our innovative team in Mannheim. We are a specialized unit within osapiens working on cutting-edge analytics for satellite and environmental data. Tasks

title: Remote Solidity Engineer
description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies. Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

We are looking for a talented Solidity Engineer to work on an innovative project - a credit platform that leverages future cash flows to unlock capital today.

You Are a Perfect Candidate If

 You want to develop a protocol with $1B+ TVL. You are excited to build upon new EIPs and standards like [ERC-4626] and [ERC-7540]). You have a strong understanding of DeFi protocols and popular products (e.g. staking, liquidity provisioning, etc.). You have shipped Web3 products that have been audited. You love having ownership over everything you build.

You Will

 Become a key player in the Product & Engineering team where you will develop novel, new smart contracts and iterate on existing core contracts. Collaborate with Business Development team on protocol features and roadmap. Elevate and accelerate the team's smart contract development.

Profile / Requirements

 Required Tech Stack: Solidity, Foundry, Typescript. Strong experience writing and testing Solidity contracts on EVM-compatible chains. Foundry strongly preferred, but Hardhat is okay too. Experience creating documentation for complex smart contract systems. Experience researching, reading, and reusing smart contract code from libraries (e.g. OpenZeppelin, Chainlink, Uniswap, etc.), DeFi contracts, and new standards. Expert knowledge of Git. Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Valid PL/EU work permit.

title: Graduate Cloud Engineer
description:
In de rol als Graduate Cloud Engineer ga je specialiseren in het bouwen, beheren en veranderen van onze Cloud hostingomgevingen die onze applicaties hosten. Wij leveren deze als SaaS oplossingen aan onze klanten. De onderliggende techniek waar wij mee werken is Azure en onze eigen private Cloud omgeving. We zien de infrastructuurwereld veranderen naar software, dus automatiseren we uiteraard zoveel mogelijk in onze Cloud infrastructuur. Op dit moment zitten we midden in de transitiefase naar Azure. Als Cloud Engineer heb je hier een belangrijke rol in maar je vindt het ook nog interessant om ons legacy platform te ondersteunen.
Dit = de baan die je zoektAls Graduate Cloud engineer bij Exact Cloud Services, een volwaardig lid van de Exact Groep, word je samen met je collega's van de Afdeling Cloud Platform verantwoordelijk voor de stabiliteit, performance, toekomstbestendigheid en veiligheid van onze hostingplatforms. Onze hostingplatforms zijn omgevingen waar een groeiend aantal van rond de 500 klanten hun Exact producten in een gehoste vorm afnemen.Je werkt in het Cloud Platform team samen met verschillende andere, zeer ervaren engineers. Je collega's begrijpen echt de zakelijke context en vereisten. Je leert van hen, maar je bent niet bang om zelf ook je kennis te delen. Jij onderscheidt je door jouw ambitie en lerend vermogen en analytisch denkvermogen en het stellen van prioriteiten. Je bent klant- en servicegericht, altijd op zoek naar oplossingen en verdere groei.Dit = wat je meebrengtBij ons mag je jezelf zijn en we ontdekken graag waarin jij je onderscheidt. Voor de functie van Graduate Cloud Engineer willen we wel graag dat je een afgeronde IT studie hebt op universitair niveau. Je komt te werken met onderstaande technologie√´n:AzureInfrastructure as Code (IaC) Bicep ervaringAzure DevOps, CI/CD pipelinesAzure Virtual Desktop -> core componentAzure Desired State Configuration (DSC) PowerShellErvaring met Azure PaaS services (database, storage, networking, security)Windows Server / Active Directory/ Microsoft 365 (Teams, Exchange, OneDrive, SharePoint)Citrix VAD, MCS en Citrix CloudHypervisors (VmWare, HyperV)/Storage systemen (Pure) en back-up (Rubrik) / Switching, routing, firewalls / Monitoring oplossingen (ControlUp)Security en Patching-tooling (ESET, Ivanti Security Controls en Tenable)Wij vinden het belangrijk dat je zelf startend bent, met een can do mentaliteit. Je werkt in IT en bij ons is het belangrijk dat je het leuk vindt om nieuwe technieken te leren.Dit = wat je krijgtBij Exact vinden we de balans tussen inspanning en ontspanning zeer belangrijk. Zo kun je je in het zweet werken in onze eigen gym of een rustmoment pakken aan de koffiebar. En uiteraard is dat niet alles. Als Cloud Engineer kun je, op basis van 40 uur per week, ook rekenen op:Een bruto maandsalaris passend bij je kennis en werkervaring;Vakantietoeslag van 8% en een dertiende maand;27 vakantiedagen en 3 Giving back days die je kunt besteden aan vrijwilligerswerk. Daarnaast loyalitietsdagen; 1 extra dag vakantie per gewerkt jaar, met een max. van vijf.Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling, het uitwerken van creatieve idee√´n en het behalen van (Microsoft) certificeringen.Een informele werksfeer, flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om veel vanuit huis te werken.Een organisatie waar veel afgestudeerden aan de slag gaan om zich verder te ontwikkelen.Een jonge, platte en gezonde organisatie met 45 collega's verdeeld over de afdelingen Cloud Platform, Cloud Delivery, Development, Sales en Support. Onze gezamenlijke passie voor de Cloud, technologie, innovatie en klanttevredenheid verbindt ons.En wereldwijd binnen Exact ruim 2000 collega's, waarvan ruim 600 in development/IT.Een modern, mooi hoofdkantoor in Delft en hanteren een hybride werkmodel waardoor je zowel thuis als op kantoor kunt werken.Evenementen zoals een wereldwijde hackathon en Tech Talks om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen of juist het podium om ze te laten zien.

title: Full Stack Engineers X 3 - React, Python, SQL Hybrid
description:
Full Stack Engineers X 3 - React JS, Python & SQL | Permanent | Hybrid | Dublin 2
Talentspot is working exclusively to support our highly-regarded capital markets customer. Having been in business for 50 years, they are considered a Wall Street heavyweight for their scale, innovation and investment returns. Markets they operate in include asset management, real estate, credit risk, hedge funds, fund management and private equity.
COMPANY OVERVIEWThey have experienced significant growth over the last few years and are investing in a wide-scale modernisation of their technology stack and how they approach managing that technology. Their globally distributed technology portfolio includes complex, native web applications, highly extensible third-party applications, Big Data/EDWH, and reporting/insights solutions - deployed both in on-premise data centers and within the public cloud (AWS).
OPPORTUNITY OVERVIEWThey are looking for three Full Stack Engineers to join a new team based in Dublin. You will be working closely with a US-based team of agile Engineers, and will be responsible for delivering solutions to help drive their world-class investment professionals through investment strategy, asset management and operations.
Working on a cloud-native tech stack utilising microservices, you will leverage Kubernetes along with modern approaches to CI/CD. Primarily using React on the front-end and Python and NodeJS on the back end.
ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIESWork closely with key (non-technical) business stakeholders to understand business requirements, to then design, build and deploy elegant, secure, scalable, reusable technical solutionsContribute towards application design and architectural reviewsParticipate in an agile, iterative software development processCollaborate closely with business and engineering stakeholders across the divisionHelp solve complex problems into simple, creative, and effective solutionsDesign and code solutions for high availability, observability, and maintainabilityAssist with ad-hoc data reporting for business stakeholders
QUALIFICATIONS3-5 years' full-stack software engineering experience in an agile environment with React, Python and SQLAt least 1 year of experience with cloud-based service-oriented architecture and web services that includes Microservices.Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a technical field (Engineering/Mathematics/Computer Science)Advanced knowledge of Python with a proven track record of delivering high-quality enterprise-scale data-centric applicationsStrong background in databases and data pipelines (they utilise PostgreSQL but SQL experience from other databases is fine)AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform would be highly advantageous, but these can be learned by the right candidateExperience in designing, delivering, and securing data-rich web applicationsExperience in a front office support environment with strong communication skills for interacting with business stakeholders would be advantageous, but it is not essentialHighly numeric, with a background or interest in accounting along with an eye for detail to spot erroneous inputs/outputsAn ability to quickly learn new business concepts driven by a passion for learning about finance, capital markets, and asset management domains, to a reasonably high level of expertiseExcellent communication skills paired with the ability to think strategically and act tactically with attention to detailCurious with excellent analytical skills, and resourcefulnessTrack record of solution ownership and the capability to deliver results in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment.
Their current expectation for hybrid working is 4 days a week office-based (with a small degree of additional flexibility for specific events). This is a key aspect of their culture to help drive learning, build a cohesive team, and to develop business relationships across the organisation.
You must already be able to live and work in Ireland, with no restrictions as sponsorship is not available.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Join our Team

About this opportunity:

Are you a newly graduate looking to kick-start your career in the exciting field of DevOps? We are launching an initiative to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is to thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a "lean and mean" product development organization. Join our team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next. If you're passionate about fostering modern product development paradigms, inspiring change, shaping innovative technology, and building something entirely new, we want you on board!

What you will do:

Learn and grow: Design, implement, and manage cloud-based infrastructure solutions as part of an agile team, ensuring our tools and infrastructures are robust, scalable, and user-friendly.Collaborate: Work closely with development teams to solve infrastructure-related issues and support them in delivering high-quality solutions.Stay up to date: Keep yourself updated with industry-standard methodologies and emerging technologies.Contribute to the team: Participate in an agile team using Lean, Agile, and DevOps methodologies and tooling, contributing to continuous integration, delivery, and deployment capabilities.

The skills you bring:

Passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow in the field of cloud infrastructure management.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Basic understanding of cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, and their infrastructure management. We are working with GCP as our primary cloud provider and experience and certificates in GCP will be highly valued.Familiarity with DevOps principles and tools, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or GitHub Actions.Knowledge or experience with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.Excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment.

Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you¬¥ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what¬¥s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world‚Äôs toughest problems. You¬¥ll be challenged, but you won‚Äôt be alone. You¬¥ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

description:

title: Senior Software Developer
description:

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The position provides the advantage of involvement in diverse projects across different teams, helping them develop and improve their products. Additionally, there are opportunities to test product changes and see the results of your work in action by grabbing a golf club, swinging it, and seeing if the code you created reacts in the way you expect on the golf balls trajectory. 
WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?
Our mission is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ‚õ≥Ô∏è üì∫ üé•
At our new office, you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! ü•≥ üèì ‚òïÔ∏è
We are proud to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! üöÄ üíª üíô
THE ROLEWe are strengthening our Shared Data team with a Senior Data Engineer. As a Data Engineer in the Shared Data team at Toptracer, you will be working with the central parts of the Data platform and pipelines. This role offers the exciting opportunity to consolidate data pipelines and databases into a newly set up data warehouse. You will have the chance to affect the architecture and design leaving a positive impact on the product. In this role, you will take the team and Toptracer to the next level.
The position provides the advantage of involvement in diverse projects across different teams, helping them develop and improve their products. Additionally, there are opportunities to test product changes and see the results of your work in action by grabbing a golf club, swinging it, and seeing if the code you created reacts in the way you expect on the golf ball's trajectory.
The team Shared data is responsible for data analysis, streaming services and API‚Äôs. They have a great culture and chemistry together. They work with agile methods and use Jira to structure their work.
You will also have a big impact on consolidating the system we have today, the platform is both in the cloud and on-prem. You will together with the team and other teams at Toptracer make the platform more robust and scalable than it is today.
You are a quick learner who enjoys understanding new tech stacks and applying suitable technology to the tasks at hand. You are open-minded and can consider the pros and cons of multiple alternative solutions. You have a passion for data, coding, problem-solving, and a deep understanding of the needs of data for analysis and services.

WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE5+ years of experience working as a Data EngineerProfessional experience and knowledge of Data platforms and pipelines,Data model frameworks, principles, and best practicesExperience with data warehousesAn understanding of trends and opportunities to ensure we are following best practicesExperience in managing cloud infrastructure, preferably AWSAn understanding of the software development process and identifying the needs of a back-end developerAt least two years of experience working in Python
MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER
Workplace
We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
CultureOur culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.

The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Software Development Engineer - Lambda, Lambda - Sandbox
description:
Description

AWS Lambda‚Äôs goal is nothing less than to simplify and improve the experience of computing in the cloud for every developer on the planet, from startups to the largest Fortune 100 companies. Serverless computing is rapidly changing how every company thinks about building and delivering software solutions, and Lambda is leading this industry wide effort.

Our Team

AWS Lambda is growing in Dublin, Ireland and our goal is to continue to define the Serverless revolution. In the Lambda team you will be joining a team where the entire development of the service occurs in Dublin. You will have the opportunity to impact the service roadmap in a meaningful way as the existing team team has done for recent deliverables like AWS Lambda Runtime Management Controls, AWS Lambda Extensions, AWS Lambda Container Support plus a host of new Language runtimes. You will own and implement specific components, build highly available, secure, scalable, distributed, event-driven systems and help to define the system architecture. This is a full-stack development position on a large distributing computing platform.

What does it take to succeed in this role?

You should be comfortable working in an environment dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of customers. You should be intellectually curious, always looking to learn and be dedicated to turning the software developers that use Lambda to build modern applications into fans of the service. You should be somebody who aspires to make the team both productive and a fun place to work. Being excited to learn from others while bringing your own novel capabilities and perspectives.

On-Call Responsibility

This position involves on-call responsibilities, every builder on Lambda is also an owner. Nobody likes to get paged in the middle of the night or on the weekend, so we work to ensure that our systems are well engineered, fault tolerant and meet a high quality bar before the go into production. Our customers expect nothing less. When we do get paged we work together as a team to resolve the root cause of the issue and nobody is left on their own to deal with an operational issue.

Utility Computing (UC)

AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations ‚Äî from foundational services such as Amazon‚Äôs Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS‚Äôs services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you‚Äôll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS. Within AWS UC, Amazon Dedicated Cloud (ADC) roles engage with AWS customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

Job location is Dublin, Ireland. Relocation assistance available. For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com

About The Team

About AWS

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.

Basic Qualifications

 Experience (non-internship) in professional software development Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems Experience programming with at least one software programming language

Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations.
