title: Senior Engineer- Dublin
description:
#IJ

Senior Engineer - Dublin 

Life Science and tech division are looking for Senior Engineers . The Senior Engineer will manages the engineering function as the senior representative, co-ordinates with the line manager and provides Engineering Leadership for their respective project. Sets the strategy for Engineering setting out and onsite control, along with the (Engineer/Assistant Engineer) and subordinates/supply chain. Is the primary point of reference for QA, record keeping and production ensuring the establishment and maintenance of the Sisk Quality procedures and requirements. Also takes responsibility for Temporary Works Control/Co-ordination and where required actively manages lifting operations.

Responsibilities

Competent and demonstrates advanced awareness in the best forms of dimensional control and is comfortable in rotating global grids into local grid formatEnsures that site and graduate engineers take responsibility for the management of survey equipmentEnsures that the engineering team completes as-built surveys for key elements. Understands key tolerances and can analyse details across a number of interfaces to highlight potential problemsCompletes an individual daily diaryCompetent in the principles of quality control for the majority of packages. Can review and create Inspection & Test Plans. Can readily display advanced knowledge of key packages such as concrete, drainage, steelwork and brickwork Has a good awareness of the project specifications, in particular tolerances for vertical and horizontal structural elementsControls the components of the SISK Non-Conformance procedure.comfortable in creating and closing out Non-Conformances.Understands the cost of defects and remedial works.Works actively to close out NCRs in a timely mannercompetent in the issuing of ‚ÄúPermits to break ground‚ÄùCan review and create method statements and risk assessmentsIdentifies where information is missing and has an excellent working knowledge of the project RFI processUndertakes the role of the Temporary Works Co-ordinator (When appointed) and ensures the Sisk Temporary Works procedures are implemented for both direct and subcontracted worksUndertakes the role of Project Lifting Operations Appointed Person (When appointed)Constantly provides information to the project planner to allow programmes to be updated or updates them personallyProvides assistance and more often than not leads site and graduate engineers, demonstrating best practice at all timesfully aware of the locations of existing and proposed servicesConsistently stops site works, where they believe person(s) are at risk from a health and safety perspectiveWorks collaboratively with other SISK and sub-contractors‚Äô engineers, utilising their experience at all timesDevelops consents schedules and understands the key parties. Takes responsibility for ground validation reports to fulfil SISK planning obligationsDevelops the project logistics plan and has input into establishing the programme to completionUnderstand outputs for various trades, highlighting where trades are falling behind programme or under resourcedCan work and lead where necessary engineering teams of various sizes and abilities Point of contact for technical, temporary works and lifting operations audits.Responsible for ensuring that all actions are closed within a suitable timeframejey member of the project management team in the delivery of Health, Safety and Environmental presentations (Examples include project inductions, tool box talks, and crane team briefings)Provides input on the content of presentationsAssists the project design manager in the design approvals process and establishes benchmarks and samples Supervises and mentors less experienced engineers working on their siteAble to draft, monitor and update short term programmes

Requirements 

Is fully competent in understanding the dangers of underground services and the risk control procedures requiredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsGood working knowledge of Microsoft OfficeIs competent in the use of digital information systems i.e. A-Site, Viewpoint for Projects‚Ñ¢ etc.Significant experience in the design management processManaging Safety in Construction trainingFirst Aid.Service avoidance coursePossibly B.Eng/ M.EngTemporary Works Co-ordinator trainingLifting Operations basic awareness courseA61 CPCS Lifting Operations Appointed Persons courseIs working towards professional status, ICE, CIOB etc

Our people are at the heart of our success and our proposition to them is work with purpose, have time for life, build a career with no limits and surround yourself with great people.

Our Internal Recruitment Team fulfil all vacancies on a direct basis. Unsolicited contact by unapproved agencies (sharing speculative CVs) will not be accepted and introductory fees will not apply.

The full job specification is available on request

At Sisk we are committed to attracting and hiring diverse talent into our organisation. We know the confidence gap and imposter phenomenon can get in the way of meeting remarkable candidates. We also know that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't feel they meet all the criteria. Give your transferable skills the chance to tell the full story. It‚Äôs not all about your technical expertise. Don‚Äôt hold back, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: Real-Time C++ and Python Software Engineer
description:
EER Poland is looking for Real-Time C++ and Python Software Engineer to join our client's team. 
Our client is from IT industry and is focusing on AI solutions. 
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and optimizing software for real-time systems, ensuring high performance and reliability. This role involves working on cutting-edge projects that require a deep understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of real-time computing, with proficiency in both C++ and Python.

Our client offers a B2B contract (with the bonus of 20 paid vacation days) and hybrid work in Krakow (2 days a week)
Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain software for real-time systems using C++ and Python.Optimize software to meet performance requirements and ensure low latency and high reliability.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define software requirements and specifications.Implement and test software modules to ensure they meet the necessary performance and safety standards.Debug and resolve issues in a timely manner, ensuring minimal impact on project timelines.Utilize Python for scripting, automation, and integration tasks.Stay updated with the latest advancements in real-time computing, C++ programming, and Python development.Document software design, implementation, and testing procedures.
Requirements:Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.5 years of SW Development experienceAt least 3 years of experience in real-time software development with C++ and Python.Proficiency in multi-threaded and concurrent programming.Experience with low-level programming and hardware interfacing.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Advantages:Experience with real-time automotive, aerospace, telecommunications, or industrial automation systems.Familiarity with software development tools and environments such as GNU/Linux, Windows, or embedded systems.Knowledge of software development methodologies, including Agile and Scrum.Experience with performance profiling and optimization tools.Understanding of network protocols and communications in real-time systems.Experience with Python libraries and frameworks for real-time applications.

title: Technical Specialist AI
description:
Do you like solving practical problems with technology and AI? Then we are looking for you. With the current technological developments, we see the legal and tax world change, and adapt quickly. To keep up the pace with this fast changing world, we are looking for someone to help us translate new technology into solutions to support our business.

You do this by engaging with the different stakeholders, understanding their problem, and come-up with technology driven solutions. Being able to creatively solve problems, but adhering to the architecture and security guidelines is crucial.

The Loyens & Loeff IT department is looking for someone with a broad range of technical knowledge in among others the Microsoft Technology stack, ranging from Microsoft Azure and SharePoint, to Power BI, PowerApps and (Gen-) AI in general. You will be using your technology skills to create, and maintain, different types of technological solutions. After adoption of the solution, maintenance and updates are part of your role as well. The IT department is organised to optimize the agile way of working.

Your responsibilities as a technical specialist AI: 

working in a multidisciplinary IT team and collaborating with the business, you are going to combine standard product groups into solutions by developing: API`s, Connectors, Databases, Applications, Azure Components, programming custom interfaces, etc.;understanding how data can be used to implement solutions that can bring efficiency to the legal practice;embedding new technologies, such as Azure AI Search, Azure Open AI and more to come in future; developing and supporting custom solutions for practice management optimization;creating and supporting applications that enables the business to focus on higher value tasks;liaising with other IT teams; such as Architecture, Security, and other services managed by IT;actively participate in discussions regarding Networking, Security & Architecture within Azure CloudPlatform. 

This vacancy suits you, because you are/have: 

a team player; strong communication skills; speak and write fluently English and Dutch; interest in new technologies; able to translate new tech into practical implementation;conceptually strong; a good understanding of working DTAP/etc, self-relying but aware of impact and risk; an excellent understanding of how data can be used to add value to the business;‚ÄØ familiar with agile way of working and DevOps; eager to learn; based in the Netherlands, but willing to incidentally travel to our home market offices in Luxembourg, Belgium, and Switzerland. 

You have a strong knowledge of: 

MS Tech Stack used in L&L;Microsoft Azure; M365; SharePoint Online;PowerApps; Python & C#. 

Who are we?

Loyens & Loeff is a fully independent law firm specialised in law and tax. Each problem requires a customised solution. Our pragmatic approach and drive to devise innovative solutions allow us to effectively address the demands of our clients‚Äô domestic and international businesses. Thanks to the broad range of our legal experience, know-how and the size of our practices, we offer top-level advice, locally and internationally. We are committed to meeting our clients‚Äô needs at the highest quality level and in the most efficient way.

Apply for this vacancy!

Sounds like a job for you? Submit your application via 'apply' button. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Luna Staal (Recruitment Adviser) Luna.staal@loyensloeff.com or Noa Moerel (Recruitment Adviser) Noa.Moerel@loyensloeff.com We are looking forward to your application!

title: Engineering Intern
description:
Overview

PepsiCo Internship Programme is 6-month program designed for high potential undergraduate students, just like you, into real life business impact roles - with the goal to best prepare you for a successful future. We are now looking to hire an Automation Engineering Intern to join the team in Cork, Ireland starting next year for the duration of 6 months.

Who We are:

We are the concentrate team in PepsiCo (PGCS) working across the Beverage, Nutrition and Snacks categories to deliver concentrate for many of PepsiCo‚Äôs mega brands including Gatorade, 7Up and Pepsi.‚ÄØ We are at the heart of PepsiCo products, sourcing ingredients to manufacture more than 1,200 recipes for our brands.‚ÄØWe are a global organisation, situated in 15 locations across 6 countries offering careers in various functions from Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Procurement, Quality, Finance, R&D, HR and IT.We collaborate in our global organisation and are passionate about creating and delivering much-loved household brands to markets across the world. 

The Engineering Intern role will be challenging and diverse. It will give the successful candidate exposure and experience across various engineering and project management disciplines, as well as opportunities for interaction with Operations, suppliers, end-users and other third-party bodies. There will be opportunities to contribute and make a valued impact within the wider PepsiCo community also, through involvement in global programs and initiatives. Intern development and mentoring will be key focus areas.

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, the engineering intern will support the delivery of the PepsiCo PGCS Base Capital Projects Agenda. They will support the development of business cases and Capex documents for funding approval. They will build their capability and develop subject matter expertise in key areas, which will contribute to building the overall capability of the Global Engineering Team. They will leverage this newfound knowledge and expertise by supporting the global network of sites in solving complex technical problems. They will contribute towards driving productivity, efficiency and best practice in all aspects of the business. They will ensure compliance to both internal and external regulations in all their engineering activities.

Responsibilities

Specific tasks include:

Lead/Support the end to end execution of Capital Engineering Projects (including business case development, understanding user requirements/scope, communications with key stakeholders, change management, considering safety, quality and risk)Support the plants in the achievement of their KPIs through support of the productivity programUnderstanding and supporting the development of Engineering and procurement standards, including technical and commercial aspects of projectsBuilding supplier relationships with key vendors, and understanding the role they play in the delivery of our Capital agendaUnderstanding and implementing Change Management and its importance to the success of the projectBuilding an understanding of how to manage Change in a project, and the implications it brings to scope, budget and scheduleLearn and leverage the best practices from PepsiCo divisions as well as from other industries to support the delivery of best-in-class plant and equipment design, project implementation and construction managementParticipate in Global Engineering Team meetings, share and leverage best practices from other PGCS sitesLearn and leverage latest cutting edge technologies in key areas of the businessLearn how to present to and communicate with PGCS senior management for Capex Approvals & Project UpdatesLearn to implement sustainable engineering practices, ensuring sustainability in plant design and operationBuild capability and develop subject matter expertise in key areas

Qualifications

What do I need to apply?

Pursuing Degree qualification in Process, Chemical, Mechanical, Electrical or Civil Engineering Demonstrate willingness and ability to learn and to actively contribute and add value in the following areas:PGCS Engineering standardsProject concept developmentBusiness case and capital approvalDesign, Procurement and InstallationConstruction, Commissioning and ValidationEnvironmental, health and safety managementContractor and Construction ManagementPGCS Quality, Regulatory, and Operational requirementsGeneration of project documentationChange managementProject risk managementLean Six Sigma ProjectsSomone who can communicate well and work quicklyDemonstrate excellent interpersonal and someone who can communication clearly and an ability to work at all levels in an international organization, both individually and as part of a multi-functional teamExcellent IT skills (MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel)Results oriented and commitment to achieving personal and project objectivesSelf-starter with a can do attitudeAbility to work to deadlines within our environment. 

What happens after I apply?

Application is submitted and reviewed by a Talent Acquisition representative.Suitable profiles are contacted to complete a screening call followed by a more formal interview.You will then be progressed to Pre-Employment compliance checks.Once these have all been successfully completed you will be given your formal offer.

At PepsiCo, opportunity is for everyone.

Being recognised as a Great Place to Work in Ireland, highlights how PepsiCo has become a workplace where we foster a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion with acceptance and respect for all employees.‚ÄòA space to be you‚Äô is our initiative that creates a collaborative, equitable and inclusive space where everyone, regardless of what we look like, where we come from or who we love, has a voice.We make reasonable accommodations for our employees and create a supportive work environment that provides a sense of community for employees who may otherwise feel marginalized or isolated.pep+ (PepsiCo Positive) is the future of our company. It‚Äôs the core strategy that will guide how our business will grow for decades to come, all while having a positive impact on the planet and people.

For more information, scroll down to MORE FROM PEPSICO or

visit‚ÄØwww.pepsico.com.

title: Customer Service Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we‚Äôre already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

This role involves a mix of technical support, case management, and strategic collaboration with various departments.

Key Responsibilities

 Provide remote technical support and case management, acting as the primary tech support for our premium customers  Receive and manage escalated cases from 1st level support, utilizing and contributing to our knowledge base.  Deploy and assist Field Service Engineers, ensuring smooth operations.  Escalate cases to JIRA and conduct remote fleet assessments.  Offer application case support and participate in partner reviews and discussions with the Sales team.  Communicate service report content effectively to partners and customers.  Evaluate customer service history to address specific needs and enhance satisfaction.  Generate leads from case activities and quote relevant service products.  Act as a strategic partner for the FSE before deployment, providing guidance and support. 

We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR 

We Expect You To Have

 Successfully completed technical studies or training as a technician with relevant experience in the field of automation technology or mechanical/electrical engineering  A degree i n Robotics Engineering or gained similar experience through years of working with our robots  At least 3 years of professional experience in customer service or technical support, ideally in the robotics or automation industry  Experience in fault diagnosis / troubleshooting of robot applications and/or automation solutions at customer sites is an advantage  A customer service mindset with a focus on detail and adaptability.  Strong customer service orientation, detail-oriented, adaptable, and a team player.  Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment  In addition to German at native speaker level, you have very good written and spoken English and a class B driving license 

We collaborate - it¬¥s in our DNA 

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year‚Äôs innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia ‚Äì and we‚Äôre growing all the time. So, if you‚Äôre looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Experienced Full-Stack Software Developer
description:
The CyRIC Unmanned Aerial and Ground Systems (UAGS) division is looking for experienced Full-Stack Software developers to join its software development team.
Introducing CyRIC UAGS DivisionCyRIC UAGS division is part of the Cyprus Research and Innovation Centre (CyRIC) ecosystem, an award-winning, high-tech company developing novel technologies and products for local and international markets and providing unique, high-quality engineering and business services the industry. The UAGS division is responsible for the design, development and manufacturing of state-of-the-art Unmanned Aerial and Ground Vehicles (UAVs and UGVs) with applications in search and rescue, defence, critical infrastructure control and ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance). The UAGS software development team is the newest member of the UAGS division with the goal of providing our customers with custom build software applications that will enable them to efficiently and accurately fulfil their missions. 
The RoleAs an experienced full-stack software engineer you will be a key member of our engineering team and will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle, from conceptualization to deployment and maintenance. Your responsibilities will include crafting intuitive user interfaces, designing robust back-end-systems, and implementing efficient APIs. We are seeking a versatile developer who can work across multiple layers of the stack, is comfortable with various programming languages and frameworks, and can adapt quickly to new technologies. The successful candidate(s) will play a crucial role in shaping our technical architecture and delivering a high-quality, innovative solution to our customers.
Current Software Stack: JavaScript (React and React Native), Python (FastAPI), C++, SQL (PostgreSQL), Lua, KeyCloak, Github Actions, GCP, docker.
What you will be doing‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain web applications using various programming languages and frameworks.‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement new features.‚Ä¢ Write clean, efficient and maintainable code.‚Ä¢ Perform code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.‚Ä¢ Debug and fix issues in existing applications‚Ä¢ Optimize applications for performance and scalability.‚Ä¢ Implement security measures and data protection.‚Ä¢ Participate in Agile development processes.‚Ä¢ Stay updated with new technologies and industry best practices.
What we are looking forAt CyRIC we promote a culture of respect, responsibility, continuous learning and well-being and thus we are looking for individuals that will fit well with our team and values. Below is our wish list for this position. We know is a long list and we don‚Äôt expect you to fulfil every item on it. If you have strong capabilities even in a few the listed items, we do encourage you to apply, and we will be happy to discuss with you further details. 
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field‚Ä¢ Provable previous experience in full-stack software development (we are open to all levels of experienced developers)‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and modern frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue.js)‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of back-end programming languages (e.g., Python, Node.js, Ruby, C++, C#)‚Ä¢ Experience with databases systems (both SQL and NoSQL)‚Ä¢ Experience with Android and iOS native development‚Ä¢ Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git)‚Ä¢ Knowledge of RESTful API design and implementation‚Ä¢ Understanding of web security practices‚Ä¢ Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)‚Ä¢ Knowledge of microservices development, deployment and management‚Ä¢ Familiarity with real-time video and image collection and processing‚Ä¢ Experience with messaging-oriented middleware (e.g., MQTT, RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka)‚Ä¢ Experience with drone software/firmware (e.g., ArduPilot, PX4, Mission Planner, Qgroundcontrol)‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and teamwork abilities‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Position Details‚Ä¢ Position: Full-time / Employee‚Ä¢ Location: Hybrid ‚Äì Nicosia, Cyprus‚Ä¢ Reporting To: Head of Software Development ‚Äì UAGS Division

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. title: Software Integrator
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands

Software Integrator, 32- 40 uur, Hengelo.

Actief in de sectoren Aerospace, Defense en Security is Thales Nederland met ruim 2.500 medewerkers de topaanbieder van high-tech banen. Productinnovatie en snel inspelen op de nieuwste technologische mogelijkheden zijn onze drijfveren. Spraakmakende voorbeelden daarvan zijn radar-, communicatie- en command & control systemen voor marineschepen en communicatie-, beveiligings- en betaalsystemen voor het bedrijfsleven. Thales Nederland is onderdeel van de Thales Group met 81.000 werknemers in ruim 60 landen en behoort daarmee tot de grootste elektronicabedrijven van Europa.

Binnen het cluster Naval-Engineering worden door de afdeling Applications software oplossingen ontwikkeld voor onder andere onze radar en optische sensoren. Dit betreft real-time software voor onze radar processing systemen in het sensor domein.

Voor dit domein zijn wij op zoek naar getalenteerde Software Integrator.

Over jouw toekomstige baan

Software maakt een steeds groter deel uit van onze totale engineering inspanning en levert veel extra functionaliteit aan onze radar systemen. We hechten grote waarde aan de toepassing van hightech technieken en methoden om zo beter en sneller onze oplossingen te kunnen realiseren. De Large Scale Scrum methode wordt toegepast bij de software ontwikkeling. Verschillende teams ontwikkelen software die ge√Øntegreerd en gedemonstreerd wordt in √©√©n product. Dit alles in een vast ritme.

Als integrator ben je lid van √©√©n van onze scrum teams en voornamelijk bezig met het integreren en testen van software deelproducten.

Je krijgt volop mogelijkheden om je te ontwikkelen in verschillende richtingen. Afhankelijk van jouw passie en ambities zijn er meerdere groeipaden mogelijk, bijvoorbeeld richting software architect of test engineer. In het veld meewerken aan oefeningen en zo onze oplossingen live in actie zien behoren ook tot de mogelijkheden.

Waarom ben jij een goede match

Heb je een passie voor techniek en lijkt het je leuk te werken aan radar processing oplossingen en complexe algoritmes? Dan ben jij misschien wel de persoon die wij zoeken. De voorwaarde hiervoor is een afgeronde HBO- of WO opleiding in een technische richting, bij voorkeur (technische) informatica of elektrotechniek. Een passie voor software engineering is vanzelfsprekend waarbij kennis en ervaring met de volgende tools en technieken een pre is: C, C++, Linux, Jenkins, Nexus, Maven en Continuous Integration.Als persoon ben jij creatief, open en flexibel en goed instaat te opereren als een teamspeler. Je hebt enige jaren ervaring in software engineering of software integratie in een real time omgeving. Daarnaast ben je resultaatgericht, initiatiefrijk en communiceer je op heldere wijze.Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift is noodzakelijk voor een goede functie-invulling.


Wat krijg jij er voor terug

Een uitdagende baan in een leuk team binnen onze high-tech, innovatieve werkomgeving. Inclusief alle ruimte voor eigen initiatief en goede idee√´n.Mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling binnen de organisatie, bijvoorbeeld op technisch, commercieel of internationaal vlak.Waardevolle internationale samenwerkingen met collega‚Äôs uit 68 landen.Een comfortabele werkplek in een moderne omgeving, met aandacht voor flexibiliteit en de juiste work-life balance.Werken kan meestal waar en wanneer je wil om je werk zo goed en effici√´nt mogelijk te kunnen doen. Binnen Thales implementeren we het hybride werken, waarbij je bijvoorbeeld twee dagen in de week thuis kunt werken als je rol dit toelaat.Een goed salaris, passende reiskostenvergoeding en de mogelijkheid om jaarlijks jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden te personaliseren: je kunt bijvoorbeeld vrije dagen ruilen voor internetkosten, ons fietsenplan, bedrijfsfitness en verhuiskosten. 40 vakantiedagen per jaar. Ja, echt.Functie o.b.v. LR-08/ Vakgroep 60 conform cao Metalekro-HP.Mogelijkheid om 32, 36 of 40 uur per week te werken.


Interesse?

Solliciteer nu door hieronder op ‚ÄòApply now‚Äô te klikken!

Diversiteitsstatement

We vinden dat je baan de juiste work/life balance moet ondersteunen en het platform is om j√≥uw ambities waar te maken. Dat betekent dat gelijke kansen, inclusiviteit en een informele cultuur een essentieel onderdeel uitmaken van ons succes. Maar ook dat jouw gezondheid en geluk voor ons erg belangrijk zijn! Daarom bieden we je de flexibiliteit om te doen wat voor j√≥u belangrijk is; of dat nu parttime werken is, of werken vanuit huis, of de mogelijkheid om flexibel te zijn in je start- en eindtijden, we denken met je mee.

Security Requirements

In lijn met de basisbeveiligingsvereisten van Thales vragen wij kandidaten mogelijk om bewijs omtrent identiteit, werkvergunning en arbeids- plus opleidingsgeschiedenis. Sommige vacatures vereisen ook een security clearance die verdere informatie vereist. Voor meer informatie over wat er nodig is voor bepaalde security clearance, raadpleeg dan de General Intelligence and Security Service.

title: Graduate Software Development Engineer ‚Äì Redshift Query Processing
description:
Description

Amazon Redshift is the world‚Äôs most popular fully managed cloud data warehouse. Tens of thousands of enterprise customers use Redshift to crunch through exabytes of data in the cloud to make business critical decisions every day. To stay ahead in such a mission critical setting, at Redshift, we must always re-invent ourselves for customers. We are always looking for the innovative engineers to help shape the future of Redshift.

Key job responsibilities

As a software engineer in vectorized query execution team, you will:

 Design and implement state-of-the-art distributed data processing algorithms for the parallel execution query engine. Identify opportunities for performance improvement by in-depth analysis of the query plan and query execution states. Deploy and monitor new features in a highly available and fault tolerant system running in the cloud.

This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast-growing business and help shape the technology powering analytical workloads for Fortune 500 companies, startups, and everything in between. You will bring deep technical, algorithmic and coding expertise with the ability to work within a fast moving and collaborative environment in the industry leading cloud company to deliver a broad business impact. If this sounds exciting to you - come build the future with us!

About The Team

Query Processing team is at the heart of Redshift data plane and is responsible for query analysis, query optimization and massively parallel execution engine. Query Processing team is focused on maintaining Amazon Redshift‚Äôs lead on price-performance.

Query Processing team delivers extreme performance by uniquely combining novel techniques for distributed query planning, code generation, query compilation, query scheduling, resource-planning, and superscalar query execution with optimized data encodings accessed with high performance SIMD kernels, and hardware conscious algorithms. We also work closely with AWS platform teams in shaping requirements for next generation platforms to run database/analytics applications.

Our team consists of industry leading innovators, with multitudes of patents and research publications in this space. We are a fun-loving team, that is passionate about ideating, designing and delivering query processing and overall database architecture towards extreme performance. We are distributed across many locations in US, Germany, and are expanding in other geographies.

Want to learn more about AWS Redshift? Watch this insightful video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lj8oaSpCFTc

About AWS

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.

Remote Work

Realizing the full potential of the cloud won‚Äôt happen when there are limitations on where we innovate. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre leading the evolution of flexible work environments here at AWS. In this virtual role, you‚Äôll be able to massively impact how we build solutions for our customers no matter where you work.

Hybrid Work

We value innovation and recognize this sometimes requires uninterrupted time to focus on a build. We also value in-person collaboration and time spent face-to-face. Our team affords employees options to work in the office every day or in a flexible, hybrid work model near one of our Berlin Amazon offices.

Early Career Talent

When you join Amazon Web Services as a student or recent graduate, you‚Äôll have the chance for your voice to be heard and amplified. That‚Äôs because our teams are looking to learn as much from you as you‚Äôll learn from them. Whether you‚Äôre graduating with a high school or equivalent diploma, associate degree, bachelor‚Äôs degree, MBA, or PhD, we offer a range of early career opportunities across the globe.

EMEA Student Programs Team

Basic Qualifications

 A degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Mathematics / Technology / Related science/technical field OR equivalent training, certifications, and/or experience (0-2 years). Programming experience with C or C++ Internship, project, or academic experience in at least one of the areas: query optimization, job scheduling, resource management, query execution, data compression technologies, information theory, GPUs, or ML.

Preferred Qualifications

 Strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis Strong software development skills

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
Share this job

         

Hitachi Energy is a global company specializing in the delivery of electrification systems. Our customers rely on our knowledges and advices for the electrification of society. We are currently seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Senior System Engineer to work in this important field.

Role And Responsibilities

As System Engineer, you will play a crucial role in project development and design. Your responsibilities will include developing concepts and finding optimal solutions to our customers' challenges, in collaboration with our electrical equipment factories and partners. You will work at the intersection of sales and project execution, with extensive customer interaction. Additionally, you will work closely with the project manager, and lead project teams when required.

Qualifications And Experience

Experience in concept development and power system analysis for electrification and grid integration projects.Relevant experience within electric power engineering or in power distribution within the industrial sector.Clear understanding of the needed interfaces and dependencies between electrical, automation and civil scopes in large projects.Ability to generate ideas and continuously improve our solutions.Proficiency in preparing and presenting decision-making frameworks for systems and components.Familiarity with modeling electrical installations and experience in sales is advantageous.Fluent communication skills, both oral and written, in at least one of the Scandinavian languages in addition to English, is desirable.Previous experience in leading project teams is a plus, but not a requirement.

Personal Attributes

Demonstrates curiosity towards new opportunities and concept development and has the ability to work independently.Proficient in building networks and collaborating across borders and cultures within large organizations.Excellent communication and presentation skills.

We Offer

Opportunities for technical and personal development in a positive, innovative, and interdisciplinary environment.Varied and highly interesting tasks that will enhance your professional growth.A supportive and inclusive work environment.Engaging social activities.Flexible hours and some remote work options.

Your workplace will be at our new premises in Helsfyr, Oslo or Bergen. Please note that the position may involve occasional travel.

If you are passionate about contributing to the electrification of society and wish to be part of our team, we look forward to receiving your application. Please submit your CV and cover letter through our website.

For question regarding the position please contact Charl√®ne: charlene.gris@hitachienergy.com / +47 402 84 225

Please note that in cooperation with Meditor search we conduct a background screening on all candidates that receive an offer of employment in Hitachi Energy Norway. This to ensure best quality in our recruitment process, according with our company policy.

 Apply now

title: R-10052217 Automotive Field Application Engineer - BMS (Graduate) (f/m/d)
description:
For decades we at NXP have been developing innovative microchips as a world market leader that can be found almost everywhere ‚Äì and make life possible as we know it today. Whether it‚Äôs in credit cards, in smartphones or cars ‚Äì we make sure that your life is easier, better and safer.Get to know us and what we do at: www.showroom.nxp.com or www.nxp.com
Automotive Field Application Engineer - BMS (Graduate) (f/m/d)
Are you energetic, highly motivated and eager to try new things? Looking for a role that will give you comprehensive insight into how analog products are used in automotive? As part of our automotive field application team in Munich, you‚Äôll get it all first-hand at top tier automotive suppliers. Whether it‚Äôs presenting our leading capabilities, creating system solutions with customers, preparing workshops, holding trainings or running debug-sessions ‚Äì you will have the opportunity to drive significant business opportunities from the concept stage through production ramp at the OEM.We are looking for a junior field applications engineer (m/f/d) for BMS (battery management systems) at our location in Munich as soon as possible and offer an attractive compensation package incl. pension plan, a company car and mobile phone, flexible working hours in the office or at home, investment into your future (skill building), and a team that is fun to work within the NXP community.
Your responsibilities:Develop system solution proposals based on NXP products for applications in the automotive space (especially BMS) and present in front of customers and peers.Provide strong technical expertise supporting design-in activities. Assist customers on site in evaluation of silicon, and support HW reviews of customer application board schematics.Close cooperation with Sales and Marketing on project identification and proposals to customers.Leverage customer meetings to gather intelligence about the customers‚Äô end product plans and relevant silicon requirements, communicate the collected information to the product groups.Identify new features for NXP semiconductor products to meet future market requirements.Assist in the development of technical collateral for internal or customer use (e.g. Application Notes, Engineering Bulletins, etc.). Support trade shows and technical society meetings.

Your profile:Electrical Engineer with 3 years‚Äô experience, or MSEE graduate with first experience in battery technology and battery management systems.Basic knowledge of Lithium battery cell chemistry (NMC, LFP, LTO), characteristics and applications (high voltage battery or power train) and Analog / Mixed Signal ICs is required.Familiarity with the automotive environment, functional safety (ISO 26262) and Software experience (C/C++, Python, Autosar) would be a plus.High degree of flexibility, self-motivation, customer and business orientation.Good written and verbal communication/presentation skills in German and English.

title: #AGGP2025 Graduate AMTAC Engineer
description:
Job Description

Start Date: October 2025

Every year we look for university graduates from around the world to join Airbus and help fill the critical roles for our future. We need people with the aspiration, enthusiasm and the talent to help us move forward and to change the world and deliver our vision to pioneer sustainable aerospace for a safe and united world.  

When you begin your career with us, we accelerate your growth through our Airbus Global Graduate development journey, focusing on both soft skills, business knowledge and technical ability. You will be part of a two year programme that enables you to develop your professional skills; build your networks and gain a unique perspective on the world of Airbus whilst delivering in a specific position - each development journey is individual! 

In addition to on-the-job activity and a comprehensive schedule of training opportunities, once a year you will also join your global graduate community for a development week where you meet your peers, hear from our leaders and learn from the best.

By the end of the programme, you will have gained everything you need to become an established team member in your position, having already demonstrated your value. You will have developed your skills in an area that is strategically important for Airbus, you will know about the Airbus business, the opportunities, challenges and needs, and you will have learned more about yourself, and what makes you great! 

Above all you will have the opportunity to do your best work in an industry that is literally reshaping how we live in our world.

If you are ready to join and be part of this journey please apply below (& don‚Äôt forget to include a motivation letter)!

What Can You Expect...

AMTAC provides technical support to the in-service fleet of Military Transport A/C: A400M, MRTT, C295, CN235 and C212. The main objective is to establish and deliver, for all programs, on time and consistent solutions for the daily technical queries raised by customers regarding aircraft structure and system problems.

You Will Be On a Development Pathway To Prepare You To Be An AMTAC Engineer And Can Expect To Be Involved In The Following

Providing support in a dynamic environment and in a timely manner to avoid any operational disruption for our customers.AMTAC, as a single entry point for all the technical queries, have a full visibility of the fleet status and of the complete incoming technical topics. The global view in AMTAC allows the newcomer to work in any system or sub-system and to participate in multi-ATA issues.Interacting with internal and external contacts; receiving customer questions and trying to resolve them.

At the end of the two year development programme you will be fully equipped to be a key player as an AMTAC Engineer!

What We Are Looking For...

To be a successful applicant to the Airbus Global Graduate Programme, we ask that you demonstrate you have:

Educated to a degree level or equivalent within a relevant field of studyDemonstrable technical expertise with Microsoft Office toolsStrong verbal and written communication in our business language (English) and SpanishA desire to work in a collaborative team environment, focused on driving future innovationFirst professional experience in maintenance and the knowledge of programming would be beneficialThe ability to be self aware and a wish to be in the driving seat of your development.

Please note, we love your interest in working for Airbus but we do ask that you make only one application to the Airbus Global Graduate Programme. We encourage you to take time to decide which of our exciting opportunities is right for you and then submit an application that best represents you, your skills and experience in connection with the role you have selected.

STATEMENT: This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

What Is The Recruitment Process‚Ä¶

Online application -> Online Task Based Assessment -> Application Review (Talent Acquisition Partner & Manager) -> Virtual Assessment Centre (November & December) -> Offer!

NB: Applications will close 6th October (don‚Äôt delay, apply today as some roles may close early due to applications received).

Please let us know if you need us to make any adjustments. Examples of this may include (but is not exclusive to) accessible facilities; additional time for written exercises etc. Any information disclosed will be treated in the strictest confidence.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Airbus Defence and Space SAU

Employment Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Entry Level

Job Family

Support to Management

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.#YESPOST

title: Java Developer
description:
Tr—ñf–ærk experts develop business-critical enterprise solutions using open source software. We work with open-source technologies that are state-of-the-art, yet have a solid and proven base.

Your role

Trifork Amsterdam is looking for a fearless Java developer with experience under their belt, to join their team working on highly innovative custom projects in the areas of blockchain, microservices, spring and cloud native technologies! The ideal candidate will be independently productive and will be able to tackle most tasks on their own, or understand when they need to reach out for help.

Tr—ñf–ærk experts develop business-critical enterprise solutions using open source software. We work with open-source technologies that are state-of-the-art, yet have a solid and proven base. We don't have a consultant model where we hire you and then ship you off to a clients location. We position our selves with our clients as their trusted Technology Partner and have a model that focuses on keeping our developers together working on cool projects in our office!

As the birth place of theAxon frameworkwe're one of the few companies with several years of production experience in applying CQRS and event sourcing; approaches which are especially great for building scalable and auditable systems in complex domains, and have become very popular recently with the rise of microservices-based systems. New projects often target the cloud, where we embrace a cloud-native approach of building and running applications including practices like DevOps and Continuous Delivery; this ensures your ideas are turned into working software running in production in the fastest and safest way possible!

Within Trifork there are plenty of opportunities to learn new skills, to grow and take initiative. Our developers‚Äô expertise and the willingness to grow, is the main priority at Trifork and we support this with internal trainings as well as via our external training academy -GOTO Academy. We can guarantee unbeatable knowledge in the field of the newest open source technologies and agile development methods, and also a ride on the company yacht when it's in town...

Your profile

Responsibilities

Work with your team to build the best solution for your customerWork in our office in Amsterdam or on-site at the customerBe involved in expert knowledge sharing by attending conferences and participating in meetups


Must Haves

Experience in professional agile Java development with, for instance, Spring (Boot, MVC, Security, etc)Eager to learn new techniques and technologiesFluent in English (Dutch is a plus)


Nice to Haves

Experience with (No)SQL databases and/or ElasticsearchDevops attitude and knowledge of cloud and Docker, CI/CD etc.A drive to talk on or organize sessions around your expertise


Benefits

What we offer

Flexible start date 80% work week is possibleDevelopment and learning opportunities both within projects as well as in internal tech meetings,GOTO Nights, ourGOTO Conferenceetc.Macbook Pro or high-end Dell laptop (OS of choice)All-you-can-eat lunch for free


About Trifork Amsterdam

Trifork is a leading full service supplier of high-quality custom-built applications and end-to-end solutions. Providing a lean approach to support each phase of the project life-cycle from idea creation, development and to ongoing maintenance and support.

We aim to empower our customers by providing expert advice on the optimization of business critical IT systems and cutting-edge technology. Enabling our customers to seamlessly integrate and use these technologies ‚Äì bringing immediate value to our customers‚Äô business and customers.

Trifork delivers solutions for the educational, finance, public, healthcare, manufacturing and telecom industries.

What's next?

Are you interested in the above vacancy for Java Developer? Trifork Amsterdam is looking forward to receive your application! By clicking on the 'apply' button in this job listing, you'll be directed to the original posting where you can take a few effortless steps to submit your application for Java Developer.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

You will be part of a newly established, highly motivated and skilled team working on a new IBM product focusing on Data Integration capabilities. Participate in design and development activities, perform code reviews and actively contribute to daily team activities (scrum/stand-up meetings, progres checkpoints, demo sessions), be able to cooperate with different teams and team members across worldwide development organisation, participate in customer support activities resolving complex issues and providing assistance to our customers.

Applicants should have prior experience with or be able to master the tools and techniques for building, deploying, operating, and supporting large scale hybrid cloud platforms, services, and applications, based on Kubernetes and DevOps practices.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


Extensive professional experience with Java and/or JavaScript and/orC/C++, Proven experience in large software development projects, Experience with Rest APIs, Advanced in Linux and Windows, shell scripts,Understanding of cloud services and CI/CD processes, Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and OpenShift,Understanding of SaaS and micro services security aspects,Excellent communication and presentation skills,Proficiency in English


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Modern front-end JavaScript based technologies (React, Angular), Experience with cloud services from AWS, Azure and Google, Understanding of Agile/scrum, Ability to work in complex development environment with development teams spread across the world


About Business Unit

IBM Software infuses core business operations with intelligence‚Äîfrom machine learning to generative AI‚Äîto help make organizations more responsive, productive, and resilient. IBM Software helps clients put AI into action now to create real value with trust, speed, and confidence across digital labor, IT automation, application modernization, security, and sustainability. Critical to this is the ability to make use of all data, because AI is only as good as the data that fuels it. In most organizations data is spread across multiple clouds, on premises, in private datacenters, and at the edge. IBM‚Äôs AI and data platform scales and accelerates the impact of AI with trusted data, and provides leading capabilities to train, tune and deploy AI across business. IBM‚Äôs hybrid cloud platform is one of the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security, and operations across hybrid environments‚Äîa flexible foundation for leveraging data, wherever it resides, to extend AI deep into a business.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better. Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background. Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do. Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM

IBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

title: Logistics Developer BATTERY PRODUCTION
description:
Scania is currently undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to being a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Building Modules and Battery Packs for a dedicated and sustainable future! 

The electrification trend in the automotive industry is moving fast. For us, this means that we need to prepare to increase the production of electric vehicles and help Scania become more sustainable. An important component of an electric vehicle is the battery.

The first battery production in Sweden has just been inaugurated and during the spring the serial production of the first battery packs in our highly automated production will start.

At the same time the Battery production is at the forefront of diversity and inclusion. In the logistics management team, we currently have several different nationalities with an equal number of men and women.

Who We Are

Logistics consists of a number of functions: production planning, material planning, material handling, logistics development and logistics technology.

Most processes in production and material handling are automated, and the flows are strongly interconnected. Nothing is moved without signals within and between our IT systems, and the material handling processes are also largely automated with high-bay warehouses, buffers and AGVs.

We are a team working with Logistics Engineering and development, focusing on launching and running our new plant. Some of us are as well already looking into the next steps of our electrification journey. Thereby we see open-mindedness and teamwork as key for our success. We are strongly interconnected in our processes, and are establishing a common picture of where we are and where we are going.

We are a great international team with mixed backgrounds, experiences and competencies. This brings along different perspectives which strengthens our way of tackling and solving challenges. In our team an open and inclusive climate is given to facilitate everyone to lift their opinions, which supports us in our work and therefore is highly appreciated.

Your profile


 You have an academic background in Production and Logistics or other relevant education Previous experience of operational and personal responsibility, preferably in Production or Logistics environment is beneficial Communication in Swedish and English in speech and writing You have a big Production and Logistics heart, and constantly strive to develop yourself, others and our working methods, in order to reach set goals As a leader you are a good communicator, who is responsive and has the ability to inspire, motivate and develop your environment You are engaged, curious and well-structured You work with resilience and support attitude


Your main duties


 To plan, lead and follow up activities and / or projects for the logistics process in our stream To monitor the development that takes place within Production and Logistics and contribute to the introduction of new technologies Actively participate in assigned forums and obtain improvement suggestions for the business Communicate in different levels of Scania¬¥s organization Identify improvements and come up with suggestions for the need for change Calculate investment and resource needs for assigned projects Drive major improvement activities to develop working methods/methods/processes Working on a daily basis with the Warehouse Control System that is steering all three automatic storages and closely supporting operation with processes, deviations and improvements connected to this


As a manager

My name is Frederik M√ºller and during the past 5 years I have worked in different parts of Scania (Sweden), as well as MAN (Germany). I get motivated by developing teams and finding the talent of each person, to be able to coach people in their continuous learning. I am here to support you and create the right conditions for successes.

Together, we agree regarding plans and directions and we support about your development and align regarding the way to go.

More information

If you have any questions in regard to the position, please contact:

Frederik M√ºller, Manager Logistics Engineering, mail: frederik.muller@scania.com

Application

Welcome with your application. Your application should contain personal letter, CV, and grade copies. Apply thru Reflex/Career and the application period will be open until 2024-09-16

Interviews and appointments will be held continuously during the application period.

A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Software Development Engineer - Lambda, Lambda - Sandbox
description:
Description

AWS Lambda‚Äôs goal is nothing less than to simplify and improve the experience of computing in the cloud for every developer on the planet, from startups to the largest Fortune 100 companies. Serverless computing is rapidly changing how every company thinks about building and delivering software solutions, and Lambda is leading this industry wide effort.

Our Team

AWS Lambda is growing in Dublin, Ireland and our goal is to continue to define the Serverless revolution. In the Lambda team you will be joining a team where the entire development of the service occurs in Dublin. You will have the opportunity to impact the service roadmap in a meaningful way as the existing team team has done for recent deliverables like AWS Lambda Runtime Management Controls, AWS Lambda Extensions, AWS Lambda Container Support plus a host of new Language runtimes. You will own and implement specific components, build highly available, secure, scalable, distributed, event-driven systems and help to define the system architecture. This is a full-stack development position on a large distributing computing platform.

What does it take to succeed in this role?

You should be comfortable working in an environment dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of customers. You should be intellectually curious, always looking to learn and be dedicated to turning the software developers that use Lambda to build modern applications into fans of the service. You should be somebody who aspires to make the team both productive and a fun place to work. Being excited to learn from others while bringing your own novel capabilities and perspectives.

On-Call Responsibility

This position involves on-call responsibilities, every builder on Lambda is also an owner. Nobody likes to get paged in the middle of the night or on the weekend, so we work to ensure that our systems are well engineered, fault tolerant and meet a high quality bar before the go into production. Our customers expect nothing less. When we do get paged we work together as a team to resolve the root cause of the issue and nobody is left on their own to deal with an operational issue.

Utility Computing (UC)

AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations ‚Äî from foundational services such as Amazon‚Äôs Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS‚Äôs services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you‚Äôll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS. Within AWS UC, Amazon Dedicated Cloud (ADC) roles engage with AWS customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

Job location is Dublin, Ireland. Relocation assistance available. For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com

About The Team

About AWS

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.

Basic Qualifications

 Experience (non-internship) in professional software development Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems Experience programming with at least one software programming language

Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Exciting Freelance Data Engineer Opportunity with a Leading Private Equity Firm

Are you a seasoned Data Engineer ready to take your career to the next level? A prominent Private Equity firm is on the lookout for two talented Data Engineers and a Data Requirements Analyst to join their dynamic team. This is a unique opportunity to play a pivotal role in driving the firm's data strategy, enabling them to scale efficiently while minimizing costs across their expanding portfolio.

Why This Role?

As a Data Engineer with this firm, you won't just be another cog in the machine. You'll be at the forefront of transforming how data is utilized within the organization, directly impacting the performance and success of high-stakes investments. If you have a passion for data and a knack for problem-solving, this role offers you the chance to make a significant impact in the fast-paced world of private equity.

Key Responsibilities:

 Investment Performance Tracking: You'll be integral to monitoring and analyzing the performance of various investments, providing the insights needed to optimize returns. Automation of Operations: Lead the charge in automating key business processes, ensuring that the right data is always available to decision-makers, reducing manual efforts, and increasing operational efficiency. Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines that will serve as the backbone of the firm's data infrastructure. Advanced Data Modeling: Use your expertise in Kimball methodology to structure data that drives strategic decision-making. Power BI Dataset Management: While dashboard creation is not required, you'll play a critical role in managing and optimizing Power BI datasets to ensure data accuracy and availability.

What We're Looking For:

 Extensive Data Engineering Experience: You have hands-on experience in end-to-end data engineering, from initial design to deployment. Financial Data Expertise: Ideally, you've worked with private equity or financial data, giving you an edge in understanding the unique challenges of this sector. Technical Proficiency: You're well-versed in Azure Data Factory, DBT, Databricks, and Power BI, and can seamlessly integrate these tools into your workflow. Innovative Mindset: You're not just about maintaining the status quo; you're eager to explore new ways to optimize data usage and bring fresh ideas to the table.

Part-Time Data Requirements Analyst Role:

In this role, you'll work closely with various stakeholders to ensure that the data they rely on is accurate, consistent, and aligned with business goals. You'll be responsible for:

 Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with key stakeholders to fully understand their data needs and translate them into actionable data models. Data Mapping and Reconciliation: Ensure seamless data integration by mapping source data to target fields and performing thorough data reconciliation to maintain data integrity.

Technologies You'll Work With:

 #AzureDataFactory: Automate data workflows and integrate diverse data sources. #DBT: Streamline data transformations for analytics. #Databricks: Leverage this powerful platform for big data processing. #PowerBI: Manage and optimize datasets for robust business intelligence. #DataMapping & #DataReconciliation: Ensure data consistency and accuracy across systems.

Why Join Us?

 Impact: Your work will directly influence the success of high-value investments and the overall growth strategy of a leading private equity firm. Growth: This role offers unparalleled exposure to the private equity sector, with opportunities to hone your skills and grow your professional network. Flexibility: As a freelance position, you'll have the freedom to manage your time while contributing to impactful projects.

Next Steps:

Interviews are scheduled for next week, and we're eager to find the right candidates as soon as possible. If you're ready to contribute to a forward-thinking team and leave your mark on the financial industry, don't miss out on this opportunity. Apply today!

and growing team, apply today!

title: Software Engineer
description:
In het kort

Drie redenen waarom deze vacature uniek is!


Werk met de mooiste machines voor de industri√´le bakkerij industrieOntwikkel en optimaliseer de eigen softwareNeem het initiatief en pak het voortouw op de afdeling 


De organisatie

Hier ga je aan de slag

Het bouwen, ontwikkelen en verkopen van de mooiste en beste snij-, sluit en verpakkingsmachines binnen de industri√´le bakkerij wereld, dat is wat dit prachtige Hollandse bedrijf doet!

Met in totaal bijna 40 collega‚Äôs hebben zij √©√©n doel, de wereld veroveren met deze mooie machines, zo zijn zij o.a. Al actief in Afrika, Australi√´, Dubai en China. Alles wordt binnen de muren van dit bedrijf gedaan, het tekenen van de machines, het ontwikkelen van de software, het draaien, frezen en lassen van de constructies, bouwen van de besturingskasten tot het uiteindelijke opbouwen van de productielijnen, echt alles! Alles komt samen in de werkplaats waar de teams samen komen en met elkaar de klus klaren, een hechte groep waar continu wordt gezocht naar nieuwe mogelijkheden.

Producten die verwerkt worden door deze speciaal machines zijn hoofdzakelijk broden, bollen en aanverwante bakkerij producten.

De functie

Dit ga je doen

Voor de afdeling Engineering zoeken wij op dit moment een Software Engineer die ervaring heeft binnen deze functie √©n die het ook leuk vind om het initiatief te nemen. Binnen een groep van in totaal 3 Engineers is op dit moment ruimte voor een Software Engineer met kennis en ervaring. Daar komt bij dat het iemand moet zijn die ook het initiatief kan nemen op de afdeling. Niet iedere machine is nieuw ontwikkeld. Het wiel is vaak al uitgevonden, maar er is altijd ruimte voor verbetering en optimalisatie. Herken jij jezelf hierin, dan kom ik graag met je in contact! We drinken een kop koffie en onderzoeken of dit de passende baan voor je is.

Het aanbod

Dit krijg je ervoor terug

Spreekt je dit aan en wil je graag in contact komen met deze organisatie, dan kun je het volgende verwachten qua voorwaarden:


Een bruto maandsalaris wat kan oplopen tot ‚Ç¨ 4.500,00 Een eindejaars gratificatie tussen de ‚Ç¨ 500,00 en ‚Ç¨ 2.500,00, het is afhankelijk van het bedrijfsresultaat of √©n hoe hoog deze uitvaltReiskostenvergoedingMooie mogelijkheden om stappen te maken binnen de afdeling en daarin het voortouw te nemenMogelijkheden om een werkgerelateerde opleiding te volgen
