title: Financial Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague
description:
Job Description

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.

What We Do

Multi-Asset Solutions, ‚ÄúMAS‚Äù is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.

Who We Look For

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.

Requirements

Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineeringMeaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, PythonStrong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programmingStrong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end usersKnowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)1-2+ years of relevant work experience

About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We‚Äôre committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

¬© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Are you ready to fly with us? Apply now!

title: Systems Development Engineer
description:
BorgWarner is a global product leader in delivering innovative and sustainable mobility solutions for the vehicle market. We are a company of innovators and independent thinkers that brings together talented employees, meaningful work and amazing technology in a unique environment. At BorgWarner we constantly work towards our vision of a clean and energy-efficient world.

New Technical Center - Electrification in Krakow

At BorgWarner, we design and manufacture the systems that define the way the world moves forward. With the world‚Äôs foremost technologists, engineers and OEMs, we‚Äôre accelerating the world‚Äôs transformation to eMobility.

BorgWarner aspiration for Krakow is to become a major technological center with 250 employees by 2026.

Products and solutions range from existing portfolio Power Electronics - BorgWarner, but go far beyond and will include NPIs as well as applications projects.

Job Purpose

As a System Development Engineer, you will lead a feature development of power electronics inverter to ensure solutions meet stakeholder, performance, and regulatory requirements

Job Description

Key responsibilities

Lead technical development for the system feature with cross-functional development teams, component leads and customers.Negotiate the technical requirements, scope and subcontract deliverables for the system feature.Use knowledge to drive and disseminate system level requirements and architectural proposals.Use knowledge to ensure designs meet requirements and test quality and coverage are ensured.Drive engineering competencies, suppliers, and partners to ensure commitment to internal quality processes during the development, execution and verification.Lead the technical analysis, trade off studies, support FMEAs, design reviews and customer presentations for the defined features.Be a single point of reference for related change requests and issue investigations.Work closely with the SW, HW and Testing team to drive the implementation and verification for the defined features.Support the definition and continuous improvement of systems engineering processes, methods, and toolsDocument and share best-practicesMentor less experienced engineers; role model for BW Beliefs

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Masters or Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering or similarExperience in related engineering field applying Systems Engineering principles throughout the product life cycle in one or more of the following areas Automotive electronics systems development, especially in the areas of sensors and actuatorsPower electronics, especially motor drive invertersExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsKnowledge of requirements elicitation, analysis, definition, and management and experience with requirement management tools (e.g. Polarion) and process models like A-SPICE.Knowledge of embedded software and / or hardware development.Knowledge of System modeling in SysML and / or MatLab Simulink is a benefit Organized and structured work-style and attention to detail.Fluency in English is required. German and/or French would be an advantage.Occasional travel, domestic and international
What We Offer

Private Medicover medical care for the employee and his/ her family.Co-financing for the sport card Multisport.Possibility to join the PZU insurance / Generali for employees‚Äô children.Flexible working hours.Competitive salary, adequate to skills and experience.Co-financing for holidays, Christmas gifts for employees‚Äô children.Hard and soft trainings, language courses.

What We Believe

Inclusion - We value diversity in people, ideas, and experiences.Integrity - We believe in transparency, authenticity, and depend on each other to deliver what we promise.Excellence - We contribute to our developments by seeking knowledge and sharing information.Responsibility - We care about our local communities and the global environment.Collaboration - We are one BorgWarner.

Internal Use Only Salary

Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read the BorgWarner Privacy Policy before using this website. Your ability to access and use this website and apply for a job at BorgWarner are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the geographical area where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Career Scam Disclaimer  BorgWarner makes no representations or guarantees regarding employment opportunities listed on any third-party website. To protect against career scams, job applicants should take the necessary precautions when interviewing for and accepting employment positions allegedly offered by BorgWarner. Applicants should never provide their national ID numbers, birth dates, credit card numbers, bank account information or other private information when communicating with prospective employers or responding to employment opportunities online. Job applicants are invited to contact BorgWarner through BorgWarner‚Äôs website to verify the authenticity of any employment opportunities.

title: Integration and DevOps Engineer
description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents. With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions. ‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

Integration and DevOps Engineer
Within the IT Operations unit, our team (16 people between Luxembourg and Geneva) is dedicated to integrate new business applications into our ecosystem according to the requirements of different stakeholders (Security/Platform/Production/Infrastructure and Dev). Our team makes our core app evolution easier and smoother, without compromising quality.
YOUR ROLEManage the release management process to reduce operational risk in prod and test environments:Coordinate planned changes between dev and production teamsFacilitate the Change Advisory Board (CAB) meetingsEfficiently integrate new business applications into the ecosystem from design to implementation in various environments (Dev/Test/UAT and prod)Coordinate and execute technical tasks based on the requirements of different stakeholders (Security/Platform/Production/Infrastructure/provider and Dev)Identify and mitigate risks, technical issues, and dependencies across the projectCollaborate with the Provider (Third-party Package) on Lombard Odier technical requirementsDevelop the project's reference document in collaboration with DevEstimate the workload of IT tasks during the projectImplement continuous improvement using the Problem Management process to reduce downtime for business applications- Internal stakeholders: Development, Service Management (Incident/Problem Management), DBA, Network, Citrix/Virtualization, Tooling, IT Security, IT Risk.External stakeholders: Software and Service Vendors, Business Process Outsourcing Clients (Banks who are using our IT Platform and services)
YOUR PROFILEMaster in IT or equivalentGood command of development languages and linked application servers: JAVA, JBOSS, C++Good command of CI/CD tooling: Openshift, Kubernetes, DevOps principlesGood command of production tooling: FTP transferts, schedulersPrevious experience of the Banking sector will be an assetResponsible, rigorous, versatile, with good interpersonal skills and team spirit. Ready to propose enhancements and participate to continuous improvment initiatives.Fluent in English and French
TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENTService NowSerenaArgoCdNetScalerJavaApache/IISOpenshiftKubernetes

Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.
As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.
It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

title: Junior Cloud Engineer
description:
Junior Cloud Engineer (AWS)
Heb jij werkervaring als software engineer en zou je meer richting de cloud willen gaan? Te werken als Cloud engineer en daarbij training te krijgen op technisch vlak? Dan is onze Cloud Programma iets voor jou!
In dit programma bieden wij jou de kans om zowel aan de slag te gaan bij onze partner organisatie in het cloud veld; als het voortdurend krijgen van zowel technische training als persoonlijke ontwikkeling en begeleiding van onze senior collega‚Äôs vanuit Xccelerated. Cloud Programma Xccelerated:
Xccelerated is onderdeel van Xebia Group, dat zich richt op het laten groeien van de Data & Cloud teams van hun klanten. Voor onze klant zijn wij momenteel bezig met het versnellen van ontwikkelingen in het cloud team. Om dit te doen zijn we nog op zoek naar een cloud/software engineer die zich aan dit team wil toevoegen.Je zal het eerste jaar 4 dagen in de week voor de klant werken (hybride) in het bestaande cloud platform team en 1 dag per week krijg je technische training bij Xccelerated binnen diverse topics.
Vaardigheden die je nog niet volledig beheerst, ontwikkel je door middel van een ‚Äútailor-made‚Äù programma voor jou opgesteld en begeleiding van onze senior trainers. Tijdens deze trainingsdagen ga je ook dieper in op nieuwe topics of duik je dieper in onderwerpen waar je al bekend mee bent. Onze Software Engineering Lead kiest de beste aanpak voor jou en de rest van het team. Topics die in de track aanbod komen zijn o.a. Cloud Engineering op AWS | Devops & SRE Principles | CI/CD | Containers | Software Engineering (typescript). Na het programma:
Na een jaar loopt het trainingsprogramma af en ga je in gesprek met de klant om daar in dienst te treden. Die wederzijdse intentie is er vanaf de start van het programma.
Over de rol: Onze partner is een van de toonaangevende bedrijven van Nederland met een van de meest innovatieve digitale platformen van Nederland.Ze zien veel kansen om softwareontwikkeling te versnellen. Om dit te doen, ga je met een team van gelijkgestemde professionals innovatieve cloudoplossingen in AWS bouwen!
Je komt in een inspirerende werkomgeving die autonomie en leren stimuleert terecht. Een innovatief team, die werkt met de nieuwste technologie√´n waarbij je constant wordt uitgedaagd om het beste uit jezelf te halen. Je bouwt mee aan een innovatief platform en daarbij de digitale transformatie van de sierteeltsector.
Als Junior Cloud Engineer ga je:‚úÖ Software bouwen, implementeren en onderhouden in een AWS cloudomgeving;‚úÖ Werken met containerisatietechnologie√´n zoals Docker;‚úÖ Software bouwen in Typescript;‚úÖ Werken aan CI/CD-pipelines om grote delen van het softwareontwikkelings- en leveringsproces te automatiseren;‚úÖ Lokaal innoveren en push je de beste idee√´n naar een groot publiek van engineers.
Dit ben jijPersoonlijk ben je klantgericht en heb je een sterke can-do mentaliteit. Je bent resultaatgericht, hebt zin om uitdagende taken uit te voeren en leert al doende.Daarnaast heb je:
‚úîÔ∏è Een opleiding op bachelor-/masterniveau in informatica, software engineering, cloud computing of een andere vergelijkbare studie;‚úîÔ∏è 1-2 jaar ervaring op het gebied van IT voorkeur als software engineer (kan ook een stage zijn);‚úîÔ∏è Vaardigheid in een programmeertaal zoals Typescript, Python, Golang, Typescript, Java;‚úîÔ∏è Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en kun je goed in een team samenwerken
Wat we biedenNaast werken bij een super innovatief bedrijf, bieden wij jou:üí∞ Goed salarisüõ´ 25 vakantiedagenüìô 2 fulltime weken hands-on bootcamp trainingüìä Technische trainingen & Innovatiedagen voor een heel jaar (elke week)‚úÖHet volgen van AWS-cursussen waarbij je door onze consultants en trainers wordt getraindüíª Bedrijfslaptopüçé Lunches, geweldige koffie en snackbar
Ge√Ønteresseerd? We ontmoeten je graag!Neem contact op met Jessie Loogman via jloogman@xccelerated.io of telefonisch via 0650999663. De startdatum is bespreekbaar.
Recruitment procedureEerste gesprek met een van onze recruitment consultantsEen technisch assessment maken die je presenteert aan een van onze Tech LeadsIntroductie en interview met de klant zelf (jouw toekomstige werkgever)
**We streven ernaar om een aanvraagproces (van aanvraag tot aanbieding) binnen 1-2 weken af te ronden. Zoals je zult begrijpen hangt dit ook af van je eigen beschikbaarheid.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
description:
In the Global Bank Team at SumUp we are building the infrastructure and core services needed to provide our merchants with a digital bank account that allows them to be successful at doing what they love. Our goal is to become the most popular banking partner for small merchants globally by offering a high-quality banking experience tailored to small business needs - effortless, simple and affordable.

As our global banking platform continues to grow, so does the feature-set we support and the technology estate upon which it‚Äôs built.

Therefore we are seeking Software Development Engineers in Test (SDET) to join our team. You'll collaborate across the Global Bank team to improve software quality through automated testing practices. Shape our test strategy, build test packs, identify quality gaps, and integrate automated tests from mobile UI to data tier. Help us to accelerate delivery while maintaining a high quality bar.

What You'll Do

Define and implement robust testing strategies for stream-aligned squads, ensuring software reliability.Periodically audit squads‚Äô testing strategies and implementation - from the quality of the scenarios to the reliability of the test reports.Support engineers in designing, testing, and iteratively improving software products for high availability.Integrate testing methodologies and practices within teams, fostering a culture of quality assurance.Write unit, automated component, contract, integration, and end-to-end tests.Provide end-to-end support for performance and load testing, including workload modeling, test execution and results analysis.Collaborate closely with software and DevOps engineers for seamless deployment and continuous integration.Utilize metrics to identify areas for improvement and guide engineers with actionable steps.Assist in maintaining test suites, build pipelines, and test data.

You'll Be Great for This Role If:

You have solid programming experience in any language (e.g., Kotlin, Python, JavaScript, Go, Elixir, Java), and are experienced in writing and maintaining unit, component, contract, integration, and end-to-end tests.You have mobile automation experience with any tool that requires coding and can create robust automated testing frameworks.You are experienced with performance and load testing, including workload modeling, test execution, and results analysisYou have experience managing build pipelines, integrating tests, and working with Continuous Deployment.You have experience developing on a microservice architecture with good test architecture design skills.You are proficient with Git, design patterns, Docker containers, Kubernetes, and the AWS ecosystem. Familiarity with Grafana and Honeycomb is a plus.You have solid knowledge of relational databases.You take ownership of everything you ship and believe in the power of teamwork and collaboration.

Nice to Have:

Experience in the fintech industry.Knowledge of Kafka.Knowledge of PostgreSQL.GitHub Actions experience.Experience with mobile test automation.

Why you should join SumUp

title: Senior Python Engineer (Remote)
description:
Syberry is the technology partner for a U.S.-based capital management company, and we are establishing an engineering center in Europe for them. The team is building the technology platform to run the company. This is a greenfield development project utilizing Python, Kotlin, React, and AWS as the primary tech stack.

We are seeking a Senior Python Engineer to develop a toolset for portfolio managers that will enable the analysis of financial data and facilitating informed decision-making based on this analysis.

Why join us?

Learn from top Wallstreet experts: you will work in one team with quants and portfolio managers who have 15+ years of experience in the field. Greenfield development: participate in designing and building an entire tech platform for running the company from scratch. Our oldest code is just 1.5 years old. Cutting-edge practices: we embrace XP principles like TDD, CI/CD, pair programming, and trunk-based development to ship value daily Real challenges: everything you work on gets tested by real users immediately. No boring tasks with unknown value Zero bureaucracy: we're a startup so enjoy minimal bureaucracy with 90% of decisions made within 2 business days Small, skilled teams: we‚Äôre a crew of 30 experienced engineers, working in small teams of up to 5 so don‚Äôt expect communication overload True remote: No Return To Office. Work from wherever you want.


About you:

Strong engineering experience (we mean it): we believe at least 5 years of software engineering is a good predictor (however, you can challenge this belief) Experience using SQL and RDBMS; know how to write requests for relational databasesExperience designing and writing API by best practicesExperience working with Docker; can write custom dockerfileExperience writing automated testsExperience working with AWS or any other cloud ; can use key services for computation, networking, and storageGood mathematics knowledge Fluent English: for daily communication with native speakers from the U.S. Availability until 7 PM CET at least 3 days a week: our product team and end users operate in the Eastern Time Zone, so we need an overlap for effective collaboration. Still, we expect 8h of work daily so you could start later or have breaks. 


Will be a plus:

Finance knowledge: no need for deep conceptual understanding, but general knowledge about investment management is a big advantage, specifically equities, back-testing, and financial simulations Statistics knowledge is a great advantageExperience working with end users/clients directly, figuring out their needs, and delivering end-to-end solutions for them.You have experience in engineering data pipelines You have worked with Flask / FastAPI or any other web framework, You have worked with Kotlin or another backend programming language.


What a Python Developer will do: 

Create high-quality code according to Syberry‚Äôs standardsEngineer a solution to the problem of an end user: delivering API services / working with datasets and data pipelines / delivering integrations with external systems (depending on the team)Communicate with the client and the team

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Code.Hub is the first Hub for Developers in Greece, builds together with partners decentralized digital hubs in Gaming for expanding the portfolio of their services globally. Code.Hub has the knowledge and the technical mentorship for all technologies and helps the SW Engineers to expand their skills and opportunity of making a great career path for their future! Code.Hub manages the biggest Software Development projects in the Greek market and numerous already 75% of the IT market in Greece. During 2018 and 2019, Code.Hub was listed in the top 100 most innovative initiatives in Greece. Code.Hub awarded in 2021 & 2020 with Gold Award as the best company in the market regarding our servives.
Code.Hub works together with a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Code.Hub works in high end technologies to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders.
Our Gaming project is for leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest growing in Europe & US. Being International with a local approach, the company is currently operating in 6 countries. With people at the core of everything they do, their team of 800+ talented and enthusiastic people fuel their international expansion with their passion, maintaining an ‚Äùeyes-on-the-customer‚Äù approach and a unique One Team spirit. Continuous improvement is what they strive for, from professional development to team-bonding activities, while being efficient and making things happen is what their team‚Äôs mind are set on.
Description
An Analytics Engineer is at the heart of data-driven initiatives, with a focus on the silver and gold layers of a medallion architecture. The role plays a central part in enhancing four core elements: discoverability, security, quality, and observability of data.
An Analytics Engineer
Adopts best practices in data modeling, ensuring data integrity, creating resilient test designs and developing comprehensive documentation.Translates complex business and functional requirements into scalable, operational solutions that meet high standardsImplements and manages large-scale, high-volume, high-performance data structures, tailored for advanced analytics and data science.Develops and oversees efficient data transformation pipelines, utilizing ETL/ELT processes.Innovates and improves ongoing reporting and analysis processes by automating or simplifying self-service modeling and enhancing production support for our internal customers.
The candidate brings
A minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in a relevant technical discipline with a focus on data.At least 2 years of experience building ETL/ELT pipelines.A background in data modeling and familiarity with star schema and dimensional modeling.Good understanding of data quality and testing methodologies.Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills.A continuous improvement mindset with high attention to detail and commitment to quality.
Nice to have
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g. Databricks, Snowflake).Familiarity with dbt to transform and model data.Experience with version control systems (e.g. Git).Experience working in Agile teams or familiarity with Agile Methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban).Knowledge in industry domains: betting, casino, user accounts, payments, rewards, user communications.
Let‚Äôs talk about us:
Hybrid working modelA competitive salarySigning BonusBrand new equipmentExciting & friendly work environmentCareer & competencies‚Äô developmentContinuous learning & development experience based on infinity model through Code.Hub‚Äôs Code.LearnL&D plan for your career improvementA truly open, inclusive, and competitive-free environment to grow your skills and have fun!Internal competitions & rewards.
Let‚Äôs talk about Code.Hub-ers:
You are eligible to free LinkedIn trainingsYou are eligible to have free pass to all training Code.Learn activities after 6 months from your inductionTraining & Tech Mentor for your induction.Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning platform (1st semester).Sponsoring of a Bachelor and/or Master‚Äôs Degree from Athens Tech College.Private Health Insurance.Performance planning each six months and each two years planning of promotion.Free Lunch/Snack every day & Cocktail Fridays @ our offices.Referral Bonus.

title: Experienced IoT Software Developer
description:
What Impact will you make?Experienced IoT Software Developer @ Deloitte Alexander Competence CenterAre you looking for an opportunity in Thessaloniki, Greece that offers you a hybrid working model?Are you ready to work on international projects for industry-leading clients around the world and elevate your tech consulting career to an international level?If so, check below for more info about this career opportunity!You bring passion, we bring opportunities!
YOUR OPPORTUNITYDeloitte is a worldwide leader in Professional Services with a presence in more than 150 countries and territories. Since 2018, Deloitte has been operating its Alexander Competence Center in Thessaloniki with satellites in the cities of Patras, Heraklion, and Ioannina - which are model hubs of expertise, training, and innovation, specializing in cutting-edge exponential technologies, in which graduates and young professionals undergo immersive experiences, continuous learning, gaining practical insights and hands-on training that empower them to navigate the complexities of the digital landscape.Deloitte is an ideal working environment for both young and senior professionals who want to take the next step in their careers, offering them a supportive and international working environment that leverages their expertise and potential. Its corporate culture is based on trust and collaboration and ensures diversity and inclusion so that everyone feels part of a great team.
ABOUT YOUR TEAMOur IoT practices support our customers in understanding and adopting the most advanced technological solutions in industrial fields and more, identifying and implementing the integration architectures that best meet the requirements and business strategies.Our areas of expertise offer solutions in the Smart Manufacturing, Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT and IoT) and Computer Vision, helping our customers to create safe and reliable innovations that guarantee a real competitive advantage in the market:
Cloud Analytics that enable our clients to manage large amounts of data more easily and quickly, to enable state-of-the-art technologies such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, identify business objectives, and always ensure the best user experience.Graphical interfaces that offer a high level of usability and scalability on different devices, adhering to well-defined graphical standards.Integration Services solutions that aimed at radically transforming operational and digital processes, making them more efficient. Nowadays, a mandatory element for the unison functioning of complex enterprise ecosystems.Technological Architectures that allow the most modern Cloud applications to be integrated and communicated with "plug & play" systems with enterprise systems.Micro-services implementation that allows orchestration, reuse, and high availability in order to reduce time to market and improve the user experience.
OUR REQUIREMENTS:
Key Qualifications
Bachelor's/master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related technical/scientific disciplines.Experience of at least 2-3 years in the role of Software Developer, working on Enterprise projects, having gained:Back End development skills using object-oriented programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, C++, Python).Scripting and Bash development skillsLinux OS skillsMachine learning skillsParallel computing skillsExcellent abilities in:Logical, analytical, abstraction, and synthesis skills.Relational and communication skills both written and oral.Authority, organizational autonomy, effective communication, teamwork, and strong determination to achieve results.Availability for travel within Italy and abroad.Excellent proficiency in both written and spoken English.Be available to work full-time with a permanent contract at DACC office in Thessaloniki, Heraklion, Patra, Ioannina
Bonus Qualifications
Proficiency in the Tensorflow frameworkEdge programmingHardware knowledge (GPUs, accelerators)Understanding of network infrastructures
WE ARE LOOKING FOR:Individuals who have a strong will to expand their knowledge of new technologies, a passion to grow within the company and aspirations for career growth. At Deloitte we foster a consultative culture because the best decisions are made in consultation with others. We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact. These are not aspirations, but principles that we all commit to today and every day.WHAT WE OFFERAt Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits:
Competitive compensation and inclusive benefitsVarious Corporate discountsExclusive involvement with international projects and multinational top clientsClose collaboration with other member firms across EuropeA collaborative and inclusive environment that values your skillsAn empowering space where your tech enthusiasm shinesA visionary environment that welcomes your revolutionary ideasLearning and growth opportunities tailored to your journey to fuel your growthAccess to mentorship and networking opportunitiesOpportunities to make a meaningful impact on communitiesCareer growthFlexible work-from-home policyFlexibility to balance your tech advocacy journey and personal lifeFresh Fruits at the office to boost your energy
Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.Location: Thessaloniki

title: Warsaw Autumn Internship
description:
Description

Clyde & Co Autumn internship in Warsaw

We are pleased to offer an autumn internship programme in our Warsaw office, aimed at young lawyers interested Dispute Resolution. If you're keen to embark on a career as a litigator or arbitrator, an internship with us could be the perfect way to gain practical, hands-on experience and a chance to work within our team on some of the most interesting and challenging cases.

 The programme: 

The internship will start in October . While the schedule and time commitment required is flexible and intended to complement the academic workload of a?law student, we treat the programme as a serious investment in legal talent, requiring time and commitment from all involved. For that reason, we are looking for candidates willing and able to commit to a schedule of three to four days per week for an initial period of three months.

Provided that you demonstrate the willingness, commitment, and ability to work successfully within our team, you'll be given the opportunity of continued employment on mutually agreed terms, taking into account academic responsibilities.

 What you will do: 

As a member of our team, you will support our team in their daily tasks and assignments. You should expect that your work will include:

 carrying out legal research and analysis of case law, secondary sources, and other legal information relevant for the disputes and advisory work that we do for our clients; supporting our lawyers in the preparation of court submissions; being in regular contact with courts, authorities, public administration bodies and notaries regarding ongoing projects.


 Key requirements: 

You must:

 Be a law student in your 4 th or 5 th year during the academic year of 2024/25; Have successfully completed coursework in civil law , civil procedure and commercial company law ; Have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; Have strong writing skills and be able to communicate effectively; Be well-organized, committed, detail-oriented, and open to learning and doing new things; Have a good command of written and spoken English.


 What we offer: 

 A paid internship and an opportunity to continue as our team member; Opportunity to gain hands-on experience in an international firm by working directly with our lawyers; Individually tailored internship objectives; Mentoring and a dedicated buddy to help you adapt and understand our values and culture.

title: Platform DevOps Engineer
description:
This is your opportunity to become a member of our Technology Consulting division within E.ON‚Äôs Digital Technology organization. As a partner for our businesses, our division makes a major contribution as an internal professional services organization to accelerate the delivery of E.ONs Digital Transformation Strategy. E.ON is a leading European utility company, playing a key role in shaping the energy transition and connecting everyone to good energy.
If you have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place, you can become a changemaker in our energetic and diverse team!
What you are responsible for:

title: System Requirement Engineer
description:
Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?

Reality has made it clear that the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. Embracing the need for change, Volvo Cars is committed to spearheading the charge in automotive electrification. In this role, you‚Äôll play a crucial part in an exciting transformation journey that will change how the world views mobility. Are you ready for a new opportunity?

What You¬¥ll Do

As a System Engineer at our Krakow Tech Hub, you will be a part of an agile team, working closely with other software engineers, testers, and architects. You will work on numerous exciting projects related to our upcoming fully electric cars ‚Äì in this case, you will be a part of the team developing a core compute platform of the vehicles.

Our Krakow hub also works on our latest safety technology and is a key software development center for Volvo Cars. It plays a crucial role in Volvo‚Äôs strategic ambition to be a leader in new technology.

What You¬¥ll Bring

We are looking for a System Engineer with strong knowledge of systems‚Äô requirements and design with following experience:

Several years of experience within system engineering.Strong understanding of system design and system requirements.Previous experience working with SystemWeaver, DOORS or similar requirement tools. Prior experience with software download would be beneficial. Unified Diagnostic Services (UDS) standards knowledge (ISO 14229 etc.) would be beneficial. 

We also see that you have:

Fluency in spoken and written English A bachelor's degree in computer science, electrical engineering or another related field.Problem solving and solution-oriented mindset. 

An automotive industry experience is a plus.

Volvo Cars - Driving change together 

Volvo Cars‚Äô continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations so you can reach your full potential.

For the right person, an inspiring, and creative workplace awaits. Did you know that every Volvo Cars employee worldwide has the right to our Family Bond, our new all-gender, paid parental leave policy? You‚Äôll also enjoy a culture and benefits package that‚Äôs made us one of the world‚Äôs most awarded and progressive employers.

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. Join us on the journey of a lifetime as we create the driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

We work hybrid - the position is based in KRAKOW.

title: Integration Engineer
description:
Job Description

Chubb is the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer operating in 54 countries, Chubb is making significant investments to thrive in a digital age. Chubb launched its third Technology Hub in Thessaloniki in 2022 which is rapidly developing. Our new center of excellence in Greece is positioned to drive our ongoing business and to support our digital business transformation, as well as the company's operations in the European region which encompasses 27 countries.

Overview

Chubb is looking for an Integration Engineer to join our team. This is a permanent full-time position and a compelling opportunity to join a global, growing, financially stable and successful company. As an industry leader, Chubb is an employer of choice for skilled technology professionals aspiring to develop a meaningful career in a fast-paced, diverse company with offices in most major cities in the world.You will focus on the delivery of client engagements from integration perspective, you will be responsible for collaborating with different teams to integrate various software systems, ensuring seamless functionality and data synchronization using Biztalk solution.

The team‚Äôs key initiatives are focused on the delivery of integrated platforms across submission, rating, underwriting, policy admin and claims as well as providing enhanced data analytics and business intelligence. To support this transformation, the P&C IT team is growing to ensure and support the delivery of our systems to a high-quality standard and to enhance the engagement with the business.

Responsibilities

Designing, developing, and deploying BizTalk solutions using best practices.Developing and configuring custom pipelines, orchestrations, adapters, maps, and schemas in BizTalk Server.Troubleshooting and debugging issues related to BizTalk solutions.Creating and maintaining technical documentation, including design specifications, operational procedures, and documentation for support teams.Collaborate with the scrum master and business stakeholders to gather requirements and define application functionality.Review and recommend improvements to existing system designs and engineering processes.Stay updated with the latest features and industry trends.

Qualifications

 QUALIFICATIONS 

A Bachelor‚Äôs/master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Technology, engineering or another related field.At least 5 years of experience as a BizTalk developer, including hands-on experience with BizTalk Server 2016 or later versions. Strong knowledge and understanding of BizTalk Server architecture, including the use of BizTalk administration and Developer Tools.Proficiency in developing and configuring custom pipelines, orchestrations, adapters, maps, and schemas in BizTalk.Experience in developing and deploying BizTalk solutions using continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) methodologies.Knowledge of message-based integration patterns, enterprise service bus (ESB) architecture, and service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts.Familiarity with Microsoft technologies, such as SQL Server, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio.Experience in working with web services and integrating with various systems, such as databases, ERP systems, and CRM systems.Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills for identifying and resolving issues related to BizTalk solutions.Excellent communication skills in English for collaborating with cross-functional teams and documenting technical specifications.Experience with tracking tools like Jira.Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

The Following Will Be Considered a Plus

 Experience in the Insurance or Banking Sectors.  Experience in Microsoft BizTalk Server (BizTalk Server Adapter pack, BizTalk BAM, EDI and HIPAA 5010). Experience with source version control, preferably GitHub.Experience in relational database designs and database development such as creating tables, stored procedures, running query profiles. Experience with test driven development. Knowledge of Agile, CI/CD and experience working in Agile, CI/CD development teams

Our team makes the difference, every time. For this reason, we offer in return!

We offer hybrid working model, explicit, structured career development, a competitive salary package, annual bonus, private medical cover, monthly allowance for lunch, continuous learning experiences, work in a fun, lively environment with mentoring from our groundbreaking senior mentors.

Integrity. Client Focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values instruct how we live and work. We‚Äôre an ethical and honest company that‚Äôs wholly committed to its clients. A business that‚Äôs engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that‚Äôs collaborative and encouraging.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances. We earnestly strive to achieve an environment where all colleagues feel comfortable to perform to their full potential and are recognized for their contributions.

Many voices, One Chubb!

title: Software Engineer - Frontend
description:
Restream is looking for a Frontend Engineer to join us to solve complex challenges and build world-class products. In this role, you will build new features, develop the user interface of our product, and improve the reliability of our systems as we scale.

You will collaborate with a team of Engineers to drive processes and enhance user-facing features. You understand the importance of simplicity and reliability, and you calculate the impact of every decision on each. We believe in small teams where each member contributes significant value.

What You'll Do

Craft beautiful interfaces and interactions in Restream web servicesDesign and implement the UI and business logic necessary to support new and existing featuresPartner with a product designer to build great and user-friendly UI/UXGive and receive code review feedback with the teamMaintain a pulse on emerging technologies and discover hidden opportunities in our environment

A scrappy, entrepreneurial attitude that gets high-quality projects done quicklyStrong design sensibility, attention to detail, and strive for an excellent user experienceSolid knowledge of JavaScript, TypeScript, and newer specifications of ECMAScript (Experience with other programming languages is a plus)Expert in React and its major state management systemsExperience with CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASSBasic backend skills: Node.JS, building REST APIs, working with relational or NoSQL databasesComfortable working with TypeScript, MobX, AWS, Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, continuous deployment workflowStrong written and verbal communication skillsSelf-directed, analytical, and work well in a team environment

Back in 2015, Restream was founded in Ukraine. We had a burning passion for helping creators to be seen and heard. As the #1 multistreaming solution, Restream inspires over 8 million people worldwide to share their stories through live video and follow their dreams. We believe that a small but highly driven and focused team can make a lasting impact in people's lives.

A startup environment and a flat company structureWork closely with founders and team to build and grow the productOpportunity to make an impact on the evolution of the productAbility to create something that influences people's livesEquity packages for you to truly be a part of the Restream journeyThe tech you need to get your job done

description:

title: Software Development Engineer - 5G L3
description:
Job Description

The team you'll be part of

Our Business Group is a leader in wireless mobility networks and associated services. With

more than 3.500 patent families essential for 5G we have a strong 5G portfolio and are a front

runner in open and virtualized radio access networks (O-RAN and vRAN).

You will be working in the 5G L3 SW Development in Ulm joining a highly motivated intercultural

team. Together we are creating the (L3) control plane SW of the Nokia 5G New Radio base station.

We celebrate a culture of collaboration and openness. By that we fearlessly address

any challenge to improve what we are doing and how we are doing it.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

What you will learn and contribute to

As a Software Development Engineer, you and your team will implement and verify the latest

features for the Nokia 5G product family in self-organized SCRUM teams.

Your focus will be on Layer 3 related protocols and resource management within the 5G gNB.‚ÄØ

As part of our team, you will:

design, implement and maintain high availability SW for 5G base station embedded systems‚ÄØ‚ÄØ refine, estimate and plan the work for the next sprint with your team‚ÄØ ensure quality by defining and implementing unit- and component-test and taking part in code reviews‚ÄØ‚ÄØ analyze and correct software defectsprovide working leadership in a sub team and train less experienced team members improve methodologies for software development and test also support technical studies or prototypes

Key Skills And Experience

‚ÄØYour skills and experience

‚ÄØ‚ÄØYou have:

basic understanding of 5G New Radio or LTE channels, protocols and procedures‚ÄØ proven and solid knowledge of Python and C++14 (and beyond)‚ÄØ at least 3 years of working experience in developing software in a Linux environment, Bash scripting, IT network and SW debugging.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ master's degree in electrical engineering, telecommunication, computer sciencegood communication skills in English (both written and spoken)

‚ÄØIt would be nice if you also had:

passion for cooperative Teamwork and Agile Software Development processes‚ÄØ worked with git, gerrit, gtest, gmock, continuous integration systems‚ÄØknowledge of Clean Code and the SOLID Principles‚ÄØ hands on experiences with software test concepts like unit test, component test, test-driven development (TDD), continuous integration (CI), test automation skillswill to take responsibility and leadership 

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

 One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Multiphysics & Simulation Engineer
description:
Multiphysics Simulation

Join us at Nel, where innovation meets opportunity! Our technology department is now hiring a talented and experienced engineer within Multiphysics & Simulation to join our team.‚ÄØIn this role, you will play an important role in the development activities and be a part of the team to realize Nel‚Äôs R&D goals. This position reports to the Technology Director at Nel Hydrogen Electrolyser and will be based on the company's premises in Porsgrunn/Her√∏ya or Notodden.

Main Responsibilities

Develop and execute CFD simulations to analyze fluid flow, heat transfer, and related phenomena in Nel electrolyser stacks and process plant, including multiphase flows.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Develop multiphysics simulation models to analyze and predict the behavior of Nel electrolyser stacks and process plant, incorporating multiple interacting phenomena such as fluid dynamics, heat transfer, structural mechanics, electrochemistry, and electricity.‚ÄØ Utilize commercial and open-source simulation software packages, such as COMSOL Multiphysics, ANSYS, or OpenFOAM, to create, validate, and optimize simulation models.‚ÄØ Collaborate with engineers, scientists, and researchers to define simulation objectives, develop modeling strategies, and interpret simulation results to inform design decisions and optimize product performance.‚ÄØ Conduct parametric studies, sensitivity analyses, and optimization studies to explore design alternatives, identify critical parameters, and optimize system performance.‚ÄØ Validate simulation results through comparison with experimental data, empirical correlations, or analytical solutions, ensuring accuracy and reliability of simulation predictions.‚ÄØ Provide technical expertise and support to internal and external stakeholders, including participating in technical reviews and knowledge sharing sessions.‚ÄØ 


Key Qualifications

Master's or Ph.D. degree in Mechanical, Computational, chemical, electro-chemical engineering or related field, with a focus on multiphysics simulation and computational modelling.‚ÄØ Minimum 5 years of experience in multiphysics simulation, computational fluid dynamics (CFD), finite element analysis (FEA), or related areas, preferably in a research or industrial setting.‚ÄØ Proficiency in multiphysics simulation software packages, such as COMSOL Multiphysics, ANSYS Fluent, ANSYS Mechanical, or similar tools.‚ÄØ Strong understanding of numerical methods, continuum mechanics, and physics-based modelling techniques.‚ÄØ Experience with programming languages such as MATLAB, Python, or C++ for scripting, data analysis, and automation of simulation workflows.‚ÄØ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex engineering problems into mathematical models and computational simulations.‚ÄØ Effective communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.‚ÄØ Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.‚ÄØ 


Personal characteristics 

Structured and systematic‚ÄØ Proactive and self-motivated with high level of initiative and creative approach to problem solving.‚ÄØ Strong organizational skills and ability to balance multiple tasks.‚ÄØ Capable of working well in a multi-disciplinary team environment with high degree of collaboration across locations‚ÄØ Operational, naturally hands-on with a focus on quality and a strong ability to deliver‚ÄØ Safety first attitude and behaviour‚ÄØ 


What You Will Get From Working With Us

The opportunity to work in a global company that contributes to the green transition You will be part of a strong team, consisting of competent and committed colleagues Good development opportunities in a company in strong growth and a leading position in the market A dynamic and highly professional working environment Competitive insurance and pension package 


At Nel, you will join a community where your expertise does more than service a company ‚Äì it supports a vision. Step into a role where your professional skills will have an impact on the future of green energy.

Additional information:

Work location:‚ÄØOur offices are located in Her√∏ya and Notodden.

Contact information:‚ÄØFor further information please contact Robin Sandbakk, Talent Acquisition Specialist at robsa@nelhydrogen.com

To apply for the position:‚ÄØWe only accept and process digitally received applications, through our application system. All applications will be processed continuously.

Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company, delivering optimal solutions to produce, store and distribute hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve a range of different customers with leading hydrogen technologies. Our roots date back to 1927, and since then, we have had a proud history of development and continuous improvement of hydrogen technologies. Today, our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to hydrogen fueling stations, enabling industries to transition to green hydrogen, and providing all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fueling and long range as fossil-fueled vehicles ‚Äì without the emissions.

title: Senior Backend Developer (f/m/d)
description:

About The Team

In this position, you will be part of our chapter Technology & Engineering - Software Development represents all experts who deliver essential software development and engineering capabilities to all our product teams. These experts are organized together to keep E.ON‚Äôs code base modern, secure, and excellent. The products you will be working on belong to our team Digital Solutions I Future Energy Home. meaningful & challenging -Your tasks

smart & useful -Our benefits

Let‚Äôs empower each other: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building. We elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way. Let‚Äôs think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future. This is by far not all: We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the recruiting process. 

Do you have questions?  For further information please contact Janina Gilch, janina.gilch.external@eon.com.

title: Application Engineer on (Tiny) Machine Learning
description:
INNOITALY SRL is a start-up founded in October 2023 that focuses on designing, developing, planning, and producing energetically autonomous and batteryless sensory devices within a circular economy, including data processing, both embedded on the sensor with AI and on the cloud and blockchain.
For the new office located in ROVERETO (Trento), Innoitaly is looking for an APPLICATION ENGINEER PROFILE ON MACHINE LEARNING on embedded systems with the goal to design and implement a novel framework to support the development of green and even fully sustainable Tiny Machine Learning applications distributed in an edge-to-cloud continuum.
The objective is to design and develop techniques for energy-efficient Tiny Machine Learning on low-cost and low-power microcontrollers characterized by memory-constraints and powered with an unregular supply coming from energy harvesters.
Tasks include
efficient data collection, AI model generation (neural networks), compression, and code generation for memory-constrained IoT devicesintermittent execution and acceleration of the trained ML model on microcontrollers.
The activity will be intersecting with the following topics 
Energy Efficient and Low-Power ComputingMachine Learning on Microcontrollers (Tiny Machine Learning)Embedded Systems and Software SupportArchitectural and Hardware Support.
Requirements
A Master degree (or equivalent) in computer science and engineering, electronics, electrical engineering or telecomunicationEnglish fluencyMachine Learning Algorithms and Deep Neural NetworksCompilers, Efficient Code GenerationGood programming skills (Python/C/C++/Assembly Language)Programming Microcontrollers, and Interfacing Sensors(Optionally) Basic Electronics, PCBs, Circuits
Details
Full timePossibility of two days of remote workPermanent contract
Work location: Rovereto (Italy - Trento)

title: Senior Software Engineer, Shopping Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages.5 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.3 years of experience in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting distributed systems.2 years of experience leading projects and providing technical leadership.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience working in computing, distributed systems, storage, or networking.Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective verbal and written communication skills.

About The Job

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google Cloud's services‚Äîboth our internally critical and our externally-visible systems‚Äîhave reliability, uptime appropriate to customer's needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE‚Äôs will keep an ever-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance.

Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation. On the SRE team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google Cloud, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design. SRE's culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Responsibilities

Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services, from inception and design, through to deployment, operation and refinement.Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and launch reviews.Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health.Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Backend Engineer - O11y, Asserts (Remote, EMEA)
description:
This is a remote position. We are looking for candidates in Germany only.

What do we do?

The Asserts.ai team joined Grafana Labs as part of an acquisition and is now growing inside the larger Observability group. The backend team is responsible for building and operating a set of low-latency microservices built in Java and databases like Graph DB. The services provide automated Root Cause Insights by actively querying the Grafana Cloud Metrics, Traces, and Logs databases and integrating with the Grafana platform components like Dashboarding and Alerting. The Asserts services are multi-tenant, highly available and process and store data in Graph and Timeseries DB. We will soon be rolling it out to thousands of self-service customers, and it's critical that as we grow, we improve our performance, increase our reliability, and do it all more efficiently.

Grafana is trusted by major organizations worldwide, monitoring critical infrastructure. We thrive on collective creativity and diverse perspectives. Every team member is encouraged to contribute ideas that shape our product into a dependable tool.

Requirements

You have solid Java programming experience. Asserts services are built on Java. All our core databases are built on Go.You have worked on a big SaaS platform and dealt with common distributed systems problems (e.g., scalability, multi-tenancy, data isolation, HA, ‚Ä¶)You have used K8s or a public Cloud for operating your software and were responsible for operating the software you have built. You are passionate about writing clean, robust, and performant software that is easily maintained by othersYou have prior experience in owning customers' experience by participating in weekday 12h x 5d and separate weekend 24h x 2d on-call rotations.Collaboration and communication: As we are remote-first and our engineering organization is mainly remote, good communication skills, ability to work independently and collaborate with distributed teams is a must.


Nice To Haves

Been a user of Grafana and Prometheus in operational roles (including on-call for your team at a previous employer or just using these tools on hobby/homelab projects)Familiarity with GoLang


What will you be doing? 

Drive projects from initial ideation to operations once it is in the hands of customers.Take on complex challenges and break them down to achieve short feedback loops: to analyze, design, and build modular solutions, deliver MVPs, gather data and feedback, and then progress iterativelyMaintain critical systems, and own their reliability, performance, and availability.Be a part of your team‚Äôs on-call rotations and take ownership of the services you‚Äôre running.Mentor and support other team members, participate in design discussions, and collaborate with the teamLearn new skills by gaining a deeper understanding of our cloud product and our customers and getting to know the codebase.


In Germany, the Base compensation range for this role is EUR 71,688 - EUR 86,026. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.

Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market‚Äôs defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


About Grafana Labs: There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we‚Äôre building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we‚Äôre working hard to make sure that‚Äôs the foundation of our organization as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you‚Äôve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

title: Software Engineer - Hive Diagnostics
description:
About Us

Our Hive Workspace empowers clients to efficiently operate, maintain, and analyze performance in their highly automated warehouses. Dive into the world of robotics and innovation with us!

The Role & The Product 

Are you a Software Engineer who enjoys solving complex problems and staying ahead of the technology edge? We're looking for passionate engineers with great attention to details and quality who will help us make our product even better.

The Hive Workspace cluster provides a suite of applications that aims to make any maintenance (remote or on site) and repair of our smart embedded systems as efficient and effective as possible. Our goal is to ensure our highly automated warehouses can deliver the best for our customers. Hive Workspace suite is one stop shop for all of the work our clients need to do in their warehouse, to have all the tools needed to operate, maintain and analyse performance and all of that with minimal human assistance.

Production Diagnostics is a software product, part of the Hive Workspace suite of applications, designed to standardise and streamline the process of maintenance and repair. It provides an unified workflow and instructions to ensure consistency and efficiency in these operations.

Your imagination already started working? Let‚Äôs help with a short video:

Do you want to be part of this revolution, then keep reading!

Our Technology Stack

We utilise TypeScript and React.js for our front-end components. Our technology stack also includes:

JavaScriptJava 17SpringAmazon Web Services like DynamoDB, ECS, SNS, SQS and others

The list of technologies evolves as we adapt to newer challenges just as it should be in the dynamic environment of technologies.

Essential

What We Are Looking For

Extensive front-end experience with the latest technologies and tools.Solid experience with React.js.Willingness to work across the entire software stack with a main focus on the front-end.Proficient in the full delivery lifecycle, from research and technical discovery to customer feedback.Strong problem-solving skills.A passion for software engineering.

Desirable

Experience with distributed, scalable, and highly available systems.

Bonus

Experience with AWS, Java, Docker, Spring.

What You Will Do

Here‚Äôs a list of the Responsibilities you may expect:

Collaborate With Product Teams

Work closely with product managers and designers to understand user needs and product requirements.Participate in product discovery processes to identify and validate product ideas and solutions.

Design And Development

Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions that meet business and technical requirements.Ensure code quality through unit testing, code reviews, and adherence to best practices.

Continuous Improvement

Embrace a culture of continuous learning and improvement.Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices.Refactor and improve existing codebases for better performance, scalability, and maintainability.

User-Centric Approach

Focus on delivering value to users by building intuitive and user-friendly software.Gather and incorporate user feedback to enhance product features and functionality.

Collaboration And Communication

Work in a collaborative environment with cross-functional teams to deliver incremental value.Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and customers.

Problem Solving

Analyse complex technical problems and devise effective solutions.Implement and advocate for scalable, reliable, and secure software architectures.Gather data and make data-driven decisions

Ownership And Accountability

Take ownership of the entire software development lifecycle, from concept to deployment and beyond.Ensure timely delivery of high-quality software projects.

What You Will Receive In Return

The feeling of being part of a team that makes a difference in the world of automation and smart technology is great but here‚Äôs also a list of our social benefits.

Hybrid office attendance policy that sees you onsite 40% of your time30 days of ‚ÄúWork from anywhere‚Äù program30 days of annual leaveShare plan program300 BGN additional monthly allowanceEnhanced maternity and paternity leave policyMedical plan including health & dental coverageLife and disability insuranceEmployee assistance program

We also have regular divisional socials, sports clubs not to mention the Ocado Technology Academy for a packed schedule of courses, conferences and events. If you think you have what it takes to make a difference, please submit your application below.

About Ocado Group

When our journey started, we were all about changing the way people shop for groceries. 20 years later, we‚Äôre developing our own ground breaking technology, opening multiple sites at an accelerating rate and engaging in exciting new business partnerships around the world!

Transforming an industry also means transforming the way we do business. As we continually develop new technologies and customer propositions, we‚Äôre looking for the Everyday Pioneers to lead us into the next stage of our evolution: enhancing our capabilities, inspiring our teams and developing new ways of working.

Changing the way the world shops, for good.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Payments
description:
This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Payments Solution

As Java Software Engineer you will build and improve integrations at a global scale for in-store and online payments. We make sure that our merchants and partners have a seamless integration with the Adyen platform.

Recurring & Tokenization

As a Java Software Engineer you will build and improve integrations at a global scale for in-store and online payments. We make sure that our merchants and partners have a seamless integration with the Adyen platform.

The Recurring and Tokenization team focuses on supporting merchants to frictionlessly accept recurring payments. The team builds and maintains features to allow merchants safely store and keep up to date shopper's payment instruments (such as card number of bank account) to be used in recurring payments (such as subscriptions and one-click checkout).

Who You Are

You have experience with Core Java, web services, REST APIs and SQL/PostgreSQL;You enjoy working on automation and improvement of internal processes with cross-functional teamsYou are able to define, implement and monitor performance KPIs to quickly identify opportunities for improvement in existing systemsYou like to challenge the status quo and ask the ‚Äòwhy‚Äô questionYou think about how businesses would consume and benefit from your changesYou enjoy to work together with Product Designers and Frontend EngineersYou have a sharp eye for detail, like to work precisely yet pragmaticYou know how to get things done while reaching out and involving other people to hear different perspectivesGood to have experience using Gradle, CockroachDB

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments 

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you‚Äôre from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!
