title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Leer de organisatie kennen

Onze opdrachtgever ontwikkelt innovatieve oplossingen in een specifiek vakgebied. Je wordt hier onderdeel van een team van gepassioneerde experts, waarmee je samen voor verschillende klanten aan de slag gaat. Het bedrijf ziet de waarde van kennisdeling en vindt het belangrijk dat elke werknemer zichzelf verder kan ontwikkelen. Daarom organiseren ze regelmatig kennisavonden, labdagen en trainingen. Ook gaan ze zelfs af en toe naar (inter)nationale congressen, zoals een recent event in Seattle. Ze informeren zichzelf en elkaar om continu de juiste oplossingen voor klanten te kunnen bieden.

Het bedrijf van onze opdrachtgever is relatief klein. Ze blijven het liefst zo klein mogelijk, zodat de aandacht voor zowel het team als het individu blijft bestaan, je elkaar beter kunt leren kennen en er gemakkelijker geschakeld kan worden met elkaa

Over de functie

Als Cloud Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het bouwen van applicaties vanuit een DevOps-werkwijze en de doorontwikkeling in de Azure Cloud. Je krijgt in deze rol de kans om met gelijkgestemde professionals te werken, evenementen te bezoeken (zoals hierboven beschreven) en te werken aan de meest toffe projecten voor uiteenlopende klanten. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan een project bij De Nederlandsche Bank waarbij je helpt en adviseert op het gebied van cloud.

Jouw takenpakket bestaat onder andere uit;

Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van cloud-gebaseerde applicaties; Implementeren en beheren van containerization technologie√´n, zoals Docker en Kubernetes; Beheren en optimaliseren van cloud netwerken en meedenken over de infrastructuur; Uitwerken en toepassen van cloud native concepten en oplossingen.



Je bent een paar dagen per week op locatie bij de klant, kunt ook een aantal dagen thuiswerken en werkt net als de rest van het team op donderdag op kantoor. Zo blijft de klik met zowel de klant als je collega‚Äôs behouden.

Jouw kwaliteiten

We zoeken voor deze Cloud Engineer vacature een professional die ook buiten werktijd al bezig is met IT en een grote interesse heeft in het cloud-vakgebied. Je neemt het volgende mee;

3 √† 5 jaar werkervaring als Cloud Engineer;Ervaring met cloud platformen, waaronder Microsoft Azure; Kennis van en ervaring met containerization tools, zoals Docker en Kubernetes; Ervaring met DevOps-principes en tools, zoals Jenkins, Git en CI/CD pipelines; Ervaring met Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, zoals Terraform of ARM templates;Sterk probleemoplossend vermogen en de vaardigheid om technische uitdagingen aan te gaan; Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en klantgerichtheid;Een proactieve en leergierige houding; Een certificaat op het gebied van Azure is een pre. 



De voordelen

Reken als Cloud Engineer op een fulltime vast contract met uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en andere interessante voordelen, waaronder;

Een leaseauto;26 vakantiedagen; Opleidingsbudget; Stabiele organisatie met lange termijn focus; Riante winstdeling aan het einde van het jaar; Gave opdrachten voor wisselende organisaties; Werksfeer van een zakelijke vriendengroep met een passie voor IT.

title: BI - Developer
description:
FINN, Blocket, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori. Did you spot any familiar names? Then you already know a bit about Schibsted Marketplaces! Our team spans across the Nordics and Poland, united by a shared passion for our work and to foster a friendly and caring community. Curiosity, teamwork, problem-solving and continuous learning are the cornerstones of our culture.

Currently, we‚Äôre embarking on an exciting journey to become a fully marketplace-focused company. Our mission is to empower people to make smart choices for themselves and future generations. To achieve this, we are committed to staying agile and proactive in the rapidly evolving digital landscape ‚Äî shaping the future of digital marketplaces.

,

THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL

You? Are you a skilled BI developer with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical and data visualisation skills drive commercial decisions? Are you excited by the prospect of playing a crucial role in developing actionable analytics to optimise sales and advertising processes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Role? As a BI Developer with a focus on reporting and visualisation within the new BI department of Sales Insights, you'll extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and develop dashboards using Tableau. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. Your work will include developing dashboards, performing ad-hoc analyses, and presenting findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Company? Nordic Marketplaces is a dynamic and innovative company committed to driving change through data. As a result of the Schibsted company separation, Sales Insights is creating its own BI department to develop actionable analytics and enhance revenue streams through optimised sales and advertising processes. FINN.no in Norway, Blocket in Sweden, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland collectively form Schibsted Marketplaces, serving over 325 million monthly visits.

Why us?

 Impact: Drive the optimization of our sales and advertising processes through data-driven insights.  Growth: Collaborate with various teams across the organisation, gaining broad experience and ample opportunities for professional growth.  Innovation: Thrive in a forward-thinking environment that embraces emerging technologies and industry trends.  Supportive Team: Join a team packed with smart, friendly, and motivated individuals who are passionate about what they do. 

Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!

WHO ARE YOU?

 Proven experience as a BI Developer at least 3 years, and preferably in a business intelligence or sales analytics role.  Expert knowledge using Tableau to build data visualisation and dashboard development.  Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.  Familiarity with CRM systems and advertising platforms is an advantage.  Proactive and self-motivated with a forward-leaning attitude.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.  Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and concisely.  Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Detail-oriented with a focus on data quality and accuracy.  Enthusiastic about transforming data into actionable insights that drive business impact. 

WHAT‚ÄôS THE JOB LIKE?

 Extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and reports using Tableau.  Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.  Design and develop story driven dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends effectively.  Perform ad-hoc analysis to support business decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.  Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and compelling manner.  Educate and train stakeholders on how to use dashboards effectively to gain insights and drive decision making. 

What We Offer

We guarantee an engaging workplace where successes are celebrated, and colleagues support each other. Our benefits include various celebrations and plenty of opportunities to connect. Your well-being is a priority, supported by company benefits including physical and mental health support, flexible working hours, and on-site massage services. In our Oslo office, there's always cake to celebrate (which happens often), and in our Stockholm office, we cherish our Fika tradition.

GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!

If you're looking for a workplace where you can share your knowledge, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you! We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

QUESTIONS?

Head of Business Intelligence of Sales Insight Micheal Zamayeri (micheal.zamayeri@schibsted.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.

While we are continually reviewing CVs, please be aware that July is a traditional holiday period for us. We kindly ask for your patience as responses may be delayed until August. Thank you for your understanding!

title: Software Engineer in Test
description:
Engineering @ XEHelping our customers find what they are looking for easily, quickly and unambiguously is the sole most important factor that influences what we do in Engineering at xe.gr. Our engineers focus on developing high traffic and always-on web applications specialized in classifieds, optimizing our systems for performance and resilience and delivering features that make the journey of our customers easier. All of our systems are running in the AWS cloud and we make extensive use of AWS services.Joining our engineering team means you'll be actively shaping the company's future by driving innovation with state-of-the-art technologies.
About the job opportunityThis is a technical role with frequent liaison with everyone in the engineering and product teams, so good communication skills are vital. You will be a part of all testing activities and you will author new test suites and maintain existing ones so that everyone can run automated tests. Be prepared to participate in exploratory testing activities in order to better understand some of our most complex systems.
What Will I Be Doing?As a member of the Quality Assurance team you will:Daily communicate with software and product developers, system administrators and stakeholders in order to identify testing requirements, on a daily basis.Participate in the software development life cycle and provide QA-related feedback. Keep track of quality assurance metrics and know when to raise a red flag.Propose and implement detailed, meaningful and maintainable test suites for automated smoke, integration and end-to-end testing.Spread the QA culture and train internal teams to use the test suites that you help create.
What skills do I need?You should be familiar with translating requirements and acceptance criteria to test cases, test suites, both manual and automated and executing them.You will need to have a couple of years of experience with JavaScript or Java and be willing to cultivate skills in both languages. You will also need hands-on experience with Selenium, TestNG, and Jenkins.In an ideal world, you will have a deep understanding of all the systems that make an HTTP round trip possible and be used to testing REST APIs using tools like Postman as well as in automated tests.Some Playwright experience would be nice.Œ•ou will need to be observant, with strong attention-to-detail skills.You have the patience and persistence to thoroughly check the same piece of code or feature again and again, until all required tests pass.Greek candidates need to have fulfilled military obligationsFluency in Greek and good command of English language are required.
Where will I be working?Our current policy over office attendance is that of a hybrid model allowing our engineers to work remotely while meeting up a few times per week at the office.Engineers that are based outside Athens are considered fully remote employees while always being welcome to join us at the office for a team event!From the beginning of 2023, apart from our Athens office, there is also the alternative to work in our newly renovated office in Ioannina city.
What happens when I apply?The first step in our hiring process is to review your CV. If you seem to be qualified for this position, we will be having a quick phone call with you to welcome you to the process and we will give you a take home code challenge to work on your own time. Once we receive your response to the challenge, the next step is its evaluation from our Engineering managers. Depending on the challenge review, our HR team will inform you for the last recruiting stage which is an interview (virtual or physical) with the recruiting team (HR and Engineers).The interview time is focused on cultural fit and technical discussion mainly on the code challenge you have sent.
We offerGroup Health Insurance program.Competitive salary dependent on the candidate's skills and performance.A great opportunity to grow and work closely with a talented team with more than 60 engineers, in a modern, human-centric and friendly working environment.Remote work options.High tech IT equipment.
Diversity statementAt xe.gr we support human rights and focus on creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All candidates are treated equally, regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
JEX bouwt innovatieve software voor de uitzendbranche. Met inmiddels acht productteams werken we in een Agile/Scrum omgeving aan verschillende webapplicaties, gebouwd op een microservice landschap met √©√©n datawaarheid. Wil jij als Software Test Engineer een sleutelrol spelen in de kwaliteit van onze software?
Testen is een belangrijk onderdeel van ons ontwikkelproces. Zonder jouw goedkeuring gaat er geen code naar productie. Kritisch kijk je naar de huidige testprocessen om ze zoveel mogelijk te automatiseren. Je adviseert, richt processen in en zet test automation op voor onze producten. De planning, specificatie en uitvoering is bij jou in veilige handen. En hoe we onze software ontwikkelen en testen? Natuurlijk met de nieuwste technieken!
Dit vind jij leuk om te doen:Als Software Test Engineer draai je mee in een multidisciplinair Scrum team. Samen met je team bouw je aan een product dat onderdeel is van een cloud-based microservice landschap. Dit ga je doen: Werken in teamverband met collega‚Äôs met verschillende expertises;De kwaliteit van de gebouwde functionaliteiten op de eerste plek zetten door test automation; Zorgen dat de gebouwde functionaliteiten voldoen aan de gestelde eisen, zowel functioneel als technisch;Meedenken en meewerken aan een groter testplan voor heel JEX;Buiten je functie treden en samen met je team het product naar een hoger niveau tillen. 
Je werkt samen met een productteam, bestaande uit: Product Owner, Dedicated Scrum Master, Lead Developer, Business Analisten, UX Designers, Developers en Test Automation Engineers. 
Benieuwd hoe wij bij JEX √©√©n datawaarheid cre√´ren? Neem hier een kijkje onder onze motorkap: JEXPLAIN. 
Hier herken jij jezelf in:Je bent een gedreven Software Test Engineer en zoekt graag samenwerkingen op, binnen en buiten je team. Dit heb je ook:Een goed stel hersens op minimaal hbo denk- en werkniveau met een relevant diploma of een sterk verhaal waarom je geen diploma nodig hebt; Ervaring met geautomatiseerde test tools, zoals Cypress en Cucumber of soortgelijke framework; Ervaring met programmeertalen, zoals JavaScript en TypeScript; Basiskennis van CI/CD pipelines en GIT; Ervaring met Azure Devops en met Angular (pr√©); Een sterke Agile mindset;Goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Mis je toch iets in het bovenstaande rijtje, maar kan je goed uitleggen waarom de functie en JEX bij jou passen? In gemotiveerde kandidaten investeren we maar al te graag! 
Wat biedt JEX:Bij JEX werk je met de meest moderne technieken. Het upgraden naar nieuwe versies van onze gebruikte frameworks staat bij ons altijd hoog op de prioriteitenlijst. Dit kan je verwachten: Een salaris tussen ‚Ç¨3.500 en ‚Ç¨5.600 (o.b.v. je ervaring, skills en potentie); Meegroeien met JEX door onze optieregeling voor personeel; Een passende mobiliteitsvergoeding; 30 vakantiedagen o.b.v. 40 uur, 8% vakantiegeld en inwisselbare feestdagen; Een omgeving waar ruimte is voor initiatieven, idee√´n en kennisdeling: wij moedigen je altijd aan om de beste versie van jezelf te worden; Diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis bij te spijkeren, zodat je als Software Test Engineer nog beter in je vak wordt. 
JEX in het kortAls software en serviceorganisatie heeft JEX de ambitie om de arbeidsmarkt flink op te schudden. Een klein beetje omdat we dat leuk vinden, maar bovenal om uitzendorganisaties, werkgevers en medewerkers ruimte te geven om te groeien. Hoe we dat doen? Met onze zelfgebouwde software en aanvullende services. 
En waar deze software en services binnen de productstrategie het allerbelangrijkste zijn, zien we de mensen van JEX als ons grootste kapitaal. Daar zorgen we dus goed voor en dat merk je aan alles. Van ons mooie pand aan de Maas met ontbijt en lunch in ons bedrijfsrestaurant, tot aan een gebedsruimte en de mogelijkheid om feestdagen om te wisselen. En natuurlijk kunnen de vrijmibo‚Äôs ook niet ontbreken. Wat ons uniek maakt? De ruimte die we je bieden om te experimenteren, te groeien, op je bek te gaan en impact te maken. Want talent en kwaliteit excelleren in een open en ambitieuze omgeving, waar hecht wordt samengewerkt aan onze missie. Dat is waar wij in geloven! 
#WorkAsOne 
Overtuigd?Logisch! Al zeggen we het zelf. Solliciteren kan snel en gemakkelijk via onderstaand formulier. We zijn vooral benieuwd naar de persoon achter de naam, jouw motivatie, skills en wat jou speciaal maakt. Een kleine tip: kort is de kunst, krachtig de key.

title: Scala developer
description:
Amsterdam - As an experienced Scala Engineer you will play a critical role in transforming the technical landscape supporting our three car platforms, with the vision of bringing them into a unified modern micro service architecture.

Who Are We

Automotive Mediaventions consists of three brands: AutoTrack, Gaspedaal & Autowereld. We list thousands of dealers and hundreds of thousands of cars on these platforms. Currently, our team is busy with multiple technology transformations within our technical landscape. Our priorities are being a great place to work as an engineer and delivering high-quality products and services.

Our stack: Scala, Java, Play, Axon, SQS, PHP, Javascript, Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, AWS.

Our teams are dedicated to building high-quality automotive websites with the purpose of helping millions of people find their next car every month. We list thousands of dealers and hundreds of thousands of cars on our platforms, and we work in a high-performance, high-availability scenario where quality takes priority over speed.

The job 

We are currently replacing parts of our main application with microservices while we keep serving over 12 million page views a month. You will help us by figuring out how we can continue to deliver value while replacing small parts of our applications incrementally. You will also contribute to a modern distributed microservices system architecture, building services for high volume traffic and working with lots of data. Your main focus is:

Applying knowledge of software engineering, as well as coding best practices that minimise tech and architecture debt;Architecting, designing, developing, deploying and operating services that serve millions of users in a DevOps manner;Continuously search for the most efficient way of building software to prove ideas, and know how to harden these successful outcomes into a performant architecture that is scalable.

We offer

An experience-based salary.12% personal choice budget (of which is 8% holiday allowance).Participating in profit every year.36-hour working week.Over 350 training opportunities in our own academy. We also pay for your training that isn't in our academy. If you'd like to become TOGAF certified, we'd be happy to offer you this.Does a physical newspaper or magazine on your doormat make you happy? We offer you a subscription of your choice!We also offer travel allowance, a flexible work allowance and a staff discount for specific options.Please see more about our Tech colleagues and what we do here

Requirements

For this role, we are really looking for someone who can translate business needs and problems into software solutions. Also, you should be interested in industry developments and good at keeping your knowledge relevant and recent.

Several years of experience in OOP/FP (Java/Scala) to demonstrate a level of maturity;Experience with Akka, Axon or Event Sourcing and/or CQRS;Having worked in an Agile environment;Comfortable working with AWS or other cloud environments.Strong experience with most of our technologies.Patient and a strong team player.Familiarity with Linux systems (terminal should not scare you).Experience with GitOps, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment.

As the largest media company in the Netherlands, we are open to all talents in our society. We call on candidates with a diverse background - in the broadest sense of the word - to apply for this position. It‚Äôs the differences between colleagues that lead to surprising insights and innovative solutions. And that, in turn, fits very well with us as an organisation. We are curious about you, your qualities, and your experience.

Are you interested in joining our team? Apply now!

For further information or any questions, please feel free to contact me at leonie.lugtenberg@dpgmedia.nl

Even more reasons to work at DPG Media

At DPG Media, we work for more than 90 strong news brands, magazines, television shows, radio stations, and online services such as Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, and VTM. Although we look like a media group, we are really a tech company. We get digital transformation done.

We offer a high-performing tech workplace where we treasure freedom, from how you find solutions to choosing your path. Feel free to be an entrepreneur, an apprentice, a team player, and, of course, to be you. We welcome everyone to apply, whatever your background may be. A great bunch of smart colleagues awaits you and are eager for you to join the team, whether that be a project team, a pub quiz team, or a sports team.

Learn what we have to offer you or get to know our tech company! And while you‚Äôre at it, you can find us on LinkedIn en Twitter too

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:

title: PhD cand. Communicative AI
description:
The Center for Media, Communication and Information Research (ZeMKI) at the University of Bremen is offering two positions for a:
Research Assistant (doctoral researcher) (f/m/d) (100% of full-time weekly working hours, pay group 13 TV-L)from 1.1.2025 until 31.12.2028 (according to ¬ß 2 WissZeitVG).
The two positions are part of the DFG and FWF-funded Research Unit 5656 ‚ÄúCommunicative AI: The Automation of Societal Communication‚Äù in project P4 ‚ÄúGovernance: Private ordering of ComAI through corporate communication and policies‚Äù (Principal Investigator: Christian Katzenbach).
The Research Unit investigates how societal communication changes with communicative AI. The focus of the first funding period (2025 - 2028) is on the emergence and constructions of communicative AI. Our research uses highly innovative methods from the social sciences and HCI, including digital and computer-aided methods. For more information on the Research Unit and various opportunities for doctoral researchers, please visit the website https://www.comai.space.
Job descriptionThe project P4 is based at ZeMKI, University of Bremen. It investigates private ordering as one dimension of ComAI‚Äôs sociomaterial constitution with regard to corporate communication and policies in the context of public controversies, focusing on Germany, UK and US. The project thus investigates the ways in which corporate strategies and product policies of companies such as Alphabet, Amazon, and OpenAI as well as public controversies contribute to and negotiate what ComAI products are and how they are governed. The research uses a multi-method design that analyzes media discourses, interviews, corporate websites and product policies.
TasksThe research assistants (f/m/d) will be responsible for tasks related to data collection and analysis, to organizing project processes, and to the preparation of publications and presentations.Responsibilities include in particular:‚Ä¢ Collecting and analysing qualitative and quantitative data on at least two of four focus areas (please specify interest in the cover letter): Media discourses and controversies on ComAI; product policies and governance of AI products; corporate communication on ComAI; interviews with tech companies.‚Ä¢ Data management and documentation, including participation in the development of the Research Unit‚Äôs ‚ÄúComAI Research Space‚Äù‚Ä¢ Collaboration on project-related publications, events, and networking activitiesThe position offers the possibility of a doctorate.
Application requirementsVery good Master‚Äôs degree in the social sciences or related disciplinesGood knowledge in media and communication studies, technology and AI discourses, and ideally AI governance and regulationExperience with or good knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods of media and communication research, in particular with regard to qualitative andsemi-automated content analyses, as well as with expert interviewVery good knowledge of English (written and spoken)for at least one of two positions: Excellent knowledge of German (written and spoken)Strong communication skills and willingness to collaborate within the project team and the Research Unit
Also welcome are:Knowledge of the development of communicative AI to dateKnowledge of media discourses and governance of communicative AI or othermedia technologies (e.g. platforms)Experience in working with tools for qualitative analysisExperience in working with tools for semi-automated data analysisProgramming skills in R or PythonInterest in advanced methods of computational social sciences
If you have any questions regarding the job advertisement, please email Christian Katzenbach (katzenbach@uni-bremen.de).
Please send applications with the usual documents (cover letter, CV, MA thesis, any other publications, certificates) by 27.09.2024, quoting the reference number A269-24, by e-mail (as one file in PDF format) to Janina Fadil-Kerstein (janina.fadil-kerstein@vw.uni- bremen.de)

title: IoT Engineer
description:
Company Description

Are you passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex puzzles? 

Then we're the perfect place for you!

At Helin we are shaping a better world by upgrading the present! We created a game-changing SaaS platform for managing edge devices on industrial assets, boosting efficiency, safety, and sustainability. With this, our clients in marine and energy sectors accelerate the energy transition and save billions at the same time.

Intrigued? Excited? Want to know more?

We Are a Team Of 60 People From 30+ Different Nationalities, Ages Ranging From 19 To 60+ And We Work Based On 4 Core Values

 Kind and driven teamwork - you would not be doing implementations alone :) Collaborative growth - we grow as team and expect you to grow as professional Courage to innovate - we are free to try the newest things Trust in progress - every evolution is part of this revolution

Job Description

As IoT Engineer, you play a pivotal role in developing and implementing practical solutions for integrating physical devices, sensors, and other hardware components. The tools and technologies you use involve embedded linux, PLC's, HTTP, Modbus, manipulating historical data and struct.pack to play around with protocol data. In addition, you use (mostly) Python and communication protocols to enable machine to machine data sharing and control.

With a keen interest in experimenting with platforms like Raspberry Pi, Arduino, PYNQ, and beyond, you are a hands-on technologist who thrives on solving puzzles. Possessing a strong affinity for creating, testing, troubleshooting, debugging, and implementing pragmatic solutions, you bring a passion for technology to every project.

Qualifications

Who are you?

To thrive in this team, it's important to work as a team player, meaning that you communicate and live up to what you commit to.

Furthermore, you stand out through your problem-solving ability and analytical skills. Technically, you are resourceful, curious, and eager to learn. You might not know something (yet), but when it's necessary, you'll figure it out in no time.

Next To That You

Are a resident of The Netherlands and have a permanent work permit (we do not sponsor visas nor relocations).Have at least 3 years of proven hands-on experience working with Python on (IoT/embedded) devices using GIT and automated testing.Have a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field. Have proper English communication and people skills; you are adept at conveying complex information to both expert and non-expert stakeholders. Some experience with (IoT/PLC) communication protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, HTTP, and WebSocket, modbus and profinet.And it would be great if you have affinity with Docker, Azure and Linux and experience in a fast-growing scale-up international environment. 

This Is What You Get From Us

A chance to be part of an amazing international and fast growing team.A flexible work environment; at our growing office in Rijswijk or from home.The chance to learn, excel in your craft and grow. We will support your education and development with a yearly budget, and you‚Äôll have plenty of freedom for your own ideas and initiative.Lunch is on us and on Fridays, we get food from one of our favorite local eateries delivered to the office.We‚Äôve got your commuting expenses covered: if you walk, bike, drive or use public transport with an NS business card.After putting in all effort, we want to make sure you can unwind too. If you work a 40-hour week, you‚Äôll have 24 vacation days, and we will offer you the possibility to work remotely for 2 weeks per year.We've got your retirement savings sorted too, and Helin covers half of the contribution.

Additional Information

Click on Apply for this job and send us your CV in English and a brief motivation letter clarifying how you meet our requirements 1 to 6 above.

Please note, that only candidates living in the Netherlands with EU citizenship or equivalent will be considered as viable candidates. We are not eligible to offer a Highly Skilled Migrant sponsorship. Working remotely is NOT an option.

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

The Product Security team ensures that Snowflake products are built and shipped with the highest level of security. Our team drives the security development lifecycle of new products in collaboration with multiple product, security and engineering teams. Our approach is to empower Snowflake developers to build secure software. We aim to increase their autonomy by providing clear security guidelines, automating security reviews, and building necessary security tools and frameworks.

In this role, you will design and build solutions to enable software supply chain security at Snowflake to help protect from potential vulnerabilities. You will integrate your solutions in the software development lifecycle and own the entire lifecycle, from application development to the CI/CD pipeline and deployment. Your work is crucial to ensuring the integrity and security of the Snowflake product and to protecting our customers.

You will have the opportunity to help set the direction for the secure software supply chain team at Snowflake while working closely with security architects, PMs, and other teams at Snowflake.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.Experience in software development working with one or more of the following languages: JavaScript, Java, Python, C, C++, Go.Experience designing, testing, and maintaining software solutions.Experience leading project teams and setting technical direction.Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.Experience working with infrastructure from major cloud vendors (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)Experience with building security products, CI/CD pipelines and deployments.Effective interpersonal and communication skills.


AS A SOFTWARE ENGINEER AT SNOWFLAKE, YOU WILL:

Design, develop and scale secure software supply chain solutions at SnowflakePartner with security, engineering and product teams to define and set the strategy for secure software supply chain practices and processes.Lead and manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.


Snowflake is growing fast, and we‚Äôre scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

title: Python Developer bij Cisol
description:
QStars IT is een bekend kennishuis op het gebied van Red Hat Linux en Open Source tooling. Ook op software gebied timmeren wij hard aan de weg bij onze klanten en daarbij hebben we jou nodig! 

Jouw rol 

Je bent een ontwikkelaar die houdt van een uitdaging. Elke opdracht brengt zijn eigen kansen om je te ontwikkelen op technisch √©n persoonlijk vlak. Het werk bij Qstars brengt je bij veel verschillende bedrijven waar je de kans krijgt om je te ontwikkelen op beide gebieden, waarbij je Qstars collega‚Äôs altijd klaar staan om je te ondersteunen.

Wij zijn Pythonistas. Onze oplossingen schrijven wij in verschillende frameworks zoals Django, Flask en FastAPI. Kom je van een andere taal maar wil je meer gaan doen met Python? Dan nodigen we je graag uit voor een kop koffie!

Wie we zoeken 

Een gedreven (Python) developer;Je bent bekend met JavaScript;Git is bekend terrein voor jou;Tegen CI/CD zeg je geen nee;Containers zijn niet nieuw voor jou;Je kent de concepten van programmeren, een andere taal kun jij je eigen maken;Je bent niet bang om kennis op te doen van infra (Linux) en open-source tooling


Wat we bieden 

Leuk team met ontwikkelaars en infra collega‚Äôs;Leuke opdrachten bij onze klanten;Veel mogelijkheden tot trainingen, zowel intern als extern;Verschillende cursus tools, net waar je behoefte ligt;Naast technische trainingen, ontwikkel je ook je social skills;Laptop naar keuze;Goed salaris;Transparante en platte bedrijfsvoering;Mobiliteitsvergoeding of auto van de zaak;


Over Cisol

Je komt in een team van ontwikkelaars die voor verschillende klanten aan het werk is. Van universiteiten tot de Publieke Omroep bouwen we backends die impact maken op de maatschappij. Door ons grote klantenbestand is er altijd een passende opdracht te vinden waar je kunt werken met de technologie die jij interessant vind.

&Work helpt je verder

Bij &Work begrijpen we dat het belangrijk is om te werken op een plek waar je gewaardeerd wordt, waar je je verder kunt ontwikkelen en waar je de ruimte krijgt om te groeien. Door via &Work te solliciteren, krijg je direct toegang tot ons brede netwerk van werkgevers. We kunnen je helpen bij de introductie bij het bedrijf, achtergrondinformatie verstrekken, je voorbereiden op gesprekken zodat je jezelf overtuigend kan presenteren en je bijstaan tijdens de onderhandelingen om je een mooie stap vooruit te laten zetten in je carri√®re. Nog niet gevonden wat je zocht? Schrijf je in via &Work en we houden contact. Als we iets gevonden hebben dat echt precies bij jou past, laten we het je weten!

title: 2K Games Dublin - Publishing Graduate Programme
description:
Who We Are

2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K‚Äôs portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, 31st Union, HB Studios, and 2K SportsLab. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today‚Äôs most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.

Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of 2K‚Äôs portfolio currently includes several AAA, sports and entertainment brands, including global powerhouse NBA¬ÆÔ∏è 2K, renowned BioShock¬ÆÔ∏è, Borderlands¬ÆÔ∏è, Mafia, Sid Meier‚Äôs Civilization¬ÆÔ∏è and XCOM¬ÆÔ∏è brands; popular WWE¬ÆÔ∏è 2K and WWE¬ÆÔ∏è SuperCard franchises, TopSpin 2K25, as well as the critically and commercially acclaimed PGA TOUR¬ÆÔ∏è 2K

At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We encourage ALL applicants to explore our global positions, even if they don‚Äôt meet every requirement for the role. If you're interested in the job and think you have what it takes to work at 2K, we encourage you to apply!

Publishing Graduate Programme

2K Games Dublin: A Hub of Opportunities

If you're seeking a vibrant and fulfilling career, look no further than 2K Games Dublin. Our hub is brimming with excitement, where we focus on performance marketing, commercial strategy ,product management, data science, and analytics. As part of the 2K Games family, we bring innovation to the gaming industry. Located in the heart of Dublin city center, we offer an inspiring environment for you to thrive in.

Do I Need to be a Gamer?

Here's the best part: you don't! We embrace diversity and welcome both passionate gamers and individuals who have never held a console in their hands. Your unique perspectives and experiences are valued, as we believe in the power of different ideas coming together to create extraordinary outcomes.

Who are We Looking for?

Curiosity and motivation are the key qualities we seek in extraordinary individuals like you. At 2K Games, we welcome aspiring graduates from all subject areas. Whether you have a background in science, economics, engineering, philosophy, social sciences, arts, or any other field, our doors are wide open. Our recruitment process is task-driven, ensuring that you have the opportunity to showcase your skills and talents. Plus, our comprehensive core skills training and continuous development programmes guarantee you'll have the support and tools you need to succeed.

How We Recruit

A lot of companies have fun and quirky processes for deciding who gets onto their graduate programme. We keep our recruitment process short and straightforward, focusing on assessing the qualities that we know are essential for success within our company.

We Hire Graduates Who Either Excel In Or Show a Natural Inclination For Analytical Thinking, And Our Hiring Decision Is Primarily Based On a Test That Examines Three Essential Qualities

Quantitative skillsQualitative skillsThe ability to learn new things.

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you're interested in you‚Äôll thrive at 2K. So, we encourage you to apply for our graduate programme.

What makes our Grad Programme so great? 

Prepare to embark on an exhilarating journey with our renowned Grad Programme. At 2K Games, we understand the importance of nurturing talent, and that's why our Grad Programme is a game-changer (pun intended!). With a jam-packed 21-month programme, you'll dive headfirst into an adventure that kicks off after initial training. The initial onboarding & training gets everyone to the same level with specific skills to set you up for success.

Then the excitement truly begins when you start to explore various facets of the gaming industry and discover where your true passions lie. Imagine the thrill of embarking on rotation adventures in our international offices, expanding your horizons and experiencing different cultures (visa & availability permitting, of course).

Publishing: Beyond Books and into the Gaming World

Let's debunk a common misconception together. Publishing isn't limited to books alone‚Äîit encompasses so much more! In our vibrant world, publishing extends to everything beyond game development. Picture yourself managing advertising, both externally and within our games, coordinating budget spend, delving into marketing technology, shaping live services within the games, spearheading growth initiatives, unraveling player insights and analytics, crafting global marketing strategies, and implementing go-to-market plans. These exhilarating rotations are just a taste of what our Grad Programme has to offer.

What will I be doing?

Our graduate programme will begin in July 2025 and it is a 21-month programme.

Our graduate programme offers a fantastic opportunity for you to embark on a rotation-based journey. You'll have the chance to experience different areas of our business in Dublin, as well as the possibility of a rotation in one of our international offices. This programme is all about empowering you to shape your own graduate experience, as we match your learning goals with our business needs.

We have an array of teams eager to help our talented grads develop new skills and thrive. Our ultimate goal is to equip every graduate with three essential skill sets: analytical, technical, and commercial. While not everyone possesses all three initially, we believe these skills are crucial for success in 2K. We're seeking smart individuals like you, who have the potential to develop and grow these skills with us. Learn more about some of our teams here.

Show Me the Money!

Now, let's talk about the perks! As a valued member of our Grad Programme, you'll enjoy a starting salary of ‚Ç¨39,000, with salary reviews during the course of the programme. But that's not all‚Äîwe offer an array of benefits and perks to make your experience even more rewarding. Private medical insurance, a pension scheme, dental insurance, an annual bonus, life insurance, a company phone with expenses covered, a monthly fitness allowance, an office gym, personal training sessions, physio, free food and so much more.

What happens after the Grad Programme?

After 21 months of our programme, our talented graduates have the opportunity to specialize and transition into specific permanent roles within our business. Whether you choose to work in digital marketing or explore exciting avenues like marketing technology or analytical teams, the possibilities are vast.

By that point, you will have received comprehensive training in a range of essential skills. From mastering advanced Excel to our unique approach to work and project management, you'll be equipped with a well-rounded skill set. This ensures that you'll be well-prepared to tackle any e-commerce role and thrive in it.

At the core of our graduate programme is the goal of nurturing future leaders within our organization. We are fully committed to attracting and hiring the most exceptional people, providing them with excellent training, and paving the way for their successful careers with us. We firmly believe in creating a clear path for our graduates to grow and lead in their respective fields.

Hear about our 2K Publishing Grad Programme from our Grads themselves!

title: API Software Engineer, 1356
description:

title: QA Engineer - Core Banking
description:
Tuum is a next-generation banking platform. We enable fintech and banks to rapidly offer seamless and tailored financial services to their customers. Our core banking platform is revolutionising the financial services industry. The platform is API-based consisting of flexible and independent modules covering all retail and business banking capabilities for quick and easy integration.
Launched in 2019, Tuum is headquartered in Tallinn and is backed by investors including BlackFin Capital Partners, Karma Ventures, Portage Ventures and CommerzVentures.
We are looking for a professional QA Engineer to join our Core Banking team. As a QA you will support our Product team with manual and automation testing.
What you'll be doing
Supporting rapid feature development with automated testing once the features are readyBe responsible for API automation testingDesign, develop and execute automation scripts using CypressInvestigate test failures to identify potential bugsCooperate closely with different stakeholders and other team members to release the product at a higher level of qualityPerform manual testing when necessaryBe responsible for functional testing of the financial back-end system on the integration and system levelsParticipate in knowledge sharing sessions between QA, contributing to the development of automation tool-setWriting clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans, cases and keep them up to date
Our expectations
Studies (BA/MA) in the field of IT or technologyExcellent problem-solving skills and attention to detailStrong understanding of software QA methodologies, tools, and processesA team player with strong communication skillsGood knowledge of SQL and Javascript is a bonusExperience in microservicesExperience with Jenkins is a bonusPrevious experience in banking or finance, but if you feel this is something you‚Äôd be committed to learning, that‚Äôs also fine with usExcellent communication skills in English
What we offer
Competitive salaryTuum stock options4 day work week during the summer months (June, July, August)Pension plan and private health insurance (depending on location)Benefits and perks that support work-life balance (wellness compensation, team events and much more)Career opportunities to grow both professionally and personally as we scaleBright and warm-hearted team of professionals delivering great things togetherAll-hands-on-deck-approach (meaning that everyone delivers value regardless of responsibilities)
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We actively hire for cultural growth and welcome people of all ages, backgrounds and value people who take a journey unique to them. Equality, diversity and inclusion are our priority and we are committed to ensuring all job applicants are treated equally. All applicants will be treated fairly and will be considered for employment without discrimination because of ethnicity, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender reassignment, family or parental status, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, national origin, age, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

title: Data Science GenAI
description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. title: Process Engineer
description:
Envision AESC is the world‚Äôs leading battery technology company and lithium-ion battery manufacturer with battery plants in Japan, the United Kingdom, the United States, and China. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of France's highest profile manufacturing plants as Envision AESC is building a new battery manufacturing plant in Douai, Hauts-de-France to support its business growth in Europe. This is a unique opportunity to join one of the most exciting, large-scale industrial developments in many years, where new and emerging technologies will be adopted in support of the rapidly growing electric vehicle marketplace.
The Process Engineer is a professional position that is responsible for safe, proper, and efficient operation and maintenance of all plant equipment at the Envision AESC Battery Plant production facility in Douai. The Process Engineer will be responsible for maintaining plant efficiencies, engineering, and procurement of efficiency monitoring equipment. Work with the maintenance department to recommend preventative maintenance on plant equipment. In addition, work across the organization to foster continuous improvement for long-term success. 
Responsibilities -Work cross functionally with Operations, Maintenance and Quality to identify opportunities to continuously improve safety, quality, delivery and cost-Monitor plant efficiencies and makes recommendations to operations site management if plant processes require adjustments. Analyzes data on the process to troubleshoot process issues and maximize plant performance-Respond to operating needs. Provide a leading role for plant and equipment performance evaluation; optimizing resource use and maximize reliable power generation-Write clear and accurate equipment and process procedures for manufacturing employee-Responsible for process sheet development for assigned area-Supports process changes, design changes, trial parts, and Kaizen improvement activities-Leads equipment acquisition or modifications to support new model launches-Provides engineering representation for cross-functional activities involving other disciplines such as Facilities and Controls, etc.-Demonstrates data driven problem solving methodology and can effectively present work to all levels of management-Conducts regular safety and process audits
Background and requirements-Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering (Industrial, Electrical, Mechanical, or Chemical Engineering)-Experience in a high-volume manufacturing facility. Automotive OEM or Tier 1 Supplier experience a plus-A good understanding of root cause analysis (RCA), problem solving techniques, and process control management for quality and throughput issue resolution.-High level of applicable technical skills with AutoCAD, Inventor, Statistics, Basic Engineering --Principles and reporting of Technical Automotive OEM or Tier 1 Supplier experience a plus.-Ability to quickly obtain a working knowledge of lithium-ion batteries.-New model experience and equipment design, installation, and commissioning-New plant design, build, and commissioning a plus-Ability to apply technical math skills to solve real world problems-Experience working and leading a team across cultural and discipline boundaries-Fluent in French and English  Skills -Leadership-Communication-Problem-Solving-Decision-Making-Time Management-Coaching-Negotiation-Ability to work cross functionally in a multi-cultural organization  For further information please contact please apply or contact iftab@intelligentemployment.com

title: Data Scientist
description:

Your profile :You have a Master degree, You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,You have a first experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,You have knowldege in Python,You have experience with big data,You can work autonomously.

title: Solution Engineer ‚Äì Detect & Respond
description:
Are you ready to embark on our journey in a truly product-led organization? At Sandvik Group IT we‚Äôve recently switched to a new way of working to enhance our operational efficiency and elevate our service to delivery to new heights.

In our cybersecurity area we‚Äôre now looking for a Solution Engineer with excellent people skills and a profound knowledge in the area. We offer you the chance to influence our work where it matters. We look forward to achieving great success in this exciting new chapter ‚Äì and we want you to join us!

Your new team

The product area Detect & Respond Platform (DRP) is an internal capability enabler for Sandvik‚Äôs Global Security Operations ‚Äì who both are key components of our central cybersecurity service. Our focus lays on Microsoft Defender technologies and we‚Äôre a trusted internal party enabling, maintaining, supporting and providing expertise for owned tools. We‚Äôre a small team where transparency and sharing best practices pervades our culture. Our mission is to be proactive in identifying and addressing needs and gaps!

About Your Job

In this position, you play a crucial role in enhancing productivity, profitability, and sustainability within the department. You primarily work with MS Defender technologies and are an important part of the people and processes aspects of the delivery ‚Äì as both an actor and a contributor. Providing your technical expertise, you support customer operations, and drive projects within the field. You‚Äôre involved in the entire lifecycle of services and solutions, from development to support and maintenance, ensuring alignment with industry standards and innovation. To support your colleagues and help them grow to increase their capability to deliver is also an important part of your job.

Where‚Äôs the office?

The location for this position is flexible within Sweden and we offer a hybrid work solution. Your team is primarily located in Stockholm while stakeholders and other teams are in Sandviken and regular presence in these sites is necessary.

About You

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced engineer, preferably with a background from a larger global organization. You have deep knowledge in cybersecurity, MS Sentinel and the MS Defender technology stack, particularly for Endpoint, Identity, Cloud and Office365. Experience with common policies, practices and procedures within Cybersecurity is a plus, as is knowledge in MS Defender related deployment projects. Proven stakeholder management skills, both internal and external, are also beneficial. Your knowledge should be backed by a relevant education, or equivalent knowledge gained from a working career. Acting in a truly global environment calls for profound communication skills in English. Knowledge in Swedish is a plus.

Sure, the hard skills are important, but it all comes down to how you are as a person! You have an analytical and problem-solving mindset and can easily work independently with limited supervision. You‚Äôre creative and thrive in an ever-changing environment and can switch mindset and tasks in moment‚Äôs notice. Being a true team player, you happily support and coach colleagues and challenge when necessary. Your excellent communication skills enable you to build strong relationships based on honesty and trust all over our global organization!

Our culture

At Sandvik, we‚Äôre tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact Petra Englund, recruiting manager, petra.englund@sandvik.com.

We‚Äôve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts ‚Äì Sweden

Anders R√∂nnqvist, Unionen, +46 (0)70 616 41 21

G√∂ran Norell, Akademikerf√∂reningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78

Peter Olsson-Andr√©e, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55

Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist

How To Apply

We have an ongoing recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than September 23, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don‚Äôt accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0067487.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers‚Äô processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Bij Navara gaan we altijd ‚Äòfor the win‚Äô. We zien software ontwikkeling als teamsport. Want alleen als je samenwerkt met de beste mensen kom je tot het beste resultaat. Zo zijn we nu op zoek naar een Data Engineer die graag onderdeel wordt van een team van experts!

Jouw rol 

Impactvolle digitale transformaties

We ontwikkelen data en AI oplossingen die bedrijven daadwerkelijk een voorsprong geven. Zowel op de concurrentie als in de energietransitie. Bijt je vast in de migratie van diverse databronnen naar de cloud. Met data oplossingen maken we van conventionele klanten in de energiesector tech bedrijven.

Moderne cloud- oplossingen

Het is onze roeping om technologie te ontwikkelen die de beloftes w√©l waarmaakt. Eindelijk wordt de boel makkelijker, in plaats van moeilijker. Eindelijk wordt de potentie van AI duidelijk. En eindelijk wordt data w√©l schaalbaar en flexibel.

Daarom werken we met toptalent op het gebied van bijvoorbeeld Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure of Snowflake. Beheers je iets nog niet? Dan leren we je dit graag.

Wij zien ons werk als teamsport

Samenwerking is essentieel; daarom zijn Navarianen ook allemaal sociale en communicatief vaardige teamspelers. Bij ons gaan resultaat en plezier hand in hand. Door samen te werken in multidisciplinaire teams wordt het spel uitdagender √©n leuker. We inspireren, we presteren.

Wie we zoeken 

We zijn op zoek naar iemand die beschikt over de volgende kwaliteiten:

Een technische BSc of MSc behaald in Informatica, Computer Science of Software EngineeringJe spreekt Nederlands en EngelsMinimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in Data Engineering bij voorkeur met een van de volgende tech stacks:SQL, Python, Snowflake, Kubernates, Microsoft AzureJe staat er voor open om mee te denken over technische en productkeuzes. Je vindt het leuk om in een vroeg stadium aangehaakt te worden en mee te denken over de vormgeving van het product. 

Wat we bieden 

Voor ons is de wederzijdse klik het allerbelangrijkste en gaan we voor een duurzame samenwerking. Hiermee bedoelen we; samen successen behalen en langdurig met elkaar samenwerken. Hoe doen we dit bij Navara en wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Zeer uitdagende, veelal lange termijn projecten waar je √©cht impact kan maken. Je werkt veelal in teamverband bij de opdrachtgever. Daarnaast organiseren we samenwerkdagen voor het hele team zodat je elkaar kunt blijven inspireren. Je werkt altijd met moderne, relevante technologie√´n. Je ontwikkelt samen met Technology Officer Eva Oudemans een ambitieplan, om jouw ontwikkeling te blijven volgen en stimuleren. Een hechte bedrijfscultuur waar resultaat en plezier hand in hand gaan. Denk aan AI team events, Ski-vara en het Kerstgala. Natuurlijk krijg je een leaseauto, leasefiets, OV abonnement of andere mobiliteitsvergoeding. Een salaris dat zeer competitief is in de huidige markt. 


Over Navara

NAVARA is leidend op het gebied van Enterprise Mobility. Geen enkele Europese leverancier kan vergelijkbare kennis en ervaring ter tafel brengen. Onze software is specifiek ontwikkeld om overzichtelijk en veilig toegang te verschaffen tot Enterprise Apps. Wij hebben onze kunde succesvol ingezet bij organisaties in de financi√´le sector, overheid, industrie en zorgsector. Deze organisaties hebben allen een ding gemeen: hun medewerkers hebben behoefte aan betrouwbaar en veilige toegang tot corporate systemen.

NAVARA levert zowel Mobile Application Management software als hooggekwalificeerde diensten op het gebied van Enterprise Mobility. Wij leveren onze diensten zowel rechtstreeks als via Business Partners.

&Work helpt je verder

Navara werkt samen met &Work. &Work begrijpt dat het belangrijk is om te werken op een plek waar je gewaardeerd wordt, waar je je verder kunt ontwikkelen en waar je de ruimte krijgt om te groeien. Door via &Work te solliciteren, krijg je direct toegang tot hun brede netwerk van werkgevers. &Work kan je helpen bij de introductie bij Navara, achtergrondinformatie verstrekken, je voorbereiden op gesprekken zodat je jezelf overtuigend kan presenteren en je bijstaan tijdens de onderhandelingen om je een mooie stap vooruit te laten zetten in je carri√®re.

title: Back-end GoLang developer
description:
Help jij ons mee om de grootste Europese Mediaspeler te worden?

Wij zoeken een

 Back-end GoLang developer 

 Amsterdam  Fulltime 

Bij Mediahuis beheren wij een breed scala aan (online) platformen zoals Dumpert, Metronieuws, Autovisie, Manners, Famme, WANT, Culy en meer. Hiermee bereiken we een diverse doelgroep in Nederland. Onze ambitie? Een belangrijke Europese mediaspeler worden. Onze platformen hebben grootse plannen. Wij bieden altijd spraakmakende, virale content en kijken verder dan het huidige medialandschap. Om al deze platformen goed te laten draaien is ons development team onmisbaar.

 Dit ga je doen.



Wat maakt ons als development team bijzonder? We hebben een eigen stack gebaseerd op GoLang voor alle Dumpert-functionaliteiten, zoals onze eigen admin, back-end API voor video- en image content, SSO-systeem en commenting API. Jij zorgt ervoor dat de Dumpert-app en -website optimaal werken, zodat dagelijks de beste video- en image content van alle uithoeken van het internet beschikbaar is. Ons SSO- en commentingsysteem wordt dagelijks intensief gebruikt om in te loggen en de beste comments van het internet bij ons achter te laten. Jij zorgt ervoor dat dit mogelijk blijft. Om ervoor te zorgen dat wij de grootste media-speler van Nederland worden blijven wij innoveren met nieuwe functionaliteiten en innovaties, zo gebruiken wij bijvoorbeeld AI, om ons platform nog gebruiksvriendelijker te maken. Als GoLang-developer denk je mee en werk je mee aan de leukste toevoegingen aan onze systemen rekening houdend met onze vele dagelijkse gebruikers.

Je komt te werken in een internationaal team van back-end en front-end developers. Zij werken dagelijks aan een optimale stack die onze redacties gebruiken om, samen met onze techniek, onze vele gebruikers dagelijks van de beste entertainment te voorzien op al onze platformen.

 Dit neem je mee.



Het is een pr√© als je ervaring hebt met Golang, verschillende databases, caching en CloudFlare. Daarnaast kom je komt goed tot je recht in een agile werkomgeving. Maar niet alleen jouw CV is belangrijk, als persoon ben je flexibel, innovatief, nieuwsgierig en pragmatisch, en weet je de balans te vinden tussen resultaat en technologie.

En verder:

Je kunt microservice API's opzetten en hebt kennis van Kubernetes en GoogleCloud. Je hebt ervaring met CI/CD en GIT. Het is een pr√© als je bekwaam bent in webontwikkeling, bij voorkeur voor React en front-end. Het is een pr√© als je ervaring hebt in het werken binnen een high traffic omgeving. Daarnaast is uitstekend Engels en vloeiend Nederlands een grote plus. 

 Dit hebben we voor jou in huis.



Bij Mediahuis nemen we goede arbeidsvoorwaarden serieus, want ze vormen het fundament onder onze samenwerking. We blijven deze voortdurend optimaliseren en vernieuwen om jou de beste voordelen te bieden. Bij deze functie hoort een bruto maandsalaris dat ligt tussen ‚Ç¨3.430 tot ‚Ç¨4.880 bij een 36-urige werkweek, waarbij jouw startsalaris afhankelijk is van wat jij in huis hebt. Ben je benieuwd naar wat we je nog meer te bieden hebben? Klik hier voor al onze arbeidsvoorwaarden.

title: System Engineer
description:
Are you our next Systems Engineer?
Parker Hannifin is currently looking for a Systems Engineer to provide the best possible technical expertise for its key customers. Location is based in Bor√•s or Tampere.
Parker Hannifin - Global Leader in Motion and Control TechnologiesAs the global leader in motion and control technologies, Parker Hannifin is present in almost every area of industrial applications and employs over 55,000 people in 50 countries. This opens up a whole world of possibilities in which you can make the best out of yourself. At Parker, you have the individual scope for development to discover a broad range of topics and possibilities to which you can contribute your own ideas. On eye level with your colleagues, interacting in a team which welcomes you heartily. Take charge of your future. Discover Parker for yourself. Working in the frontline helping Parker Hannifin's Key Clients
In the Systems Engineer role you can step into the international team of 18 professionals. You are helping multiple Parker's key clients in different kinds of engineering projects. In many cases you are the go to person who people turn to when it comes to providing the best solutions and components for Parker's clients operating in the mobile sector (material handling machines, reach stackers, mining equipment etc.)
You are usually working with multiple long term projects simultaneously. One of the best parts about this position is the fact that you can often see the whole project lifecycle all the way from initial conversations to commissioning. You work closely with Parker's manufacturing divisions, other engineers and sales team in finding the best possible technical solution for the clients. Even though you do not have commercial responsibility you are often doing sales by bringing the technical expertise that solves client challenges to the table.
There is no typical week in this role. However often you can find yourself from doing the following: helping the customers at their premises, attending weekly team meetings, finding out what is the best technical solution for client needs, working with simulation tools, drawings or schematics and co-operating with your colleagues in order to bring out the best possible outcome for the needs of the clients.
We are seeking for three factors:
Experience:We are looking for a person with an engineering degree. You can be an experienced professional and for this role we are looking for someone with at least +2 years of relevant experience from the industrial field. Big plus is if you have experience from mobile machinery, hydraulics systems (especially valves), control systems or electromechanics. The preferred location for this position is Bor√•s and secondary location is Tampere. Position comes with traveling domestically and internationally and you need to have a valid driver's license. Language wise English is a must, German is considered a benefit.
Interaction:You are stepping into a very talented international team that is full of doers. Team is very passionate about providing the best possible service for its clients and developing themselves in order to constantly be able to deliver top notch service. We are hoping that you share the same ideologies when it comes to being on top of the wave of motion control technologies and placing customer service as top priority. You are comfortable when it comes to interacting with internal stakeholders and giving out presentations for clients. You like to work in the customer interface and are someone who makes the difference not only with your expertise but also with your positive personality.
Humanity:Kindness & respect. These are two main things that you need to have in Parker's organization. You value and respect others and want to work in an international environment. You are ambitious with a goal to to succeed in your role but your ambition comes with humbleness instead of arrogance.Position is sometimes hectic with a lot going on and sometimes projects might move frustratingly slow. However, you can still keep an optimistic attitude and see opportunities in places where others might only see obstacles!
Why Parker?At Parker Hannifin you can work in an international Fortune 250 company with a lot of career opportunities. Stepping into a global leader in the motion control technologies will not only give you a lot of room to learn but also an environment that will constantly develop and move forward with eyes set on the future. At Parker Hannifin people are valued and the well-being of employees is one of the top priorities. No wonder careers tend to be long at Parker!Your salary is a combination of base salary and possible annual bonus.
How to apply:This recruitment is done in a co-operation with Parker Hannifin¬¥s recruitment partner Nawia Oy. Recruitment process includes one meeting with Nawia's Hannu Pelli and 2-3 meetings with Parker Hannifin representatives. Also reference checks and possible work personality assessment is part of the process. Position will be closed as soon as the right person is found. In case you have any questions please do not hesitate to reach out to Nawia's Hannu Pelli (+358401633625, hannu.pelli@nawia.fi).
Best of luck for the recruitment process!

title: NVH Simulation Engineer
description:
Description:
NVH Simulation and Aero-Acoustic expert
The consultant will support aero-acoustic simulations, noise regulation discussions, and project management to ensure the successful execution of vehicle noise and vibration analysis tasks.
Responsibilities- Participate in aero-acoustic wind tunnel tests and collaborate with the Complete Vehicle team.- Perform aero-acoustic simulations to validate wind tunnel test data, focusing on side mirror benchmarks and various cab models.- Provide simulation support to correct test data, addressing wind tunnel background noise and vibration.- Develop methods for three-dimensional interior noise simulations, modeling in-cab acoustic environments.- Prepare materials and analyze texts for noise regulation discussion meetings.- Assist specialists in discussions regarding noise regulations.- Report project progress, plan upcoming projects, manage expenses, and oversee project execution. - Participate in relevant sub-committee and committee meetings related to noise simulation.
Qualifications:MSc/PhD in Acoustic Engineering, Fluid Mechanics, or related field.- Expertise in aero-acoustic simulations and noise analysis.- Experience with testing & automotive NVH field.- Proficiency in software including StarCCM+, Actran, and Ansa.- Ability to develop advanced simulation methods for complex noise environments.- Familiarity with noise regulation standards.- Strong project management and communication skills.
