title: Product Development Engineer
description:
What is the job about? 

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Product Development Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating and conducting Product verification tests, analysing/assessing test results, handling specifications/test method descriptions and documenting the technical development of our products in compliance with our engineering and product development process.

Your main responsibilities:

Create and develop test method descriptions for product - motor - verification in the design phase.Prototyping. Facilitate/coordinate prototype ‚Äì motor - building and testing. Verify products by handling product/test specifications.Create and apply the right testing method and seek/establish new ones if needed. Analyse and assess test results/measurements to be able progress Product Development Ensure high quality measurements results.Prepare documentation in compliance with our product engineering and product development process.Create TVS (Test Verification Specification) to specify testing requirements and prototyping needs.Document the whole Product verification in TVS. (Test results with all the technical details, possible solutions, proposals)Help to conduct measurement for the Technicians, guide them if needed.

Your background:

We imagine that you have:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in electrical engineeringNative in Hungarian Fluent communication in EnglishAbility to delegate activities and coordinate Engineering activities/projects.Ability to align/negotiate with external companies/suppliers mainly in technical aspects.0-3 years of relevant work experience before entering level besides formal education.Good knowledge of the planning, processes, and activities within the functional area in Product Development.

What‚Äôs in it for you? 

Whether it‚Äôs developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we‚Äôll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You‚Äôll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values.

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:

You are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 2 days‚Äô additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmesAccess to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional developmentDiverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly

Do you want to learn more? 

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume and cover letter by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù.

If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Zsolt Balog, Laboratory & Test Manager, Hiring Manager at zbalog@grundfos.com.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: 2025 Software Engineer Program - Full-time - Dublin (September Start)
description:
Job Description

The Software Engineer Program (SEP) is a global two-year career development program, designed to provide entry-level software engineering talent with foundational technical and professional skills which enable them to build robust networks and establish successful careers at JPMorgan Chase. You will receive opportunities for job growth, accelerated career advancement, and career mobility. The program starts with an in-depth induction program that teaches you about our businesses, builds on your knowledge of development methodologies, and sharpens your professional skills and will focus on holistic development of your technology, professional, and leadership competencies and skills.

Job Summary

As a Software Engineer in the Software Engineer Program, you will join an inspiring and curious team of technologists who will support you in developing new skills, experiencing new projects and businesses, and taking your career where you want to go. You‚Äôll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment‚Äîone that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will help build and optimize digital applications and systems that support millions of customers, clients, and employees worldwide. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders daily to stay focused on common goals.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading financial services firm with operations worldwide. With over 55,000 technologists globally and an annual tech spend of $15 billion, JPMorgan Chase is dedicated to innovating and improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality software and new products. Under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands, the Firm serves millions of customers in the U.S., and many of the world‚Äôs most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients globally. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. We look first and foremost for people who are passionate about solving business problems through innovation & engineering practices.

Job Responsibilities

Create innovative solutions that make a difference for our customers, clients and employees Create and improve the design, analytics, coding and testing for high-quality software and new products Own projects end-to-end, keeping teams and stakeholders up to speed on the progress of what‚Äôs being developed Work and share ideas, information and innovation with our team of technologists from all over the worldDevelop through on-going training, mentorship and access to senior leadersParticipate in our Force for Good program to develop real-life tech solutions for social good organizations while learning new skills and collaborating with our JPMorgan Chase tech experts 

Required Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills

Pursuing a Bachelors or Master‚Äôs degree with expected graduation year of 2025You should have graduated and be available to start full time employment in September 2025A well-rounded academic background Foundational knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, Java, C++, C#), databases, data structures and algorithmsRelevant internship experience and leadership in school or community organizationExperience across the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency and SecurityEmerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)In touch with industry wide technology trends and best practices with a thirst for learning, growing and trying new thingsAbility to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement 

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

Computer Science and/or Engineering majors are preferred. 

Locations you may join in:

Dublin 

About You

If you're ready to put your passion for technology to work in a way that makes a real difference, you‚Äôll find your place in our Software Engineer Program.

What‚Äôs Next?

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume and location preference. Your application and resume are a way for us to initially get to know you, so it‚Äôs important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you‚Äôll receive an email invitation to complete a coding challenge powered by HackerRank. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

HackerRank is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this step. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible.

We will be filling our classes on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible before job postings close.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds, and professional experiences. We will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

About Us

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world‚Äôs most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

title: Cloud Engineer for George (all humans)
description:
Make a difference in the financial life of millions of people: At Erste Digital you are co-creating the digital future, in which better financial health is possible. #believeinyourself
We are part of Erste Group ‚Äì the largest banking group in Central and Eastern Europe with more than 2,500 branches and over 45,000 employees. Our more than 2,000 IT experts and enthusiasts are the bank's Digital Muscle.
The Future of Banking is Digital. Digital transformation is happening at every level in the banking industry, and leading this initiative by delivering digital solutions across Erste Group, is what we do. Artificial Intelligence, check, Data Scientists making meaning from Big Data, we‚Äôve got that covered too. One of our prized solutions is the award winning digital banking platform, George, providing a desktop and mobile banking gateway for the bank‚Äôs retail customers. We are agile & awesome, creative & brave, playful & serious. And we are looking for great people to help us deliver this promise.
What to do: As the saying goes; ‚Äòkeep your feet on the ground, and your head in the clouds‚Äô, is the type of person we are looking for. Someone who has the foresight and expertise to define the cloud landscape, while being the person on the ground helping the customer and our teams succeed in the cloud journey. As a Cloud Engineer, you will facilitate, communicate, design and guide the implementation of cloud technical blueprints. You will ultimately be responsible for matching the technical design specifications with the needs of our customers, but also help our project managers and cloud engineers understand these requirements with clarity.
You check these boxes:Proven technical expertise in cloud technology and architecture SaaS, PaaS, IaaS and Digital Transformation related topicsMultiple years of experience as an operations engineer, ideally with DevOps experienceScripting skills (bash / python), with Linux environmentStrong trouble shooting and problem analysis skillsTechnical knowledge in any of the following areas: AWS Cloud Platform, Containers (Kubernetes, Docker, Cloud Foundry) and TerraformA natural confidence with your communication and team skills, while being fluent in EnglishThe right mindset for DevOps knowing the processes and the common tools (development pipeline, continuous delivery, automated testing, application analytics)
Why you will like us:Because you will be joining a dynamic, international and diverse workplaceWe provide a relaxed, professional environment and all the hardware & software you need to work efficiently (e.g. Laptop, mobile device, licenses...)We care for your personal well-being and career development while actively supporting your educational needsWe communicate and collaborate with a variety of tools including Slack, Confluence and JIRAWe encourage regular conference visits and multiple chances to shine with George.Working from home, virtual office, working while riding a bike. What ever and how ever you do your best work to make George shine, is fine by us.A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - we are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 3.000,- gross per month for this full time position. But this is just a formality, we are more than happy to discuss your actual expectations.
The way we areAs an employee of Erste Digital, the success of our people is more than a motto, it‚Äôs our manifest. We nurture a work environment where age, skin colour, gender, sexual orientation and cultural background are seen as the key to our success ‚Äì we live diversity!

title: Senior Full-Stack Software Developer and Data Scientist
description:
We are a leading professional services company, providing a broad range of solutions in digital strategies, technology consulting and operations. With over 20 years of experience we have built software for many worldwide companies and have made a name for ourselves in a whole array of services, mainly in the Big Pharma. 
We are looking for a Senior Full-Stack Software Developer and Data Scientist in the digital health sector, with 5+ years of programming experience and good English, both written and spoken. 
Essential Skills: Experience in Linux Fundamentals and Scripting Experience in DB SQL and NoSQL like: Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, Elastichsearch Experience in Javascript (Typescript), HTML, CSS (SCSS, Less) Experience in Node.js or Java Experience in frameworks like Angular or React for the UI development Experience in frameworks like NestJS or SpringBoot for API Development Experience with Docker for development and deployment Experience in Git (distributed version control system) software application Experience in Python and data science (numpy, pandas, matplotlib libraries) 
Nice to have: Experience in project management software like Jira Experience with large language models (LLM) and integration of existing services through APIs Experience in data analysis with Machine Learning (e.g. pytorch, scikit-learn, tensorflow libraries) Experience with the ELK stack for dashboard e graphs

HOPE TO SEE YOU SOON IN OUR TEAM!

title: Computer Vision Engineer (C++)
description:
Computer Vision Engineer - Machine Learning - ML - C++ - Python - Pytorch - Germany - Heidelberg - Hybrid
Computer Vision Engineer (C++) 
Company Overview:This company is looking for a Computer Vision Engineer to join their dynamic team. 
They partner with global brands, providing solutions for customer engagement and cutting-edge marketing. They are bringing Metaverse applications to life on standard screens using gesture control, all without the need for headsets. This allows their clients to connect with their audiences in a truly digital and innovative way.
Role Overview:The C++ Engineer is the enabler of the company's innovative solutions. Success is driven by a diverse team of over 70 professionals, who value initiative, creativity, and a commitment to customer satisfaction. The company is expanding its R&D team to design, develop, and implement next-generation solutions for contactless interaction, both in business environments and at home.
Key Responsibilities:Translating gesture control specifications into practical, user-centered solutions.Developing and enhancing their codebase (C++).Advancing machine learning algorithms to improve gesture control (Pytorch, Python).Integrating solutions across platforms including Windows, Linux, Android, and both x86_64 and ARM processors.Contributing to the evolution of Human-Machine Interface (HMI) standards.Fostering growth and collaboration within the teams.
Candidate Profile:Proficiency in C++ development, with experience in Pytorch and Python.A strong passion for understanding and advancing gesture control technology.Experience in software product development teams.Background in areas such as machine learning, augmented reality, game development, or computer vision.Familiarity with C#, Unity, and/or OpenCL is a plus but not mandatory.

title: Software Development Engineer, Aurora Storage
description:
Description

Are you interested in building hyper-scale database services in the cloud? Do you want to revolutionize the way databases are built for the cloud ? Do you want to have direct and immediate impact on hundreds of thousands of users who use AWS database services?

Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and Postgres compatible, relational database service that combines the speed and availability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open source databases. It provides up to five times better performance than MySQL at a price point one tenth that of a commercial database while delivering similar performance and availability. Amazon Aurora is powered by an auto-scaling, auto-healing, distributed storage cluster of massive world-wide scale.

Amazon Aurora Storage platform team is looking for experienced software engineers who are excited about building large scale systems spanning tens of thousands of servers, across multiple data-centers worldwide. These are core systems development positions where you will own the design and development of significant software components critical to our industry leading database services architect-ed for the cloud.

In this hands on position you will be asked to do everything from building rock-solid components to mentoring other engineers. You need to not only be a top software developer with a good track record of delivering, but also excel in communication, leadership and customer focus. This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast growing business and help shape the technology, product and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical and software expertise and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to deliver high quality code that has a broad business impact.

Key job responsibilities

Our engineers collaborate across diverse teams, projects, and environments to have a firsthand impact on our global customer base. You‚Äôll bring a passion for innovation, data, search, analytics, and distributed systems. You‚Äôll also: Solve challenging technical problems, often ones not solved before, at every layer of the stack. Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative software solutions to transform service performance, durability, cost, and security. Build high-quality, highly available, always-on products. Research implementations that deliver the best possible experiences for customers.

A day in the life

As you design and code solutions to help our team drive efficiencies in software architecture, you‚Äôll create metrics, implement automation and other improvements, and resolve the root cause of software defects. You‚Äôll also: Build high-impact solutions to deliver to our large customer base. Participate in design discussions, code review, and communicate with internal and external stakeholders. Work cross-functionally to help drive business decisions with your technical input. Work in a startup-like development environment, where you‚Äôre always working on the most important stuff.

About The Team

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we‚Äôre building an environment that celebrates knowledge-sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects that help our team members develop your engineering expertise so you feel empowered to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Utility Computing (UC)

AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations ‚Äî from foundational services such as Amazon‚Äôs Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS‚Äôs services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you‚Äôll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS, including support for customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.

About AWS

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Basic Qualifications

 Experience (non-internship) in professional software development Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems Experience programming with at least one software programming language

Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: SW Developer, IAM (m/f/d)

title: Cloud Integration Engineer
description:

Collaborate with the Implementation and Technical Support team to deliver a complete solution which includes analyzing, mapping, testing, and deploying Inbound Map profiles within defined timescales.

 While the job description describes what is anticipated as the requirements of the position, the job requirements are subject to change based upon any changing needs and requirements of the business.

Excellent Communication Skills (both written & oral)Analytical and good problem-solving skillsExcellent ability to articulate problems and resolutionsAttention to DetailsLogical thinkingAbility to multitask and work under pressure

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
About The Role & Team

On any given day at Disney Entertainment & ESPN Technology, we‚Äôre reimagining ways to create magical viewing experiences for the world‚Äôs most beloved stories while also transforming our media business for the future. Whether that‚Äôs evolving our streaming and digital products in new and immersive ways, powering worldwide advertising and distribution to enhance flexibility and efficiency, or delivering Disney‚Äôs unmatched entertainment and sports content, every day is a moment to make a difference to partners and to hundreds of millions of people globally.

A few reasons why we think you‚Äôd love working for the team:


Building the future of Disney's media business: DE&E Technologists are designing and building the infrastructure that will power our media, advertising, and distribution businesses for years to come.Reach & Scale: The products and platforms this group builds and operates delight millions of consumers every minute of every day ‚Äì from Disney+ and Hulu, to ABC News and Entertainment, to ESPN and ESPN+, and much more.Innovation: We develop and execute groundbreaking products and techniques that shape industry norms and enhance how audiences experience sports, entertainment & news.


This is a hybrid role based in the Amsterdam office.

What You Will Do

Disney's Android team is seeking an experienced Software Engineer who is excited to build apps enjoyed by millions around the world. You will be building scalable, elegant solutions for the Android applications on Disney+ and Star+ across variety of devices including phones, tablets, and TVs. Our highly collaborative group works in tandem with many cross-functional teams. We value communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as a bias for action. We are exceptionally invested in maintaining high code quality standards with unit tests, automated tests, modern libraries, and a Kotlin codebase. We strive to build the best Live and video-on-demand (VOD) applications in the world, and we look forward to hearing more about your skills and how they can help us achieve this lofty goal.

As a Lead Android Engineer at Disney, you are ready and willing to be responsible for a wide array of technical aspects. You assist with critical components including our release process, remote configuration management, and live production issues. You have and will lead entire projects end-to-end. While familiar with the high-level aspects of our project as a whole, you are also focused on and monitoring the health of the team. You not only seek out leadership opportunities to improve processes, but you do it with finesse and a positive attitude. You are comfortable facilitating career growth amongst team members and are invested in the long-term success of the company.

Required Qualifications & Skills


5+ years of production experience with Kotlin, and the Android SDKProficiency with Reactive Programming and Dependency InjectionWell-versed in different architectural patterns (MVI/MVVM or equivalent)Experience with Java, Gradle, Databases, Reactive paradigms, coroutines.Pristine communication skills who can collaborate well across teamsYou write excellent code, tests, and documentationExperience resolving production issues ideally on a large scaleOptimally lead a project from start to finishBachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience or better in Computer Science or a related technical field.


Preferred Qualifications


Comfortable using common Android libraries such as Dagger 2 / Hilt, RxJava2, GroupieFamiliarity with Android TV / Amazon Fire TV developmentExperience with streaming video, codecs, and DRMKnowledgeable about maintaining a large modularized codebaseExperience using performance evaluation tools such as Android Profiler


The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Design Developer

Vi st√•r foran en spennende innovasjonsreise, med s√∏kelys p√• nye tjenester og produkter st√∏ttet av en moderne tech stack. Du blir sentral i dette arbeidet, og vi trenger deg, dine ideer og kreativitet for √• utvikle v√•r tjenesteplattform for fremtiden!
,

title: Software Engineer (Golang)
description:
Diabolocom enables organizations worldwide to build brand loyalty and drive sales growth. Our innovative cloud-based solution leverages its proprietary AI technologies to optimize contact centers of medium to large sizes, enabling efficient management of customer interactions across all communication channels. As a telecom operator, we ensure premium voice quality, efficient handling of high call volumes, and provide phone numbers worldwide.
Our comprehensive range of AI services, specifically designed for customer relations, elevates data quality and automates tasks. These services, fully integrated into our cloud contact center solutions, are also accessible through APIs in multiple languages.
We empower Customer Service and Sales teams to effectively handle all inbound and outbound interactions thanks to our state-of-the-art dialer. Our solution seamlessly integrateswith leading CRMs and offers real-time monitoring and analytics capabilities.
Diabolocom, with offices across Europe, the USA, Brazil, and the UAE, proudly serves 350+ clients, with agents operating from 60+ countries.
About The Role
Diabolocom is seeking a skilled and experienced Software Engineer (Golang) to join its Software Engineering team. This role is crucial for developing new backend services and enhancing customer communication channels, including chats, SMS, WhatsApp, and
support for email services.
Your Responsibilities
Develop microservices and adapters for specific written channels (chats, SMS,
WhatsApp).
-Collaborate with backend/frontend developers and product owners to deliver high-
quality solutions.
Mentor team members in GoLang best practices to facilitate skill development within
the team.
What We're Looking For
Minimum 5 years of experience in backend development.Strong proficiency in GoLang with at least 3 years of hands-on experience.Experience with microservice architecture and API design.Knowledge of cloud-native infrastructure and CI/CD tools is a plus.Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
What's In It For You
Work in a multicultural environment with colleagues from 5 different countries and 10 nationalities.First choice IT equipment and a central office location in Paris near the Opera Garnier.Remote-friendly work environment.Swile card for lunch vouchers.Team building events in exciting locations like Ibiza, Porquerolles, and Corsica.Opportunity to contribute to a growing company with ample career development
prospects.
A culture where your ideas are valued and contribute directly to the organization's
success.
Continuous learning and growth opportunities.
Recruitment Process
Technical challenge on HackerRank platform to assess general levelCall with a Talent Acquisition ManagerLive coding challenge and design interview through screen sharing with our Lead Software Engineer Call with David, our COO

title: API Developer
description:
Nice to know (you)

We are looking for an experienced API Developer with profound JAVA knowledge to facilitate the automated data exchange between Schiphol‚Äôs information systems internally as well as to its ecosystem. This includes passengers, airlines, customs, caterers and energy companies. You‚Äôll be part of the DnA API development team, where we deliver (REST and Streaming) APIs in a small but closely connected team. Within this agile team we provide customers and the aviation partners of Schiphol with timely and accurate data. With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports. 


Connecting your world

As API developer you disclose the world of Schiphol data. The activities you perform on a daily basis are diverse and included the creation of new APIs, upgrading existing APIs to the newest standard, problem solving and interacting with the users.How you achieve results in this? That‚Äôs up to you. We trust in the way you find a solution for every problem. You put your talents to work at:

Developing REST APIs and Streaming APIs. Reviewing code, pair programming and sharing knowledge. Supporting our (internal) clients. Taking part in our drive to continuously improve. 


You've got this

Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this by analysing problems, recognising patterns and reasoning logically. The result? Insight and solutions. Also, you are the talent who keeps coming up with new, clever things. In addition, for this position you have:

5+ years of experience in designing, developing and maintaining APIs. Experienced in Java >=8 programming and worked with Java for at least five years. A relevant bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs degree. Good knowledge of (the majority) our technology stack: Reactor, Confluent Kafka, Elasticsearch, OpenShift/ Docker, Micronau. 


You get this

 ‚Ç¨ 4401 to ‚Ç¨ 6128 gross per month (Schaal 11). A 13th month (year-end bonus). The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week. An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work. 


These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.

About The Team

With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:

... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport. ‚Ä¶ there were a total of 61.7 million travellers from and to Schiphol Airport in 2023? ... as a API Developer will be joining the business area Data, AI and Analytics (DnA)?


Choose your destination

What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.

Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner by sending a message to: erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group. For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Your mission

Platform Engineers in Midokura develop the infrastructure, tools and services that accelerate our product teams by enabling them to manage the life cycle of applications, from source code management and continuous integration testing, to continuous deployment and operating the services in production.

We seek an engineer who has a deep understanding of cloud-native architectures and a product-centric mindset. The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic culture where adaptability to an emerging technology space is critical, shows a collaborative spirit and has a strong commitment to team success demonstrating equal passion for the work of their teammates as they do for their own work.

Responsibilities

Deliver the tooling necessary to solve the product team‚Äôs pain points. Among them:CI/CD infrastructureDefine application deployable artifacts (docker containers and helm charts)Standardize infrastructure lifecycle managementObservability tooling for operating servicesContribute to architecture designs and evaluations.Focus on the upper layers of the Platform stack by providing added value on top of existing platform tools. Help your team members grow and succeed, you seek to create a healthy and safe team culture where everyone feels responsible for final results and participates in all aspects of making the team work.Be an active participant in Midokura¬¥s engineering community helping to continuously push it to higher levels of excellence.
Your profile

Must-have Skills And Experience

Excellent communication and analytical skills.Strong product mindset to shape the platform product portfolioA solid base of software engineering fundamentals.Strong experience in infrastructure management.An eagerness to learn new technologies and a pragmatic approach to their application.Enjoys working as part of a team and consider it a fundamental part of the job

Desired Skills And Experience

We believe you will thrive in Midokura if you possess a mix of some of the following skills and experiences:

Experience dealing with CI & CD systems (Github Actions, Flux CD)Experience dealing with infrastructure management (Terraform)Experience operating services in productionSLOs, observability, networking, troubleshooting skillsExperience with Cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS.Experience with Observability platforms such as DataDog or Grafana.Experience with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes and Docker.How to iterate and improve Incident Management processes.Implement and shape SLOs.Define OKRs as a goal-setting tool.
Requirements

Education:

BS or MS in Computer Science, or a related field.

Other Requirements: 

EU Working Permit.Team worker.Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (Full Professional Proficiency)Spanish or Japanese as a plusJob location in Barcelona (Spain).

About Us

MIDOKURA is a Sony Group company that delivers innovative solutions to power the Edge AI revolution in IoT.

Find more about us here.

title: Linux System Engineer
description:
For an international trading company, (that actually places tech above traders!) I am looking for a Site Reliability Engineer, also known as Linux & Automation master that likes to act in a fast paced - dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders globally. Due to the growth of this company they have just opened their Amsterdam office and you will be the first Linux master who joins.
In a global team you will manage a Linux based Private Cloud (ao Kubernetes / Linux); managing Storage, Security, Big Data, Linux, Kubernetes amongst each other. You will be working in the team that is responsible for monitoring production systems, working alongside the traders to troubleshoot issues on the spot and work on improvements of the applications and infrastructure. (50% ops, 50% improvement).   Next to this, you will be speaking to different hubs of stakeholders (Developers, Traders, Infra Engineers, Support), taking ownerships of the different (global) projects that run simultaneously. 
Tech requirements:6+ experience as a Linux SRE/System EngineerSolid understanding of the Linux Operating SystemScripting skills in PythonNice to have: experience in maintaining Kubernetes clusters;Strong communicator and interest to work in a chaotic and high-pressure environment. As the man in the middle you try and think steps ahead when it comes to speed; availability; stability and performance. This is your game and you like having an impact! 
Salary: 140k Location: Amsterdam WFH: 3 days in office, 2 at homeRelocation within EU is possible and funded
